Text

[I]0-i [John Campton]174-campton , [the American portrait - painter]362-the american portrait - painter , stood in [[his]174-campton bare studio in [Montmartre]1-montmartre]363-his bare studio in montmartre at the end of a summer afternoon contemplating a battered calendar that hung against the wall . The calendar marked July 30 , 1914 . [Campton]174-campton looked at this date with a gaze of unmixed satisfaction . [[His]174-campton son]364-his son , [[his]174-campton only boy , who was coming from [America]2-america]365-his only boy , who was coming from america , must have landed in [England]3-england that morning , and after a brief halt in [London]4-london would join [him]174-campton the next evening in [Paris]5-paris . To bring the moment nearer , [Campton]174-campton , smiling at [his]174-campton weakness , tore off the leaf and uncovered the 31 . Then , leaning in the window , [he]174-campton looked out over [[his]174-campton untidy scrap of garden]366-his untidy scrap of garden at [the silver - grey sea of [Paris]5-paris spreading mistily below [him]174-campton]367-the silver - grey sea of paris spreading mistily below him . [A number of [visitors]369-visitors]368-a number of visitors had passed through [the studio]370-the studio that day . After years of obscurity [Campton]174-campton had been projected into the light — or perhaps only into the limelight — by [his]174-campton portrait of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son [George]175-george , exhibited three years earlier at the spring show of [the French Society of [Painters]373-painters and [Sculptors]374-sculptors]372-the french society of painters and sculptors . The picture seemed to [its author]375-its author to be exactly in the line of the unnoticed things [he]174-campton had been showing before , though perhaps nearer to what [he]174-campton was always trying for , because of the exceptional interest of [his]174-campton subject . But to [the public]376-the public [he]174-campton had appeared to take a new turn ; or perhaps [some critic]377-some critic had suddenly found the right phrase for [him]174-campton ; or , that season , [people]378-people wanted [a new painter]379-a new painter to talk about . Did n’t [he]174-campton know by heart all the [Paris]5-paris reasons for success or failure ? The early years of [his]174-campton career had given [him]174-campton ample opportunity to learn them . Like [other young students of [his]174-campton generation]380-other young students of his generation , [he]174-campton had come to [Paris]5-paris with an exaggerated reverence for [the few conspicuous figures who made [the old Salons of the ’ eighties]382-the old salons of the ’ eighties]381-the few conspicuous figures who made the old salons of the ’ eighties like bad plays written around a few stars . If [he]174-campton could get near enough to [Beausite]176-beausite , [the ruling light of [the galaxy]384-the galaxy]383-the ruling light of the galaxy , [he]174-campton thought [he]174-campton might do things not unworthy of [that great master]385-that great master ; but [Beausite]176-beausite , who had ceased to receive [pupils]386-pupils , saw no reason for making an exception in favour of [an obscure youth without a backing]387-an obscure youth without a backing . [He]174-campton was not kind ; and on the only occasion when a painting of [Campton]174-campton ’s came under [his]174-campton eye [he]174-campton let fall an epigram which went the round of [Paris]5-paris , but shocked its victim by its revelation of [the great man]388-the great man ’s ineptitude . [Campton]174-campton , if [he]174-campton could have gone on admiring [Beausite]176-beausite ’s work , would have forgotten [his]174-campton unkindness and even [his]174-campton critical incapacity ; but as [the young painter]389-the young painter ’s personal convictions developed [he]174-campton discovered that [[his]174-campton idol]390-his idol had none , and that the dazzling _ maëstria _ still enveloping [his]174-campton work was only the light from a dead star . All these things were now nearly thirty years old . [Beausite]176-beausite had vanished from the heavens , and [the youth [he]174-campton had sneered at throned there in [his]174-campton stead]391-the youth he had sneered at throned there in his stead . [Most of the people who besieged [[Campton]174-campton ’s studio]393-campton ’s studio]392-most of the people who besieged campton ’s studio were [the lineal descendants of those who had echoed [Beausite]176-beausite ’s sneer]394-the lineal descendants of those who had echoed beausite ’s sneer . [They]392-most of the people who besieged campton ’s studio belonged to [the types that [Campton]174-campton least cared to paint]395-the types that campton least cared to paint ; but [they]392-most of the people who besieged campton ’s studio were usually those who paid the highest prices , and [he]174-campton had lately had new and imperious reasons for wanting to earn all the money [he]174-campton could . So for two years [he]174-campton had let it be as difficult and expensive as possible to be “ done by [Campton]174-campton ”[174-campton] ; and this oppressive July day had been crowded with the visits of suppliants of a sort unused to waiting on [anybody]396-anybody ’s pleasure , [people who had postponed [St. Moritz]9-st. moritz and [Deauville]6-deauville , [Aix]7-aix and [Royat]178-royat]397-people who had postponed st. moritz and deauville , aix and royat , because it was known that [one]398-one had to accept [the master]399-the master ’s conditions or apply elsewhere . The job bored [him]174-campton more than ever ; the more of [their]400-their fatuous faces [he]174-campton recorded the more [he]174-campton hated the task ; but for the last two or three days the monotony of [his]174-campton toil had been relieved by a new element of interest . This was produced by what [he]174-campton called the “ war - funk , ”[174-campton] and consisted in the effect on [[his]174-campton sitters]401-his sitters and [[their]401-his sitters friends]402-their friends of the suggestion that something new , incomprehensible and uncomfortable might be about to threaten the ordered course of [their]400-their pleasures . [Campton]174-campton [himself]174-campton did not “ believe in the war ”[174-campton] ( as the current phrase went ) ; therefore [he]174-campton was able to note with perfect composure its agitating effect upon [[his]174-campton sitters]401-his sitters . On the whole [the women]404-the women behaved best : [the idiotic Mme]405-the idiotic mme . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch had actually grown beautiful through fear for [[her]179-de dolmetsch lover]406-her lover , who turned out ( in spite of a name as exotic as [hers]179-de dolmetsch ) to be [a French subject of military age]407-a french subject of military age . [The men]408-the men had made a less creditable showing — especially [the big banker and promoter]409-the big banker and promoter , [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein , whose round red face had withered like a pricked balloon , and [young Prince Demetrios Palamèdes]181-young prince demetrios palamèdes , just married to [the fabulously rich daughter of [an Argentine wheat - grower]411-an argentine wheat - grower]410-the fabulously rich daughter of an argentine wheat - grower , and so secure as to [[his]174-campton bride]412-his bride ’s fortune that [he]174-campton could curse impartially [all the disturbers of [his]174-campton summer plans]413-all the disturbers of his summer plans . Even [the great tuberculosis specialist]414-the great tuberculosis specialist , [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , whom [Campton]174-campton was painting in return for [the physician]415-the physician ’s devoted care of [George]175-george the previous year , had lost something of [his]182-fortin - lescluze professional composure , and no longer gave out the sense of tranquillizing strength which had been such a help in [the boy]416-the boy ’s fight for health . [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , always in contact with [the rulers of [the earth]418-the earth]417-the rulers of the earth , must surely have some hint of [their]417-the rulers of the earth councils . Whatever it was , [he]182-fortin - lescluze revealed nothing , but continued to talk frivolously and infatuatedly about [a new Javanese dancer whom [he]182-fortin - lescluze wanted [Campton]174-campton to paint]419-a new javanese dancer whom he wanted campton to paint ; but [his]419-a new javanese dancer whom he wanted campton to paint large beaked face with its triumphant moustache had grown pinched and grey , and [he]419-a new javanese dancer whom he wanted campton to paint had forgotten to renew the dye on the moustache . [[Campton]174-campton ’s one really imperturbable visitor]420-campton ’s one really imperturbable visitor was [little Charlie Alicante]183-little charlie alicante , [the Spanish secretary of Embassy at [Berlin]8-berlin , who had dropped in on [his]183-little charlie alicante way to [St. Moritz]9-st. moritz]421-the spanish secretary of embassy at berlin , who had dropped in on his way to st. moritz , bringing the newest news from [the Wilhelmstrasse]10-the wilhelmstrasse news that was all suavity and reassurance , with a touch of playful reproach for the irritability of French feeling , and a reminder of Imperial longanimity in regard to the foolish misunderstandings of [Agadir]184-agadir and [Saverne]68-saverne . Now [all the visitors]422-all the visitors had gone , and [Campton]174-campton , leaning in the window , looked out over [Paris]5-paris and mused on [his]174-campton summer plans . [He]174-campton meant to plunge straight down to [Southern Italy]11-southern italy and [Sicily]12-sicily , perhaps even push over to [North Africa]13-north africa . That at least was what [he]174-campton hoped for : no sun was too hot for [him]174-campton and [no landscape]423-no landscape too arid . But it all depended on [George]175-george ; for [George]175-george was going with [him]174-campton , and if [George]175-george preferred [Spain]186-spain [they]424-they would postpone [the desert]425-the desert . It was almost impossible to [Campton]174-campton to picture what it would be like to have [the boy]416-the boy with [him]174-campton . For so long [he]174-campton had seen [[his]174-campton son]364-his son only in snatches , hurriedly , incompletely , uncomprehendingly : it was only in the last three years that [their]424-they intimacy had had a chance to develop . And [they]424-they had never travelled together , except for hasty dashes , two or three times , to [seashore]428-seashore or [mountains]429-mountains ; had never gone off on a long solitary journey such as this . [Campton]174-campton , tired , disenchanted , and nearing sixty , found [himself]174-campton looking forward to the adventure with an eagerness as great as the different sort of ardour with which , in [his]174-campton youth , [he]174-campton had imagined flights of another kind with [the woman who was to fulfill every dream]430-the woman who was to fulfill every dream . “ Well — [I]174-campton suppose that ’s the stuff pictures are made of , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton thought , smiling at [his]174-campton inextinguishable belief in the completeness of [his]174-campton next experience . Life had perpetually knocked [him]174-campton down just as [he]174-campton had [his]174-campton hand on [her]430-the woman who was to fulfill every dream gifts ; nothing had ever succeeded with [him]174-campton but [his]174-campton work . But [he]174-campton was as sure as ever that peace of mind and contentment of heart were waiting for [him]174-campton round the next corner ; and this time , it was clear , [they]431-they were to come to [him]174-campton through [[his]174-campton wonderful son]432-his wonderful son . The doorbell rang , and [he]174-campton listened for [the maidservant]433-the maidservant ’s step . There was another impatient jingle , and [he]174-campton remembered that [[his]174-campton faithful [Mariette]187-mariette]434-his faithful mariette had left for [Lille]14-lille , where [she]187-mariette was to spend [her]187-mariette vacation with [[her]187-mariette family]435-her family . [Campton]174-campton , reaching for [his]174-campton stick , shuffled across [the studio]370-the studio with [his]174-campton lame awkward stride . At the door stood [[his]174-campton old friend]437-his old friend [Paul Dastrey]188-dastrey , [one of [the few men with whom [he]174-campton had been unbrokenly intimate since the first days of [his]174-campton disturbed and incoherent Parisian life]439-the few men with whom he had been unbrokenly intimate since the first days of his disturbed and incoherent parisian life]438-one of the few men with whom he had been unbrokenly intimate since the first days of his disturbed and incoherent parisian life . [Dastrey]188-dastrey came in without speaking : [his]188-dastrey small dry face , seamed with premature wrinkles of irony and sensitiveness , looked unusually grave . The wrinkles seemed suddenly to have become those of [an old man]440-an old man ; and how grey [Dastrey]188-dastrey had turned ! [He]174-campton walked a little stiffly , with a jauntiness obviously intended to conceal a growing tendency to rheumatism . In the middle of the floor [he]174-campton paused and tapped a varnished boot - tip with [his]174-campton stick . “ Let ’s see what [you]174-campton ’ve done to [Daisy Dolmetsch]189-daisy de dolmetsch . ”[174-campton] “ Oh , it ’s been done for [me]174-campton — [you’ll]188-dastrey see ! ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton laughed . [He]174-campton was enjoying the sight of [Dastrey]188-dastrey and thinking that this visit was providentially timed to give [him]174-campton a chance of expatiating on [his]174-campton coming journey . In [his]174-campton rare moments of expansiveness [he]174-campton felt the need of some substitute for the background of domestic sympathy which , as a rule , would have simply bored or exasperated [him]174-campton ; and at such times [he]174-campton could always talk to [Dastrey]188-dastrey . [The little man]441-the little man screwed up [his]441-the little man eyes and continued to tap [his]441-the little man varnished toes . “ But [she]189-daisy de dolmetsch ’s magnificent . [She]189-daisy de dolmetsch ’s seen [the Medusa]2486-the medusa ! ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton laughed again . “ Just so . For days and days [I]174-campton ’d been trying to do something with [her]189-daisy de dolmetsch ; and suddenly the war - funk did it for [me]174-campton . ”[174-campton] “ The war - funk ? ”[174-campton] “ Who ’d have thought it ? [She]189-daisy de dolmetsch ’s frightened to death about [Ladislas Isador]190-ladislas isador — who is [French]208-the french , it turns out , and mobilisable . [The poor soul]2487-the poor soul thinks there ’s going to be war ! ”[174-campton] “ Well , there _ is _ , ”[188-dastrey] said [Dastrey]188-dastrey . [The two men]442-the two men looked at [each other]443-each other : [Campton]174-campton amused , incredulous , a shade impatient at the perpetual recurrence of the same theme , and aware of presenting a smile of irritating unresponsiveness to [[his]441-the little man friend]444-his friend ’s solemn gaze . “ Oh , come — [you]174-campton too ? Why , [the Duke of Alicante]2488-the duke of alicante has just left [here]2489-here , fresh from [Berlin]8-berlin . [You]174-campton ought to hear [him]2488-the duke of alicante laugh at [us]442-the two men .... ”[174-campton] “ How about [Berlin]8-berlin ’s laughing at _ [him]2488-the duke of alicante _ ? ”[188-dastrey] [Dastrey]188-dastrey sank into a wicker armchair , drew out a cigarette and forgot to light it . [Campton]174-campton returned to the window . “ There ca n’t be war : [I]174-campton ’m going to [Sicily]12-sicily and [Africa]16-africa with [George]175-george the day after to - morrow , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton broke out . “ Ah , [George——.]192-george——. To be sure .... ”[174-campton] There was a silence ; [Dastrey]188-dastrey had not even smiled . [He]188-dastrey turned the unlit cigarette in [his]188-dastrey dry fingers . “ Too young for ’ seventy — and too old for this ! [Some men]2490-some men are born under a curse , ”[188-dastrey] [he]188-dastrey burst out . “ What on earth are [you]188-dastrey talking about ? ”[188-dastrey] [Campton]174-campton exclaimed , forcing [his]174-campton gaiety a little . [Dastrey]188-dastrey stared at [him]174-campton with furious eyes . “ But [I]188-dastrey shall get something , somewhere ... [they]2491-they ca n’t stop [a man]2492-a man ’s enlisting ... [I]188-dastrey had [an old uncle who did it in ’ seventy]2493-an old uncle who did it in ’ seventy ... [he]2493-an old uncle who did it in ’ seventy was older than [I]188-dastrey am now . ”[188-dastrey] [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]174-campton compassionately . [Poor little circumscribed [Paul Dastrey]188-dastrey , whose utmost adventure had been an occasional article in an art review , an occasional six weeks in [the near East]17-the near east]445-poor little circumscribed paul dastrey , whose utmost adventure had been an occasional article in an art review , an occasional six weeks in the near east ! It was pitiful to see [him]188-dastrey breathing fire and fury on an enemy one knew to be engaged , at that very moment , in meeting [England]3-england and [France]18-france more than half - way in the effort to smooth over diplomatic difficulties . But [Campton]174-campton could make allowances for the nerves of [the tragic generation brought up in the shadow of [Sedan]19-sedan]446-the tragic generation brought up in the shadow of sedan . “ Look here , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said , “ [I]174-campton ’ll tell [you]174-campton what . Come along with [George]175-george and [me]174-campton — as far as [Palermo]20-palermo , anyhow . [You]174-campton ’re a little stiff again in that left knee , and [we]2494-we can bake [our]2494-we lamenesses together in the good Sicilian oven . ”[174-campton] [Dastrey]188-dastrey had found a match and lighted [his]188-dastrey cigarette . “ [[My]188-dastrey poor [Campton]174-campton]2495-my poor campton — there’ll be war in three days . ”[188-dastrey] [Campton]174-campton ’s incredulity was shot through with the deadly chill of conviction . There it was — there would be war ! It was too like [his]188-dastrey cursed luck not to be true .... [He]174-campton smiled inwardly , perceiving that [he]174-campton was viewing the question exactly as [the despicable Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein and [the fatuous Prince Demetrios]447-the fatuous prince demetrios had viewed it : as an unwarrantable interference with [his]174-campton private plans . Yes — but [his]174-campton case was different .... Here was [the son [he]174-campton had never seen enough of , never till lately seen at all as [most fathers]449-most fathers see [[their]449-most fathers sons]450-their sons]448-the son he had never seen enough of , never till lately seen at all as most fathers see their sons ; and [the boy]416-the boy was to be packed off to [New York]21-new york that winter , to go into [a bank]452-a bank ; and for [the Lord]453-the lord knew how many months this was to be [their]454-their last chance , as it was almost [their]454-their first , of being together quietly , confidentially , uninterruptedly . [These other men]455-these other men were whining at the interruption of [their]455-these other men vile pleasures or [their]455-these other men viler money - making ; [he]174-campton , [poor devil]456-poor devil , was trembling for the chance to lay the foundation of a complete and lasting friendship with [[his]174-campton only son]457-his only son , at the moment when such understandings do most to shape [a youth]458-a youth ’s future .... “ And with what [I]174-campton ’ve had to fight against ! ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton groaned , seeing victory in sight , and sickening at the idea that it might be snatched from [him]174-campton . Then another thought came , and [he]174-campton felt the blood leaving [his]174-campton ruddy face and , as it seemed , receding from every vein of [his]174-campton heavy awkward body . [He]174-campton sat down opposite [Dastrey]188-dastrey , and [the two]459-the two looked at [each other]443-each other . “ There wo n’t be war . But if there were — why should n’t [George]175-george and [I]174-campton go to [Sicily]12-sicily ? [You]174-campton do n’t see [us]459-the two sitting here making lint , do [you]174-campton ? ”[174-campton] [Dastrey]188-dastrey smiled . “ [Lint]193-lint is unhygienic ; [you]174-campton wo n’t have to do that . Through the years of [his]174-campton poverty it had been impossible not to put up , on occasions , with [that odious first person plural]515-that odious first person plural : as long as [his]174-campton wretched inability to make money had made it necessary that [[[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife ’s second husband]517-his wife ’s second husband should pay for [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s keep , such allusions had been part of [Campton]174-campton ’s long expiation . [He]174-campton had meant to reassure [her]196-mrs. brant , to reaffirm [his]174-campton conviction that [the boy]416-the boy was sure to be discharged . But as [their]531-their eyes met [he]174-campton saw that [she]196-mrs. brant believed this no more than [he]174-campton did ; and [he]174-campton felt the contagion of [her]196-mrs. brant incredulity . “ But if [you]196-mrs. brant ’re so sure there ’s not going to be war — — ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton began . As [he]174-campton spoke [he]174-campton saw [her]196-mrs. brant face change , and was aware that the door behind [him]174-campton had opened and that [a short man , bald and slim]532-a short man , bald and slim , was advancing at a sort of mincing trot across the pompous garlands of the Savonnerie carpet . [Campton]174-campton got to [his]174-campton feet . [He]174-campton had expected [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant to stop at sight of [him]174-campton , mumble a greeting , and then back out of [the room]475-the room — as usual . But [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant did nothing of the sort : [he]174-campton merely hastened [his]174-campton trot toward the tea - table . [He]174-campton made no attempt to shake hands with [Campton]174-campton , but bowing shyly and stiffly said : “ [I]174-campton understood [you]174-campton were coming , and hurried back ... on the chance ... to consult .... ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton gazed at [him]174-campton without speaking . [They]534-their had not seen [each other]443-each other since the extraordinary occasion , two years before , when [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , furtively one day at dusk , had come to [[his]197-mr. brant studio]536-his studio to offer to buy [George]175-george ’s portrait ; and , as [their]534-their eyes met , the memory of that visit reddened both [their]534-their faces . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was [a compact little man of about sixty]537-a compact little man of about sixty . [His]197-mr. brant sandy hair , just turning grey , was brushed forward over a baldness which was ivory - white at the crown and became brick - pink above the temples , before merging into the tanned and freckled surface of [his]197-mr. brant face . [He]197-mr. brant was always dressed in carefully cut clothes of a discreet grey , with a tie to match , in which even the plump pearl was grey , so that [he]197-mr. brant reminded [Campton]174-campton of a dry perpendicular insect in protective tints ; and the fancy was encouraged by [his]197-mr. brant cautious manner , and the way [he]197-mr. brant had of peering over [his]197-mr. brant glasses as if they were part of [his]197-mr. brant armour . [His]197-mr. brant feet were small and pointed , and seemed to be made of patent leather ; and shaking hands with [him]197-mr. brant was like clasping a bunch of twigs . It had been [Campton]174-campton ’s lot , on the rare occasions of [his]197-mr. brant meeting [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , always to see [this perfectly balanced man]538-this perfectly balanced man in moments of disequilibrium , when the attempt to simulate poise probably made [him]197-mr. brant more rigid than nature had created [him]197-mr. brant . But to - day [his]197-mr. brant perturbation betrayed itself in the gesture with which [he]197-mr. brant drummed out a tune on the back of the gold and platinum cigar - case [he]197-mr. brant had unconsciously drawn from [his]197-mr. brant pocket . After a moment [he]197-mr. brant seemed to become aware of what [he]197-mr. brant had in [his]197-mr. brant hand , and pressing the sapphire spring held out the case with the remark : “ [Coronas]202-coronas . ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton made a movement of refusal , and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , overwhelmed , thrust the cigar - case away . “ [I]174-campton ought to have taken one — [I]174-campton may need [him]197-mr. brant , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton thought ; and [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant said , addressing [[her]196-mrs. brant husband]539-her husband : “ [He]197-mr. brant thinks as _ [we]2520-we _ do — exactly . ”[196-mrs. brant] [Campton]174-campton winced . Thinking as [the Brants]203-the brants did was , at all times , so foreign to [his]197-mr. brant nature and [his]197-mr. brant principles that [his]197-mr. brant first impulse was to protest . But the sight of [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , standing there helplessly , and trying to hide the twitching of [his]197-mr. brant lip by stroking [his]197-mr. brant lavender - scented moustache with a discreetly curved hand , moved [the painter]540-the painter ’s imagination . “ [Poor devil]456-poor devil — [he’d]456-poor devil give all [his]456-poor devil millions if [the boy]416-the boy were safe , ”[197-mr. brant] [he]197-mr. brant thought , “ and [he]456-poor devil does n’t even dare to say so . ”[197-mr. brant] It satisfied [Campton]174-campton ’s sense of [his]174-campton rights that [these two powerful people]541-these two powerful people were hanging on [his]174-campton decision like [frightened children]542-frightened children , and [he]174-campton answered , looking at [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant : “ There ’s nothing to be done at present ... absolutely nothing — — Except , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton added abruptly , “ to take care not to talk in this way to [George]175-george . ”[174-campton] [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant lifted a startled gaze . “ What do [you]174-campton mean ? If war is declared , [you]174-campton ca n’t expect [me]196-mrs. brant not to speak of it to [him]175-george . ”[196-mrs. brant] “ Speak of it as much as [you]196-mrs. brant like , but do n’t drag [him]175-george in . Let [him]175-george work out [his]175-george own case for [himself]175-george . ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton went on with an effort : “ It ’s what [I]174-campton intend to do . ”[174-campton] “ But [you]174-campton said [you]174-campton ’d use every influence ! ”[196-mrs. brant] [she]196-mrs. brant protested , obtusely . “ Well — [I]196-mrs. brant believe this is one of them . ”[196-mrs. brant] [She]196-mrs. brant looked down resignedly at [her]196-mrs. brant clasped hands , and [he]174-campton saw [her]196-mrs. brant lips tighten . “ [My]174-campton telling [her]196-mrs. brant that has been just enough to start [her]196-mrs. brant on the other tack , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton groaned to [himself]174-campton , all [her]196-mrs. brant old stupidities rising up around [him]174-campton like a fog . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant gave a slight cough and removed [his]197-mr. brant protecting hand from [his]197-mr. brant lips . “ [Mr. Campton]174-campton is right , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said , quickly and timorously . “ [I]174-campton take the same view — entirely . [George]175-george must not know that [we]543-we are thinking of using ... any means .... ”[174-campton] [He]197-mr. brant coughed again , and groped for the cigar - case . As [he]174-campton spoke , there came over [Campton]174-campton a sense of [their]543-we possessing a common ground of understanding that [Campton]174-campton had never found in [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife . [He]174-campton had had a hint of the same feeling , but had voluntarily stifled it , on the day when [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , apologetic yet determined , had come to [the studio]370-the studio to buy [George]175-george ’s portrait . [Campton]174-campton had seen then how [the man]546-the man suffered from [his]546-the man failure , but had chosen to attribute [his]546-the man distress to the humiliation of finding there were things [his]546-the man money could not purchase . Now , that judgment seemed as unimaginative as [he]174-campton had once thought [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s overture . [Campton]174-campton turned on [the banker]547-the banker a look that was almost brotherly . “ [[We]2523-we [men]2525-men]2524-we men know ... ”[174-campton] the look said ; and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s parched cheek was suffused with a flush of understanding . Then , as if frightened at the consequences of such complicity , [he]197-mr. brant repeated [his]197-mr. brant bow and went out . When [Campton]174-campton issued forth into [the Avenue Marigny]548-the avenue marigny , it came to [him]174-campton as a surprise to see the old unheeding life of [Paris]5-paris still going on . In the golden decline of day the usual throng of [idlers]549-idlers sat under the horse - chestnuts of [the Champs Elysées]550-the champs elysées , [children]551-children scampered between turf and flowers , and the perpetual stream of motors rolled - up [the central avenue]552-the central avenue to [the restaurants beyond the gates]553-the restaurants beyond the gates . Under the last trees of [the Avenue Gabriel]554-the avenue gabriel [the painter]540-the painter stood looking across [the Place de la Concorde]27-the place de la concorde . No doubt the future was dark : [he]540-the painter had guessed from [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s precipitate arrival that [the banks]556-the banks and [the Stock Exchange]557-the stock exchange feared the worst . But what could [a man]2492-a man do , whose convictions were so largely formed by the play of things on [his]2492-a man retina , when , in the setting sun , all that majesty of space and light and architecture was spread out before [him]2492-a man undisturbed ? [Paris]5-paris was too triumphant a fact not to argue down [his]2492-a man fears . There [she]559-she lay in the security of [her]559-she beauty , and once more proclaimed [herself]559-she eternal . III The night was so lovely that , though the Boulogne express arrived late , [George]175-george at once proposed dining in [the Bois]560-the bois . [His]2492-a man luggage , of which , as usual , there was a good deal , was dropped at [the Crillon]28-the crillon , and [they]561-they shot up [the Champs Elysées]550-the champs elysées as the summer dusk began to be pricked by lamps . “ How jolly [the old place]2526-the old place smells ! ”[175-george] [George]175-george cried , breathing in the scent of sun - warmed asphalt , of flowerbeds and freshly - watered dust . [He]175-george seemed as much alive to such impressions as if [his]175-george first word at [the station]563-the station had not been : “ Well , this time [I]175-george suppose [we]561-they ’re in for it . ”[175-george] In for it they might be ; but meanwhile [he]2492-a man meant to enjoy the scents and scenes of [Paris]5-paris as acutely and unconcernedly as ever . [Campton]174-campton had hoped that [he]2492-a man would pick out [one of [the humble cyclists ’ restaurants near [the Seine]29-the seine]565-the humble cyclists ’ restaurants near the seine]564-one of the humble cyclists ’ restaurants near the seine ; but not [he]2492-a man . “ [Madrid]30-madrid , is it ? ”[2492-a man] [he]2492-a man said gaily , as [the taxi]566-the taxi turned into [the Bois]31-the bois ; and there [they]567-their sat under the illuminated trees , in the general glitter and expensiveness , with [the Tziganes]204-the tziganes playing down [their]567-their talk , and all around [them]567-their the painted faces that seemed to [the father]568-the father so old and obvious , and to [the son]569-the son , no doubt , so full of novelty and mystery . The music made conversation difficult ; but [Campton]174-campton did not care . It was enough to sit and watch the face in which , after each absence , [he]174-campton noted a new and richer vivacity . [He]174-campton had often tried to make up [his]174-campton mind if [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy were handsome . Not that [the father]568-the father ’s eye influenced [the painter]540-the painter ’s ; but [George]175-george ’s young head , with its thick blond thatch , the complexion ruddy to the golden eyebrows , and then abruptly white on the forehead , the short amused nose , the inquisitive eyes , the ears lying back flat to the skull against curly edges of fair hair , defied all rules and escaped all classifications by a mixture of romantic gaiety and shrewd plainness like that in certain eighteenth - century portraits . As [father]573-father and [son]574-son faced [each other]443-each other over the piled - up peaches , while the last sparkle of champagne died down in [their]567-their glasses , [Campton]174-campton ’s thoughts went back to the day when [he]174-campton had first discovered [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . [George]175-george was [a schoolboy of twelve]577-a schoolboy of twelve , at [home]502-home for the Christmas holidays . At [home]502-home meant at [the Brants]203-the brants ’ , since it was always there [he]175-george stayed : [[his]364-his son father]580-his father saw [him]175-george only on certain days . [Usually Mariette]187-mariette fetched [him]175-george to [the studio]370-the studio on one afternoon in the week ; but this particular week [George]175-george was ill , and it had been arranged that in case of illness [[his]364-his son father]580-his father was to visit [him]175-george at [[his]364-his son mother]583-his mother ’s . [He]175-george had one of [his]580-his father frequent bad colds , and [Campton]174-campton recalled [him]175-george , propped up in bed in [[his]580-his father luxurious overheated room]584-his luxurious overheated room , a scarlet sweater over [his]580-his father nightshirt , a book on [his]580-his father thin knees , and [his]580-his father ugly little fever - flushed face bent over it in profound absorption . Till that moment [George]175-george had never seemed to care for books : [[his]364-his son father]580-his father had resigned [himself]580-his father to the probability of seeing [him]175-george grow up into [the ordinary pleasant young fellow , with [[his]364-his son mother]583-his mother ’s worldly tastes]586-the ordinary pleasant young fellow , with his mother ’s worldly tastes . But [the boy]416-the boy was reading as only a bookworm reads — reading with [his]416-the boy very finger - tips , and [his]416-the boy inquisitive nose , and the perpetual dart ahead of a gaze that seemed to guess each phrase from its last word . [He]416-the boy looked up with a smile , and said : “ Oh , [Dad]205-dad ... ”[416-the boy] but it was clear that [he]416-the boy regarded the visit as an interruption . [Campton]174-campton , leaning over , saw that the book was a first edition of [Lavengro]32-lavengro . “ Where the deuce did [you]205-dad get that ? ”[175-george] [George]175-george looked at [him]174-campton with shining eyes . “ Did n’t [you]205-dad know ? [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant has started collecting first editions . There ’s [a chap who comes over from [London]4-london with things for [him]197-mr. brant]2527-a chap who comes over from london with things for him . [He]2527-a chap who comes over from london with things for him lets [me]175-george have them to look at when [I]175-george ’m seedy . [I]175-george say , is n’t this topping ? Do [you]205-dad remember the fight ? ”[175-george] And , marvelling once more at the ways of [Providence]206-providence , [Campton]174-campton perceived that [the millionaire]589-the millionaire ’s taste for owning books had awakened in [[his]174-campton stepson]590-his stepson a taste for reading them . “ [I]568-the father could n’t have done that for [him]174-campton , ”[568-the father] [the father]568-the father had reflected with secret bitterness . It was not that [[a bibliophile]592-a bibliophile ’s library]593-a bibliophile ’s library was necessary to develop a taste for letters ; but that [Campton]174-campton [himself]174-campton , being [a small reader]594-a small reader , had few books about [him]174-campton , and usually borrowed those few . If [George]175-george had lived with [him]175-george [he]175-george might never have guessed [the boy]416-the boy ’s latent hunger , for the need of books as part of one ’s daily food would scarcely have presented itself to [him]174-campton . From that day [he]175-george and [George]175-george had understood [each other]443-each other . [Initiation]207-initiation had come to [them]597-they in different ways , but [their]597-they ardour for beauty had the same root . The visible world , and its transposition in terms of one art or another , were thereafter the subject of [their]597-they interminable talks ; and [Campton]174-campton , with a passionate interest , watched [[his]174-campton son]364-his son absorbing through books what had mysteriously reached [him]174-campton through [his]174-campton paintbrush . [They]597-they had been parted often , and for long periods ; first by [George]175-george ’s schooling in [England]3-england , next by [his]175-george French military service , begun at eighteen to facilitate [his]175-george entry into [Harvard]33-harvard ; finally , by [his]175-george sojourn at [the University]599-the university . But whenever [they]597-they were together [they]597-they seemed to make up in the first ten minutes for the longest separation ; and since [George]175-george had come of age , and been [[his]175-george own master]600-his own master , [he]175-george had given [[his]175-george father]580-his father every moment [he]175-george could spare . [His]175-george career at [Harvard]33-harvard had been interrupted , after two years , by the symptoms of tuberculosis which had necessitated [his]175-george being hurried off to [the Engadine]23-the engadine . [He]175-george had returned completely cured , and at [his]175-george own wish had gone back to [Harvard]33-harvard ; and having finished [his]175-george course and taken [his]175-george degree , [he]175-george had now come out to join [[his]175-george father]580-his father on a long holiday before entering [the [New York]21-new york banking - house of [Bullard]200-bullard]34-the new york banking - house of bullard and [Brant]194-julia . [Campton]174-campton , looking at [the boy]416-the boy ’s bright head across the lights and flowers , thought how incredibly stupid it was to sacrifice an hour of such a life to the routine of money - getting ; but [he]174-campton had had that question out with [himself]174-campton once for all , and was not going to return to it . [His]174-campton own success , if it lasted , would eventually help [him]174-campton to make [George]175-george independent ; but meanwhile [he]174-campton had no right to interfere with [the boy]416-the boy ’s business training . [He]174-campton had hoped that [George]175-george would develop some marked talent , some irresistible tendency which would decide [his]175-george future too definitely for interference ; but [George]175-george was twenty - five , and no such call had come to [him]175-george . Apparently [he]175-george was fated to be only [a delighted spectator and commentator]605-a delighted spectator and commentator ; to enjoy and interpret , not to create . And [Campton]174-campton knew that this absence of a special bent , with the strain and absorption it implies , gave [the boy]416-the boy [his]416-the boy peculiar charm . The trouble was that it made [him]416-the boy the prey of [other people]607-other people ’s plans for [him]416-the boy . And now all these plans — [Campton]174-campton ’s dreams for the future as well as the business arrangements which were [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s contribution — might be wrecked by to - morrow ’s news from [Berlin]8-berlin . The possibility still seemed unthinkable ; but in spite of [his]174-campton incredulity the evil shadow hung on [him]174-campton as [he]174-campton and [[his]174-campton son]364-his son chatted of political issues . [George]175-george made no allusion to [his]175-george own case : [his]175-george whole attitude was so dispassionate that [[his]175-george father]580-his father began to wonder if [he]175-george had not solved the question by concluding that [he]175-george would not pass the medical examination . The tone [he]175-george took was that the whole affair , from the point of view of twentieth - century civilization , was too monstrous an incongruity for something not to put a stop to it at the eleventh hour . [His]175-george easy optimism at first stimulated [[his]175-george father]580-his father , and then began to jar on [him]580-his father . “ [Dastrey]188-dastrey does n’t think it can be stopped , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton said at length . [The boy]416-the boy smiled . “ [Dear old Dastrey]188-dastrey ! No , [I]174-campton suppose not . [That after - Sedan generation]2528-that after - sedan generation have got the inevitability of war in [their]2528-that after - sedan generation bones . [They]2528-that after - sedan generation ’ve never been able to get beyond it . _ [Our]2529-we _ whole view is different : [we]2529-we ’re internationals , whether [we]2529-we want to be or not . ”[174-campton] “ To begin with , if by ‘ [our]2529-we ’ view [you]416-the boy mean [yours]416-the boy and [mine]2530-mine , [you]416-the boy and [I]580-his father have n’t a drop of French blood in [us]2529-we , ”[580-his father] [[his]416-the boy father]580-his father interposed , “ and [we]2529-we can never really know what [the French]208-the french feel on such matters . ”[580-his father] [George]175-george looked at [him]580-his father affectionately . “ Oh , but [I]175-george didn’t — [I]175-george meant ‘ [we]2529-we ’ in the sense of [[my]175-george generation]2531-my generation , of whatever nationality . [I]175-george know [French chaps who feel as [I]175-george do]2532-french chaps who feel as i do — [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey , [[Paul]188-dastrey ’s nephew]2533-paul ’s nephew , for one ; and [lots of English ones]2534-lots of english ones . [They]2532-french chaps who feel as i do do n’t believe [the world]2535-the world will ever stand for another war . It ’s too stupidly uneconomic , to begin with : [I]175-george suppose [you]175-george ’ve read [Angell]210-angell ? Then life ’s worth too much , and nowadays [too many millions of people]2536-too many millions of people know it . That ’s the way [we]2537-we all feel . Think of everything that counts — art and science and poetry , and all the rest — going to smash at the nod of [some doddering diplomatist]2538-some doddering diplomatist ! It was different in old times , when the best of life , for the immense majority , was never anything but plague , pestilence and famine . [People]378-people are too healthy and well - fed now ; [they]378-people ’re not going off to die in [a ditch]2540-a ditch to oblige [anybody]396-anybody . ”[175-george] [Campton]174-campton looked away , and [his]174-campton eye , straying over [the crowd]613-the crowd , lit on the long heavy face of [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , seated with [a group of men on the other side of [the garden]488-the garden]614-a group of men on the other side of the garden . Why had it never occurred to [him]174-campton before that if there was one being in [the world]2535-the world who could get [George]175-george discharged it was [the great specialist under whose care [he]175-george had been]617-the great specialist under whose care he had been ? “ Suppose war does come , ”[568-the father] [the father]568-the father thought , “ what if [I]568-the father were to go over and tell [him]182-fortin - lescluze [I]568-the father ’ll paint [[his]182-fortin - lescluze dancer]2542-his dancer ? ”[568-the father] [He]568-the father stood up and made [his]568-the father way between the tables . [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze was dining with [a party of [jaded - looking politicians]620-jaded - looking politicians and [journalists]621-journalists]619-a party of jaded - looking politicians and journalists . To reach [him]182-fortin - lescluze [Campton]174-campton had to squeeze past another table , at which [a fair worn - looking lady]622-a fair worn - looking lady sat beside [a handsome old man with a dazzling mane of white hair and a Grand Officer]623-a handsome old man with a dazzling mane of white hair and a grand officer ’s rosette of [the Legion of Honour]36-the legion of honour . [Campton]174-campton bowed , and [the lady]624-the lady whispered something to [[her]624-the lady companion]625-her companion , who returned a stately vacant salute . [Poor old Beausite]176-beausite , dining alone with [[his]176-beausite much - wronged and all - forgiving wife]626-his much - wronged and all - forgiving wife , bowing to [the people [she]626-his much - wronged and all - forgiving wife told [him]176-beausite to bow to]627-the people she told him to bow to , and placidly murmuring : “ War — war , ”[176-beausite] as [he]176-beausite stuck [his]176-beausite fork into the peach [she]626-his much - wronged and all - forgiving wife had peeled ! At [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s table the faces were less placid . [The men]408-the men greeted [Campton]174-campton with a deference which was not lost on [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite , and [the painter]540-the painter bent close over [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze , embarrassed at the idea that [she]626-his much - wronged and all - forgiving wife might overhear [him]176-beausite . “ If [I]626-his much - wronged and all - forgiving wife can make time for a sketch — will [you]415-the physician bring [[your]415-the physician dancing lady]2543-your dancing lady to - morrow ? ”[626-his much - wronged and all - forgiving wife] [The physician]415-the physician ’s eyes lit up under [their]408-the men puffy lids . “ [[My]415-the physician dear friend]2544-my dear friend — will [I]415-the physician ? [She]2543-your dancing lady ’s simply set [her]2543-your dancing lady heart on it ! ”[415-the physician] [He]415-the physician drew out [his]415-the physician watch and added : “ But why not tell [her]2543-your dancing lady the good news [yourself]415-the physician ? [You]415-the physician told [me]415-the physician , [I]415-the physician think , [you]415-the physician ’d never seen [her]2543-your dancing lady ? This is [her]2543-your dancing lady last night at [the ‘ Posada]37-the ‘ posada , ’ and if [you]415-the physician ’ll jump into [my]415-the physician motor [we]2545-we shall be just in time to see [her]2543-your dancing lady come on . ”[415-the physician] [Campton]174-campton beckoned to [George]175-george , and [father]573-father and [son]574-son followed [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze . [None of [the three men]634-the three men , on the way back to [Paris]5-paris]633-none of the three men , on the way back to paris , made any reference to the war . [The physician]415-the physician asked [George]175-george a few medical questions , and complimented [him]175-george on [his]175-george look of recovered health ; then the talk strayed to [studios]636-studios and [theatres]637-theatres , where [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze firmly kept it . The last faint rumours of the conflict died out on the threshold of the “ Posada . ”[415-the physician] It would have been hard to discern , in the crowded audience , any appearance but that of [ordinary pleasure - seekers]638-ordinary pleasure - seekers momentarily stirred by a new sensation . Collectively , fashionable [Paris]5-paris was already away , at [the seashore]639-the seashore or in [the mountains]640-the mountains , but [not a few of [[its]5-paris chief ornaments]642-its chief ornaments]641-not a few of its chief ornaments still lingered , as the procession through [[Campton]174-campton ’s studio]393-campton ’s studio had proved ; and [others]644-others had returned drawn back by doubts about the future , the desire to be nearer the source of news , the irresistible French craving for [the forum]645-the forum and the market when [messengers]646-messengers are foaming in . [The public of [the “ Posada]37-the ‘ posada]2546-the public of the “ posada , ”[644-others] therefore , was still Parisian enough to flatter [the new dancer]647-the new dancer ; and on all the pleasure - tired faces , belonging to [every type of money - getters and amusement - seekers]648-every type of money - getters and amusement - seekers , [Campton]174-campton saw only the old familiar music - hall look : the look of [a house]649-a house with lights blazing and windows wide , but nobody and nothing within . The usualness of it all gave [him]174-campton a sense of ease which [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ’s enjoyment confirmed . [George]175-george , lounging on the edge of [their]651-their box , and watching [the yellow dancer]652-the yellow dancer with a clear - eyed interest refreshingly different from [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s tarnished gaze , [George]175-george so fresh and cool and unafraid , seemed to prove that a world which could produce [such youths]653-such youths would never again settle its differences by the bloody madness of war . Gradually [Campton]174-campton became absorbed in [the dancer]654-the dancer and began to observe [her]654-the dancer with the concentration [he]174-campton brought to bear on any subject that attracted [his]174-campton brush . [He]174-campton saw that [she]654-the dancer was more paintable than [he]174-campton could have hoped , though not in the extravagant dress and attitude [he]174-campton was sure [[her]654-the dancer eminent admirer]655-her eminent admirer would prefer ; but rather as a little crouching animal against a sun - baked wall . [He]174-campton smiled at the struggle [he]174-campton should have when the question of costume came up . “ Well , [I]174-campton ’ll do [her]654-the dancer , if [you]415-the physician like , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton turned to say ; and two tears of senile triumph glittered on [the physician]415-the physician ’s cheeks . “ To - morrow , then — at two — may [I]174-campton bring [her]654-the dancer ? [She]654-the dancer leaves as soon as possible for [the south]2547-the south . [She]654-the dancer lives on sun , heat , radiance .... ”[174-campton] “ To - morrow — yes , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton nodded . [His]174-campton decision once reached , the whole subject bored [him]174-campton , and in spite of [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s entreaties [he]174-campton got up and signalled to [George]175-george . As [they]657-they strolled [home]502-home through [the brilliant midnight streets]659-the brilliant midnight streets , [the boy]416-the boy said : “ Did [I]416-the boy hear [you]174-campton tell [old Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze [you]174-campton were going to do [[his]182-fortin - lescluze dancer]2542-his dancer ? ”[416-the boy] “ Yes — why not ? [She]2542-his dancer ’s very paintable , ”[174-campton] said [Campton]174-campton , abruptly shaken out of [his]174-campton security . “ Beginning to - morrow ? ”[174-campton] “ Why not ? ”[416-the boy] “ Come , [you]174-campton know—_to - morrow _ ! ”[175-george] [George]175-george laughed . “ [We]663-we ’ll see , ”[175-george] [[his]175-george father]580-his father rejoined , with an obscure sense that if [he]580-his father went on steadily enough doing [his]580-his father usual job it might somehow divert the current of events . On the threshold of [the hotel]662-the hotel [they]663-we were waylaid by [an elderly man with a round face and round eyes behind gold eye - glasses]664-an elderly man with a round face and round eyes behind gold eye - glasses . [His]580-his father grey hair was cut in a fringe over [his]580-his father guileless forehead , and [he]580-his father was dressed in expensive evening clothes , and shone with soap and shaving ; but the anxiety of [a frightened child]665-a frightened child puckered [his]580-his father innocent brow and twitching cheeks . “ [[My]174-campton dear]2497-my dear [Campton]174-campton — [the very man [I]174-campton ’ve been hunting for]2550-the very man i ’ve been hunting for ! [You]174-campton remember [me]174-campton — [[your]174-campton cousin Harvey Mayhew of [Utica]39-utica]211-your cousin harvey mayhew of utica ? ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton , with an effort , remembered , and asked what [he]174-campton could do , inwardly hoping it was not a portrait . “ Oh , the simplest thing in [the world]2535-the world . [You]174-campton see , [I]174-campton ’m here as [a Delegate]2552-a delegate — — ”[174-campton] At [Campton]174-campton ’s look of enquiry , [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew interrupted [himself]212-mr. mayhew to explain : “ To the Peace Congress at [The Hague]40-the hague —— why , yes : naturally . [I]212-mr. mayhew landed only this morning , and find [myself]212-mr. mayhew in the middle of all this rather foolish excitement , and unable to make out just how [I]212-mr. mayhew can reach [my]212-mr. mayhew destination . [My]212-mr. mayhew time is — er — valuable , and it is very unfortunate that all this commotion should be allowed to interfere with [our]2553-our work . It would be most annoying if , after having made the effort to break away from [Utica]39-utica , [I]212-mr. mayhew should arrive too late for the opening of the Congress . ”[212-mr. mayhew] [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]212-mr. mayhew wonderingly . “ Then [you]212-mr. mayhew ’re going anyhow ? ”[174-campton] “ Going ? Why not ? [You]174-campton surely do n’t think — — ? ”[212-mr. mayhew] [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew threw back [his]212-mr. mayhew shoulders , pink and impressive . “ [I]212-mr. mayhew should n’t , in any case , allow anything so opposed to [my]212-mr. mayhew convictions as _ war _ to interfere with [my]212-mr. mayhew carrying out [my]212-mr. mayhew mandate . All [I]212-mr. mayhew want is to find out the route least likely to be closed if — if this monstrous thing should happen . ”[212-mr. mayhew] [Campton]174-campton considered . “ Well , if [I]174-campton were [you]212-mr. mayhew , [I]174-campton should go round by [Luxembourg]41-luxembourg — it ’s longer , but [you]212-mr. mayhew ’ll be out of the way of trouble . ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton gave a nod of encouragement , and [the Peace Delegate]666-the peace delegate thanked [him]174-campton profusely . [Father]573-father and [son]574-son were lodged on [the top floor of [the Crillon]28-the crillon]669-the top floor of the crillon , in [the little apartment which opens on the broad terraced roof]670-the little apartment which opens on the broad terraced roof . [Campton]174-campton had wanted to put before [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy one of [the city]672-the city ’s most perfect scenes ; and when [they]673-they reached [[their]673-they sitting - room]674-their sitting - room [George]175-george went straight out onto [the terrace]675-the terrace , and leaning on the parapet , called back : “ Oh , do n’t go to bed yet — it ’s too jolly . ”[175-george] [Campton]174-campton followed , and [the two]459-the two stood looking down on the festal expanse of [the Place de la Concorde]677-the place de la concorde strown with great flower - clusters of lights between [its]677-the place de la concorde pearly distances . The sky was full of stars , pale , remote , half - drowned in [the city]672-the city ’s vast illumination ; and the foliage of [the Champs Elysées]550-the champs elysées and [the Tuileries]680-the tuileries made masses of mysterious darkness behind the statues and the flashing fountains . For a long time neither [father]573-father nor [son]574-son spoke ; then [Campton]174-campton said : “ Are [you]574-son game to start the day after to - morrow ? ”[174-campton] [George]175-george waited a moment . “ For [Africa]16-africa ? ”[174-campton] “ Well — [my]175-george idea would be to push straight through to [the south]2547-the south — as far as [Palermo]20-palermo , say . All this cloudy watery loveliness gives [me]175-george a furious appetite for violent red earth and white houses crackling in the glare . ”[175-george] [George]175-george again pondered ; then [he]175-george said : “ It sounds first - rate . But if [you]574-son ’re so sure [we]2555-we ’re going to start why did [you]574-son tell [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze to bring [that girl]2556-that girl to - morrow ? ”[175-george] [Campton]174-campton , reddening in the darkness , felt as if [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s clear eyes were following the motions of [his]364-his son blood . Had [George]175-george suspected why [he]175-george had wanted to ingratiate [himself]175-george with [the physician]415-the physician ? “ It was stupid — [I’ll]175-george put [her]2556-that girl off , ”[175-george] [he]175-george muttered . [He]175-george dropped into an armchair , and sat there , in [his]175-george clumsy infirm attitude , [his]175-george arms folded behind [his]175-george head , while [George]175-george continued to lean on the parapet . [The boy]416-the boy ’s question had put an end to [their]686-their talk by baring the throbbing nerve of [[his]416-the boy father]580-his father ’s anxiety . If war were declared the next day , what did [George]175-george mean to do ? There was every hope of [his]175-george obtaining [his]175-george discharge ; but would [he]175-george lend [himself]175-george to the attempt ? The deadly fear of crystallizing [[his]580-his father son]364-his son ’s refusal by forcing [him]175-george to put it into words kept [Campton]174-campton from asking the question . [IV]213-iv The evening was too beautiful , and too full of the sense of fate , for sleep to be possible , and long after [George]175-george had finally said “ All the same , [I]175-george think [I]175-george ’ll turn in , ”[175-george] [[his]416-the boy father]580-his father sat on , listening to the gradual subsidence of the traffic , and watching the night widen above [Paris]5-paris . As [he]580-his father sat there , discouragement overcame [him]580-his father . [His]580-his father last plan , [his]580-his father plan for getting [George]175-george finally and completely over to [his]580-his father side , was going to fail as all [his]580-his father other plans had failed . If there were war there would be no more portraits to paint , and [his]580-his father vision of wealth would vanish as visions of love and happiness and comradeship had one by one faded away . Nothing had ever succeeded with [him]580-his father but the thing [he]580-his father had in some moods set least store by , the dogged achievement of [his]580-his father brush ; and just as that was about to assure [his]580-his father happiness , here was this horrible world - catastrophe threatening to fall across [his]580-his father path . [His]580-his father misfortune had been that [he]580-his father could neither get on easily with [people]378-people nor live without [them]378-people ; could never wholly isolate [himself]580-his father in [his]580-his father art , nor yet resign [himself]580-his father to any permanent human communion that left it out , or , worse still , dragged it in irrelevantly . [He]580-his father had tried both kinds , and on the whole preferred the first . [His]580-his father marriage , [his]580-his father stupid ill - fated marriage , had after all not been the most disenchanting of [his]580-his father adventures , because [Julia Ambrose]214-julia , when [she]214-julia married [him]580-his father , had made no pretense of espousing [his]580-his father art . [He]580-his father had seen [her]214-julia first in [the tumble - down Venetian palace]691-the tumble - down venetian palace where [she]214-julia lived with [[her]214-julia bachelor uncle]692-her bachelor uncle , [old Horace Ambrose]215-old horace ambrose , who dabbled in bric - a - brac and cultivated a guileless Bohemianism . [Campton]174-campton , looking back , could still understand why , to [a youth fresh from [Utica]39-utica , at odds with [[his]580-his father father]580-his father , unwilling to go into the family business , and strangling with violent unexpressed ideas on art and [the universe]695-the universe]693-a youth fresh from utica , at odds with his father , unwilling to go into the family business , and strangling with violent unexpressed ideas on art and the universe , marriage with [Julia Ambrose]214-julia had seemed so perfect a solution . [She]214-julia had been brought up abroad by [[her]214-julia parents]696-her parents , [a drifting and impecunious American couple]697-a drifting and impecunious american couple ; and after [their]696-her parents deaths , within a few months of [each other]443-each other , [her]214-julia education had been completed , at [[her]214-julia uncle]699-her uncle ’s expense , in [a fashionable Parisian convent]700-a fashionable parisian convent . Thence [she]214-julia had been transplanted at nineteen to [[his]699-her uncle Venetian household]701-his venetian household , and all the ideas that most terrified and scandalized [[Campton]174-campton ’s family]702-campton ’s family were part of the only air [she]214-julia had breathed . [She]214-julia had never intentionally feigned an exaggerated interest in [his]699-her uncle ambitions . But [her]214-julia bringing - up made [her]214-julia regard [them]703-them as natural ; [she]214-julia knew what [he]699-her uncle was aiming at , though [she]214-julia had never understood [his]699-her uncle reasons for trying . The jargon of art was merely one of [her]214-julia many languages ; but [she]214-julia talked it so fluently that [he]699-her uncle had taken it for [[her]214-julia mother]704-her mother - tongue . [The only other girls [he]699-her uncle had known well]705-the only other girls he had known well were [[his]699-her uncle sisters]706-his sisters — [earnest eye - glassed young women , whose one answer to all [his]699-her uncle problems]707-earnest eye - glassed young women , whose one answer to all his problems was that [he]699-her uncle ought to come [home]502-home . The idea of [Europe]42-europe had always been terrifying to [them]709-them , and indeed to [[his]699-her uncle whole family]710-his whole family , since the extraordinary misadventure whereby , as the result of a protracted diligence journey over [bad roads]711-bad roads , of a violent thunderstorm , and [a delayed steamer]712-a delayed steamer , [Campton]174-campton had been born in [Paris]5-paris instead of [Utica]39-utica . [Mrs. Campton]216-mrs. campton [the elder]713-the elder had taken the warning to heart , and never again left [[her]216-mrs. campton native soil]714-her native soil ; but [the sisters]715-the sisters , safely and properly brought into [the world]2535-the world in [[their]715-the sisters own city and State]717-their own city and state , had always felt that [Campton]174-campton ’s persistent yearnings for [Europe]42-europe , and [his]174-campton inexplicable detachment from [Utica]39-utica and [the Mangle]217-the mangle , were mysteriously due to the accident of [[their]715-the sisters mother]718-their mother ’s premature confinement . Compared with the admonitions of [these domestic censors]719-these domestic censors , [Miss Ambrose]218-miss ambrose ’s innocent conversation was as seductive as the tangles of [Neæra]219-neæra ’s hair , and it used to be a joke between [them]720-them ( one of the few [he]174-campton had ever been able to make [her]218-miss ambrose see ) that [he]174-campton , [the raw up - Stater]721-the raw up - stater , was Parisian born , while [she]218-miss ambrose , the glass and pattern of worldly knowledge , had seen the light in the pure atmosphere of [Madison Avenue]43-madison avenue . Through [her]218-miss ambrose , in due course , [he]174-campton came to know [another girl]722-another girl , [a queer abrupt young American]723-a queer abrupt young american , already [an old maid at twenty - two]724-an old maid at twenty - two , and in open revolt against [[her]218-miss ambrose family]435-her family for reasons not unlike [his]174-campton own . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had come abroad to keep [house]726-house for [a worthless “ artistic ”[727-a worthless “ artistic ” brother] brother]727-a worthless “ artistic ” brother , who was preparing to be [a sculptor]728-a sculptor by prolonged sessions in [Anglo - American bars]729-anglo - american bars and the lobbies of [music - halls]730-music - halls . When [he]174-campton finally went under , and was shipped [home]502-home , [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony stayed on in [Paris]5-paris , ashamed , as [she]221-miss anthony told [Campton]174-campton , to go back and face the righteous triumph of [a family]732-a family connection who had unanimously disbelieved in the possibility of making [Bill Anthony]222-bill anthony into [a sculptor]728-a sculptor , and in the wisdom of [[his]174-campton sister]734-his sister ’s staking [her]734-his sister small means on the venture . “ Somehow , behind it all , [I]221-miss anthony was right , and [they]735-many friends in paris were wrong ; but to do anything with poor [Bill]222-bill anthony [I]221-miss anthony ought to have been able to begin two or three generations back , ”[221-miss anthony] [she]221-miss anthony confessed . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony had [many friends in [Paris]5-paris]735-many friends in paris , of whom [Julia Ambrose]214-julia was the most admired ; and [she]221-miss anthony had assisted sympathizingly ( if not enthusiastically ) at [Campton]174-campton ’s wooing of [Julia]214-julia , and [their]736-their hasty marriage . [Her]221-miss anthony only note of warning had been the reminder that [Julia]214-julia had always been poor , and had always lived as if [she]214-julia were rich ; and that was silenced by [Campton]174-campton ’s rejoinder that [the Magic Mangle]737-the magic mangle , to which [the Campton]174-campton prosperity was due , was some day going to make [him]174-campton rich , though [he]174-campton had always lived as if [he]174-campton were poor . “ Well — [you’d]174-campton better not , any longer , ”[220-adele anthony] [Adele]220-adele anthony sharply advised ; and [he]174-campton laughed , and promised to go out and buy a new hat . In truth , careless of comfort as [he]174-campton was , [he]174-campton adored luxury in [women]738-women , and was resolved to let [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife ruin [him]174-campton if [she]516-his wife did it handsomely enough . Doubtless [she]516-his wife might have , had fate given [her]516-his wife time ; but soon after [their]740-their marriage [old Mr. Campton]174-campton died , and it was found that [a trusted manager]741-a trusted manager had so invested the profits of [the Mangle]742-the mangle that [the heirs]743-the heirs inherited only a series of law - suits . [John Campton]174-campton , henceforth , was merely [the unsuccessful son of [a ruined manufacturer]745-a ruined manufacturer]744-the unsuccessful son of a ruined manufacturer ; painting became a luxury [he]174-campton could no longer afford , and [[his]174-campton mother]583-his mother and [sisters]747-sisters besought [him]174-campton to come back and take over what was left of [the business]748-the business . It seemed so clearly [his]174-campton duty that , with anguish of soul , [he]174-campton prepared to go ; but [Julia]214-julia , on being consulted , developed a sudden passion for art and poverty . “ [We]740-their ’d have to live in [Utica]39-utica — for some years at any rate ? ”[214-julia] “ Well , yes , no doubt — — ”[740-their] [They]740-their faced the fact desolately . “ [They]740-their ’d much better look out for [another manager]2557-another manager . What do [you]174-campton know about business ? Since [you]174-campton ’ve taken up painting [you]174-campton ’d better try to make a success of that , ”[214-julia] [she]214-julia advised [him]174-campton ; and [he]174-campton was too much of the same mind not to agree . It was not long before [George]175-george ’s birth , and [they]740-their were fully resolved to go [home]502-home for the event , and thus spare [their]740-their hoped for heir the inconvenience of coming into [the world]2535-the world , like [[his]175-george father]580-his father , in [a foreign country]752-a foreign country . But now this was not to be thought of , and the eventual inconvenience to [George]175-george was lost sight of by [[his]175-george progenitors]753-his progenitors in the contemplation of nearer problems . For a few years [their]740-their life dragged along shabbily and depressingly . Now that [Campton]174-campton ’s painting was no longer [an amateur]754-an amateur ’s hobby but a domestic obligation , [Julia]214-julia thought it [her]214-julia duty to interest [herself]214-julia in it ; and [her]214-julia only idea of doing so was by means of what [she]214-julia called “ relations , ”[214-julia] using the word in its French and diplomatic sense . [She]214-julia was convinced that [[her]214-julia husband]539-her husband ’s lack of success was due to [Beausite]176-beausite ’s blighting epigram , and to [Campton]174-campton ’s subsequent resolve to strike out for [himself]176-beausite . “ It ’s a great mistake to try to be original till [people]378-people have got used to [you]176-beausite , ”[214-julia] [she]214-julia said , with the shrewdness that sometimes startled [him]176-beausite . “ If [you]176-beausite ’d only been civil to [Beausite]176-beausite [he]176-beausite would have ended by taking [you]176-beausite up , and then [you]176-beausite could have painted as queerly as [you]176-beausite liked . ”[214-julia] [Beausite]176-beausite , by this time , had succumbed to the honours which lie in wait for such talents , and in [his]176-beausite starred and titled maturity [his]176-beausite earlier dread of rivals had given way to a prudent benevolence . [Young artists]756-young artists were always welcome at the receptions [he]176-beausite gave in [[his]176-beausite sumptuous hotel of [the Avenue du Bois]758-the avenue du bois]757-his sumptuous hotel of the avenue du bois . [Those who threatened to be rivals]759-those who threatened to be rivals were even invited to dine ; and [Julia]214-julia was justified in triumphing when such an invitation finally rewarded [her]214-julia efforts . [Campton]174-campton , with a laugh , threw the card into the stove . “ If [you]214-julia ’d only understand that that ’s not the way , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said . “ What is , then ? ”[174-campton] “ Why , letting [all that lot]2559-all that lot see what unutterable rubbish one thinks [them]2559-all that lot ! ”[214-julia] “ [I]214-julia should have thought [you]174-campton ’d tried that long enough , ”[214-julia] [she]214-julia said with pale lips ; but [he]174-campton answered jovially that it never palled on [him]174-campton . [She]214-julia was bitterly offended ; but [she]214-julia knew [Campton]174-campton by this time , and was not [a woman]760-a woman to waste [herself]214-julia in vain resentment . [She]214-julia simply suggested that since [he]174-campton would not profit by [Beausite]176-beausite ’s advance the only alternative was to try to get orders for portraits ; and though at that stage [he]174-campton was not in the mood for portrait - painting , [he]174-campton made an honest attempt to satisfy [her]214-julia . [She]214-julia began , of course , by sitting for [him]174-campton . [She]214-julia sat again and again ; but , lovely as [she]214-julia was , [he]174-campton was not inspired , and one day , in sheer self - defence , [he]174-campton blurted out that [she]214-julia was not paintable . [She]214-julia never forgot the epithet , and it loomed large in [their]761-their subsequent recriminations . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony — it was just like [her]214-julia — gave [him]174-campton [his]174-campton first order , and [she]214-julia did prove paintable . [Campton]174-campton made a success of [her]214-julia long crooked pink - nosed face ; but [she]214-julia did n’t perceive it ( [she]214-julia had wanted something oval , with tulle , and a rose in a taper hand ) , and after heroically facing the picture for six months [she]214-julia hid it away in [an attic]762-an attic , whence , a year or so before the date of [the artist]763-the artist ’s present musings , it had been fished out as an “ early [Campton]174-campton , ”[214-julia] to be exhibited half a dozen times , and have articles written about it in the leading art reviews . [Adele]220-adele anthony ’s picture acted as an awful warning to [intending patrons]764-intending patrons , and after one or two attempts at depicting [mistrustful friends]765-mistrustful friends [Campton]174-campton refused to constrain [his]174-campton muse , and no more was said of portrait - painting . But life in [Paris]5-paris was growing too expensive . [He]174-campton persuaded [Julia]214-julia to try [Spain]186-spain , and [they]766-they wandered about [there]467-there for a year . [She]214-julia was not fault - finding , [she]214-julia did not complain , but [she]214-julia hated travelling , [she]214-julia could not eat things cooked in oil , and [his]174-campton pictures seemed to [her]214-julia to be growing more and more ugly and unsalable . Finally [they]766-they came one day to [Ronda]223-ronda , after a trying sojourn at [Cordova]45-cordova . In [the train]768-the train [Julia]214-julia had moaned a little at the mosquitoes of the previous night , and at the heat and dirt of [the second - class compartment]769-the second - class compartment ; then , always conscious of the ill - breeding of fretfulness , [she]214-julia had bent [her]214-julia lovely head above [her]214-julia Tauchnitz . And it was then that [Campton]174-campton , looking out of the window to avoid [her]214-julia fatally familiar profile , had suddenly discovered another . It was that of [a peasant girl in front of [a small whitewashed house]771-a small whitewashed house , under a white pergola hung with bunches of big red peppers]770-a peasant girl in front of a small whitewashed house , under a white pergola hung with bunches of big red peppers . [The house]772-the house , which was close to [the railway]773-the railway , was propped against an orange - coloured rock , and in the glare cast up from the red earth [its]772-the house walls looked as blue as snow in shadow . [The girl]774-the girl was all blue - white too , from [her]774-the girl cotton skirt to the kerchief knotted turban - wise above two folds of blue - black hair . [Her]774-the girl round forehead and merry nose were relieved like a bronze medallion against the wall ; and [she]774-the girl stood with [her]774-the girl hands on [her]774-the girl hips , laughing at a little pig asleep under a cork - tree , who lay on [his]174-campton side like a dog . The vision filled the carriage - window and then vanished ; but it remained so sharply impressed on [Campton]174-campton that even then [he]174-campton knew what was going to happen . [He]174-campton leaned back with a sense of relief , and forgot everything else . The next morning [he]174-campton said to [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife : “ There ’s a little place up the line that [I]174-campton want to go back and paint . [You]516-his wife do n’t mind staying [here]2489-here a day or two , do [you]516-his wife ? ”[174-campton] [She]516-his wife said [she]516-his wife did not mind ; it was what [she]516-his wife always said ; but [he]174-campton was somehow aware that this was the particular grievance [she]516-his wife had always been waiting for . [He]174-campton did not care for that , or for anything but getting a seat in the diligence which started every morning for [the village nearest [the white house]777-the white house]776-the village nearest the white house . On the way [he]174-campton remembered that [he]174-campton had left [Julia]214-julia only forty pesetas , but [he]174-campton did not care about that either .... [He]174-campton stayed a month , and when [he]174-campton returned to [Ronda]223-ronda [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife had gone back to [Paris]5-paris , leaving a letter to say that the matter was in the hands of [[her]516-his wife lawyers]779-her lawyers . “ What did [you]174-campton do it for — [I]220-adele anthony mean in that particular way ? For goodness knows [I]220-adele anthony understand all the rest , ”[220-adele anthony] [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had once asked [him]174-campton , while the divorce proceedings were going on ; and [he]174-campton had shaken [his]174-campton head , conscious that [he]174-campton could not explain . It was a year or two later that [he]174-campton met [the first person who _ did _ understand]780-the first person who _ did _ understand : [a Russian lady who had heard the story]781-a russian lady who had heard the story , was curious to know [him]174-campton , and asked , one day , when [their]782-their friendship had progressed , to see the sketches [he]174-campton had brought back from [his]174-campton _ fugue _ . “ _ Comme je vous comprends ! _ ”[781-a russian lady who had heard the story] [she]781-a russian lady who had heard the story had murmured , [her]781-a russian lady who had heard the story grey eyes deep in [his]174-campton ; but perceiving that [she]781-a russian lady who had heard the story did not allude to the sketches , but to [his]174-campton sentimental adventure , [Campton]174-campton pushed the drawings out of sight , vexed with [himself]174-campton for having shown them . [He]174-campton forgave [the Russian lady]783-the russian lady [her]783-the russian lady artistic obtuseness for the sake of [her]783-the russian lady human comprehension . [They]782-their had met at the loneliest moment of [his]174-campton life , when [his]174-campton art seemed to have failed [him]174-campton like everything else , and when the struggle to get possession of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , which had been going on in the courts ever since the break with [Julia]214-julia , had finally been decided against [him]174-campton . [[His]174-campton Russian friend]785-his russian friend consoled , amused and agitated [him]174-campton , and after a few years drifted out of [his]174-campton life as irresponsibly as [she]785-his russian friend had drifted into it ; and [he]174-campton found [himself]174-campton , at forty - five , [a lonely thwarted man]786-a lonely thwarted man , as full as ever of faith in [his]174-campton own powers , but with little left in human nature or in opportunity . It was about this time that [he]174-campton heard that [Julia]214-julia was to marry again , and that [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy would have [a stepfather]788-a stepfather .
