[He]174-campton knew that even [[his]174-campton own family]789-his own family thought it “ the best thing that could happen . ”[789-his own family] [They]789-his own family were tired of clubbing together to pay [Julia]214-julia ’s alimony , and heaved a united sigh of relief when [they]789-his own family learned that [her]214-julia second choice had fallen , not on the bankrupt “ foreign Count ”[200-bullard] [they]789-his own family had always dreaded , but on [the [Paris]5-paris partner of [the famous bank of [Bullard]200-bullard and [Brant]197-mr. brant]791-the famous bank of bullard and brant]790-the paris partner of the famous bank of bullard and brant . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s request that [[his]197-mr. brant wife]516-his wife ’s alimony should be discontinued gave [him]197-mr. brant a moral superiority which even [Campton]174-campton ’s recent successes could not shake . It was felt that the request expressed the contempt of an income easily counted in seven figures for a pittance painfully screwed up to four ; and [the Camptons]224-the camptons admired [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant much more for not needing [their]224-the camptons money than for refusing it . [Their]224-the camptons attitude left [John Campton]174-campton without support in [his]174-campton struggle to keep a hold on [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy . [[His]174-campton family]794-his family sincerely thought [George]175-george safer with [the Brants]203-the brants than with [[his]175-george own father]795-his own father , and [the father]568-the father could advance to the contrary no arguments [they]794-his family would have understood . All the forces of order seemed leagued against [him]568-the father ; and it was perhaps this fact that suddenly drove [him]568-the father into conformity with [them]794-his family . At any rate , from the day of [Julia]214-julia ’s remarriage [no other woman]797-no other woman shared [[her]214-julia former husband]798-her former husband ’s life . [Campton]174-campton settled down to the solitude of [[his]174-campton dusty studio at [Montmartre]1-montmartre]799-his dusty studio at montmartre , and painted doggedly , all [his]174-campton thoughts on [George]175-george . * * * * * At this point in [his]174-campton reminiscences the bells of [Sainte Clotilde]225-sainte clotilde rang out the half - hour after midnight , and [Campton]174-campton rose and went into [the darkened sitting - room]800-the darkened sitting - room . The door into [[George]175-george ’s room]801-george ’s room was open , and in the silence [the father]568-the father heard [the boy]416-the boy ’s calm breathing . A light from [the bathroom]804-the bathroom cast its ray on the dressing - table , which was scattered with the contents of [George]175-george ’s pockets . [Campton]174-campton , dwelling with a new tenderness on everything that belonged to [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , noticed a smart antelope card - case ( [George]175-george had [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother ’s weakness for Bond Street novelties ) , a wrist - watch , [his]174-campton studs , a bundle of bank - notes ; and beside these a thumbed and dirty red book , the size of a large pocket - diary . [The father]568-the father wondered what it was ; then of a sudden [he]568-the father knew . [He]174-campton had once seen [[Mme . Lebel]195-mme ’s grandson]808-mme . lebel ’s grandson pull just such a red book from [his]174-campton pocket as [he]174-campton was leaving for [his]174-campton “ twenty - eight days ”[195-mme] of military service ; it was the _ livret militaire _ that [every French citizen under forty - eight]809-every french citizen under forty - eight carries about with [him]174-campton . [Campton]174-campton had never paid much attention to French military regulations : [George]175-george ’s service over , [he]174-campton had dismissed the matter from [his]174-campton mind , forgetting that [[his]174-campton son]364-his son was still [a member of [the French army]812-the french army , and as closely linked to the fortunes of [France]18-france as [the grandson of [the concierge of]814-the concierge of [Montmartre]1-montmartre]813-the grandson of the concierge of montmartre]811-a member of the french army , and as closely linked to the fortunes of france as the grandson of the concierge of montmartre . Now it occurred to [him]174-campton that that little red book would answer the questions [he]174-campton had not dared to put ; and stealing in , [he]174-campton possessed [himself]174-campton of it and carried it back to [the sitting - room]815-the sitting - room . There [he]174-campton sat down by the lamp and read . First [George]175-george ’s name , [his]175-george domicile , [his]175-george rank as a _ maréchal des logis _ of dragoons , the number of [[his]175-george regiment]816-his regiment and its base : all that was already familiar . But what was this on the next page ? “ In case of general mobilisation announced to [the populations of [France]18-france]2561-the populations of france by public proclamations , or by notices posted in [the streets]2562-the streets , [the bearer of this order]2563-the bearer of this order is to rejoin [[his]175-george regiment]816-his regiment at — — . “[175-george] [He]175-george is to take with [him]175-george provisions for one day . “ [He]175-george is to present [himself]175-george at [the station of —]2565-the station of — — on the third day of mobilisation at 6 o’clock , and to take [the train]768-the train indicated by [the station - master]2567-the station - master . “[175-george] The days of mobilisation are counted from 0 o’clock to 24 o’clock . The first day is that on which the order of mobilisation is published . ” [Campton]174-campton dropped the book and pressed [his]174-campton hands to [his]174-campton temples . “[175-george] The days of mobilisation are counted from 0 o’clock to 24 o’clock . The first day is that on which the order of mobilisation is published . ” Then , if [France]18-france mobilised that day , [George]175-george would start the second day after , at six in the morning . [George]175-george might be going to leave [him]175-george within forty - eight hours from that very moment ! [Campton]174-campton had always vaguely supposed that , some day or other , if war came , a telegram would call [George]175-george to [[his]175-george base]2568-his base ; it had never occurred to [him]174-campton that every detail of [the boy]416-the boy ’s military life had long since been regulated by the dread power which had [him]174-campton in [its]18-france grasp . [He]174-campton read the next paragraph : “[817-the bearer] [The bearer]817-the bearer will travel free of charge — — ” and thought with a grin how it would annoy [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant that [the French government]2570-the french government should presume to treat [[his]174-campton stepson]590-his stepson as if [he]174-campton could not pay [his]174-campton way . [The plump bundle of bank - notes on the dressing - table]2572-the plump bundle of bank - notes on the dressing - table seemed to look with ineffectual scorn at the red book that sojourned so democratically in the same pocket . And [Campton]174-campton , picturing [George]175-george jammed into [an overcrowded military train]2573-an overcrowded military train , on [the plebeian wooden seat of [a third - class compartment]2575-a third - class compartment]2574-the plebeian wooden seat of a third - class compartment , grinned again , forgetful of [his]174-campton own anxiety in the vision of [Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s exasperation . Ah , well , it was n’t war yet , whatever [they]2576-they said ! [He]174-campton carried the red book back to the dressing - table . The light falling across the bed drew [his]174-campton eye to [the young face on the pillow]2577-the young face on the pillow . [George]175-george lay on [his]175-george side , one arm above [his]175-george head , the other laxly stretched along the bed . [He]175-george had thrown off the blankets , and the sheet , clinging to [his]175-george body , modelled [his]175-george slim flank and legs as [he]175-george lay in dreamless rest . For a long time [Campton]174-campton stood gazing ; then [he]174-campton stole back to [the sitting - room]815-the sitting - room , picked up a sketch - book and pencil and returned . [He]174-campton knew there was no danger of waking [George]175-george , and [he]174-campton began to draw , eagerly but deliberately , fascinated by the happy accident of the lighting , and of [the boy]416-the boy ’s position . “[817-the bearer] Like a statue of [a young knight]818-a young knight [I]0-i ’ve seen somewhere , ” [he]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton , vexed and surprised that [he]174-campton , whose plastic memories were always so precise , should not remember where ; and then [his]174-campton pencil stopped . What [he]174-campton had really thought was : “[817-the bearer] Like the _ effigy _ of [a young knight”—though]2580-a young knight”—though [he]174-campton had instinctively changed the word as it formed itself . [He]174-campton leaned in the doorway , the sketch - book in hand , and continued to gaze at [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . It was the clinging sheet , no doubt , that gave [him]174-campton that look ... and the white glare of the electric burner . If war came , that was just the way [a boy]2582-a boy might lie on a battle - field - or afterward in [a hospital bed]2583-a hospital bed . Not _ [[his]174-campton _ boy]2584-his _ boy , thank heaven ; but very probably [[his]174-campton boy ’s friends]2585-his boy ’s friends : hundreds and [thousands of boys like [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy , the age of [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy]2586-thousands of boys like his boy , the age of his boy , with a laugh like [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ’s .... The wicked waste of it ! Well , that was what war meant ... what to - morrow might bring to [millions of [parents]2591-parents like [himself]174-campton]2590-millions of parents like himself . [He]174-campton stiffened [his]174-campton shoulders , and opened the sketch - book again . What watery stuff was [he]174-campton made of , [he]174-campton wondered ? Just because [the boy]416-the boy lay as if [he]416-the boy were posing for a tombstone ! ... What of [Signorelli]226-signorelli , who had sat at [[his]226-signorelli dead son]2593-his dead son ’s side and drawn [him]416-the boy , tenderly , minutely , while the coffin waited ? Well , damn [Signorelli]226-signorelli — that was all ! [Campton]174-campton threw down [his]174-campton book , turned out the sitting - room lights , and limped away to bed . [V]227-v The next morning [he]174-campton said to [George]175-george , over coffee on [the terrace]675-the terrace : “[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i ’ll drop in at [Cook ’s]819-cook ’s about [our]820-our tickets . ” [George]175-george nodded , munching [his]175-george golden roll . “[0-i] Right . [I]0-i ’ll run up to see [mother]821-mother , then . ” [[His]2593-his dead son father]580-his father was silent . Inwardly [he]580-his father was saying to [himself]580-his father : “[821-mother] The chances are [she]821-mother ’ll be going back to [Deauville]6-deauville this afternoon . ” There had not been much to gather from the newspapers heaped at [their]820-our feet . [Austria]228-austria had ordered general mobilisation ; but while the tone of the despatches was nervous and contradictory that of the leading articles remained almost ominously reassuring . [Campton]174-campton absorbed the reassurance without heeding its quality : it was a drug [he]174-campton had to have at any price . [He]174-campton expected [the Javanese dancer]2596-the javanese dancer to sit to [him]174-campton that afternoon , but [he]174-campton had not proposed to [George]175-george to be present . On the chance that things might eventually take a wrong turn [he]174-campton meant to say a word to [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze ; and the presence of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son would have been embarrassing . “[822-you] [You]822-you ’ll be back for lunch ? ” [he]174-campton called to [George]175-george , who still lounged on [the terrace]675-the terrace in pyjamas . “[822-you] Rather.—That is , unless [mother]821-mother makes a point ... in case [she]821-mother ’s leaving . ” “[821-mother] Oh , of course , ” said [Campton]174-campton with grim cordiality . “[821-mother] [You]822-you see , [dear old boy]824-dear old boy , [I]0-i ’ve got to see [Uncle Andy]229-uncle andy some time .... ” It was the grotesque name that [George]175-george , in [his]175-george babyhood , had given to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , and when [he]175-george grew up it had been difficult to substitute another . “[822-you] Especially now — — ” [George]175-george added , pulling [himself]175-george up out of [his]175-george chair . “[822-you] Now ? ” [They]2599-they looked at [each other]443-each other in silence , irritation in [the father]568-the father ’s eye , indulgent amusement in [the son]569-the son ’s . “[822-you] Why , if [you]822-you and [I]0-i are really off on this long trek — — ” “[822-you] Oh , of course , ” agreed [Campton]174-campton , relieved . “[822-you] [You]824-dear old boy ’d much better lunch with [them]825-them . [I]0-i always want [you]824-dear old boy to do what ’s decent . ” [He]0-i paused on the threshold to add : “[0-i] By the way , do n’t forget [Adele]220-adele anthony . ” “[220-adele anthony] Well , rather not , ” [[his]0-i son]364-his son responded . “[220-adele anthony] And [we]826-we ’ll keep the evening free for something awful . ” As [he]0-i left [the room]475-the room [he]0-i heard [George]175-george rapping on the telephone and calling out [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s number . [Campton]174-campton had to have reassurance at any price ; and [he]174-campton got it , as usual , irrationally but irresistibly , through [his]174-campton eyes . The mere fact that the midsummer sun lay so tenderly on [Paris]5-paris , that the bronze dolphins of the fountains in [the square]2605-the square were spraying [the Nereids]230-the nereids ’ Louis Philippe chignons as playfully as ever ; that [the sleepy Cities of [France]18-france]2606-the sleepy cities of france dozed as heavily on [their]2606-the sleepy cities of france thrones , and the Horses of [Marly]231-marly pranced as fractiously on [their]231-marly pedestals ; that the glorious central setting of [the city]672-the city lay there in its usual mellow pomp — all this gave [him]174-campton a sense of security that no crisscrossing of [Reuters]46-reuters and [Havases]232-havases could shake . Nevertheless , [he]174-campton reflected that there was no use in battling with [the silly hysterical crowd [he]174-campton would be sure to encounter at [Cook ’s]47-cook ’s]2608-the silly hysterical crowd he would be sure to encounter at cook ’s ; and having left word with [the hotel - porter]2609-the hotel - porter to secure two “[220-adele anthony] sleepings ” on [the Naples express]2610-the naples express , [he]174-campton drove to [the studio]370-the studio . On the way , as [his]174-campton habit was , [he]174-campton thought hard of [his]174-campton model : everything else disappeared like a rolled - up curtain , and [his]174-campton inner vision centred itself on the little yellow face [he]174-campton was to paint . Peering through [her]2612-her cobwebby window , [he]174-campton saw [old Mme . Lebel]195-mme on the watch . [He]174-campton knew [she]2612-her wanted to pounce out and ask if there would be war ; and composing [his]174-campton most taciturn countenance [he]174-campton gave [her]2612-her a preoccupied nod and hurried by . [The studio]370-the studio looked grimy and disordered , and [he]174-campton remembered that [he]174-campton had intended , the evening before , to come back and set [it]370-the studio to rights . In pursuance of this plan , [he]174-campton got out a canvas , fussed with [his]174-campton brushes and colours , and then tried once more to make [the place]2614-the place tidy . But [his]174-campton attempts at order always resulted in worse confusion ; the fact had been one of [Julia]214-julia ’s grievances against [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton had often thought that a reaction from [his]174-campton ways probably explained the lifeless neatness of [the Anderson Brant drawing - room]2615-the anderson brant drawing - room . [Campton]174-campton had fled to [Montmartre]1-montmartre to escape a number of things : first of all , the possibility of meeting [people who would want to talk about the European situation , then of being called up by [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant , and lastly of having to lunch alone in [a fashionable restaurant]2617-a fashionable restaurant]2616-people who would want to talk about the european situation , then of being called up by mrs. brant , and lastly of having to lunch alone in a fashionable restaurant . In [his]174-campton morbid dread of seeing [people]378-people [he]174-campton would have preferred an omelette in [the studio]370-the studio , if only [Mariette]187-mariette had been at hand to make it ; and [he]174-campton decided , after a vain struggle with [his]174-campton muddled “[220-adele anthony] properties , ” to cross over to [the Luxembourg quarter]2620-the luxembourg quarter and pick up a meal in [a wine - shop]2621-a wine - shop . [He]174-campton did not own to [himself]174-campton [his]174-campton secret reason for this decision ; but it caused [him]174-campton , after a glance at [his]174-campton watch , to hasten [his]174-campton steps down [the rue Montmartre]2622-the rue montmartre and bribe [a passing taxi]2623-a passing taxi to carry [him]174-campton to [the Museum of the Luxembourg]2624-the museum of the luxembourg . [He]174-campton reached [it]2624-the museum of the luxembourg ten minutes before the midday closing , and hastening past the serried statues , turned into [a room half - way down [the gallery]2626-the gallery]2625-a room half - way down the gallery . [[Whistler]233-whistler ’s Mother]2627-whistler ’s mother and [the Carmencita of [Sargent]48-sargent]2628-the carmencita of sargent wondered at each other from [its]2624-the museum of the luxembourg walls ; and on the same wall with the [Whistler]233-whistler hung the picture [Campton]174-campton had come for : [his]174-campton portrait of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . [He]174-campton had given it to [the Luxembourg]41-luxembourg the day after [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had tried to buy it , with the object of inflicting the most cruel slight [he]174-campton could think of on [the banker]547-the banker . In the generous summer light the picture shone out on [him]0-i with a communicative warmth : never had [he]0-i seen so far into its depths . “[220-adele anthony] No wonder , ” [he]0-i thought , “[220-adele anthony] it opened [people]378-people ’s eyes to what [I]0-i was trying for . ” [He]0-i stood and stared [his]0-i own eyes full , mentally comparing the features before [him]0-i with those of [the firmer harder George [he]0-i had left on [the terrace of [the Crillon]28-the crillon]2632-the terrace of the crillon]2631-the firmer harder george he had left on the terrace of the crillon , and noting how time , while fulfilling the rich promise of the younger face , had yet taken something from its brightness . [Campton]174-campton , at that moment , found more satisfaction than ever in thinking how it must have humiliated [Brant]197-mr. brant to have the picture given to [France]18-france . “[828-he] [He]828-he could have understood [my]0-i keeping it [myself]0-i — or holding it for a bigger price — but _ giving it _ — — ! ” The satisfaction was worth the sacrifice of the best record [he]174-campton would ever have of that phase of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s youth . At various times afterward [he]0-i had tried for the same [George]175-george , but not one of [his]0-i later studies had that magic light on it . Still , [he]0-i was glad [he]0-i had given the picture . It was safe , safer than it would have been with [him]0-i . [His]0-i great dread had always been that if [his]0-i will were mislaid ( and [his]0-i things were always getting mislaid ) the picture might be sold , and fall into [Brant]197-mr. brant ’s hands after [his]0-i death . The closing signal drove [him]0-i out of [the Museum]2634-the museum , and [he]0-i turned into [the first wine - shop]2635-the first wine - shop . [He]0-i had advised [George]175-george to lunch with [the Brants]203-the brants , but there was disappointment in [his]0-i heart . Seeing the turn things were taking , [he]0-i had hoped [the boy]416-the boy would feel the impulse to remain with [him]0-i . But , after all , at such a time [a son]2637-a son could not refuse to go to [[his]2637-a son mother]583-his mother . [Campton]174-campton pictured [the little party of three]2639-the little party of three grouped about the luncheon - table in [the high cool dining - room of [the Avenue Marigny]548-the avenue marigny]2640-the high cool dining - room of the avenue marigny , with the famous [Hubert Robert]235-hubert robert panels , and [the Louis XV silver and Sèvres]2642-the louis xv silver and sèvres ; while [he]0-i , [the father]568-the father , [[George]175-george ’s father]2644-george ’s father , sat alone at the soiled table of [a frowsy wine - shop]2645-a frowsy wine - shop . Well — it was [he]174-campton who had so willed it . Life was too crazy a muddle — and who could have foreseen that [he]174-campton might have been repaid for twenty - six years with [such a wife]2646-such a wife by keeping an undivided claim on [such a son]2647-such a son ? [His]174-campton meal over , [he]174-campton hastened back to [the studio]370-the studio , hoping to find [the dancer]654-the dancer [there]467-there . [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze had sworn to bring [her]654-the dancer at two , and [Campton]174-campton was known to exact absolute punctuality . [He]174-campton had put the final touch to [his]174-campton fame by refusing to paint [the mad young Duchesse de la Tour Crenelée — who was exceptionally paintable — because [she]654-the dancer had kept [him]174-campton waiting three - quarters of an hour]2651-the mad young duchesse de la tour crenelée — who was exceptionally paintable — because she had kept him waiting three - quarters of an hour . But now , though it was nearly three , and [the dancer]654-the dancer and [[her]654-the dancer friend]2653-her friend had not come , [Campton]174-campton dared not move , lest [he]174-campton should miss [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze . “[828-he] Sent for by [a rich patient in a war - funk]829-a rich patient in a war - funk ; or else hanging about in [[the girl]774-the girl ’s dressing - room]831-the girl ’s dressing - room while [she]774-the girl polishes [her]774-the girl toe - nails , ” [Campton]174-campton reflected ; and sulkily sat down to wait . [He]174-campton had never been willing to have a telephone . To [him]174-campton it was a live thing , a kind of Laocoon - serpent that caught one in its coils and dragged [one struggling to the receiver]2654-one struggling to the receiver . [[His]174-campton friends]2655-his friends had spent all [their]2655-his friends logic in trying to argue away this belief ; but [he]174-campton answered obstinately : “[832-every one] [Every one]832-every one would be sure to call [me]0-i up when [Mariette]187-mariette was out . ” Even [the Russian lady]783-the russian lady , during [her]783-the russian lady brief reign , had pleaded in vain on this point . [He]174-campton would have given a good deal now if [he]174-campton had listened to [her]783-the russian lady . The terror of having to cope with small material difficulties , always strongest in [him]174-campton in moments of artistic inspiration — when the hushed universe seemed hardly big enough to hold [him]174-campton and [[his]174-campton model]2657-his model — this dread anchored [him]174-campton to [his]174-campton seat while [he]174-campton tried to make up [his]174-campton mind to send [Mme . Lebel]195-mme to [the nearest telephone - station]2658-the nearest telephone - station . If [he]174-campton called to [her]783-the russian lady , [she]783-the russian lady would instantly begin : “[832-every one] And the war , [sir]2499-sir ? ” And [he]174-campton would have to settle that first . Besides , if [he]174-campton did not telephone [himself]174-campton [he]174-campton could not make sure of another appointment with [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze . But the idea of battling alone with the telephone in [a public place]2659-a public place covered [his]174-campton large body with a damp distress . If only [George]175-george had been in reach ! [He]174-campton waited till four , and then , furious , locked [the studio]370-the studio and went down . [Mme . Lebel]195-mme still sat in [[her]783-the russian lady spidery den]2661-her spidery den . [She]783-the russian lady looked at [him]174-campton gravely , [their]2662-their eyes met , [they]2662-their exchanged a bow , but [she]783-the russian lady did not move or speak . [She]783-the russian lady was busy as usual with some rusty sewing — [he]174-campton thought it odd that [she]783-the russian lady should not rush out to waylay [him]174-campton . Everything that day was odd . [He]174-campton found all [the telephone - booths]2663-the telephone - booths besieged . [The people waiting]2664-the people waiting were certainly bad cases of war - funk , to judge from [their]2664-the people waiting looks ; after scrutinizing [them]2664-the people waiting for a while [he]174-campton decided to return to [[his]174-campton hotel]2665-his hotel , and try to communicate with [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze from [there]467-there . To [his]174-campton annoyance there was not [a taxi]2503-a taxi to be seen . [He]174-campton limped down [the slope of [Montmartre]1-montmartre]2668-the slope of montmartre to [the nearest métro - station]2669-the nearest métro - station , and just as [he]174-campton was preparing to force [his]174-campton lame bulk into [a crowded train]2670-a crowded train , caught sight of [a solitary horse - cab]2671-a solitary horse - cab : [a vehicle [he]174-campton had not risked [himself]174-campton in for years]2672-a vehicle he had not risked himself in for years . [The cab - driver]2673-the cab - driver , for gastronomic reasons , declined to take [him]174-campton farther than [the Madeleine]2674-the madeleine ; and getting out there , [Campton]174-campton walked along [the rue Royale]2675-the rue royale . Everything still looked wonderfully as usual ; and the fountains in [the Place]2614-the place sparkled gloriously . [Comparatively few people]2677-comparatively few people were about : [he]174-campton was surprised to see how few . [A small group of [them]2677-comparatively few people]2678-a small group of them , [he]174-campton noticed , had paused near the doorway of [the Ministry of Marine]2679-the ministry of marine , and were looking — without visible excitement — at a white paper pasted on the wall . [He]174-campton crossed [the street]2680-the street and looked too . In the middle of the paper , in queer Gothic - looking characters , [he]174-campton saw the words = “[2499-sir] Les Armees De Terre et De Mer .... ”= War had come — — [He]174-campton knew now that [he]174-campton had never for an instant believed it possible . Even when [he]174-campton had had that white - lipped interview with [the Brants]203-the brants , even when [he]174-campton had planned to take [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze by [his]174-campton senile infatuation , and secure a medical certificate for [George]175-george ; even then , [he]174-campton had simply been obeying the superstitious impulse which makes [a man]2492-a man carry [his]2492-a man umbrella when [he]2492-a man goes out on a cloudless morning . War had come . [He]174-campton stood on the edge of [the sidewalk]2682-the sidewalk , and tried to think — now that it was here — what it really meant : that is , what it meant to [him]174-campton . Beyond that [he]174-campton had no intention of venturing . “[2499-sir] This is not [our]834-our job anyhow , ” [he]174-campton muttered , repeating the phrase with which [he]174-campton had bolstered up [his]174-campton talk with [Julia]214-julia . But abstract thinking was impossible : [his]174-campton confused mind could only snatch at a few drifting scraps of purpose . “[2499-sir] Let ’s be practical , ” [he]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton . The first thing to do was to get back to [the hotel]662-the hotel and call up [the physician]415-the physician . [He]174-campton strode along at [his]174-campton fastest limp , suddenly contemptuous of [the people who got in [his]174-campton way]2685-the people who got in his way . “[236-war] [War]236-war — and [they]835-they ’ve nothing to do but dawdle and gape ! How like [the French]208-the french ! ” [He]174-campton found [himself]174-campton hating [the French]208-the french . [He]174-campton remembered that [he]174-campton had asked to have [his]174-campton sleepings engaged for the following night . But even if [he]174-campton managed to secure [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s discharge , there could be no thought , now , of [George]175-george ’s leaving [the country]2496-the country ; and [he]174-campton stopped at the desk to cancel the order . There was [no one behind the desk]2688-no one behind the desk : [one]398-one would have said that confusion prevailed in [the hall]2690-the hall , if [its]2690-the hall emptiness had not made the word incongruous . At last [a waiter with rumpled hair]2691-a waiter with rumpled hair strayed out of [the restaurant]2692-the restaurant , and of [him]174-campton , imperiously , [Campton]174-campton demanded [the concierge]480-the concierge . “[208-the french] [The concierge]480-the concierge ? [He]837-he ’s gone . ” “[837-he] To get [my]0-i places for [Naples]237-naples ? ” [The waiter]2694-the waiter looked blank . “[837-he] Gone : mobilised — to join [[his]837-he regiment]816-his regiment . It ’s the war . ” “[0-i] But look here , [some one]839-some one must have attended to getting [my]0-i places , [I]0-i suppose , ” cried [Campton]174-campton wrathfully . [He]174-campton invaded [the inner office]2695-the inner office and challenged [a secretary who was trying to deal with [several unmanageable travellers]2697-several unmanageable travellers]2696-a secretary who was trying to deal with several unmanageable travellers , but who explained to [him]174-campton , patiently , that [his]174-campton sleepings had certainly not been engaged , as [no trains]2698-no trains were leaving [Paris]5-paris for the present . “[839-some one] Not for civilian travel , ” [he]174-campton added , still more patiently . [Campton]174-campton had a sudden sense of suffocation . No trains leaving [Paris]5-paris “[839-some one] for the present ” ? But then [[people]378-people like [himself]174-campton]2700-people like himself — [people who had nothing on earth to do with the war]2701-people who had nothing on earth to do with the war — had been caught like rats in a trap ! [He]174-campton reflected with a shiver that [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant would not be able to return to [Deauville]6-deauville , and would probably insist on [his]174-campton coming to see [her]196-mrs. brant every day . [He]174-campton asked : “[0-i] How long is this preposterous state of things to last?”—but [no one]2702-no one answered , and [he]174-campton stalked to [the lift]2703-the lift and had [himself]174-campton carried [upstairs]2704-upstairs . [He]174-campton was confident that [George]175-george would be there waiting ; but [the sitting - room]815-the sitting - room was empty . [He]174-campton felt as if [he]174-campton were on [a desert island]2706-a desert island , with the last sail disappearing over [the dark rim of [the world]2535-the world]2707-the dark rim of the world . After much vain ringing [he]174-campton got into communication with [[Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s house]2709-fortin ’s house , and heard a confused voice saying that [the physician]415-the physician had already left [Paris]5-paris . “[842-they] Left — for where ? For how long ? ” And then the eternal answer : “[840-the doctor] [The doctor]840-the doctor is mobilised . _ It ’s the war . _ ” Mobilised — already ? Within the first twenty - four hours ? [A man of [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s age and authority]2711-a man of fortin ’s age and authority ? [Campton]174-campton was terrified by the uncanny rapidity with which events were moving , [he]174-campton whom haste had always confused and disconcerted , as if there were a secret link between [his]174-campton lameness and the movements of [his]174-campton will . [He]174-campton rang up [Dastrey]220-adele anthony , but [no one]2702-no one answered . Evidently [[his]174-campton friend]444-his friend was out , and [[his]174-campton friend]444-his friend ’s _ bonne _ also . “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose _ [she]841-she ’s _ mobilised : [they]842-they ’ll be mobilising [the women]404-the women next . ” At last , from sheer over - agitation , [his]174-campton fatigued mind began to move more deliberately : [he]174-campton collected [his]174-campton wits , laboured with [his]174-campton more immediate difficulties , and decided that [he]174-campton would go to [[Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze ’s house]2715-fortin - lescluze ’s house , on the chance that [the physician]415-the physician had not , after all , really started . “[842-they] Ten to one [he]841-she wo n’t go till to - morrow , ” [Campton]174-campton reasoned . [The hall of [the hotel]662-the hotel]2717-the hall of the hotel was emptier than ever , and [no taxi]2719-no taxi was in sight down the whole length of [the rue Royale]2675-the rue royale , or [the rue Boissy d’Anglas]2721-the rue boissy d’anglas , or [the rue de Rivoli]2722-the rue de rivoli : not even [a horse - cab]2723-a horse - cab showed against the deserted distances . [He]174-campton crossed to [the métro]2724-the métro , and painfully descended [[its]2724-the métro many stairs]2725-its many stairs . [VI Campton]238-vi campton , proffering twenty francs to [an astonished maid - servant]2726-an astonished maid - servant , learned that , yes , to [[his]174-campton intimates]2727-his intimates — and of course [Monsieur]2728-monsieur was [one?—the doctor]2729-one?—the doctor _ was _ in , was in fact dining , and did not leave till the next morning . “[841-she] Dining — at six o’clock ? ” “[844-monsieur] [[Monsieur]844-monsieur ’s son]845-monsieur ’s son , [Monsieur Jean]239-monsieur jean , is starting at once for [[his]844-monsieur depot]846-his depot . That ’s the reason . ” [Campton]174-campton sent in [his]174-campton card . [He]174-campton expected to be received in [the so - called “[239-monsieur jean] studio]2730-the so - called “ studio , ” [a lofty room with Chinese hangings , Renaissance choir - stalls]2731-a lofty room with chinese hangings , renaissance choir - stalls , organ , grand piano , and post - impressionist paintings , where [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze received the celebrities of the hour . [Mme . Fortin]240-mme . fortin never appeared [there]467-there , and [Campton]174-campton associated [the studio]370-the studio with amusing talk , hot - house flowers , and [ladies]2734-ladies lolling on black velvet divans . [He]174-campton supposed that [the physician]415-the physician was separated from [[his]415-the physician wife]516-his wife , and that [she]516-his wife had [a home of [her]516-his wife own]2737-a home of her own . When [the maid]2738-the maid reappeared [she]2738-the maid did not lead [him]174-campton to [the studio]370-the studio , but into [a small dining - room]2740-a small dining - room with the traditional Henri II sideboard of waxed walnut , a hanging table - lamp under a beaded shade , an India - rubber plant on a plush pedestal , and napkins that were just being restored to their bone rings by [the four persons seated about the red - and - white checkered table - cloth]2741-the four persons seated about the red - and - white checkered table - cloth . These were : [the great man]388-the great man [himself]388-the great man , [a tall large woman with grey hair]2743-a tall large woman with grey hair , [a tiny old lady]2744-a tiny old lady , [her]2744-a tiny old lady face framed in [a peasant]2745-a peasant ’s fluted cap , and [a plain young man wearing a private]2746-a plain young man wearing a private ’s uniform , who had a nose like [the doctor]840-the doctor ’s and simple light blue eyes . [The two ladies]2748-the two ladies and [the young man]2749-the young man — so much more interesting to [the painter]540-the painter ’s eye than the sprawling beauties of [the studio]370-the studio — were introduced by [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze as [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife , [[his]174-campton mother]583-his mother and [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . [Mme . Fortin]240-mme . fortin said , in a deep alto , a word or two about the privilege of meeting [the famous painter who had portrayed [[her]583-his mother husband]539-her husband]2755-the famous painter who had portrayed her husband , and [the old mother]2757-the old mother , in a piping voice , exclaimed : “[847-monsieur] [Monsieur]847-monsieur , [I]0-i was at [Sedan]19-sedan in 1870 . [I]0-i saw [the Germans]241-the germans . [I]0-i saw [the Emperor]848-the emperor sitting on a bench . [He]848-the emperor was crying . ” “[848-the emperor] [[My]0-i mother]849-my mother ’s heard everything , [she]849-my mother ’s seen everything . There ’s [no one in [the world]2535-the world like [[my]0-i mother]849-my mother]850-no one in the world like my mother ! ” [the physician]415-the physician said , laying [his]0-i hand on [hers]2757-the old mother . “[853-you] [You]853-you wo n’t see [the Germans]854-the germans again , _ ma bonne mère _ ! ” [[her]2757-the old mother daughter - in - law]2759-her daughter - in - law added , smiling . [Campton]174-campton took coffee with [them]2760-them , bore with a little inevitable talk about the war , and then eagerly questioned [the son]569-the son . [The young man]2749-the young man was [a chemist]2763-a chemist , a _ préparateur _ in [the laboratory of [the Institut Pasteur]2765-the institut pasteur]2764-the laboratory of the institut pasteur . [He]2749-the young man was also , it appeared , given to prehistoric archæology , and had written a “[853-you] thesis ” on [the painted caves of [the Dordogne]49-the dordogne]2766-the painted caves of the dordogne . [He]2749-the young man seemed extremely serious , and absorbed in questions of science and letters . But it appeared to [him]2749-the young man perfectly simple to be leaving it all in a few hours to join [[his]2749-the young man regiment]816-his regiment . “[853-you] The war had to come . This sort of thing could n’t go on , ” [he]2749-the young man said , in the words of [Mme . Lebel]195-mme . [He]2749-the young man was to start in an hour , and [Campton]174-campton excused [himself]174-campton for intruding on [the family]2768-the family , who seemed as happily united , as harmonious in [their]2768-the family deeper interests , as if no musical studio - parties and [exotic dancers]2769-exotic dancers had ever absorbed [the master of [the house]772-the house]2770-the master of the house . [Campton]174-campton , looking at [the group]2772-the group , felt a pang of envy , and thought , for the thousandth time , how frail a screen of activity divided [him]2749-the young man from depths of loneliness [he]2749-the young man dared not sound . “[853-you] ‘ For [every man]855-every man hath business and desire , ’ ” [he]174-campton muttered as [he]174-campton followed [the physician]415-the physician . In [the consulting - room]2774-the consulting - room [he]174-campton explained : “[853-you] It ’s about [[my]0-i son]856-my son — — ” [He]174-campton had not been able to bring the phrase out in the presence of [the young man who must have been just [George]175-george ’s age , and who was leaving in an hour for [[his]0-i regiment]816-his regiment]2775-the young man who must have been just george ’s age , and who was leaving in an hour for his regiment . But between [Campton]174-campton and [the father]568-the father there were complicities , and there might therefore be accommodations . In [the consulting - room]2774-the consulting - room [one]398-one breathed a lower air . It was not that [Campton]174-campton wanted to do anything underhand . [He]174-campton was genuinely anxious about [George]175-george ’s health . After all , tuberculosis did not disappear in a month or even a year : [his]174-campton anxiety was justified . And then [George]175-george , but for the stupid accident of [his]175-george birth , would never have been mixed up in the war . [Campton]174-campton felt that [he]174-campton could make [his]174-campton request with [his]174-campton head high . [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze seemed to think so too ; at any rate [he]182-fortin - lescluze expressed no surprise . But could anything on [earth]2780-earth have surprised [him]182-fortin - lescluze , after thirty years in [that confessional of [a room]2782-a room]2781-that confessional of a room ? The difficulty was that [he]182-fortin - lescluze did not see [his]182-fortin - lescluze way to doing anything — not immediately , at any rate . “[856-my son] [You]857-you must let [the boy]416-the boy join [[his]416-the boy base]2568-his base . [He]416-the boy leaves to - morrow ? Give [me]0-i the number of [[his]416-the boy regiment]816-his regiment and the name of [the town]861-the town , and trust [me]0-i to do what [I]0-i can . ” “[0-i] But [you]857-you ’re off [yourself]857-you ? ” “[0-i] Yes : [I]0-i ’m being sent to [a hospital at [Lyons]50-lyons]862-a hospital at lyons . But [I]0-i ’ll leave [you]857-you [my]0-i address . ” [Campton]174-campton lingered , unable to take this as final . [He]174-campton looked about [him]174-campton uneasily , and then , for a moment , straight into [the physician]415-the physician ’s eyes . “[857-you] [You]857-you must know how [I]0-i feel ; [[your]857-you boy]863-your boy is [an only son]864-an only son , too . ” “[857-you] Yes , yes , ” [the father]568-the father assented , in the absent - minded tone of professional sympathy . But [Campton]174-campton felt that [he]174-campton felt the deep difference . “[857-you] Well , goodbye — and thanks . ” As [Campton]174-campton turned to go [the physician]415-the physician laid a hand on [his]174-campton shoulder and spoke with sudden fierce emotion . “[239-monsieur jean] Yes : [Jean]239-monsieur jean is [an only son]864-an only son — [an only child]866-an only child . For [[his]239-monsieur jean mother]583-his mother and [myself]0-i it ’s not a trifle — having [[our]868-our only son]869-our only son in the war . ” There was no allusion to [the dancer]654-the dancer , no hint that [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze remembered [her]654-the dancer ; it was [Campton]174-campton who lowered [his]174-campton gaze before the look in [the other father]2787-the other father ’s eyes . VII “[870-a son in the war] [A son in the war]870-a son in the war — — ” The words followed [Campton]174-campton down [the stairs]482-the stairs . What did it mean , and what must it feel like , for [[parents]2591-parents in [this safe denationalized modern world]2791-this safe denationalized modern world]2790-parents in this safe denationalized modern world to be suddenly saying to [each other]443-each other with white lips : [A son in the war]870-a son in the war ? [He]174-campton stood on the kerbstone , staring ahead of [him]174-campton and forgetting whither [he]174-campton was bound . [The world]2535-the world seemed to lie under a spell , and its weight was on [his]174-campton limbs and brain . Usually any deep inward trouble made [him]174-campton more than ever alive to the outward aspect of things ; but this new world in which [people]378-people talked glibly of [sons in the war]2796-sons in the war had suddenly become invisible to [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton did not know where [he]174-campton was , or what [he]174-campton was staring at . [He]174-campton noted the fact , and remembered a story of [St. Bernard]242-st. bernard — [he]174-campton thought it was — walking beside [a beautiful lake in supersensual ecstasy]2797-a beautiful lake in supersensual ecstasy , and saying afterward : “[870-a son in the war] Was there [a lake]871-a lake ? [I]0-i did n’t see it . ” On the way back to [the hotel]662-the hotel [he]174-campton passed [the American Embassy]2799-the american embassy , and had a vague idea of trying to see [the Ambassador]2800-the ambassador and find out if [the United States]2801-the united states were not going to devise some way of evading the tyrannous regulation that bound [young Americans to [France]18-france]2802-young americans to france . “[0-i] And [they]872-they call this [a free country]873-a free country ! ” [he]174-campton heard [himself]174-campton exclaiming . The remark sounded exactly like one of [Julia]214-julia ’s , and this reminded [him]174-campton that [the Ambassador]2800-the ambassador frequently dined at [the Brants]203-the brants ’ . [They]872-they had certainly not left [his]174-campton door untried ; and since , to [the Brant circles]196-mrs. brant , [Campton]174-campton was still [a shaggy Bohemian]2804-a shaggy bohemian , [his]174-campton appeal was not likely to fortify [theirs]872-they . [His]174-campton mind turned to [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein , and the vast web of [the speculator]2805-the speculator ’s financial relations . But , after all , [France]18-france was on the verge of war , if not in it ; and following up the threads of the Jorgenstein web was likely to land one in [Frankfort]51-frankfort or [Vienna]52-vienna . At [the hotel]662-the hotel [he]174-campton found [[his]174-campton sitting - room]2807-his sitting - room empty ; but presently the door opened and [George]175-george came in laden with books , fresh yellow and grey ones in Flammarion wrappers . “[243-hullo] [Hullo]243-hullo , [Dad]205-dad , ” [he]175-george said ; and added : “[205-dad] So the silly show is on . ” “[205-dad] Mobilisation is not war — — , ” said [Campton]174-campton . “[205-dad] No — — ” “[205-dad] What on earth are all those books ? ” “[244-provender] [Provender]244-provender . It appears [we]874-we may rot at [the depot]875-the depot for weeks . [I]0-i ’ve just seen [a chap who ’s in [[my]0-i regiment]877-my regiment]876-a chap who ’s in my regiment . ” [Campton]174-campton felt a sudden relief . The purchase of the books proved that [George]175-george was fairly sure [he]175-george would not be sent to the front . [[His]175-george father]580-his father went up to [him]175-george and tapped [him]175-george on the chest . “[876-a chap who ’s in my regiment] How about this — — ? ” [He]0-i wanted to add : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve just seen [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze , who says [he]182-fortin - lescluze ’ll get [you]878-you off ” ; but though [George]175-george ’s eye was cool and unenthusiastic it did not encourage such confidences . “[182-fortin - lescluze] Oh — lungs ? [I]0-i imagine [I]0-i ’m sound again . ” [He]0-i paused , and stooped to turn over the books . Carelessly , [he]0-i added : “[0-i] But then the stethoscope may think differently . Nothing to do but wait and see . ” “[0-i] Of course , ” [Campton]174-campton agreed . It was clear that [the boy]416-the boy hated what was ahead of [him]416-the boy ; and what more could [[his]175-george father]580-his father ask ? Of course [he]416-the boy was not going to confess to a desire to shirk [his]416-the boy duty ; but it was easy to see that [his]416-the boy whole lucid intelligence repudiated any sympathy with the ruinous adventure . “[0-i] Have [you]0-i seen [Adele]220-adele anthony ? ” [Campton]174-campton enquired , and [George]175-george replied that [he]175-george had dropped in for five minutes , and that [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony wanted to see [[his]175-george father]580-his father . “[879-she] Is [she]879-she — nervous ? ” “[879-she] [Old Adele]245-old adele ? [I]0-i should say not : [she]879-she ’s fighting mad . _ La Revanche _ and all the rest of it . [She]879-she does n’t realize—_sancta simplicitas ! _ ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i can see [Adele]245-old adele throwing on the faggots ! ” [Father]573-father and [son]574-son were silent , both busy lighting cigarettes . When [George]175-george ’s was lit [he]580-his father remarked : “[245-old adele] Well , if [we]880-we ’re not called at once it ’ll be a good chance to read ‘ [The Golden Bough]246-the golden bough ’ right through . ” [Campton]174-campton stared , not knowing the book even by name . What [a queer changeling]2814-a queer changeling [the boy]416-the boy was ! But [George]175-george ’s composure , [his]175-george deep and genuine indifference to the whole political turmoil , once more fortified [[his]416-the boy father]580-his father . “[881-they] Have [they]881-they any news — ? ” [he]416-the boy ventured . “[881-they] [They]881-they , ” in [their]881-they private language , meant [the Brants]203-the brants . “[881-they] Oh , yes , lots : [Uncle Andy]229-uncle andy was stiff with it . But not really amounting to anything . Of course there ’s no doubt there ’ll be war . ” “[881-they] How about [England]3-england ? ” “[882-nobody] [Nobody]882-nobody knows ; but [the bankers]883-the bankers seem to think [England]3-england ’s all right . ” [George]175-george paused , and finally added : “[883-the bankers] Look here , [dear old boy]824-dear old boy — before [she]885-she leaves [I]0-i think [mother]821-mother wants to see [you]824-dear old boy . ” [Campton]174-campton hardened instantly . “[885-she] [She]885-she _ has _ seen [me]0-i — yesterday . ” “[885-she] [I]0-i know ; [she]885-she told [me]0-i . ” [The son]569-the son began to cut the pages of one of [his]569-the son books with a visiting - card [he]569-the son had picked up , and [the father]568-the father stood looking out on [the Place de la Concorde]27-the place de la concorde through the leafy curtain of [the terrace]675-the terrace . [Campton]174-campton knew that [he]174-campton could not refuse [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s request ; in [his]174-campton heart of hearts [he]174-campton was glad it had been made , since it might mean that “[885-she] [they]887-they ” had found a way — perhaps through [the Ambassador]2800-the ambassador . But [he]174-campton could never prevent a stiffening of [his]174-campton whole self at any summons or suggestion from [the Brants]203-the brants . [He]174-campton thought of the seeming unity of [the Fortin - Lescluze couple]2822-the fortin - lescluze couple , and of the background of peaceful family life revealed by the scene about the checkered table - cloth . [A chap who was at [Harvard]33-harvard with [me]0-i]890-a chap who was at harvard with me . [He]247-boylston ’s out here studying painting at [the Beaux Arts]891-the beaux arts . [He]247-boylston ’s [an awfully good sort]892-an awfully good sort , and [he]247-boylston wanted to see [me]0-i before [I]0-i go . ” [The father]568-the father ’s heart sank . Only one whole day more with [[his]568-the father boy]570-his boy , and this last evening but one was to be spent with [poor embittered Dastrey]2827-poor embittered dastrey , and [two youths]2828-two youths , one unknown to [Campton]174-campton , who would drown [them]2828-two youths in stupid war - chatter ! But it was what [George]175-george wanted ; and there must not be a shade , for [George]175-george , on these last hours . “[247-boylston] All right ! [You]0-i promised [me]0-i something awful for to - night , ” [Campton]174-campton grinned sardonically . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i mind ? [I]0-i ’m sorry . ” “[0-i] It ’s only [Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s damned chauvinism that [I]0-i mind . Why do n’t [you]0-i ask [Adele]220-adele anthony to join [the chorus]893-the chorus ? ” “[0-i] Well — [you’ll]0-i like [Boylston]247-boylston , ” said [George]175-george . * * * * * [Dastrey]209-dastrey , after all , turned out less tragic and aggressive than [Campton]174-campton had feared . [His]209-dastrey irritability had vanished , and though [he]209-dastrey was very grave [he]209-dastrey seemed preoccupied only with the fate of [Europe]42-europe , and not with [his]209-dastrey personal stake in the affair . But [the older men]2829-the older men said little . [The youngsters]2830-the youngsters had the floor , and [Campton]174-campton , as [he]174-campton listened to [George]175-george and [young Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey , was overcome by a sense of such dizzy unreality that [he]174-campton had to grasp the arms of [his]174-campton ponderous leather armchair to assure [himself]174-campton that [he]174-campton was really in the flesh and in [the world]2535-the world . What ! Two days ago [they]2830-the youngsters were still in [the old easy Europe]2832-the old easy europe , [a Europe]2833-a europe in which [one]398-one could make plans , engage passages on [trains and steamers]2835-trains and steamers , argue about pictures , books , [theatres]637-theatres , ideas , draw as much money as [one]398-one chose out of the bank , and say : “[247-boylston] The day after to - morrow [I]0-i ’ll be in [Berlin]8-berlin or [Vienna]52-vienna or [Belgrade]53-belgrade . ” And here [they]2830-the youngsters sat in [their]2830-the youngsters same evening clothes , about the same shining mahogany writing - table , apparently the same group of [free and independent youths]2838-free and independent youths and [elderly men]2839-elderly men , and in reality [prisoners]2840-prisoners , [every one of [them]2830-the youngsters]2841-every one of them , hand - cuffed to [this hideous masked bully of “[0-i] War ”]2842-this hideous masked bully of “ war ” ! [The young men]2843-the young men were sure that the conflict was inevitable — the evening papers left no doubt of it — and there was much animated discussion between [young Dastrey]209-dastrey and [George]175-george . Already [their]2830-the youngsters views diverged ; [the French youth]2844-the french youth , theoretically at one with [[his]2844-the french youth friend]444-his friend as to the senselessness of war in general , had at once resolutely disengaged from the mist of doctrine the fatal necessity of this particular war . “[0-i] It ’s the old festering wound of [Alsace - Lorraine]54-alsace - lorraine : [Bismarck]248-bismarck foresaw it and feared it — or perhaps planned it and welcomed it : who knows ? But as long as the wound was there , [Germany]55-germany believed that [France]18-france would try to avenge it , and as long as [Germany]55-germany believed that , [she]55-germany had to keep up [her]55-germany own war - strength ; and [she]55-germany ’s kept it up to the toppling - over point , ruining [herself]55-germany and [us]894-we . That ’s the whole thing , as [I]0-i see it . War ’s rot ; but to get rid of war forever [we]894-we ’ve got to fight this one first . ” It was wonderful to [Campton]174-campton that [this slender learned youth]2846-this slender learned youth should already have grasped the necessity of the conflict and its deep causes . While [his]2844-the french youth own head was still spinning with wrath and bewilderment at the bottomless perversity of [mankind]2847-mankind , [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey had analyzed and accepted the situation and [his]2844-the french youth own part in it . And [he]2844-the french youth was not simply resigned ; [he]2844-the french youth was trembling with eagerness to get the thing over . “[55-germany] If only [England]3-england is with [us]894-we [we]894-we ’re safe — it ’s a matter of weeks , ” [he]2844-the french youth declared . “[55-germany] Wait a bit — wait a bit ; [I]0-i want to know more about a whole lot of things before [I]0-i fix a date for the fall of [Berlin]8-berlin , ” [[his]0-i uncle]2848-his uncle interposed ; but [Louis]209-dastrey flung [him]0-i a radiant look . “[0-i] [We]894-we ’ve been [there]467-there before , [[my]0-i uncle]896-my uncle ! ” “[0-i] But there ’s [Russia]56-russia too — — ” said [Boylston]247-boylston explosively . [He]247-boylston had not spoken before . “[0-i] ‘ _ Nous l’avons eu , votre Rhin allemand _ , ’ ” quoted [George]175-george , as [he]175-george poured a golden Hock into [his]175-george glass . [He]175-george was keenly interested , that was evident ; but interested as [a looker - on]2849-a looker - on , [a dilettante]2850-a dilettante . [He]175-george had neither [Valmy]249-valmy nor Sedan in [his]175-george blood , and it was as [a sympathizing spectator]2851-a sympathizing spectator that [he]175-george ought by rights to have been sharing [[his]175-george friend]444-his friend ’s enthusiasm , not as [a combatant compelled to obey the same summons]2853-a combatant compelled to obey the same summons . [Campton]174-campton , glancing from one to another of [their]2854-their brilliant faces , felt [his]174-campton determination harden to save [George]175-george from the consequences of [[his]174-campton parents]509-his parents ’ stupid blunder . After dinner [young Dastrey]209-dastrey proposed a music - hall . [The audience]2856-the audience would be a curious sight : there would be wild enthusiasm , and singing of the Marseillaise . [The other young men]2857-the other young men agreed , but [[their]2857-the other young men elders]2858-their elders , after a tacitly exchanged glance , decided to remain at [the club]2859-the club , on the plea that [some one at [the Ministry of War]57-the ministry of war]2860-some one at the ministry of war had promised to telephone if there were fresh news . [Campton]174-campton and [Dastrey]209-dastrey , left alone , stood on the balcony watching [the Boulevards]469-the boulevards . [The streets]2562-the streets , so deserted during the day , had become suddenly and densely populated . Hardly [any vehicles]2863-any vehicles were in sight : [the motor omnibuses]2864-the motor omnibuses were already carrying [troops]2865-troops to [the stations]2866-the stations , there was a report abroad that [private motors]2867-private motors were to be requisitioned , and only [a few taxis]2868-a few taxis and [horse - cabs]2869-horse - cabs , packed to the driver ’s box with [young men in spick - and - span uniforms]2870-young men in spick - and - span uniforms , broke through the mass of pedestrians which filled the whole width of [the Boulevards]469-the boulevards . This mass moved slowly and vaguely , swaying this way and that , as though it awaited a portent from the heavens . In the glare of electric lamps and glittering theatre - fronts the innumerable faces stood out vividly , grave , intent , slightly bewildered . Except when [the soldiers]2872-the soldiers passed no cries or songs came from [the crowd]613-the crowd , but only the deep inarticulate rumour which [any vast body of people]2874-any vast body of people gives forth . “[0-i] Queer — — ! How silent [they]897-they are : how do [you]898-you think [they]897-they ’re taking it ? ” [Campton]174-campton questioned . But [Dastrey]209-dastrey had grown belligerent again . [He]209-dastrey saw the throngs before [him]209-dastrey bounding toward [the frontier]2875-the frontier like the unchained furies of [[Rude]250-rude ’s “[898-you] Marseillaise]58-rude ’s “ marseillaise ” ; whereas to [Campton]174-campton [they]897-they seemed full of the dumb wrath of [an orderly and laborious people upon whom an unrighteous quarrel has been forced]2876-an orderly and laborious people upon whom an unrighteous quarrel has been forced . [He]209-dastrey knew that the thought of [Alsace - Lorraine]54-alsace - lorraine still stirred in [French]208-the french hearts ; but all [Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s eloquence could not convince [him]209-dastrey that [these people]2877-these people wanted war , or would have sought it had it not been thrust on [them]2877-these people . The whole monstrous injustice seemed to take shape before [him]209-dastrey , and to brood like a huge sky - filling dragon of the northern darknesses over [[his]209-dastrey light - loving , pleasure - loving , labour - loving [France]18-france]2878-his light - loving , pleasure - loving , labour - loving france . * * * * * [George]175-george came [home]502-home late . It was two in the morning of [his]175-george last day with [[his]175-george boy]570-his boy when [Campton]174-campton heard the door open , and saw a flash of turned on light . All night [he]174-campton had lain staring into the darkness , and thinking , thinking : thinking of [[George]175-george ’s future]2881-george ’s future , [[George]175-george ’s friends]2882-george ’s friends , [George]175-george and [women]738-women , of that unknown side of [[his]175-george boy]570-his boy ’s life which , in this great upheaval of things , had suddenly lifted its face to the surface . If war came , if [George]175-george were not discharged , if [George]175-george were sent to the front , if [George]175-george were killed , how strange to think that things [the father]568-the father did not know of might turn out to have been the central things of [[his]175-george son]364-his son ’s life ! [The young man]2749-the young man came in , and [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]2749-the young man as though [he]2749-the young man were [a stranger]2888-a stranger . “[243-hullo] [Hullo]243-hullo , [Dad]205-dad — any news from [the Ministry]899-the ministry ? ” [George]175-george , tossing aside [his]175-george hat and stick , sat down on the bed . [He]900-he had a crumpled rose in [his]900-he button - hole , and looked gay and fresh , with the indestructible freshness of youth . “[899-the ministry] What do [I]0-i really know of [him]900-he ? ” [the father]568-the father asked [himself]0-i . Yes : [Dastrey]209-dastrey had had news . [Germany]55-germany had already committed acts of overt hostility on the frontier : telegraph and telephone communications had been cut , French locomotives seized , [troops]2865-troops massed along the border on the specious pretext of the “[0-i] _ Kriegsgefahr - zustand _ . ” It was war . “[0-i] Oh , well , ” [George]175-george shrugged . [He]175-george lit a cigarette , and asked : “[0-i] What did [you]205-dad think of [Boylston]247-boylston ? ” “[205-dad] [Boylston]247-boylston — — ? ” “[247-boylston] [The fat brown chap]901-the fat brown chap at dinner . ” “[901-the fat brown chap] Yes — yes — of course . ” [Campton]174-campton became aware that [he]174-campton had not thought of [Boylston]247-boylston at all , had hardly been aware of [his]247-boylston presence . But [[the painter]540-the painter ’s registering faculty]2892-the painter ’s registering faculty was always latently at work , and in an instant [he]900-he called up a round face , shyly jovial , with short - sighted brown eyes as sharp as needles , and dark hair curling tightly over a wide watchful forehead . “[901-the fat brown chap] Why — [I]0-i liked [him]900-he . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m glad , because it was a tremendous event for [him]900-he , seeing [you]205-dad . [He]900-he paints , and [he]900-he ’s been keen on [your]205-dad things for years . ” “[900-he] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i ’d known .... Why did n’t [he]900-he say so ? [He]900-he did n’t say anything , did [he]900-he ? ” “[900-he] No : [he]900-he does n’t , much , when [he]900-he ’s pleased . [He]900-he ’s the very best chap [I]0-i know , ” [George]175-george concluded . [VIII]251-viii That morning the irrevocable stared at [him]900-he from the head - lines of the papers . [The German Ambassador]2893-the german ambassador was recalled . [Germany]55-germany had declared war on [France]18-france at 6.40 the previous evening ; there was an unintelligible allusion , in the declaration , to French aeroplanes throwing bombs on [Nuremberg]59-nuremberg and [Wesel]60-wesel . [Campton]174-campton read that part of the message over two or three times . [Aeroplanes]2894-aeroplanes throwing bombs ? [Aeroplanes]2894-aeroplanes as engines of destruction ? [He]174-campton had always thought of [them]2894-aeroplanes as a kind of giant kite that [fools]2896-fools went up in when [they]2896-fools were tired of breaking [their]2896-fools necks in other ways . But aeroplane bombardment as a cause for declaring war ? The bad faith of it was so manifest that [he]174-campton threw down the papers half relieved . Of course there would be a protest on the part of [the allies]2897-the allies ; [a great country like [France]18-france]2898-a great country like france would not allow [herself]2898-a great country like france to be bullied into war on such a pretext . The ultimatum to [Belgium]61-belgium was more serious ; but [Belgium]61-belgium ’s gallant reply would no doubt check [Germany]55-germany on that side . After all , there was such a thing as international law , and [Germany]55-germany [herself]55-germany had recognized it .... So [his]174-campton mind spun on in vain circles , while under the frail web of [his]174-campton casuistry gloomed the obstinate fact that [George]175-george was mobilised , that [George]175-george was to leave the next morning . The day wore on : it was the shortest and yet most interminable that [Campton]174-campton had ever known . [Paris]5-paris , when [he]174-campton went out into [it]5-paris , was more dazzlingly empty than ever . In [the hotel]662-the hotel , in [the hall]2690-the hall , on the stairs , [he]174-campton was waylaid by flustered compatriots—“Oh[900-he] , [Mr. Campton]174-campton , [you]174-campton do n’t know [me]0-i , but of course [all Americans]902-all americans know _ [you_!”—who]252-you_!”—who appealed to [him]174-campton for the very information [he]174-campton was trying to obtain for [himself]174-campton : how [one]398-one could get money , how [one]398-one could get hold of [the concierge]480-the concierge , how [one]398-one could send cables , if there was [any restaurant where [the waiters]2906-the waiters had not all been mobilised]2905-any restaurant where the waiters had not all been mobilised , if [he]174-campton had any “[900-he] pull ” at [the Embassy]2907-the embassy , or at any of [the steamship offices]2908-the steamship offices , or any of the banks . [One disordered beauty]2909-one disordered beauty blurted out : “[900-he] Of course , with [your]174-campton connection with [Bullard]200-bullard and [Brant”—and]253-brant”—and was only waked to [her]2909-one disordered beauty mistake by [Campton]174-campton ’s indignant stare , and [his]174-campton plunge past [her]2909-one disordered beauty while [she]2909-one disordered beauty called out excuses . But the name acted as a reminder of [his]174-campton promise to go and see [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant , and [he]174-campton decided to make [his]174-campton visit after lunch , when [George]175-george would be off collecting last things . Visiting [the Brants]203-the brants with [George]175-george would have been beyond [his]174-campton capacity . * * * * * [The great drawing - rooms]2910-the great drawing - rooms , [their]2910-the great drawing - rooms awnings spread against the sun , [their]2910-the great drawing - rooms tall windows wide to the glow of [the garden]488-the garden , were empty when [he]174-campton entered ; but in a moment [he]174-campton was joined by [a tall angular woman with a veil pushed up untidily above]2912-a tall angular woman with a veil pushed up untidily above [her]2912-a tall angular woman with a veil pushed up untidily above pink nose . [Campton]174-campton reflected that [he]174-campton had never seen [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony in the daytime without a veil pushed up above a flushed nose , and dangling in irregular wisps from the back of a small hard hat of which the shape never varied . “[214-julia] [Julia]214-julia will be [here]2489-here in a minute . When [she]214-julia told [me]0-i [you]0-i were coming [I]0-i waited . ” [He]174-campton was glad to have a word with [her]2912-a tall angular woman with a veil pushed up untidily above before meeting [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant , though [his]174-campton impulse had been almost as strong to avoid [the one]2913-the one as [the other]2914-the other . [He]174-campton dreaded belligerent bluster as much as vain whimpering , and in the depths of [his]174-campton soul [he]174-campton had to own that it would have been easier to talk to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant than to [either of [the women]404-the women]2915-either of the women . “[214-julia] [Julia]214-julia is powdering [her]214-julia nose , ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony continued . “[214-julia] [She]214-julia has an idea that if [you]0-i see [she]214-julia ’s been crying [you]0-i ’ll be awfully angry . ” [Campton]174-campton made an impatient gesture . “[0-i] If [I]0-i were — much it would matter ! ” “[0-i] Ah , but [you]0-i might tell [George]175-george ; and [George]175-george is not to know . ” [She]214-julia paused , and then bounced round on [him]174-campton abruptly . [She]214-julia always moved and spoke in explosions , as if the wires that agitated [her]214-julia got tangled , and then were too suddenly jerked loose . “[175-george] _ Does _ [George]175-george know ? ” “[175-george] About [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother ’s tears ? ” “[175-george] About this plan [you]905-you ’re all hatching to have [him]175-george discharged ? ” [Campton]174-campton reddened under [her]214-julia lashless blue gaze , and the consciousness of doing so made [his]174-campton answer all the curter . “[175-george] Probably not — unless [you]0-i ’ve told [him]175-george ! ” The shot appeared to reach the mark , for an answering blush suffused [her]214-julia sallow complexion . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’d better not put ideas into [my]0-i head ! ” [she]214-julia laughed . Something in [her]214-julia tone reminded [him]174-campton of all [her]214-julia old dogged loyalties , and made [him]174-campton ashamed of [his]174-campton taunt . “[0-i] Anyhow , ” [he]174-campton grumbled , “[0-i] [[his]175-george place]906-his place is not in [the French army]812-the french army . ” “[0-i] That was for [you]0-i and [Julia]214-julia to decide twenty - six years ago , was n’t it ? Now it ’s up to [him]175-george . ” [Her]214-julia capricious adoption of American slang , fitted anyhow into [her]214-julia old - fashioned and punctilious English , sometimes amused but oftener exasperated [Campton]174-campton . “[175-george] If [you]0-i ’re going to talk modern slang [you]0-i ought to give up those ridiculous stays , and not wear a fringe like [a mid - Victorian royalty]908-a mid - victorian royalty , ” [he]174-campton jeered , trying to laugh off [his]174-campton exasperation . [She]214-julia let this pass with a smile . “[175-george] Well , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could find the language to make [you]0-i understand how much better it would be to leave [George]175-george alone . This war will be the making of [him]175-george . ” “[175-george] [He]175-george ’s made quite to [my]0-i satisfaction as it is , thanks . But what ’s the use of talking ? [You]0-i always get [your]0-i phrases out of books . ” The door opened , and [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant came in . [Her]196-mrs. brant appearance answered to [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s description . A pearly mist covered [her]196-mrs. brant face , and some reviving liquid had cleared [her]196-mrs. brant congested eyes . [Her]196-mrs. brant poor hands had suddenly grown so thin and dry that the heavy rings , slipping down to the joints , slid back into place as [she]196-mrs. brant shook hands with [Campton]174-campton . “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i for coming , ” [she]196-mrs. brant said . “[0-i] Oh — — ” [he]0-i protested , helpless , and disturbed by [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s presence . At the moment [[his]0-i former wife]519-his former wife ’s feelings were more intelligible to [him]0-i than [[his]0-i friend]444-his friend ’s : the maternal fibre stirred in [her]196-mrs. brant , and made [her]196-mrs. brant more appealing than [any elderly virgin on the war - path]2919-any elderly virgin on the war - path . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m off , [[my]0-i dears]909-my dears , ” said [the elderly virgin]2920-the elderly virgin , as if guessing [his]0-i thought . [Her]2920-the elderly virgin queer shallow eyes included [them]2921-they both in a sweeping glance , and [she]2920-the elderly virgin flung back from the threshold : “[0-i] Be careful of what [you]0-i say to [George]175-george . ” What [they]2921-they had to say to [each other]443-each other did not last many minutes . [The Brants]203-the brants had made various efforts , but had been baffled on all sides by the general agitation and confusion . In [high quarters]2923-high quarters [the people]2924-the people [they]2921-they wanted to see were inaccessible ; and those who could be reached lent but a distracted ear . [The Ambassador]2800-the ambassador had at once declared that [he]175-george could do nothing ; [others]644-others vaguely promised [they]644-others “[0-i] would [see”—but]254-see”—but hardly seemed to hear what [they]644-others were being asked . “[175-george] And meanwhile time is passing — and [he]175-george ’s going ! ” [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant lamented . The reassurance that [Campton]174-campton brought from [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , vague though it was , came to [her]196-mrs. brant as a miraculous promise , and raised [Campton]174-campton suddenly in [her]196-mrs. brant estimation . [She]196-mrs. brant looked at [him]174-campton with a new confidence , and [he]174-campton could almost hear [her]196-mrs. brant saying to [Brant]196-mrs. brant , as [he]174-campton had so often heard [her]196-mrs. brant say to [himself]174-campton : “[175-george] [You]175-george never seem able to get anything done . [I]0-i do n’t know how [other people]607-other people manage . ” [Her]196-mrs. brant gratitude gave [him]174-campton the feeling of having been engaged in something underhand and pusillanimous . [He]174-campton made haste to take leave , after promising to pass on any word [he]174-campton might receive from [the physician]415-the physician ; but [he]174-campton reminded [her]196-mrs. brant that [he]174-campton was not likely to hear anything till [George]175-george had been for some days at [[his]174-campton base]2568-his base . [She]196-mrs. brant acknowledged the probability of this , and clung to [him]174-campton with trustful eyes . [She]196-mrs. brant was much disturbed by the preposterous fact that [the Government]2929-the government had already requisitioned [two of [the Brant motors]2931-the brant motors]2930-two of the brant motors , and [Campton]174-campton had an idea that , dazzled by [his]174-campton newly - developed capacity to “[0-i] manage , ” [she]196-mrs. brant was about to implore [him]174-campton to rescue from the clutches of [the authorities]2932-the authorities [[her]196-mrs. brant Rolls - Royce]63-her rolls - royce and [[Anderson]196-mrs. brant ’s Delaunay]64-anderson ’s delaunay . [He]174-campton was hastening to leave when the door again opened . [A rumpled - looking maid]2933-a rumpled - looking maid peered in , evidently perplexed , and giving way doubtfully to [a young woman who entered with a rush]2934-a young woman who entered with a rush , and then paused as if [she]2934-a young woman who entered with a rush too were doubtful .
