In [the street]2680-the street , however , [he]174-campton felt grateful to [her]196-mrs. brant for reducing [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant to such confusion that [she]196-mrs. brant had made no attempt to detain [him]174-campton . [His]174-campton way of life lay so far apart from [[his]174-campton former wife]519-his former wife ’s that [they]925-they had hardly ever been exposed to [accidents of the kind]2945-accidents of the kind , and [he]174-campton saw that [Julia]214-julia ’s embarrassment kept all its freshness . The fact set [him]174-campton thinking curiously of what [her]214-julia existence had been since [they]925-they had parted . [She]214-julia had long since forgotten [her]214-julia youthful art - jargon to learn others more consonant to [her]214-julia tastes . As [the wife of [the powerful American banker]2947-the powerful american banker]2946-the wife of the powerful american banker [she]214-julia dispensed the costliest hospitality with the simple air of [one who has never learnt that human life may be sustained without the aid of orchids and champagne]2948-one who has never learnt that human life may be sustained without the aid of orchids and champagne . With [guests either brought up in the same convictions]2949-guests either brought up in the same convictions or bent on acquiring [them]2949-guests either brought up in the same convictions [she]214-julia conversed earnestly and unweariedly about motors , clothes and morals ; but perhaps [her]214-julia most stimulating hours were those brightened by the weekly visit of [the Rector of [[her]214-julia parish]2951-her parish]2950-the rector of her parish . With happy untrammelled hands [she]214-julia was now free to rebuild to [her]214-julia own measure a corner of [the huge wicked welter of [Paris]5-paris]2952-the huge wicked welter of paris ; and immediately [it]2953-it became as neat , as empty , as air - tight as [[her]214-julia own immaculate drawing - room]2954-her own immaculate drawing - room . There [he]2950-the rector of her parish seemed to see [her]214-julia , throning year after year in an awful emptiness of wealth and luxury and respectability , seeing only [dull people]2955-dull people , doing only dull things , and fighting feverishly to defend the last traces of a beauty which had never given [her]214-julia anything but the tamest and most unprofitable material prosperity . “[927-cursed fools] [She]929-she ’s never even had the silly kind of success [she]929-she wanted — [poor Julia]214-julia ! ” [he]2950-the rector of her parish mused , wondering that [she]214-julia had been able to put into [her]214-julia life so few of the sensations which can be bought by wealth and beauty . “[214-julia] And now what will be left — how on earth will [she]929-she fit into a war ? ” [He]2950-the rector of her parish was sure all [her]214-julia plans had been made for the coming six months : [her]214-julia week - end sets of heavy millionaires secured for [Deauville]6-deauville , and after that for the shooting at [the big château near [Compiègne]65-compiègne]2956-the big château near compiègne , and three weeks reserved for [Biarritz]66-biarritz before the return to [Paris]5-paris in January . One of the luxuries [Julia]214-julia had most enjoyed after [her]214-julia separation from [Campton]174-campton ( [Adele]220-adele anthony had told [him]2950-the rector of her parish ) had been that of planning things ahead : [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , thank heaven , was not impulsive . And now here was this black bolt of war falling among all [her]214-julia carefully balanced arrangements with a crash more violent than any of [Campton]174-campton ’s inconsequences ! As [he]2950-the rector of her parish reached [the Place de la Concorde]677-the place de la concorde [a newsboy]2958-a newsboy passed with the three o’clock papers , and [he]2950-the rector of her parish bought one and read of the crossing of [Luxembourg]41-luxembourg and the invasion of [Belgium]61-belgium . [The Germans]854-the germans were arrogantly acting up to [their]854-the germans menace : heedless of international law , [they]854-the germans were driving straight for [France]18-france and [England]3-england by [the road [they]854-the germans thought the most accessible ....]2960-the road they thought the most accessible .... In [the hotel]662-the hotel [he]2950-the rector of her parish found [George]175-george , red with rage , devouring the same paper : [the boy]416-the boy ’s whole look was changed . “[930-the howling blackguards] [The howling blackguards]930-the howling blackguards ! [The brigands]931-the brigands ! This is n’t war — it ’s simple murder ! ” [The two men]442-the two men stood and stared at [each other]443-each other . “[930-the howling blackguards] Will [England]3-england stand it ? ” sprang to [their]442-the two men lips at the same moment . Never — never ! [England]3-england would never permit such a violation of the laws regulating the relations between [civilized peoples]2965-civilized peoples . [They]442-the two men began to say both together that after all perhaps it was the best thing that could have happened , since , if there had been the least hesitation or reluctance in any section of English opinion , this abominable outrage would instantly sweep it away . “[932-they] [They]932-they ’ve been too damned clever for once ! ” [George]175-george exulted . “[932-they] [France]18-france is saved — that ’s certain anyhow ! ” Yes ; [France]18-france was saved if [England]3-england could put [her]3-england army into the field at once . But could [she]3-england ? Oh , for [the Channel tunnel]2966-the channel tunnel at this hour ! Would this lesson at last cure [England]3-england of [her]3-england obstinate insularity ? [Belgium]61-belgium had announced [her]3-england intention of resisting ; but what was that gallant declaration worth in face of [Germany]55-germany ’s brutal assault ? [A poor little country pledged to a guaranteed neutrality]2967-a poor little country pledged to a guaranteed neutrality could hardly be expected to hold [her]3-england frontiers more than forty - eight hours against [the most powerful army in [Europe]42-europe]2968-the most powerful army in europe . And what [a narrow strip [Belgium]61-belgium]2969-a narrow strip belgium was , viewed as [an outpost of [France]18-france]2970-an outpost of france ! These thoughts , racing through [Campton]174-campton ’s mind , were swept out of it again by [his]174-campton absorbing preoccupation . What effect would the Belgian affair have on [George]175-george ’s view of [his]175-george own participation in the war ? For the first time [the boy]416-the boy ’s feelings were visibly engaged ; [his]416-the boy voice shook as [he]416-the boy burst out : “[209-dastrey] [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s right : this kind of thing has got to stop . [We]933-we shall go straight back to cannibalism if it doesn’t.—God , what hounds ! ” Yes , but — [Campton]174-campton pondered , tried to think up Pacifist arguments , remembered [his]174-campton own discussion with [Paul Dastrey]188-dastrey three days before . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear chap]934-my dear chap , has n’t [France]18-france perhaps gone about with a chip on [her]18-france shoulder ? [They]241-the germans ’re not fit to live with [white people]936-white people , and the sooner [they]241-the germans ’re shown it the better . ” “[241-the germans] Well , [France]18-france and [Russia]56-russia and [England]3-england are here to show [them]241-the germans . ” [George]175-george laughed . “[241-the germans] Yes , and double quick . ” [Both]2972-both were silent again , each thinking [his]175-george own thoughts . [They]2972-both were apparently the same , for just as [Campton]174-campton was about to ask where [George]175-george had decided that [they]938-they should take [their]938-they last dinner , [the young man]2749-the young man said abruptly : “[241-the germans] Look here , [Dad]937-dad ; [I]0-i ’d planned a little tête - à - tête for [us]938-they this evening . ” “[0-i] Yes — — ? ” “[0-i] Well — [I]0-i ca n’t . And now for [my]0-i adieux to [Adele]220-adele anthony . ” [He]0-i went off whistling the waltz from [the Rosenkavalier]2977-the rosenkavalier , and [Campton]174-campton returned to [his]174-campton own thoughts . * * * * * [He]174-campton was still revolving [them]2978-them when [he]174-campton went [upstairs]2704-upstairs after a solitary repast in [the confused and servantless dining - room]2980-the confused and servantless dining - room . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had telephoned to [him]174-campton to come and dine — after seeing [George]175-george , [he]174-campton supposed ; but [he]174-campton had declined . [He]174-campton wanted to be with [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy , or alone . As [he]174-campton left [the dining - room]2982-the dining - room [he]174-campton ran across [Adamson]256-adamson , [the American newspaper correspondent]2983-the american newspaper correspondent , who had lived for years in [Paris]5-paris and was reputed to have “[0-i] inside information . ” [Adamson]256-adamson was grave but confident . In [his]174-campton opinion [Russia]56-russia would probably not get to [Berlin]8-berlin before November ( [he]174-campton smiled at [Campton]174-campton ’s astonished outcry ) ; but if [England]3-england — oh , [they]2984-they were sure of England!—could get [[her]3-england army]2985-her army over without delay , the whole business would very likely be settled before that , in one big battle in [Belgium]61-belgium . ( Yes — poor [Belgium]61-belgium , indeed ! ) Anyhow , in the opinion of [the military experts]2986-the military experts the war was not likely to last more than three or four months ; and of course , even if things went badly on the western front , which was highly unlikely , there was [Russia]56-russia to clench the business as soon as [her]56-russia huge forces got in motion . [Campton]174-campton drew much comfort from this sober view of the situation , midway between that of [the optimists who knew [Russia]56-russia would be in [Berlin]8-berlin in three weeks]2987-the optimists who knew russia would be in berlin in three weeks , and of [those who saw [the Germans]241-the germans in [Calais]69-calais]2988-those who saw the germans in calais even sooner . [Adamson]256-adamson was [a levelheaded fellow , who weighed what [he]256-adamson said and pinned [his]256-adamson faith to facts]2989-a levelheaded fellow , who weighed what he said and pinned his faith to facts . [Campton]174-campton managed to evade [several people whom [he]174-campton saw]2990-several people whom he saw lurking for [him]174-campton , and mounted to [[his]174-campton room]2991-his room . On [the terrace]675-the terrace , alone with [the serene city]2993-the serene city , [his]174-campton confidence grew , and [he]174-campton began to feel more and more sure that , whatever happened , [George]175-george was likely to be kept out of the fighting till the whole thing was over . With such formidable forces closing in on [her]56-russia it was fairly obvious that [Germany]55-germany must succumb before half or even a quarter of [the allied reserves]2994-the allied reserves had been engaged . Sustained by the thought , [he]174-campton let [his]174-campton mind hover tenderly over [George]175-george ’s future , and the effect on [his]174-campton character of this brief and harmless plunge into a military career . [IX George]175-george was gone . When , with a last whistle and scream , [[his]174-campton train]2995-his train had ploughed its way out of [the clanging station]2996-the clanging station ; when [the last young figures clinging to the rear of [the last carriage]2998-the last carriage]2997-the last young figures clinging to the rear of the last carriage had vanished , and the bare rails again glittered up from the cindery tracks , [Campton]174-campton turned and looked about [him]174-campton . [All the platforms of [the station]563-the station]2999-all the platforms of the station were crowded as [he]174-campton had seldom seen [any place]3001-any place crowded , and to [his]174-campton surprise [he]174-campton found [himself]174-campton taking in every detail of the scene with a morbid accuracy of observation . [He]174-campton had discovered , during these last days , that [[his]174-campton artist]3002-his artist ’s vision had been strangely unsettled . Sometimes , as when [he]174-campton had left [[Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s house]2709-fortin ’s house , [he]174-campton saw nothing : the material world , which had always tugged at [him]174-campton with a thousand hands , vanished and left [him]174-campton in the void . Then again , as at present , [he]174-campton saw everything , saw it too clearly , in all its superfluous and negligible reality , instead of instinctively selecting , and disregarding what was not to [his]174-campton purpose . Faces , faces — [they]3004-they swarmed about [him]174-campton , and [his]174-campton overwrought vision registered [them]3004-they one by one . Especially [he]174-campton noticed the faces of [the women]404-the women , [women of all ages , all classes]3006-women of all ages , all classes . [These]3004-they were [the wives]3007-the wives , [mothers]507-mothers , [grandmothers]3009-grandmothers , [sisters]747-sisters , [mistresses of all those heavily laden trainfuls of French youth]3011-mistresses of all those heavily laden trainfuls of french youth . [He]174-campton was struck with the same strong cheerfulness in all : some pale , some flushed , some serious , but all firmly and calmly smiling . [One young woman in particular]3012-one young woman in particular [his]174-campton look dwelt on — [a dark girl in a becoming dress]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress — both because [she]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress was so pleasant to see , and because there was such assurance in [her]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress serenity that [she]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress did not have to constrain [her]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress lips and eyes , but could trust them to be what [she]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress wished . Yet [he]174-campton saw by the way [she]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress clung to [the young artilleryman from whom [she]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress was parting]3014-the young artilleryman from whom she was parting that [hers]3013-a dark girl in a becoming dress were no sisterly farewells . An immense hum of voices filled [the vast glazed enclosure]3015-the vast glazed enclosure . [Campton]174-campton caught the phrases flung up to [the young faces piled one above another in the windows]3016-the young faces piled one above another in the windows — words of motherly admonishment , little jokes , tender names , mirthful allusions , last callings out : “[0-i] Write often ! Do n’t forget to wrap up [your]946-your throat .... Remember to send a line to [Annette]70-annette .... Bring [home]502-home a Prussian helmet for [the children]948-the children ! _ On les aura , pas , mon vieux ? _ ” It was all bright , brave and confident . “[8-berlin] If [Berlin]8-berlin could only see it ! ” [Campton]174-campton thought . [He]174-campton tried to remember what [his]174-campton own last words to [George]175-george had been , but could not ; yet [his]174-campton throat felt dry and thirsty , as if [he]174-campton had talked a great deal . [The train]768-the train vanished in a roar , and [he]174-campton leaned against [a pier]3018-a pier to let [the crowd]613-the crowd flood by , not daring to risk [his]174-campton lameness in such a turmoil . Suddenly [he]174-campton heard loud sobs behind [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton turned , and recognized the hat and hair of [the girl whose eyes]3020-the girl whose eyes had struck [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton could not see them now , for they were buried in [her]3020-the girl whose eyes hands and [her]3020-the girl whose eyes whole body shook with woe . [An elderly man]3021-an elderly man was trying to draw [her]3020-the girl whose eyes away — [[her]3020-the girl whose eyes father]3022-her father , probably . “[8-berlin] Come , come , [[my]0-i child]949-my child — — ” “[8-berlin] Oh — oh — oh , ” [she]3020-the girl whose eyes hiccoughed , following blindly . [The people nearest]3023-the people nearest stared at [her]3020-the girl whose eyes , and the faces of [other women]3024-other women grew pale . [Campton]174-campton saw tears on the cheeks of an old body in a black bonnet who might have been [his]174-campton own [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme . [A pale lad]3025-a pale lad went away weeping . But [they]3023-the people nearest were all afraid , then , all in immediate deadly fear for the lives of [[their]3023-the people nearest beloved]3026-their beloved ! The same fear grasped [Campton]174-campton ’s heart , a very present terror , such as [he]174-campton had hardly before imagined . Compared to it , all that [he]174-campton had felt hitherto seemed as faint as the sensations of [a looker - on]2849-a looker - on . [His]174-campton knees failed [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton grasped a transverse bar of [the pier]3028-the pier . [People]378-people were leaving [the station]563-the station in [groups of two or three who seemed to belong to [each other]443-each other]3031-groups of two or three who seemed to belong to each other ; only [he]174-campton was alone . [[George]175-george ’s mother]3033-george ’s mother had not come to bid [[her]3033-george ’s mother son]3034-her son goodbye ; [she]3033-george ’s mother had declared that [she]3033-george ’s mother would rather take leave of [him]3034-her son quietly in [[her]3033-george ’s mother own house]3035-her own house than in [a crowd of [dirty people at [the station]563-the station]3037-dirty people at the station]3036-a crowd of dirty people at the station . But then it was impossible to conceive of [her]3033-george ’s mother being up and dressed and at [the Gare de l’Est]3039-the gare de l’est at five in the morning — and how could [she]3033-george ’s mother have got [there]467-there without [her]3033-george ’s mother motor ? So [Campton]174-campton was alone , in [that crowd which seemed all made up of [families]3042-families]3041-that crowd which seemed all made up of families . But no — not all . Ahead of [him]174-campton [he]174-campton saw [one woman]3043-one woman moving away alone , and recognized , across the welter of heads , [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ’s adamantine hat and tight knob of hair . [Poor Adele]257-adele ! So [she]3043-one woman had come too — and had evidently failed in [her]3043-one woman quest , not been able to fend a way through [the crowd]613-the crowd , and perhaps not even had a glimpse of [[her]3043-one woman hero]3045-her hero . The thought smote [Campton]174-campton with compunction : [he]174-campton regretted [his]174-campton sneering words when [they]3046-they had last met , regretted refusing to dine with [her]3043-one woman . [He]174-campton wished the barrier of [people]378-people between [them]3046-they had been less impenetrable ; but for the moment it was useless to try to force a way through it . [He]174-campton had to wait till [the crowd]613-the crowd shifted to [other platforms]3049-other platforms , whence [other trains]3050-other trains were starting , and by that time [she]3043-one woman was lost to sight . At last [he]174-campton was able to make [his]174-campton way through [the throng]3051-the throng , and as [he]174-campton came out of a side entrance [he]174-campton saw [her]3043-one woman . [She]3043-one woman appeared to be looking for [a taxi]2503-a taxi — [she]3043-one woman waved [her]3043-one woman sunshade aimlessly . But [no one who knew the Gare de l’Est]3053-no one who knew the gare de l’est would have gone around that corner to look for [a taxi]2503-a taxi ; least of all the practical [Adele]257-adele . Besides , [Adele]257-adele never took [taxis]3055-taxis : [she]257-adele travelled in [the bowels of [the earth]418-the earth]3056-the bowels of the earth or on [the dizziest omnibus tops]3058-the dizziest omnibus tops . [Campton]174-campton knew at once that [she]3043-one woman was waiting for [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton went up to [her]3043-one woman and a guilty pink suffused [her]3043-one woman nose . “[8-berlin] [You]950-you missed [him]951-him after all — — ? ” [he]174-campton said . “[0-i] [I]0-i — oh , no , [I]0-i did n’t . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i did n’t ? But [I]0-i was with [him]951-him all the time . [We]952-we did n’t see [you]950-you — — ” “[952-we] No , but _ [I]0-i _ saw — distinctly . That was all [I]0-i went for , ” [she]3043-one woman jerked back . [He]174-campton slipped [his]174-campton arm through [hers]3043-one woman . “[0-i] [This crowd]953-this crowd terrifies [me]0-i . [I]0-i ’m glad [you]950-you waited for [me]0-i , ” [he]174-campton said . [He]174-campton saw [her]950-you pleasure , but [she]950-you merely answered : “[950-you] [I]0-i ’m dying of thirst , are n’t [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes — or hunger , or something . Could [we]952-we find [a _ laiterie _]954-a _ laiterie _ ? ” [They]952-we found one , and sat down among [early clerks]3059-early clerks and [shop - girls]3060-shop - girls , and [a few dishevelled women with swollen faces whom [Campton]174-campton had noticed in [the station]563-the station]3061-a few dishevelled women with swollen faces whom campton had noticed in the station . One of [them]3061-a few dishevelled women with swollen faces whom campton had noticed in the station , who sat opposite [an elderly man]3021-an elderly man , had drawn out a pocket mirror and was powdering [her]950-you nose . [Campton]174-campton hated to see [women]738-women powder [their]738-women noses — one of the few merits with which [he]174-campton credited [Julia Brant]194-julia was that of never having adopted these dirty modern fashions , of continuing to make [her]194-julia toilet in private “[955-a lady] like [a lady]955-a lady , ” as [people]378-people used to say when [he]174-campton was young . But now the gesture charmed [him]174-campton , for [he]174-campton had recognized [the girl who had been sobbing in [the station]563-the station]3066-the girl who had been sobbing in the station . “[955-a lady] How game [she]956-she is ! [I]0-i like that . But why is [she]956-she so frightened ? ” [he]174-campton wondered . For [he]174-campton saw that [her]956-she chocolate was untouched , and that the smile had stiffened on [her]956-she lips . Since [his]174-campton talk with [Adamson]256-adamson [he]174-campton could not bring [himself]174-campton to be seriously alarmed . Fear had taken [him]174-campton by the throat for a moment in [the station]563-the station , at the sound of [the girl]774-the girl ’s sobs ; but already [he]174-campton had thrown it off . [Everybody]3070-everybody agreed that the war was sure to be over in a few weeks ; even [Dastrey]220-adele anthony had come round to that view ; and with [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s protection , and the influences [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant could put in motion , [George]175-george was surely safe — as safe at [[his]175-george depot]846-his depot as anywhere else in [this precarious world]3072-this precarious world . [Campton]174-campton poured out [Adele]220-adele anthony ’s coffee , and drank off [his]174-campton own as if it had been champagne . “[956-she] Do [you]957-you know anything about [the people [George]175-george was dining with last night]958-the people george was dining with last night ? ” [he]174-campton enquired abruptly . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony knew everything and [everybody in [the American circle in [Paris]5-paris]3074-the american circle in paris]3073-everybody in the american circle in paris ; [she]221-miss anthony was [a clearing - house of Franco - American gossip]3075-a clearing - house of franco - american gossip , and it was likely enough that if [George]175-george had special reasons for wishing to spend [his]175-george last evening away from [[his]175-george family]794-his family [she]221-miss anthony would know why . But the chance of [her]221-miss anthony knowing what had been kept from [him]175-george made [Campton]174-campton ’s question , as soon as it was put , seem indiscreet , and [he]174-campton added hastily : “[957-you] Not that [I]0-i want — — ” [She]221-miss anthony looked surprised . “[175-george] No : [he]175-george did n’t tell [me]0-i . [Some young man]959-some young man ’s affair , [I]0-i suppose .... ” [She]221-miss anthony smirked absurdly , [her]221-miss anthony lashless eyes blinking under the pushed - back veil . [Campton]174-campton ’s mind had already strayed from the question . Nothing bored [him]174-campton more than [Adele]220-adele anthony doing the “[175-george] sad dog , ” and [he]174-campton was vexed at having given [her]221-miss anthony such a chance to be silly . What [he]174-campton wanted to know was whether [George]175-george had spoken to [[his]175-george old friend]437-his old friend about [his]175-george future — about [his]175-george own idea of [his]175-george situation , and [his]175-george intentions and wishes in view of the grim chance which [people]378-people , with propitiatory vagueness , call “[175-george] anything happening . ” Had [the boy]416-the boy left any word , any message with [her]221-miss anthony for any one ? But it was useless to speculate , for if [he]174-campton had , [the old goose , true as steel]3080-the old goose , true as steel , would never betray it by as much as a twitch of [her]221-miss anthony lids . [She]221-miss anthony could look , when it was a question of keeping a secret , like such [an impenetrable idiot]3081-an impenetrable idiot that [one]398-one could not imagine [any one]3083-any one ’s having trusted a secret to [her]221-miss anthony . [Campton]174-campton had no wish to surprise [George]175-george ’s secrets , if [the boy]416-the boy had any . But [their]3085-their parting had been so hopelessly [Anglo - Saxon , so curt and casual]3086-anglo - saxon , so curt and casual , that [he]174-campton would have liked to think [[his]174-campton son]364-his son had left , somewhere , a message for [him]416-the boy , a word , a letter , in case ... in case there was anything premonitory in the sobbing of [that girl at the next table]3088-that girl at the next table . But [Adele]220-adele anthony ’s pink nose confronted [him]174-campton , as guileless as a rabbit ’s , and [he]174-campton went out with [her]221-miss anthony unsatisfied . [They]3085-their parted at the door of [the restaurant]2692-the restaurant , and [Campton]174-campton went to [the studio]370-the studio to see if there were any news of [[his]174-campton maid]3091-his maid - servant [Mariette]187-mariette . [He]174-campton meant to return to sleep [there]467-there that night , and even [his]174-campton simple housekeeping was likely to be troublesome if [Mariette]187-mariette should not arrive . On the way it occurred to [him]174-campton that [he]174-campton had not yet seen the morning papers , and [he]174-campton stopped and bought a handful . Negotiations , hopes , fears , conjectures — but nothing new or definite , except the insolent fact of [Germany]55-germany ’s aggression , and the almost - certainty of [England]3-england ’s intervention . When [he]174-campton reached [the studio]370-the studio [he]174-campton found [Mme . Lebel]195-mme in [her]195-mme usual place , paler than usual , but with firm lips and bright eyes . [[Her]195-mme three grandsons]3094-her three grandsons had left for [[their]3094-her three grandsons depots]3095-their depots the day before : [one]398-one was in [the _ Chasseurs Alpins _]3097-the _ chasseurs alpins _ , and probably already on [his]398-one way to [Alsace]71-alsace , another in [the infantry]3098-the infantry , the third in [the heavy artillery]3099-the heavy artillery ; [she]195-mme did not know where [the two latter]3100-the two latter were likely to be sent . [[Her]195-mme eldest son]3101-her eldest son , [[their]3094-her three grandsons father]3102-their father , was dead ; [the second]3103-the second , [a man of fifty]3104-a man of fifty , and [a cabinetmaker by trade]3105-a cabinetmaker by trade , was in [the territorials]3106-the territorials , and was not to report for another week . [He]398-one hoped , before leaving , to see the return of [[his]398-one wife]516-his wife and [little girl , who were in [the Ardennes]72-the ardennes with [[the wife]3109-the wife ’s people]3110-the wife ’s people]3108-little girl , who were in the ardennes with the wife ’s people . [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme ’s mind was made up and [her]195-mme philosophy ready for immediate application . “[175-george] It ’s terribly hard for [the younger people]960-the younger people ; but it had to be . [I]0-i come from [Nancy]73-nancy , [Monsieur]961-monsieur : [I]0-i remember the German occupation . [I]0-i understand better than [[my]0-i daughter - in - law]962-my daughter - in - law .... ” There was no news of [Mariette]187-mariette , and small chance of having any for some days , much less of seeing [her]187-mariette . [No one]2702-no one could tell how long civilian travel would be interrupted . [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme , moved by [[her]195-mme lodger]3112-her lodger ’s plight , promised to “[3113-some one ”] find [some one ”]3113-some one ” ; and [Campton]174-campton mounted to [the studio]370-the studio . [He]174-campton had left [it]370-the studio only two days before , on the day when [he]174-campton had vainly waited for [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze and [[his]182-fortin - lescluze dancer]2542-his dancer ; and an abyss already divided [him]174-campton from that vanished time . Then [[his]174-campton little world]3116-his little world still hung like a straw above an eddy ; now it was spinning about in the central vortex . The pictures stood about untidily , and [he]174-campton looked curiously at all those faces which belonged to [the other life]3117-the other life . Each bore the mark of its own immediate passions and interests ; not one betrayed the least consciousness of coming disaster except the face of poor [Madame de Dolmetsch]258-de dolmetsch , whose love had enlightened [her]258-de dolmetsch . [Campton]174-campton began to think of the future from [the painter]540-the painter ’s point of view . What [a modeller of faces a great war]3119-a modeller of faces a great war must be ! What would [the people who came through it]3120-the people who came through it look like , [he]174-campton wondered . [His]174-campton bell tinkled , and [he]174-campton turned to answer it . [Dastrey]220-adele anthony , [he]174-campton supposed ... [he]174-campton had caught a glimpse of [[his]174-campton friend]444-his friend across the crowd at [the Gare de l’Est]3039-the gare de l’est , seeing off [[his]174-campton nephew]3123-his nephew , but had purposely made no sign . [He]174-campton still wanted to be alone , and above all not to hear war - talk . [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme , however , had no doubt revealed [his]174-campton presence in [the studio]370-the studio , and [he]174-campton could not risk offending [Dastrey]220-adele anthony . When [he]174-campton opened the door it was a surprise to see there , instead of [Dastrey]220-adele anthony ’s anxious face , the round rosy countenance of [a well - dressed youth with a shock of fair hair above eyes of childish candour]3125-a well - dressed youth with a shock of fair hair above eyes of childish candour . “[3113-some one ”] Oh — come in , ” [Campton]174-campton said , surprised , but divining [a compatriot]3126-a compatriot in a difficulty . [The youth]3127-the youth obeyed , blushing [his]3127-the youth apologies . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher , [sir]2499-sir , ” [he]0-i said , in a tone modest yet confident , as if the name were an introduction . “[259-benny upsher] Oh — — ” [Campton]174-campton stammered , cursing [his]174-campton absent - mindedness and [[his]174-campton unfailing faculty]3128-his unfailing faculty for forgetting names . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’re [a friend of [George]175-george ’s]964-a friend of george ’s , are n’t [you]0-i ? ” [he]174-campton risked . “[0-i] Yes — tremendous . [We]965-we were at [Harvard]33-harvard together — [he]175-george was two years ahead of [me]0-i . ” “[175-george] Ah — then [you]0-i ’re still there ? ” [Mr. Upsher]260-mr. upsher ’s blush became a mask of crimson . “[0-i] Well — [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was , till this thing happened . ” “[0-i] What thing ? ” [The youth]3127-the youth stared at [the older man]3130-the older man with a look of celestial wonder . “[0-i] [This war.—George]966-this war.—george has started already , has n’t [he]175-george ? ” “[175-george] Yes .
