[I]0-i wanted most awfully to see [him]175-george ; if [I]0-i had , of course [I]0-i should n’t have bothered [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear [young man]970-young man]969-my dear young man , [you]0-i ’re not bothering [me]0-i . But what can [I]0-i do ? ” [Mr. Upsher]260-mr. upsher ’s composure seemed to be returning as the necessary preliminaries were cleared away . “[0-i] Thanks a lot , ” [he]260-mr. upsher said . “[0-i] Of course what [I]0-i ’d like best is to join [[his]175-george regiment]816-his regiment . ” “[175-george] Join [his]175-george regiment—_you _ ! ” [Campton]174-campton exclaimed . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i know it ’s difficult ; [I]0-i raced up from [Biarritz]66-biarritz quick as [I]0-i could to catch [him]175-george . ” [He]260-mr. upsher seemed still to be panting with the effort . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to be in this , ” [he]260-mr. upsher concluded . [Campton]174-campton contemplated [him]260-mr. upsher with helpless perplexity . “[0-i] But [I]0-i do n’t understand — there ’s no reason , in [your]175-george case . With [George]175-george it was obligatory — on account of [his]175-george being born [here]2489-here . But [I]0-i suppose [you]175-george were born in [America]2-america ? ” “[175-george] Well , [I]0-i guess so : in [Utica]39-utica . [[My]0-i mother]849-my mother was [Madeline Mayhew]261-madeline mayhew . [I]0-i think [we]974-we ’re [a sort of cousins]975-a sort of cousins , [sir]2499-sir , are n’t [we]974-we ? ” “[974-we] Of course — of course . Excuse [my]0-i not recalling it — just at first . But , [[my]0-i dear boy]977-my dear boy , [I]0-i still do n’t see — — ” [Mr. Upsher]260-mr. upsher ’s powers of stating [his]260-mr. upsher case were plainly limited . [He]260-mr. upsher pushed back [his]260-mr. upsher rumpled hair , looked hard again at [[his]260-mr. upsher cousin]3131-his cousin , and repeated doggedly : “[0-i] [I]0-i want to be _ in _ this . ” “[0-i] This war ? ” [He]260-mr. upsher nodded . [Campton]174-campton groaned . What did [the boy]416-the boy mean , and why come to [him]260-mr. upsher with such tomfoolery ? At that moment [he]260-mr. upsher felt even more unfitted than usual to deal with practical problems , and in spite of the forgotten cousinship it was no affair of [his]260-mr. upsher what [[Madeline Mayhew]261-madeline mayhew ’s son]3133-madeline mayhew ’s son wanted to be in . But there was [the boy]416-the boy [himself]416-the boy , stolid , immovable , impenetrable to hints , and with something in [his]416-the boy wide blue eyes like [George]175-george — and yet so childishly different . “[0-i] Sit down — have a cigarette , wo n’t you?—You know , of course , ” [Campton]174-campton began , “[0-i] that what [you]0-i propose is almost insuperably difficult ? ” “[0-i] Getting into [[George]175-george ’s regiment]978-george ’s regiment ? ” “[175-george] Getting into [the French army]812-the french army at all — for [a foreigner]2498-a foreigner , a neutral ... [I]0-i ’m afraid there ’s really nothing [I]0-i can do . ” [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher smiled indulgently . “[0-i] [I]0-i can fix that up all right ; getting into [the army]981-the army , [I]0-i mean . The only thing that might be hard would be getting into [[his]175-george regiment]816-his regiment . ” “[0-i] Oh , as to that — out of the question , [I]0-i should think . ” [Campton]174-campton was conscious of speaking curtly : [the boy]416-the boy ’s bland determination was beginning to get on [his]174-campton nerves . “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i no end , ” said [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher , getting up . “[0-i] Sorry to have butted in , ” [he]0-i added , holding out a large brown hand . [Campton]174-campton followed [him]0-i to the door perplexedly . [He]174-campton knew that something ought to be done — but what ? On the threshold [he]174-campton laid [his]174-campton hand impulsively on [the youth]3127-the youth ’s shoulder . “[0-i] Look here , [[my]0-i boy]983-my boy , [we]984-we ’re [cousins]985-cousins , as [you]0-i say , and if [you]0-i ’re [[Madeline Mayhew]261-madeline mayhew ’s boy]986-madeline mayhew ’s boy [you]0-i ’re [an only son]864-an only son . Moreover [you]0-i ’re [[George]175-george ’s friend]988-george ’s friend — which matters still more to [me]0-i . [I]0-i ca n’t let [you]0-i go like this . Just let [me]0-i say a word to [you]0-i before — — ” A gleam of shrewdness flashed through [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher ’s inarticulate blue eyes . “[0-i] A word or two _ against _ , [you]0-i mean ? Why , it ’s awfully kind , but not the least earthly use . [I]0-i guess [I]0-i ’ve heard all the arguments . But all [I]0-i see is that hulking bully trying to do [Belgium]61-belgium in . [England]3-england ’s coming in , ai n’t [she]989-she ? Well , then why ai n’t [we]990-we ? ” “[990-we] [England]3-england ? Why — why , there ’s no analogy — — ” [The young man]2749-the young man groped for the right word . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know . Maybe not . Only in tight places [we]990-we always _ do _ seem to stand together . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i ’re mad — this is not [our]990-we war . Do [you]0-i really want to go out and butcher [people]378-people ? ” “[0-i] Yes — [this kind of people]992-this kind of people , ” said [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher cheerfully . “[992-this kind of people] [You]0-i see , [I]0-i ’ve had all this talk from [Uncle Harvey Mayhew]263-mayhew a good many times on the way over . [We]990-we came out on [the same boat]993-the same boat : [he]263-mayhew wanted [me]0-i to be [[his]263-mayhew private secretary]994-his private secretary at [the Hague Congress]74-the hague congress . But [I]0-i was pretty sure [I]0-i ’d have a job of [my]0-i own to attend to . ” [Campton]174-campton still contemplated [him]0-i hopelessly . “[0-i] Where is [[your]0-i uncle]995-your uncle ? ” [he]174-campton wondered . [Benny]259-benny upsher grinned . “[995-your uncle] On [his]995-your uncle way to [the Hague]996-the hague , [I]0-i suppose . ” “[995-your uncle] [He]995-your uncle ought to be here to look after [you]0-i — [some one]839-some one ought to ! ” “[995-your uncle] Then [you]0-i do n’t see [your]0-i way to getting [me]0-i into [[George]175-george ’s regiment]978-george ’s regiment ? ” [Benny]259-benny upsher simply replied . An hour later [Campton]174-campton still seemed to see [him]259-benny upsher standing there , with obstinate soft eyes repeating the same senseless question . It cost [him]0-i an effort to shake off the vision . [He]0-i returned to [the Crillon]28-the crillon to collect [his]0-i possessions . On [his]0-i table was a telegram , and [he]0-i seized it eagerly , wondering if by some mad chance [George]175-george ’s plans were changed , if [he]259-benny upsher were being sent back , if [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze had already arranged something .... [He]0-i tore open the message , and read : “[0-i] Utica July thirty - first . No news from [Benny]259-benny upsher please do all [you]0-i can to facilitate [his]259-benny upsher immediate return to [America]2-america dreadfully anxious [[your]0-i cousin]999-your cousin [Madeline Upsher]264-madeline upsher . ” “[264-madeline upsher] Good Lord ! ” [Campton]174-campton groaned—“and[264-madeline upsher] [I]0-i never even asked [the boy]416-the boy ’s address ! ” BOOK II X The war was three months old — three centuries . By virtue of some gift of adaptation which seemed forever to discredit human sensibility , [people]378-people were already beginning to live into the monstrous idea of it , acquire its ways , speak its language , regard it as a thinkable , endurable , arrangeable fact ; to eat it by day , and sleep on it — yes , and soundly — at night . The war went on ; life went on ; [Paris]5-paris went on . [She]264-madeline upsher had had [her]264-madeline upsher great hour of resistance , when , alone , exposed and defenceless , [she]264-madeline upsher had held back [the enemy]3139-the enemy and broken [his]3139-the enemy strength . [She]264-madeline upsher had had , afterward , [her]264-madeline upsher hour of triumph , the hour of [the Marne]265-the marne ; then [her]264-madeline upsher hour of passionate and prayerful hope , when it seemed to [the watching nations]3140-the watching nations that [the enemy]3139-the enemy was not only held back but thrust back , and victory finally in reach . That hour had passed in its turn , giving way to the grey reality of [the trenches]3142-the trenches . A new speech was growing up in [this new world]3143-this new world . There were [trenches]3144-trenches now , there was [a “[0-i] Front”—people]3145-a “ front”—people were beginning to talk of [[their]3145-a “ front”—people sons]450-their sons at the front . The first time [John Campton]174-campton heard the phrase it sent a shudder through [him]174-campton . Winter was coming on , and [he]174-campton was haunted by the vision of [the youths out there]3147-the youths out there , [boys of [George]175-george ’s age]3148-boys of george ’s age , [thousands and thousands of them , exposed by day in reeking wet ditches and sleeping at night under the rain and snow]3149-thousands and thousands of them , exposed by day in reeking wet ditches and sleeping at night under the rain and snow . [People]378-people were talking calmly of victory in the spring — the spring that was still six long months away ! And meanwhile , what cold and wet , what blood and agony , what shattered bodies out on that hideous front , what shattered homes in [all the lands it guarded]3151-all the lands it guarded ! [Campton]174-campton could bear to think of these things now . _ [[His]174-campton _ son]3152-his _ son was not at the front — was safe , thank [God]266-god , and likely to remain so ! During the first awful weeks of silence and uncertainty , when every morning brought news of a fresh disaster , when no letters came from [the army]981-the army and no private messages could reach it — during those weeks , while [Campton]174-campton , like [other fathers]3154-other fathers , was without news of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , the war had been to [him]174-campton simply a huge featureless mass crushing [him]174-campton earthward , blinding [him]174-campton , letting [him]174-campton neither think nor move nor breathe . But at last [he]174-campton had got permission to go to [Chalons]75-chalons , [whither Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze , who chanced to have begun [his]174-campton career as [a surgeon]3156-a surgeon , had been hastily transferred . [The physician]415-the physician , called from [his]415-the physician incessant labours in [a roughly - improvised operating - room]3158-a roughly - improvised operating - room , to which [Campton]174-campton was led between rows of stretchers laden with [livid blood - splashed men]3159-livid blood - splashed men , had said kindly , but with a shade of impatience , that [he]415-the physician had not forgotten , had done what [he]415-the physician could ; that [George]175-george ’s health did not warrant [his]174-campton being discharged from [the army]981-the army , but that [he]174-campton was temporarily on a staff - job at the rear , and would probably be kept [there]467-there if such and such influences were brought to bear . Then , calling for hot water and fresh towels , [the surgeon]3162-the surgeon vanished and [Campton]174-campton made [his]174-campton way back with lowered eyes between the stretchers . [The “[0-i] influences ” in question]3163-the “ influences ” in question were brought to bear — not without [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s assistance — and now that [George]175-george was fairly certain to be kept at clerical work a good many miles from [the danger - zone]3164-the danger - zone [Campton]174-campton felt less like [an ant under a landslide]3165-an ant under a landslide , and was able for the first time to think of the war as [he]174-campton might have thought of any other war : objectively , intellectually , almost dispassionately , as of history in the making . It was not that [he]174-campton had any doubt as to the rights and wrongs of the case . The painfully preserved equilibrium of [the neutrals]3166-the neutrals made a pitiful show now that the monstrous facts of the first weeks were known : [Germany]55-germany ’s diplomatic perfidy , [her]55-germany savagery in [the field]3167-the field , [her]55-germany premeditated and systematized terrorizing of [the civil populations]3168-the civil populations . Nothing could efface what had been done in [Belgium]61-belgium and [Luxembourg]41-luxembourg , the burning of [Louvain]76-louvain , the bombardment of [Rheims]77-rheims . These successive outrages had roused in [Campton]174-campton the same incredulous wrath as in the rest of [mankind]2847-mankind ; but being of a speculative mind — and fairly sure now that [George]175-george would never lie in the mud and snow with [the others]3170-the others — [he]174-campton had begun to consider the landslide in its universal relations , as well as in its effects on [his]174-campton private ant - heap . [[His]174-campton son]364-his son ’s situation , however , was still [his]174-campton central thought . That [this lad]3172-this lad , who was meant to have been born three thousand miles away in [[his]3172-this lad own safe warless country]3173-his own safe warless country , and who was regarded by [the government of [that country]3175-that country]3174-the government of that country as having been born [there]467-there , as subject to [her]3174-the government of that country laws and entitled to [her]3174-the government of that country protection — that [this lad , by the most idiotic of blunders]3177-this lad , by the most idiotic of blunders , a blunder perpetrated before [he]3172-this lad was born , should have been dragged into a conflict in which [he]3172-this lad was totally unconcerned , should become temporarily and arbitrarily the subject of [a foreign state]3178-a foreign state , exposed to whatever catastrophes [that state]3179-that state might draw upon [itself]3179-that state , this fact still seemed to [Campton]174-campton as unjust as when it first dawned on [him]174-campton that [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ’s very life might hang on some tortuous secret negotiation between [the cabinets of [Europe]42-europe]3181-the cabinets of europe . [He]174-campton still refused to admit that [France]18-france had any claim on [George]175-george , any right to [his]175-george time , to [his]175-george suffering or to [his]175-george life . [He]174-campton had argued it out a hundred times with [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony . “[1001-you] [You]1001-you say [Julia]194-julia and [I]0-i were to blame for not going [home]502-home before [the boy]416-the boy was born — and [God]266-god knows [I]0-i agree with [you]1001-you ! But suppose [we]1004-we ’d meant to go ? Suppose [we]1004-we ’d made every arrangement , taken every precaution , as [[my]0-i parents]1005-my parents did in [my]0-i own case , got to [Havre]78-havre or [Cherbourg]79-cherbourg , say , and been told [the steamer]1006-the steamer had broken [her]1006-the steamer screw — or been prevented [ourselves]1004-we , at the last moment , by illness or accident , or any sudden grab of the Hand of [God]266-god ? [You]1001-you ’ll admit [we]1004-we should n’t have been to blame for that ; yet the law would have recognized no difference . [George]175-george would still have found [himself]175-george [a French soldier on the second of last August]1007-a french soldier on the second of last august because , by the same kind of unlucky accident , [he]175-george and [I]0-i were born on [the wrong side of [the Atlantic]80-the atlantic]1008-the wrong side of the atlantic . And [I]0-i say that ’s enough to prove it ’s an iniquitous law , a travesty of justice . [Nobody]882-nobody ’s going to convince [me]0-i that , because [a steamer]1010-a steamer may happen to break a phlange of [her]1006-the steamer screw at the wrong time , or [a poor woman]1011-a poor woman be frightened by a thunderstorm , [France]18-france has the right to force [an American boy]1012-an american boy to go and rot in [the trenches]3142-the trenches . ” “[175-george] In [the trenches]3142-the trenches — is [George]175-george in the trenches ? ” [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony asked , raising [her]1006-the steamer pale eyebrows . “[175-george] No . ” [Campton]174-campton thundered , [his]174-campton fist crashing down among [her]1006-the steamer tea things ; “[175-george] and all [your]0-i word - juggling is n’t going to convince [me]0-i that [he]175-george ought to be [there]467-there . ” [He]174-campton paused and stared furiously about [the little ladylike drawing - room into which [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony]3182-the little ladylike drawing - room into which miss anthony ’s sharp angles were so incongruously squeezed . [She]221-miss anthony made no answer , and [he]174-campton went on : “[175-george] [George]175-george looks at the thing exactly as [I]0-i do . ” “[175-george] Has [he]175-george told [you]0-i so ? ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony enquired , rescuing [his]174-campton teacup and putting sugar into [her]221-miss anthony own . “[175-george] [He]175-george has told [me]0-i nothing to the contrary . [You]0-i do n’t seem to be aware that military correspondence is censored , and that [a soldier]1016-a soldier ca n’t always blurt out everything [he]1016-a soldier thinks . ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony followed [his]174-campton glance about [the room]475-the room , and [her]221-miss anthony eyes paused with [his]174-campton on [her]221-miss anthony own portrait , now in the place of honour over the mantelpiece , where it hung incongruously above a menagerie of china animals and a collection of trophies from [the Marne]3184-the marne . “[0-i] [I]0-i dropped in at [the Luxembourg]1017-the luxembourg yesterday , ” [she]221-miss anthony said . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i know whom [I]0-i saw [there]467-there ? [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant . [He]175-george was looking at [George]175-george ’s portrait , and turned as red as a beet . [You]0-i ought to do [him]175-george a sketch of [George]175-george some day — after this . ” [Campton]174-campton ’s face darkened . [He]174-campton knew it was partly through [Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s influence that [George]175-george had been detached from [[his]175-george regiment]816-his regiment and given a staff job in [the Argonne]81-the argonne ; but [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s reminder annoyed [him]174-campton . [The Brants]203-the brants had acted through sheer selfish cowardice , the desire to safeguard something which belonged to [them]3186-they , something [they]3186-they valued as [they]3186-they valued [their]3186-they pictures and tapestries , though of course in a greater degree ; whereas [he]174-campton , [Campton]174-campton , was sustained by a principle which [he]174-campton could openly avow , and was ready to discuss with [any one who had the leisure to listen]3187-any one who had the leisure to listen . [He]174-campton had explained all this so often to [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony that the words rose again to [his]174-campton lips without an effort . “[175-george] If it had been a national issue [I]0-i should have wanted [him]1019-him to be among the first : such as [our]1020-our having to fight [Mexico]82-mexico , for instance — — ” “[1019-him] Yes ; or the moon . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i understand [Julia]194-julia and [Anderson]196-mrs. brant better . [They]1021-they do n’t care a fig for national issues ; [they]1021-they ’re just animals defending [their]1021-they cub . ” “[1021-they] _ Their_—thank [you]0-i ! ” [Campton]174-campton exclaimed . “[196-mrs. brant] Well , poor [Anderson]196-mrs. brant really _ was _ [a dry - nurse to [the boy]416-the boy]1022-a dry - nurse to the boy . Who else was there to look after [him]416-the boy ? [You]0-i were painting Spanish beauties at the time . ” [She]3188-her frowned . “[0-i] Life ’s a puzzle . [I]0-i see perfectly that if [you]0-i ’d let everything else go to keep [George]175-george [you]0-i ’d never have become [the great John Campton]174-campton : [the _ real _ John Campton]1024-the _ real _ john campton [you]0-i were meant to be . And it would n’t have been half as satisfactory for [you]0-i — or for [George]175-george either . Only , in the meanwhile , [somebody]1025-somebody had to blow [the child]1026-the child ’s nose , and pay [[his]1026-the child dentist]1027-his dentist and [doctor]1028-doctor ; and [you]0-i ought to be grateful to [Anderson]196-mrs. brant for doing it . Are n’t there bees or ants , or something , that are kept for such purposes ? ” [Campton]174-campton ’s lips were opened to reply when [her]3188-her face changed , and [he]174-campton saw that [he]174-campton had ceased to exist for [her]3188-her . [He]174-campton knew the reason . That look came over [everybody]3070-everybody ’s face nowadays at the hour when the evening paper came . [The old maid - servant]3190-the old maid - servant brought it in , and lingered to hear the _ communiqué _ . At that hour , everywhere over [the globe]3191-the globe , business and labour and pleasure ( if it still existed ) were suspended for a moment while the hearts of [all men]3192-all men gathered [themselves]3192-all men up in a question and a prayer . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony sought for [her]3188-her _ lorgnon _ and failed to find it . With a shaking hand [she]221-miss anthony passed the newspaper over to [Campton]174-campton . “[1025-somebody] Violent enemy attacks in [the region of [Dixmude]83-dixmude]1029-the region of dixmude , [Ypres]84-ypres , [Armentières]85-armentières , [Arras]86-arras , in [the Argonne]81-the argonne , and on [the advanced slopes of [the Grand Couronné de Nancy]1031-the grand couronné de nancy]1030-the advanced slopes of the grand couronné de nancy , have been successfully repulsed . [We]1032-we have taken back [the village of Soupir]1033-the village of soupir , near [Vailly]87-vailly ( [Aisne]88-aisne ) ; [we]1032-we have taken [Maucourt]89-maucourt and [Mogeville]90-mogeville , to [the northeast of [Verdun]91-verdun]1034-the northeast of verdun . Progress has been made in [the region of [Vermelles]92-vermelles]1035-the region of vermelles ( [Pas - de - Calais]93-pas - de - calais ) , [south of [Aix Noulette]94-aix noulette]1036-south of aix noulette . Enemy attacks in [the Hauts - de - Meuse]95-the hauts - de - meuse and [southeast of [Saint - Mihiel]96-saint - mihiel]1037-southeast of saint - mihiel have also been repulsed . “ In [Poland]97-poland [the Austrian]3193-the austrian retreat is becoming general . [The Russians]267-the russians are still advancing in [the direction of [Kielce - Sandomir]98-kielce - sandomir]3194-the direction of kielce - sandomir and have progressed beyond the [San]99-san in [Galicia]100-galicia . [Mlawa]101-mlawa has been reoccupied , and [the whole railway system of [Poland]97-poland]3195-the whole railway system of poland is now controlled by [the Russian forces]3196-the russian forces . ”[1038-the people who talked of a winter in the trenches , to be followed by a spring campaign] A good day — oh , decidedly a good day . At this rate , what became of the gloomy forecasts of [the people who talked of a winter in the trenches , to be followed by a spring campaign]1038-the people who talked of a winter in the trenches , to be followed by a spring campaign ? True , [the Serbian army]1039-the serbian army was still retreating before [superior Austrian forces]1040-superior austrian forces — but there too the scales would soon be turned if [the Russians]267-the russians continued to progress . That day there was hope everywhere : [the old maid - servant]3190-the old maid - servant went away smiling , and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony poured out another cup of tea . [Campton]174-campton had not lifted [his]174-campton eyes from the paper . Suddenly [they]1042-they lit on a short paragraph : “ Fallen on [the Field of Honour]3197-the field of honour . ”[1042-they] [One]398-one had got used to that with the rest ; used even to the pang of reading names [one knew , evoking familiar features]1044-one knew , evoking familiar features , young faces blotted out in blood , young limbs convulsed in the fires of that hell called “ [the Front]102-the front . ”[174-campton] But this time [Campton]174-campton turned pale and the paper fell to [his]174-campton knee . “ [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze ; [Jean - Jacques - Marie]268-jean - jacques - marie , [lieutenant of _ Chasseurs à Pied _ , gloriously fallen for [France]18-france]3198-lieutenant of _ chasseurs à pied _ , gloriously fallen for france .... ”[174-campton] There followed a ringing citation . [[Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s son]1045-fortin ’s son , [[his]182-fortin - lescluze only son]457-his only son , was dead . [Campton]174-campton saw before [him]174-campton [the honest _ bourgeois _ dining - room]1047-the honest _ bourgeois _ dining - room , so strangely out of keeping with [the rest of [the establishment]1049-the establishment]1048-the rest of the establishment ; [he]174-campton saw the late August sun slanting in on the group about the table , on [the ambitious and unscrupulous great man]1050-the ambitious and unscrupulous great man , [the two quiet women hidden under [his]1050-the ambitious and unscrupulous great man illustrious roof]1051-the two quiet women hidden under his illustrious roof , and [the youth who had held together [these three dissimilar people]1053-these three dissimilar people , making an invisible home in the heart of all that publicity]1052-the youth who had held together these three dissimilar people , making an invisible home in the heart of all that publicity . [Campton]174-campton remembered [his]174-campton brief exchange of words with [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze on the threshold , and [the father]568-the father ’s uncontrollable outburst : “ For [[his]1056-his own son mother]583-his mother and [myself]568-the father it ’s not a trifle — having [[our]3200-our only son]869-our only son in the war . ”[568-the father] [Campton]174-campton shut [his]174-campton eyes and leaned back , sick with the memory . [This man]1055-this man had had a share in saving [George]175-george ; but [[his]1055-this man own son]1056-his own son [he]1055-this man could not save . “ What ’s the matter ? ”[221-miss anthony] [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony asked , [her]221-miss anthony hand on [his]174-campton arm . [Campton]174-campton could not bring the name to [his]174-campton lips . “ Nothing — nothing . Only [this room]3202-this room ’s rather hot — and [I]174-campton must be off anyhow . ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton got up , escaping from [her]221-miss anthony solicitude , and made [his]174-campton way out . [He]174-campton must go at once to [Fortin ’s]182-fortin - lescluze for news . [The physician]415-the physician was still at [Chalons]75-chalons ; but there would surely be [some one at [the house]772-the house]1058-some one at the house , and [Campton]174-campton could at least leave a message and ask where to write . Dusk had fallen . [His]174-campton eyes usually feasted on the beauty of [the new]104-the new [Paris]5-paris , [the secret mysterious [Paris]5-paris of veiled lights and [deserted streets]1061-deserted streets]1060-the secret mysterious paris of veiled lights and deserted streets ; but to - night [he]174-campton was blind to it . [He]174-campton could see nothing but [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s face , hear nothing but [his]182-fortin - lescluze voice when [he]182-fortin - lescluze said : “ [[Our]3203-our only son]869-our only son in the war . ”[182-fortin - lescluze] [He]174-campton groped along [the pitch - black street]1062-the pitch - black street for the remembered outline of [the house]772-the house ( since [no house]1064-no house - numbers were visible ) , and rang several times without result . [He]174-campton was just turning away when a big mud - splashed motor drove up . [He]174-campton noticed [a soldier at the steering - wheel]1065-a soldier at the steering - wheel , then [three people]1066-three people got out stiffly : [two women smothered in crape]1067-two women smothered in crape and [a haggard man in a dirty uniform]1068-a haggard man in a dirty uniform . [Campton]174-campton stopped , and [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze recognized [him]174-campton by the light of the motor - lamp . [The four]1069-the four stood and looked at [each other]443-each other . [The old mother]2757-the old mother , under [her]2757-the old mother crape , appeared no bigger than [a child]1072-a child . “ Ah — [you]174-campton know ? ”[840-the doctor] [the doctor]840-the doctor said . [Campton]174-campton nodded . [The father]568-the father spoke in a firm voice . “ It happened three days ago — at [Suippes]105-suippes . [You]174-campton ’ve seen [his]568-the father citation ? [They]3205-they brought [him]568-the father in to [me]568-the father at [Chalons]75-chalons without a warning — and too late . [I]568-the father took off both legs , but gangrene had set in . Ah — if [I]568-the father could have got hold of [one of [[our]3207-our big surgeons]3208-our big surgeons]3206-one of our big surgeons .... Yes , [we]3207-our ’re just back from the funeral .... [[My]568-the father mother]849-my mother and [[my]568-the father wife]3210-my wife ... [they]3205-they had that comfort .... ”[568-the father] [The two women]1075-the two women stood beside [him]568-the father like shrouded statues . Suddenly [Mme]195-mme . [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s deep voice came through the crape : “ [You]568-the father saw [him]3206-one of our big surgeons , [Monsieur]3211-monsieur , that last day ... the day [you]568-the father came about [[your]568-the father own son]3212-your own son , [I]182-fortin - lescluze think ? ”[182-fortin - lescluze] “ [I]174-campton ... yes .... ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton stammered in anguish . [The physician]415-the physician intervened . “ And , now , _ ma bonne mère _ , [you]174-campton ’re not to be kept standing . [You]174-campton ’re to go straight in and take [your]174-campton _ tisane _ and go to bed . ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton kissed [[his]174-campton mother]583-his mother and pushed [her]583-his mother into [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife ’s arms . “ Goodbye , [[my]174-campton dear]2497-my dear . Take care of [her]583-his mother . ”[174-campton] [The women]404-the women vanished under the porte - cochère , and [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze turned to [the painter]540-the painter . “ Thank [you]540-the painter for coming . [I]182-fortin - lescluze ca n’t ask [you]540-the painter in — [I]182-fortin - lescluze must go back immediately . ”[182-fortin - lescluze] “ Back ? ”[174-campton] “ To [my]174-campton work . Thank [God]266-god . If it were not for that — — ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton jumped into [the motor]1081-the motor , called out “ _ En route _ , ”[174-campton] and was absorbed into the night . [XI Campton]174-campton went [home]502-home to [[his]174-campton studio]536-his studio . [He]174-campton still lived [there]467-there , shiftlessly and uncomfortably — for [Mariette]187-mariette had never come back from [Lille]14-lille . [She]187-mariette had not come back , and there was no news of [her]187-mariette . [Lille]14-lille had become [a part of [the “ occupied provinces]3215-the “ occupied provinces]3214-a part of the “ occupied provinces , ”[1086-that living burial] from which there was no escape ; and [people]378-people were beginning to find out what [that living burial]1086-that living burial meant . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had urged [Campton]174-campton to go back to [the hotel]662-the hotel , but [he]174-campton obstinately refused . What business had [he]174-campton to be living in [expensive hotels]1088-expensive hotels when , for [the Lord]1089-the lord knew how long , [his]174-campton means of earning a livelihood were gone , and when it was [his]174-campton duty to save up for [George]175-george — [George]175-george , who was safe , who was definitely out of danger , and whom [he]174-campton longed more than ever , when the war was over , to withdraw from the stifling atmosphere of [[his]174-campton stepfather]1090-his stepfather ’s millions ? [He]174-campton had been so near to having [the boy]416-the boy to [himself]174-campton when the war broke out ! [He]174-campton had almost had in sight the proud day when [he]174-campton should be able to say : “ Look here : this is [[your]416-the boy own bank - account]3216-your own bank - account . Now [you]416-the boy ’re independent — for [God]266-god ’s sake stop and consider what [you]416-the boy want to do with [your]416-the boy life . ”[174-campton] The war had put an end to that — but only for a time . If victory came before long , [Campton]174-campton ’s reputation would survive the eclipse , [his]174-campton chances of money - making would be as great as ever , and [the new George]1092-the new george , [the George]175-george matured and disciplined by war , would come back with a finer sense of values , and a soul steeled against the vulgar opportunities of wealth . Meanwhile , it behoved [[his]174-campton father]580-his father to save every penny . And the simplest way of saving was to go on camping in [the studio]370-the studio , taking [his]174-campton meals at [the nearest wine - shop]1095-the nearest wine - shop , and entrusting [his]174-campton bed - making and dusting to [old Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme . In that way [he]174-campton could live for a long time without appreciably reducing [his]174-campton savings . [Mme]195-mme . [[Lebel]195-mme ’s daughter - in - law]1096-lebel ’s daughter - in - law , [Mme]195-mme . [Jules]270-jules , who was in [the Ardennes]72-the ardennes with [the little girl]1097-the little girl when the war broke out , was to have replaced [Mariette]187-mariette . But , like [Mariette]187-mariette , [Mme]195-mme . [Jules]270-jules never arrived , and no word came from [her]195-mme or [the child]1026-the child . [They]1099-they too were in [an occupied province]1100-an occupied province . So [Campton]174-campton jogged on without [a servant]1101-a servant . It was very uncomfortable , even for [his]174-campton lax standards ; but the dread of letting [a stranger]2888-a stranger loose in [the studio]370-the studio made [him]174-campton prefer to put up with [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme ’s intermittent services . So far [she]195-mme had borne up bravely . [[Her]195-mme orphan grandsons]1104-her orphan grandsons were all at the front ( how that word had insinuated itself into the language ! ) but [she]195-mme continued to have fairly frequent reassuring news of [them]1104-her orphan grandsons . [The _ Chasseur Alpin _]271-the _ chasseur alpin _ , slightly wounded in [Alsace]71-alsace , was safe in [hospital]1105-hospital ; and [the others]3170-the others were well , and wrote cheerfully . [[Her]195-mme son]3034-her son [Jules]270-jules , [the cabinetmaker]1108-the cabinetmaker , was guarding [a bridge at [St. Cloud]106-st. cloud]1109-a bridge at st. cloud , and came in regularly to see [her]195-mme ; but [Campton]174-campton noticed that it was about [him]270-jules that [she]195-mme seemed most anxious . [He]270-jules was [a silent industrious man]1110-a silent industrious man , who had worked hard to support [[his]270-jules orphaned nephews]1111-his orphaned nephews and [[his]270-jules mother]583-his mother , and had married in middle age , only four or five years before the war , when [the lads]1113-the lads could shift for [themselves]1113-the lads , and [his]270-jules own situation was secure enough to permit the luxury of [a wife]1114-a wife and [baby]1115-baby . [Mme]195-mme . [Jules]270-jules had waited patiently for [him]270-jules , though [she]195-mme had other chances ; and finally [they]1116-they had married and [the baby]1117-the baby had been born , and blossomed into one of those finished [little Frenchwomen who , at four or five , seem already to be musing on the great central problems of love and thrift]1118-little frenchwomen who , at four or five , seem already to be musing on the great central problems of love and thrift . [The parents]1119-the parents used to bring [the child]1026-the child to see [Campton]174-campton , and [he]174-campton had made a celebrated sketch of [her]195-mme , in [her]195-mme Sunday bonnet , with little earrings and a wise smile . And [these two]1121-these two , [mother]821-mother and [child]1123-child , had disappeared on the second of August as completely as if [the earth]418-the earth had opened and swallowed [them]1121-these two . As [Campton]174-campton entered [he]174-campton glanced at [[the old woman]483-the old woman ’s den]1126-the old woman ’s den , saw that [it]1126-the old woman ’s den was empty , and said to [himself]174-campton : “ [She]483-the old woman ’s at [St. Cloud]106-st. cloud again . ”[174-campton] For [he]174-campton knew that [she]483-the old woman seized every chance of being with [[her]483-the old woman eldest]1127-her eldest . [He]174-campton unlocked [his]174-campton door and felt [his]174-campton way into [the dark studio]1128-the dark studio . [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme might at least have made up the fire ! [Campton]174-campton lit the lamp , found some wood , and knelt down stiffly by the stove . Really , life was getting too uncomfortable .... [He]174-campton was trying to coax a flame when the door opened and [he]174-campton heard [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme . “ Really , [you]483-the old woman know — — ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton turned to rebuke [her]483-the old woman ; but the words died on [his]174-campton lips . [She]483-the old woman stood before [him]174-campton , taking no notice ; then [her]483-the old woman shapeless black figure doubled up , and [she]483-the old woman sank down into [his]174-campton own armchair . Mme . [Lebel]195-mme , who , even when [he]174-campton offered [her]483-the old woman a seat , never did more than rest respectful knuckles on its back ! “ What ’s the matter ? What ’s wrong ? ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton exclaimed . [She]483-the old woman lifted [her]483-the old woman aged face . “ [Monsieur]3217-monsieur , [I]483-the old woman came about [your]3217-monsieur fire ; but [I]483-the old woman am too unhappy . [I]483-the old woman have more than [I]483-the old woman can bear . ”[483-the old woman] [She]483-the old woman fumbled vainly for a handkerchief , and wiped away [her]483-the old woman tears with the back of [her]483-the old woman old laborious hand . “ [Jules]270-jules has enlisted , [Monsieur]3217-monsieur ; enlisted in [the infantry]3098-the infantry . [He]270-jules has left for the front without telling [me]483-the old woman . ”[483-the old woman] “ [Good Lord]272-good lord . [Enlisted]3220-enlisted ? At [his]270-jules age — is [he]270-jules crazy ? ”[483-the old woman] “ No , [Monsieur]3217-monsieur . But [the little girl]1097-the little girl — [he]270-jules ’s had news — — ”[483-the old woman] [She]483-the old woman waited to steady [her]483-the old woman voice , and then fishing in another slit of [her]483-the old woman multiple skirts , pulled out a letter . “ [I]483-the old woman got that at midday . [I]483-the old woman hurried to [St. Cloud]106-st. cloud — but [he]270-jules left yesterday . ”[483-the old woman] The letter was grim reading . [The poor father]1129-the poor father had accidentally run across [an escaped prisoner who had regained the French lines near [the village where [Mme]195-mme . [Jules]270-jules]1131-the village where mme . jules and [the child]1026-the child were staying . [The man]546-the man , who knew [[the wife]3109-the wife ’s family]1135-the wife ’s family]1130-an escaped prisoner who had regained the french lines near the village where mme . jules and the child were staying . the man , who knew the wife ’s family , had been charged by [them]1135-the wife ’s family with a message to the effect that [Mme]195-mme . [Jules]270-jules , who was [a proud woman]1136-a proud woman , had got into trouble with [the authorities]2932-the authorities , and been sent off to [a German prison]1138-a german prison on the charge of spying . [The poor little girl]1139-the poor little girl had cried and clung to [[her]1139-the poor little girl mother]704-her mother , and had been so savagely pushed aside by [the officer who made the arrest]1141-the officer who made the arrest that [she]1139-the poor little girl had fallen on the stone steps of [the “ Kommandantur ”]3223-the “ kommandantur ”[1142-the fugitive] and fractured [her]1139-the poor little girl skull . [The fugitive]1142-the fugitive reported [her]1139-the poor little girl as still alive , but unconscious , and dying . [Jules Lebel]270-jules had received this news the previous day ; and within twenty - four hours [he]270-jules was at the front . Guard [a bridge at [St. Cloud]106-st. cloud]1109-a bridge at st. cloud after that ? All [he]270-jules asked was to kill and be killed . [He]270-jules knew the name and the regiment of [the officer who had denounced [[his]270-jules wife]516-his wife]1144-the officer who had denounced his wife . “ If [I]270-jules live long enough [I]270-jules shall run the swine down , ”[270-jules] [he]270-jules wrote . “ If not , [I]270-jules ’ll kill as many of [[his]270-jules kind]3224-his kind as [God]266-god lets [me]270-jules . ”[270-jules] Mme . [Lebel]195-mme sat silent , [her]195-mme head bowed on [her]195-mme hands ; and [Campton]174-campton stood and watched [her]195-mme . Presently [she]195-mme got up , passed the back of [her]195-mme hand across [her]195-mme eyes , and said : “ [The room]475-the room is cold . [I]195-mme ’ll fetch some coal . ”[195-mme] [Campton]174-campton protested . “ No , no , [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme . Do n’t worry about [me]195-mme . Make [yourself]195-mme something warm to drink , and try to sleep — — ”[195-mme] “ Oh , [Monsieur]3217-monsieur , thank [God]266-god for the work ! If it were not for that — — ”[195-mme] [she]195-mme said , in the same words as [the physician]415-the physician . [She]195-mme hobbled away , and presently [he]174-campton heard [her]195-mme bumping up again with the coal . When [his]174-campton fire was started , and the curtains drawn , and [she]195-mme had left [him]174-campton , [the painter]540-the painter sat down and looked about [the studio]370-the studio . Bare and untidy as it was , [he]540-the painter did not find the sight unpleasant : [he]540-the painter was used to it , and being used to things seemed to [him]540-the painter the first requisite of comfort . But to - night [his]540-the painter thoughts were elsewhere : [he]540-the painter saw neither the tattered tapestries with [their]1149-their huge heroes and [kings]1150-kings , nor the blotched walls hung with pictures , nor the canvases stacked against the chair - legs , nor the long littered table at which [he]540-the painter wrote and ate and mixed [his]540-the painter colours . At one moment [he]540-the painter was with [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , speeding through the night toward fresh scenes of death ; at another , in [the _ loge _ downstairs]1151-the _ loge _ downstairs , where [Mme . Lebel]195-mme , [her]195-mme day ’s work done , would no doubt sit down as usual by [her]195-mme smoky lamp and go on with [her]195-mme sewing . “ Thank [God]266-god for the work — — ”[1152-they] [they]1152-they had both said . And here [Campton]174-campton sat with idle hands , and did nothing — — It was not exactly [his]174-campton fault . What was there for [a portrait - painter]1153-a portrait - painter to do ? [He]174-campton was not [a portrait - painter]1153-a portrait - painter only , and on [his]540-the painter brief trip to [Chalons]75-chalons some of the scenes by the way — gaunt unshorn faces of [territorials]1155-territorials at [railway bridges]1156-railway bridges , [soldiers]1157-soldiers grouped about [a provision - lorry]1158-a provision - lorry , a mud - splashed company returning to the rear , [a long grey train of “ seventy - fives ”]3227-a long grey train of “ seventy - fives ”[540-the painter] ploughing forward through the rain — at these sights the old graphic instinct had stirred in [him]540-the painter . But the approaches of [the front]1159-the front were sternly forbidden to [civilians]1160-civilians , and especially to [neutrals]1161-neutrals ( [Campton]174-campton was beginning to wince at the word ) ; [he]540-the painter [himself]540-the painter , who had been taken to [Chalons]75-chalons by [a high official of [the Army Medical Board]107-the army medical board]1162-a high official of the army medical board , had been given only time enough for [his]540-the painter interview with [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze , and brought back to [Paris]5-paris the same night . If ever there came a time for art to interpret the war , as [Raffet]273-raffet , for instance , had interpreted [Napoleon]274-napoleon ’s campaigns , the day was not yet ; [the world in which [men]2525-men lived at present]1163-the world in which men lived at present was one in which the word “ art ”[1166-a father] had lost its meaning . And what was [Campton]174-campton , what had [he]174-campton ever been , but [an artist]1165-an artist ? ... [A father]1166-a father ; yes , [he]174-campton had waked up to the practice of that other art , [he]174-campton was learning to be [a father]1166-a father . And now , at a stroke , [his]174-campton only two reasons for living were gone : since the second of August [he]174-campton had had no portraits to paint , [no son to guide and to companion]1168-no son to guide and to companion . [Other people]607-other people , [he]174-campton knew , had found jobs : [most of [[his]174-campton friends]2655-his friends]1170-most of his friends had been drawn into some form of war - work . [Dastrey]220-adele anthony , after vain attempts to enlist , thwarted by [an untimely sciatica]1172-an untimely sciatica , had found a post near the front , on the staff of [a Red Cross Ambulance]1173-a red cross ambulance . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony was working eight or nine hours a day in [a Depot which distributed food and clothing to refugees from [the invaded provinces]1175-the invaded provinces]1174-a depot which distributed food and clothing to refugees from the invaded provinces ; and [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s name figured on the committees of [most of [the newly - organized war charities]1177-the newly - organized war charities]1176-most of the newly - organized war charities . Among [[Campton]174-campton ’s other friends]1178-campton ’s other friends many had accepted humbler tasks . [Some]1179-some devoted [their]1179-some time to listing and packing hospital supplies , keeping accounts in [ambulance offices]1180-ambulance offices , sorting out [refugees]1181-refugees at [the railway - stations]1182-the railway - stations , and telling [them]1181-refugees where to go for food and help ; still [others]644-others spent [their]644-others days , and sometimes [their]644-others nights , at [the bitter - cold suburban sidings where the long train - loads of [wounded]1185-wounded stopped on the way to [the hospitals of the interior]1186-the hospitals of the interior]1184-the bitter - cold suburban sidings where the long train - loads of wounded stopped on the way to the hospitals of the interior . There was enough misery and confusion at the rear for [every civilian volunteer]1187-every civilian volunteer to find [his]1187-every civilian volunteer task . Among [them]1188-them all , [Campton]174-campton could not see [[his]174-campton place]906-his place . [His]174-campton lameness put [him]174-campton at a disadvantage , since [taxicabs]1190-taxicabs were few , and it was difficult for [him]174-campton to travel in [the crowded métro]1191-the crowded métro . [He]174-campton had no head for [figures]1192-figures , and would have thrown the best - kept accounts into confusion ; [he]174-campton could not climb steep stairs to seek out [refugees]1181-refugees , nor should [he]174-campton have known what to say to [them]1181-refugees when [he]174-campton reached [[their]1181-refugees attics]1194-their attics . And so it would have been at [the railway canteens]1195-the railway canteens ; [he]174-campton choked with rage and commiseration at all the suffering about [him]174-campton , but found no word to cheer [the sufferers]1196-the sufferers . [Secretly]275-secretly , too , [he]174-campton feared the demands that would be made on [him]174-campton if [he]174-campton once let [himself]174-campton be drawn into the network of [war charities]1197-war charities . [Tiresome women]1198-tiresome women would come and beg for money , or for pictures for bazaars : [they]1198-tiresome women were already getting up bazaars . Money [he]174-campton could not spare , since it was [his]174-campton duty to save it for [George]175-george ; and as for pictures — why , there were a few sketches [he]174-campton might give , but here again [he]174-campton was checked by [his]174-campton fear of establishing a precedent . [He]174-campton had seen in the papers that [the English painters]1199-the english painters were already giving blank canvases to be sold by auction to [millionaires]1200-millionaires in quest of a portrait . But that form of philanthropy would lead to [his]174-campton having to paint [all the unpaintable people who had been trying to bribe a picture out of [him]174-campton since [his]174-campton sudden celebrity]1201-all the unpaintable people who had been trying to bribe a picture out of him since his sudden celebrity . [No artist]1202-no artist had a right to cheapen [his]1202-no artist art in that way : it could only result in [his]1202-no artist turning out work that would injure [his]1202-no artist reputation and reduce [his]1202-no artist sales after the war . So far , [Campton]174-campton had not been troubled by many appeals for help ; but that was probably because [he]174-campton had kept out of sight , and thrown into the fire the letters of [the few ladies who had begged a sketch for [their]1203-the few ladies who had begged a sketch for their sales sales]1203-the few ladies who had begged a sketch for their sales , or [his]174-campton name for [[their]1203-the few ladies who had begged a sketch for their sales committees]1204-their committees . One appeal , however , [he]174-campton had not been able to avoid . About two months earlier [he]174-campton had had a visit from [[George]175-george ’s friend]988-george ’s friend [Boylston]247-boylston , the youth [he]174-campton had met at [Dastrey]220-adele anthony ’s dinner the night before war was declared . In the interval [he]174-campton had entirely forgotten [Boylston]247-boylston ; but as soon as [he]174-campton saw [the fat brown young man]1206-the fat brown young man with a twinkle in [his]1206-the fat brown young man eyes and [his]1206-the fat brown young man hair , [Campton]174-campton recalled [him]1206-the fat brown young man , and held out a cordial hand . Had not [George]175-george said that [Boylston]247-boylston was [the best fellow [he]174-campton knew]1207-the best fellow he knew ? [Boylston]247-boylston seemed much impressed by the honour of waiting on [the great man]388-the great man . In spite of [his]247-boylston cool twinkling air [he]247-boylston was evidently full of reverence for the things and people [he]247-boylston esteemed , and [Campton]174-campton ’s welcome sent the blood up to the edge of [his]247-boylston tight curls . It also gave [him]247-boylston courage to explain [his]247-boylston visit . [He]247-boylston had come to beg [Campton]174-campton to accept the chairmanship of [the American Committee of “ [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ”[247-boylston] an international group of painters who proposed to raise funds for [the families of [mobilised artists]1211-mobilised artists]1210-the families of mobilised artists]1209-the american committee of “ the friends of french art , ” an international group of painters who proposed to raise funds for the families of mobilised artists . [The American group]1212-the american group would naturally be the most active , since [Americans]276-americans had , in larger numbers than [any other foreigners]1213-any other foreigners , sought artistic training in [France]18-france ; and [all the members]1214-all the members agreed that [Campton]174-campton ’s name must figure at [their]1214-all the members head . But [Campton]174-campton was known to be inaccessible , and [the committee]1215-the committee , aware that [Boylston]247-boylston was [a friend of [George]175-george ’s]964-a friend of george ’s , had asked [him]174-campton to transmit [their]1215-the committee request . “ [You]174-campton see , [sir]2499-sir , [nobody else]3230-nobody else represents .... ”[1215-the committee] [Campton]174-campton thought as seldom as possible of what followed : [he]174-campton hated the part [he]174-campton had played . But , after all , what else could [he]174-campton have done ? Everything in [him]174-campton recoiled from what acceptance would bring with it : publicity , committee meetings , speechifying , writing letters , seeing [troublesome visitors]1217-troublesome visitors , hearing harrowing stories , asking [people]378-people for money — above all , having to give [his]174-campton own ; a great deal of [his]174-campton own . [He]174-campton stood before [the young man]2749-the young man , abject , irresolute , chinking a bunch of keys in [his]2749-the young man trouser - pocket , and remembering afterward that the chink must have sounded as if it were full of money . [He]174-campton remembered too , oddly enough , that as [his]174-campton own embarrassment increased [Boylston]247-boylston ’s vanished . It was as though [the modest youth]1220-the modest youth , taking [[his]1220-the modest youth host]1221-his host ’s measure , had reluctantly found [him]1220-the modest youth wanting , and from that moment had felt less in awe of [his]1220-the modest youth genius . Illogical , of course , and unfair — but there it was . The talk had ended by [Campton]174-campton ’s refusing the chairmanship , but agreeing to let [his]174-campton name figure on the list of [honorary members]1222-honorary members , where [he]174-campton hoped it would be overshadowed by rival glories . And , having reached this conclusion , [he]174-campton had limped to [his]174-campton desk , produced a handful of notes , and after a moment ’s hesitation held out two hundred francs with the stereotyped : “ Sorry [I]174-campton ca n’t make it more .... ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton had meant it to be two hundred and fifty ; but , with [his]174-campton usual luck , all [his]174-campton fumbling had failed to produce a fifty - franc note ; and [he]174-campton could hardly ask [Boylston]247-boylston to “ make the change . ”[2749-the young man] On the threshold [the young man]2749-the young man paused to ask for the last news of [George]175-george ; and on [Campton]174-campton ’s assuring [him]247-boylston that it was excellent , added , with evident sincerity : “ Still hung up on that beastly staff - job ? [I]174-campton do call that hard luck — — ”[174-campton] And now , of all the unpleasant memories of the visit , that phrase kept the sharpest sting . Was it in fact hard luck ? And did [George]175-george [himself]175-george think so ? There was nothing in [his]175-george letters to show it . [He]175-george seemed to have undergone no change of view as to [his]175-george own relation to the war ; [he]175-george had shown no desire to “ be in it , ”[175-george] as [that mad young Upsher]1224-that mad young upsher said . For the first time since [he]174-campton had seen [[George]175-george ’s train]1225-george ’s train pull out of [the Gare de l’Est Campton]1226-the gare de l’est campton found [himself]174-campton wondering at the perfection of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s moral balance . So many things had happened since ; war had turned out to be so immeasurably more hideous and abominable than [those who most abhorred war had dreamed it could be]1228-those who most abhorred war had dreamed it could be ; the issues at stake had become so glaringly plain , right and wrong , honour and dishonour , humanity and savagery faced each other so squarely across [the trenches]3142-the trenches , that it seemed strange to [Campton]174-campton that [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy , so eager , so impressionable , so quick on the uptake , should not have felt some such burst of wrath as had driven even [poor Jules Lebel]270-jules into the conflict . The comparison , of course , was absurd . [Lebel]270-jules had been parted from [[his]270-jules dearest]1231-his dearest , [[his]270-jules wife]516-his wife dragged to [prison]1233-prison , [[his]270-jules child]1234-his child virtually murdered : [any man]1235-any man , in [his]270-jules place , must have felt the blind impulse to kill . But what was [Lebel]270-jules ’s private plight but a symbol of the larger wrong ? This war could no longer be compared to other wars : [Germany]55-germany was conducting it on methods that civilization had made [men]2525-men forget . The occupation of [Luxembourg]41-luxembourg ; the systematic destruction of [Belgium]61-belgium ; the savage treatment of [the people of [the invaded regions]1238-the invaded regions]1237-the people of the invaded regions ; the outrages of [Louvain]76-louvain and [Rheims]77-rheims and [Ypres]84-ypres ; the voice with which [these offences cried to heaven]1239-these offences cried to heaven had waked the indignation of [humanity]1240-humanity . Yet [George]175-george , in daily contact with all this woe and ruin , seemed as unmoved as though [he]175-george had been behind a desk in [the [New York]21-new york office of [Bullard]200-bullard and [Brant]196-mrs. brant]1241-the new york office of bullard and brant . If there were any change in [his]175-george letters it was rather that they were more indifferent . [His]175-george reports of [himself]175-george became drier , more stereotyped , [his]175-george comments on the situation fewer : [he]175-george seemed to have been subdued to the hideous business [he]175-george worked in . It was true that [his]175-george letters had never been expressive : [his]175-george individuality seemed to dry up in contact with pen and paper . It was true also that letters from the front were severely censored , and that it would have been foolish to put in them anything likely to prevent [their]1239-these offences cried to heaven delivery . But [George]175-george had managed to send several notes by hand , and these were as colourless as the others ; and so were [his]175-george letters to [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother , which [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant always sent to [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony , who privately passed them on to [Campton]174-campton . Besides , there were other means of comparison . [People with [sons at the front]1244-sons at the front]1243-people with sons at the front were beginning to hand about copies of [their]1243-people with sons at the front letters ; a few passages , strangely moving and beautiful , had found their way into the papers . [George]175-george , [God]266-god be praised , was not at the front ; but [he]175-george was in [the war - zone]1245-the war - zone , far nearer the sights and sounds of death than [[his]175-george father]580-his father , and [he]175-george had [comrades]1247-comrades and [friends]1248-friends in [the trenches]3142-the trenches . Strange that what [he]175-george wrote was still so cold to the touch .... “ It ’s the scientific mind , [I]174-campton suppose , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton reflected . “ [These youngsters]3231-these youngsters are all rather like beautifully made machines .... ”[174-campton] Yet it had never before struck [him]174-campton that [[his]174-campton son]364-his son was like a beautifully made machine . [He]174-campton remembered that [he]174-campton had not dined , and got up wearily . As [he]174-campton passed out [he]174-campton noticed on a pile of letters and papers a brand - new card : [he]174-campton could always tell the new cards by their whiteness , which twenty - four hours of studio - dust turned to grey . [Campton]174-campton held the card to the light . It was large and glossy , a beautiful thick pre - war card ; and on it was engraved : HARVEY MAYHEW _ Déléguê des Etats Unis au Congrès de la Paix _ with a pen - stroke through the lower line . Beneath was written an imperative “ p.t.o . ”[263-mayhew] ; and reversing the card , [Campton]174-campton read , in an agitated hand : “ Must see [you]416-the boy at once . Call up [Nouveau Luxe]277-nouveau luxe ”[174-campton] ; and , lower down : “ Excuse ridiculous card . Impossible get [others under six weeks]3232-others under six weeks . ”[174-campton] So [Mayhew]263-mayhew had turned up ! Well , it was a good thing : perhaps [he]263-mayhew might bring news of that mad [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher whose doings had caused [Campton]174-campton so much trouble in the early days that [he]174-campton could never recall [the boy]416-the boy ’s obstinate rosy face without a stir of irritation . “ [I]174-campton want to be _ in _ this thing — — ”[174-campton] Well , [young Upsher]259-benny upsher had apparently been in it with a vengeance ; but what [he]259-benny upsher had cost [Campton]174-campton in cables to [[his]174-campton distracted family]1252-his distracted family , and in weary pilgrimages to [the War Office]1253-the war office , [the American Embassy]2799-the american embassy , [the Consulate]1255-the consulate , [the Prefecture of Police]1256-the prefecture of police , and divers other supposed sources of information , [the painter]540-the painter meant some day to tell [[his]174-campton young relative]1258-his young relative in no measured terms . That is , if the chance ever presented itself ; for , since [he]259-benny upsher had left [the studio]370-the studio that morning four months ago , [Benny]259-benny upsher had so completely vanished that [Campton]174-campton sometimes wondered , with a little shiver , if [they]1260-they were ever likely to exchange words again in [this world]1261-this world . “ [Mayhew]263-mayhew will know ; [he]263-mayhew wants to tell [me]174-campton about [the boy]416-the boy , [I]174-campton suppose , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton mused . [Harvey Mayhew]263-mayhew — [Harvey Mayhew]263-mayhew with a pen - stroke through the title which , so short a time since , it had been [his]263-mayhew chief ambition to display on [his]263-mayhew cards ! No wonder it embarrassed [him]263-mayhew now . But where on earth had [he]263-mayhew been all this time ? As [Campton]174-campton pondered on the card a memory flashed out . [Mayhew]263-mayhew ? [Mayhew]263-mayhew ? Why , was n’t it Mayhew who had waylaid [him]174-campton in [the Crillon]28-the crillon a few hours before war was declared , to ask [his]174-campton advice about the safest way of travelling to [the Hague]40-the hague ? And had n’t [he]174-campton , [Campton]174-campton , in all good faith , counselled [him]174-campton to go by [Luxembourg]41-luxembourg “ in order to be out of the way of trouble ”[174-campton] ? The remembrance swept away [the painter]540-the painter ’s sombre thoughts , and [he]174-campton burst into a laugh that woke the echoes of [the studio]370-the studio . [XII]278-xii Not having it in [his]174-campton power to call up [[his]174-campton cousin]3131-his cousin on the telephone , [Campton]174-campton went the next morning to [the Nouveau Luxe]1265-the nouveau luxe . It was the first time that [he]174-campton had entered [the famous hotel]1266-the famous hotel since the beginning of the war ; and at sight of [the long hall]1267-the long hall [his]174-campton heart sank as it used to whenever some untoward necessity forced [him]174-campton to run [its]1267-the long hall deadly blockade . But [the hall]2690-the hall was empty when [he]174-campton entered , empty not only of [the brilliant beings who filled [his]174-campton soul with such dismay , but also of [the porters]1270-the porters , [footmen]1271-footmen and [lift - boys]1272-lift - boys who , even in [its]1267-the long hall unfrequented hours , lent [it]1267-the long hall the lustre of [their]1272-lift - boys liveries]1269-the brilliant beings who filled his soul with such dismay , but also of the porters , footmen and lift - boys who , even in its unfrequented hours , lent it the lustre of their liveries . [A tired concierge]1273-a tired concierge sat at the desk , and near the door [a boy scout]1274-a boy scout , coiling [his]1274-a boy scout bare legs about a high stool , raised [his]1274-a boy scout head languidly from [his]1274-a boy scout book . But for [these two]1121-these two , [the world of [the Nouveau Luxe]1265-the nouveau luxe]1276-the world of the nouveau luxe had disappeared . As [the lift]2703-the lift was not running there was nothing to disturb [their]1121-these two meditations ; and when [Campton]174-campton had learned that [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew would receive [him]174-campton [he]174-campton started alone up [the deserted stairs]1279-the deserted stairs . Only a few dusty trunks remained in [the corridors]1280-the corridors where luggage used to be piled as high as in [the passages of [the great liners]1282-the great liners on sailing - day]1281-the passages of the great liners on sailing - day ; and instead of the murmur of [ladies’-maids]1283-ladies’-maids ’ skirts , and explosions of laughter behind glazed service - doors , the swish of [a charwoman]1284-a charwoman ’s mop alone broke the silence . “ After all , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton thought , “ if war did n’t kill [people]378-people how much pleasanter it might make [the world]2535-the world ! ”[174-campton] This was evidently not the opinion of [Mr. Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , whom [he]174-campton found agitatedly pacing [a large room hung]1285-a large room hung in shrimp - pink brocade , which opened on a vista of turquoise tiling and porcelain tub . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s round countenance , composed of the same simple curves as [[his]212-mr. mayhew nephew]3123-his nephew ’s , had undergone a remarkable change . [He]212-mr. mayhew was still round , but [he]212-mr. mayhew was ravaged . [His]212-mr. mayhew fringe of hair had grown greyer , and there were crow’s - feet about [his]212-mr. mayhew blue eyes , and wrathful corrugations in [his]212-mr. mayhew benignant forehead . [He]212-mr. mayhew seized [Campton]174-campton ’s hands and glared at [him]174-campton through indignant eye - glasses . “ [[My]212-mr. mayhew dear fellow]943-my dear fellow , [I]212-mr. mayhew looked [you]174-campton up as soon as [I]212-mr. mayhew arrived . No verb in the language terrified [him]174-campton as much as that which [[his]174-campton cousin]3131-his cousin had flung at [him]174-campton . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , resting a manicured hand on the edge of a gilt table , looked down awfully on [him]174-campton . “ [I]212-mr. mayhew come , ”[212-mr. mayhew] [he]212-mr. mayhew said , “ from [a German prison]1138-a german prison . ”[212-mr. mayhew] “ Good Lord—_you _ ? ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton gasped . Then [this pink - and - white man who stood there with [his]1292-this pink - and - white man who stood there with his rimless eye - glasses and neatly trimmed hair , and his shining nails reflected in the plate glass of the table - top rimless eye - glasses and neatly trimmed hair , and [his]1292-this pink - and - white man who stood there with his rimless eye - glasses and neatly trimmed hair , and his shining nails reflected in the plate glass of the table - top shining nails reflected in the plate glass of the table - top]1292-this pink - and - white man who stood there with his rimless eye - glasses and neatly trimmed hair , and his shining nails reflected in the plate glass of the table - top , [this perfectly typical , usual sort of harmless rich American]1293-this perfectly typical , usual sort of harmless rich american , had been for four months in the depths of the abyss that [men were beginning to sound with fearful hearts]1294-men were beginning to sound with fearful hearts ! “ It is a simple miracle , ”[212-mr. mayhew] said [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , “ that [I]212-mr. mayhew was not shot as [a spy]3248-a spy . ”[212-mr. mayhew] [Campton]174-campton ’s voice choked in [his]212-mr. mayhew throat . “ Where were [you]212-mr. mayhew imprisoned ? Eventually , however , [Campton]174-campton gathered that after a short sojourn in [America]2-america , where [he]174-campton found opinion too lukewarm for [him]174-campton , [he]174-campton had come back to [Europe]42-europe to collect the experiences of [other victims of German savagery]1296-other victims of german savagery . [Campton]174-campton sat down beside [him]2914-the other . “ How did [you]2914-the other know ? Have [you]2914-the other seen [me]174-campton before ? ”[174-campton] “ Once — at one of [[your]2914-the other exhibitions]3291-your exhibitions . ”[2914-the other] [He]2914-the other paused and drew a hard breath . “ But the first thing was the portrait at [the Luxembourg]1017-the luxembourg ... [[your]2914-the other son]924-your son .... ”[2914-the other] “ Ah , [you]2914-the other look like [him]924-your son ! ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton broke out . The eyes of [the young soldier]1353-the young soldier lit up . “ Do [I]1353-the young soldier ? ... [A nurse]1354-a nurse had slipped in , and [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett signed to [Campton]174-campton to follow [her]1354-a nurse out . [The boy]416-the boy seemed aware that [the painter]540-the painter was going , and interrupted [his]416-the boy enumeration to say : “ As soon as the war ’s over [you]174-campton ’ll let [me]416-the boy come ? ”[416-the boy] “ Of course [I]174-campton will , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton promised . In the passage [he]1353-the young soldier asked : “ Can nothing save [him]1353-the young soldier ? Has everything possible been done ? ”[1353-the young soldier] “ Everything . [We]3302-we ’re all so fond of [him]1353-the young soldier — [the biggest surgeons]3303-the biggest surgeons have seen [him]1353-the young soldier . [He]174-campton had not thought it possible that [he]174-campton would ever feel so kindly toward [her]255-mrs. talkett as at that moment . And then , a second later , [she]255-mrs. talkett nearly spoiled it by saying : “ [Dear Master]3279-dear master — [you]174-campton see the penalty of greatness ! ”[255-mrs. talkett] * * * * * The name of [René Davril]284-rené davril was with [Campton]174-campton all day . [The boy]416-the boy had believed in [him]416-the boy — [his]416-the boy eyes had been opened by the sight of [George]175-george ’s portrait ! And now , in a day or two more , [he]416-the boy would be filling [a three - by - six ditch in [a crowded graveyard]1364-a crowded graveyard]1363-a three - by - six ditch in a crowded graveyard . At twenty — and with eyes like [George]175-george ’s . What could [Campton]174-campton do ? [No one]2702-no one was less visited by happy inspirations ; the “ little acts of kindness ”[2702-no one] recommended to [[his]174-campton pious infancy]1366-his pious infancy had always seemed to [him]174-campton far harder to think of than to perform . But now some instinct carried [him]174-campton straight to the corner of [[his]174-campton studio]536-his studio where [he]174-campton remembered having shoved out of sight a half - finished study for [George]175-george ’s portrait . [He]174-campton found it , examined it critically , scribbled [his]174-campton signature in one corner , and set out with it for [the hospital]1368-the hospital . On the way [he]174-campton had to stop at [the Ministry of War]1369-the ministry of war on [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s tiresome business , and was delayed [there]467-there till too late to proceed with [his]174-campton errand before luncheon . But in the afternoon [he]174-campton passed in again through the revolving plate glass , and sent up [his]174-campton name . [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett was not [there]467-there , but [a nurse]1354-a nurse came down , to whom , with embarrassment , [he]174-campton explained [himself]174-campton . “ [Poor little Davril]284-rené davril ? Yes — [he]284-rené davril ’s still alive . Will [you]1354-a nurse come up ? [[His]284-rené davril family]794-his family are with [him]284-rené davril . ”[1354-a nurse] [Campton]174-campton shook [his]174-campton head and held out the parcel . “ It ’s a picture [he]284-rené davril wanted — — ”[174-campton] [The nurse]1373-the nurse promised it should be given . [She]1373-the nurse looked at [Campton]174-campton with a vague benevolence , having evidently never heard [his]174-campton name ; and [the painter]540-the painter turned away with a cowardly sense that [he]540-the painter ought to have taken the picture up [himself]540-the painter . But to see the death - change on a face so like [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s , and its look reflected in other anguished faces , was more than [he]174-campton could endure . [He]174-campton turned away . The next morning [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett wrote that [René Davril]284-rené davril was better , that the fever had dropped , and that [he]284-rené davril was lying quietly looking at the sketch . “ The only thing that troubles [him]284-rené davril is that [he]284-rené davril realizes now that [you]255-mrs. talkett have not seen [his]284-rené davril pictures . But [he]284-rené davril is very happy , and blesses [you]255-mrs. talkett for [your]255-mrs. talkett goodness . ”[284-rené davril] [His]284-rené davril goodness ! [Campton]174-campton , staring at the letter , could only curse [himself]174-campton for [his]174-campton stupidity . [He]174-campton saw now that the one thing which might have comforted [the poor lad]1376-the poor lad would have been to have [his]174-campton own pictures seen and judged ; and that one thing , [he]174-campton , [Campton]174-campton , so many years vainly athirst for the approbation of [the men [he]174-campton revered]1377-the men he revered — that one thing [he]174-campton had never thought of doing ! The only way of atoning for [his]174-campton negligence was instantly to go out to [the suburb where [[the Davril]284-rené davril family]1379-the davril family lived]1378-the suburb where the davril family lived . [Campton]174-campton , without a scruple , abandoned [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , with whom [he]174-campton had an appointment at [the Embassy]2907-the embassy and another at [the War Office]1253-the war office , and devoted the rest of the day to the expedition . It was after six when [he]174-campton reached [the hospital]1368-the hospital again ; and when [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett came down [he]174-campton went up to [her]255-mrs. talkett impetuously . “ Well — [I’ve]174-campton seen them ; [I]174-campton ’ve seen [his]284-rené davril pictures , and [he]284-rené davril ’s right . They ’re astonishing ! [Awkward]285-awkward , still , and hesitating ; but with such a sense of air and mass . [He]284-rené davril ’ll do things — May [I]174-campton go up and tell [him]284-rené davril ? ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton broke off and looked at [her]255-mrs. talkett . “ [He]284-rené davril died an hour ago . If only [you]174-campton ’d seen them yesterday ! ”[255-mrs. talkett] [she]255-mrs. talkett said . [XIII]286-xiii The killing of [René Davril]284-rené davril seemed to [Campton]174-campton one of the most senseless crimes the war had yet perpetrated . It brought [home]502-home to [him]174-campton , far more vividly than the distant death of [poor [Jean Fortin]287-jean fortin]1384-poor jean fortin , what an incalculable sum of gifts and virtues went to make up [the monster]1385-the monster ’s daily meal . “ Ah , [you]174-campton want genius , do [you]174-campton ? [Mere youth]3313-mere youth ’s not enough ... and health and gaiety and courage ; [you]174-campton want brains in the bud , imagination and poetry , ideas all folded up in [their]1386-the rich vulgarians who will eat only things out of season sheath ! It takes that , does it , to tempt [your]174-campton jaded appetite ? ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton was reminded of [the rich vulgarians who will eat only things out of season]1386-the rich vulgarians who will eat only things out of season . “ That ’s what war is like , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton muttered savagely to [himself]174-campton . The next morning [he]174-campton went to the funeral with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett — between whom and [himself]174-campton the tragic episode had created a sort of improvised intimacy — walking at [her]255-mrs. talkett side through the November rain , behind the poor hearse with the tricolour over it . At [the church]1387-the church , while [the few mourners]1388-the few mourners shivered in [a damp side chapel]1389-a damp side chapel , [he]174-campton had time to study [the family]2768-the family : [a poor sobbing mother]1391-a poor sobbing mother , [two anæmic little girls]1392-two anæmic little girls , and [the lame sister who was musical]1393-the lame sister who was musical — [a piteous group , smelling of poverty and tears]1394-a piteous group , smelling of poverty and tears . Behind [them]2768-the family , to [his]174-campton surprise , [he]174-campton saw the curly brown head and short - sighted eyes of [Boylston]247-boylston . [Campton]174-campton wondered at [the latter]1395-the latter ’s presence ; then [he]174-campton remembered “ [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ”[174-campton] and concluded that [the association]1396-the association had probably been interested in [poor Davril]284-rené davril . With some difficulty [he]174-campton escaped from the thanks of [the mother]1397-the mother and [sisters]747-sisters , and picked up [a taxi]2503-a taxi to take [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett [home]502-home . “ No — back to [the hospital]1368-the hospital , ”[255-mrs. talkett] [she]255-mrs. talkett said . “ A lot of bad cases have come in , and [I]255-mrs. talkett ’m on duty again all day . ”[255-mrs. talkett] [She]255-mrs. talkett spoke as if it were the most natural thing in [the world]2535-the world ; and [he]174-campton shuddered at the serenity with which [women]738-women endure the unendurable . At [the hospital]1368-the hospital [he]174-campton followed [her]255-mrs. talkett in . [The Davril family]1379-the davril family , [she]255-mrs. talkett told [him]174-campton , had insisted that [they]1379-the davril family had no claim on [his]174-campton picture , and that it must be returned to [him]174-campton . [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett went up to fetch it ; and [Campton]174-campton waited in [one of [the drawing - rooms]1406-the drawing - rooms]1405-one of the drawing - rooms .
