[de Dolmetsch]258-de dolmetsch ! ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton cried ; and thought : “ A new face again — what [an artist]1165-an artist ! ”[174-campton] [She]255-mrs. talkett seized [his]174-campton hands . “ [I]255-mrs. talkett heard from [dear Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett that [you]174-campton were [here]2489-here , and [I]255-mrs. talkett ’ve asked [her]255-mrs. talkett to leave [us]3318-us together . ”[255-mrs. talkett] [She]255-mrs. talkett looked at [him]174-campton with ravaged eyes , as if just risen from a penitential vigil . “ Come , please , into [[my]255-mrs. talkett little office]3319-my little office : [you]174-campton did n’t know that [I]255-mrs. talkett was the _ Infirmière - Major _ ? [The room]475-the room was empty , and [Mme]195-mme . [de Dolmetsch]258-de dolmetsch , closing the door , drew [Campton]174-campton to a seat at [her]255-mrs. talkett side . So close to [her]255-mrs. talkett , [he]174-campton saw that the perfect lines of [her]255-mrs. talkett face were flawed by marks of suffering . “ [The woman]3323-the woman really has a heart , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton thought , “ or the war could n’t have made [her]3323-the woman so much handsomer . ”[174-campton] Mme . [de Dolmetsch]258-de dolmetsch leaned closer : a breath of incense floated from [her]255-mrs. talkett conventual draperies . “ [I]255-mrs. talkett know why [you]174-campton came , ”[255-mrs. talkett] [she]255-mrs. talkett continued ; “ [you]174-campton were good to [that poor little Davril]3324-that poor little davril . ”[255-mrs. talkett] [She]255-mrs. talkett clutched [Campton]174-campton suddenly with a blue - veined hand . “ [[My]255-mrs. talkett dear friend]2544-my dear friend , can anything justify such horrors ? That [some senile old beast of [a diplomatist]3328-a diplomatist]3327-some senile old beast of a diplomatist should decree , after a good dinner , that all [we]3329-we love best must be offered up ? ”[255-mrs. talkett] [She]255-mrs. talkett caught [his]174-campton hands again , [her]255-mrs. talkett liturgical scent enveloping [him]174-campton . “ [Campton]174-campton , [I]255-mrs. talkett know [you]174-campton feel as [I]255-mrs. talkett do . ”[255-mrs. talkett] [She]255-mrs. talkett paused , pressing [his]174-campton fingers hard , [her]255-mrs. talkett beautiful mouth trembling . “ For [God]266-god ’s sake tell [me]255-mrs. talkett , ”[255-mrs. talkett] [she]255-mrs. talkett implored , “ how [you]174-campton ’ve managed to keep [[your]174-campton son]924-your son from the front ! ”[255-mrs. talkett] [Campton]174-campton drew away , red and inarticulate . “ [I]174-campton — [[my]174-campton son]856-my son ? Those things depend on [the authorities]2932-the authorities . [[My]174-campton boy]983-my boy ’s health .... ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton stammered . “ Yes , yes ; [I]174-campton know . [[Your]174-campton [George]175-george]3334-your george is delicate . But so is [[my]174-campton [Ladislas]190-ladislas isador]3335-my ladislas — dreadfully . The lungs too . [I]174-campton ’ve trembled for [him]190-ladislas isador for so long ; and now , at any moment .... ”[174-campton] Two tears gathered on [her]1413-her long lashes and rolled down ... “ at any moment [he]190-ladislas isador may be taken from [the War Office]1253-the war office , where [he]190-ladislas isador ’s doing invaluable work , and forced into all that blood and horror ; [he]190-ladislas isador may be brought back to [me]1413-her like [those poor creatures [upstairs]2704-upstairs]3337-those poor creatures upstairs , who are hardly [men]2525-men any longer ... mere vivisected animals , without eyes , without faces . ”[1413-her] [She]1413-her lowered [her]1413-her voice and drew [her]1413-her lids together , so that [her]1413-her very eyes seemed to be whispering . “ [Ladislas]190-ladislas isador has [enemies who are jealous of [him]190-ladislas isador]3340-enemies who are jealous of him ( [I]1413-her could give [you]190-ladislas isador [their]3340-enemies who are jealous of him names ) ; at this moment [someone who ought to be at the front]3341-someone who ought to be at the front is intriguing to turn [him]190-ladislas isador out and get [his]190-ladislas isador place . Everything that was dearest to [him]1414-he , the thought of [George]175-george , the vision of [the lad]1349-the lad dying [upstairs]2704-upstairs , was defiled by this monstrous coupling of [their]1417-their names with that of [the supple middle - aged adventurer safe in [his]1418-the supple middle - aged adventurer safe in his spotless uniform at the war office spotless uniform at [the War Office]113-the war office]1418-the supple middle - aged adventurer safe in his spotless uniform at the war office . And beneath the boiling - up of [Campton]174-campton ’s disgust a new fear lifted its head . How did [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch know about [George]175-george ? And what did [she]179-de dolmetsch know ? Evidently there had been foolish talk somewhere . Perhaps it was [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant — or perhaps [Fortin]287-jean fortin [himself]287-jean fortin . [All these great doctors]1419-all these great doctors forgot the professional secret with [some one woman]1420-some one woman , if not with many . [The painter]540-the painter escaped from [[Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s scented lair]1423-mme . de dolmetsch ’s scented lair , and from the sights and sounds of [the hospital]1368-the hospital , in a state of such perturbation that for a while [he]174-campton stood in [the street]2680-the street wondering where [he]174-campton had meant to go next . [He]174-campton had [his]174-campton own reasons for agreeing to [the Davrils]288-the davrils ’ suggestion that the picture should be returned to [him]174-campton ; and presently these reasons came back . “ [They]288-the davrils ’d never dare to sell it [themselves]288-the davrils ; but why should n’t [I]174-campton sell it for [them]288-the davrils ? ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton had thought , remembering [[their]288-the davrils denuded rooms]1426-their denuded rooms , and the rusty smell of [the women]404-the women ’s mourning . It cost [him]174-campton a pang to part with a study of [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ; but [he]174-campton was in a superstitious and expiatory mood , and eager to act on it . [He]174-campton remembered having been told by [Boylston]247-boylston that “ [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art ”[247-boylston] had [[their]1429-their office]1430-their office in [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal , and [he]174-campton made [his]174-campton way through [the deserted arcades]1432-the deserted arcades to the door of [a once - famous restaurant]1433-a once - famous restaurant . Behind the plate - glass windows [young women with rolled - up sleeves and straw in [their]1434-young women with rolled - up sleeves and straw in their hair hair]1434-young women with rolled - up sleeves and straw in their hair were delving in packing - cases , while , divided from [them]1434-young women with rolled - up sleeves and straw in their hair by an improvised partition , [another group]1435-another group were busy piling on the cloak - room shelves garments such as had never before dishonoured [them]1434-young women with rolled - up sleeves and straw in their hair . [Campton]174-campton stood fascinated by the sight of the things [these young women]1436-these young women were sorting : pink silk combinations , sporting ulsters in glaring black and white checks , straw hats wreathed with last summer ’s sunburnt flowers , high - heeled satin shoes split on the instep , and fringed and bugled garments that suggested obsolete names like “ [dolman ”[247-boylston] and “ mantle , ”]3344-dolman ” and “ mantle , ”[247-boylston] and looked like the costumes dug out of [a country - house attic]1437-a country - house attic by [amateurs preparing to play “ Caste]3345-amateurs preparing to play “ caste . ”[247-boylston] Was it possible that “ [The Friends of French Art ”]3346-the friends of french art ”[247-boylston] proposed to clothe [the families of [fallen artists]1439-fallen artists]1438-the families of fallen artists in [these prehistoric properties]1440-these prehistoric properties ? [Beausite]176-beausite .... [You]174-campton did n’t recognize [her]1448-a handsomely dressed elderly lady with a long emaciated face and red eyes ? Poor thing ! [[Her]1448-a handsomely dressed elderly lady with a long emaciated face and red eyes youngest boy]3348-her youngest boy is blind : [his]3348-her youngest boy eyes were put out by a shell . [Beausite]176-beausite ? Oh no , [we]3349-we never see _ [him]176-beausite _ . [He]176-beausite ’s only [[our]3349-we Honorary President]3350-our honorary president . ”[247-boylston] [Boylston]247-boylston obviously spoke without afterthought ; but [Campton]174-campton felt the sting . [He]174-campton too was on [the honorary committee]1451-the honorary committee . “ [Poor woman]3351-poor woman ! What ? [The young fellow who did Cubist things]3352-the young fellow who did cubist things ? [I]174-campton had n’t heard .... ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton remembered the cruel rumour that [Beausite]176-beausite , when [his]176-beausite glory began to wane , had encouraged [[his]176-beausite three sons]1452-his three sons in three different lines of art , so that there might always be [a Beausite]1453-a beausite in the fashion .... “ [You]2749-the young man must have to listen to pretty ghastly stories here , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said . [The young man]2749-the young man nodded , and [Campton]174-campton , with less embarrassment than [he]174-campton had expected , set forth [his]174-campton errand . In that atmosphere it seemed natural to be planning ways of relieving misery , and [Boylston]247-boylston at once put [him]2749-the young man at [his]174-campton ease by looking pleased but not surprised . “ [You]247-boylston mean to sell the sketch , [sir]2499-sir ? That will put [the Davrils]288-the davrils out of anxiety for a long time ; and [they]288-the davrils ’re in a bad way , as [you]2499-sir saw . ”[247-boylston] [Boylston]247-boylston undid the parcel , with a respectful : “ May [I]247-boylston ? ”[247-boylston] and put the canvas on a chair . [He]247-boylston gazed at it for a few moments , the blood rising sensitively over [his]247-boylston face till it reached [his]247-boylston tight ridge of hair . [Campton]174-campton remembered what [George]175-george had said of [[his]175-george friend]444-his friend ’s silent admirations ; [he]174-campton was glad [the young man]2749-the young man did not speak . When [he]174-campton did , it was to say with a businesslike accent : “ [We]3354-we ’re trying to get up an auction of pictures and sketches — and if [we]3354-we could lead off with this .... ”[174-campton] It was [Campton]174-campton ’s turn to redden . The possibility was one [he]174-campton had not thought of . If the picture were sold at auction , [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant would be sure to buy it ! But [he]174-campton could not say this to [Boylston]247-boylston . [He]174-campton hesitated , and the other , who seemed quick at feeling [his]247-boylston way , added at once : “ But perhaps [you]247-boylston ’d rather sell it privately ? In that case [we]3354-we should get the money sooner . ”[174-campton] It was just the right thing to say : and [Campton]174-campton thanked [him]174-campton and picked up [his]174-campton sketch . At the door [he]174-campton hesitated , feeling that it became a member of [the honorary committee]1451-the honorary committee to add something more . “ How are [you]247-boylston getting on ? Getting all the help [you]247-boylston need ? ”[247-boylston] [Boylston]247-boylston smiled . “ [We]3354-we need such a lot . [People]378-people have been very generous : [we]3354-we ’ve had several big sums . But look at those ridiculous clothes [downstairs]2942-downstairs — [we]3354-we get boxes and boxes of such rubbish ! And there are so many applicants , and such hard cases . Take those poor [Davrils]288-the davrils , for instance . [The lame Davril girl]3357-the lame davril girl has a talent for music : plays the violin . Well , what good does it do [her]3357-the lame davril girl now ? [The artists]3358-the artists are having an awful time . If this war goes on much longer , it wo n’t be only at the front that [they]3358-the artists ’ll die . ”[247-boylston] “ Ah — — ”[174-campton] said [Campton]174-campton . “ Well , [I]174-campton ’ll take this to [a dealer]3359-a dealer — — ”[174-campton] On the way down [he]174-campton turned in to greet [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony . [She]221-miss anthony looked up in surprise , [her]221-miss anthony tired face haloed in tumbling hairpins ; but [she]221-miss anthony was too busy to do more than nod across [the group]2772-the group about [her]221-miss anthony desk . At [his]174-campton offer to take [her]221-miss anthony [home]502-home [she]221-miss anthony shook [her]221-miss anthony head . “ [I]221-miss anthony ’m [here]2489-here till after seven . [Mr. Boylston]247-boylston and [I]221-miss anthony are nearly snowed under . [We]3361-we ’ve got to go down presently and help unpack ; and after that [I]221-miss anthony ’m due at [[my]221-miss anthony refugee canteen]3362-my refugee canteen at [the Nord]3363-the nord . It ’s [my]221-miss anthony night shift . ”[221-miss anthony] [Campton]174-campton , on the way back to [Montmartre]1-montmartre , fell to wondering if such excesses of altruism were necessary , or a mere vain overflow of energy . [He]174-campton was terrified by [his]174-campton first close glimpse of the ravages of war , and the efforts of the little band struggling to heal [them]1460-them seemed pitifully ineffectual . No doubt [they]1460-them did good here and there , made a few lives less intolerable ; but how [the insatiable monster]1461-the insatiable monster must laugh at [them]1460-them as [he]1461-the insatiable monster spread [his]1461-the insatiable monster red havoc wider ! On reaching [home]502-home , [Campton]174-campton forgot everything at sight of a letter from [George]175-george . [He]174-campton had not had one for two weeks , and this interruption , just as the military mails were growing more regular , had made [him]174-campton anxious . But it was the usual letter : brief , cheerful , inexpressive . Apparently there was no change in [George]175-george ’s situation , nor any wish on [his]175-george part that there should be . [He]174-campton grumbled humorously at the dulness of [his]174-campton work and the monotony of life in [a war - zone town]1463-a war - zone town ; and wondered whether , if this sort of thing went on , there might not soon be some talk of leave . And just at the end of [his]174-campton affectionate and unsatisfactory two pages , [Campton]174-campton lit on a name that roused [him]174-campton . “ [I]174-campton saw [a fellow who ’d seen [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher]3364-a fellow who ’d seen benny upsher yesterday on [his]3364-a fellow who ’d seen benny upsher way to the English front . [The young lunatic]3365-the young lunatic looked very fit . [You]3366-you know [he]3365-the young lunatic volunteered in [the English army]3367-the english army when [he]3365-the young lunatic found [he]3365-the young lunatic could n’t get into [the French]208-the french . [He]3365-the young lunatic ’s likely to get all the fighting [he]3365-the young lunatic wants . ”[174-campton] It was a relief to know that [someone]3282-someone had seen [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher lately . The letter was but four days old , and [he]259-benny upsher was then on [his]259-benny upsher way to the front . Probably [he]259-benny upsher was not yet in the fighting [he]259-benny upsher wanted , and [one]398-one could , without remorse , call up an unmutilated face and clear blue eyes . [Campton]174-campton , re - reading the postscript , was struck by a small thing . [George]175-george had originally written : “ [I]175-george saw [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher yesterday , ”[175-george] and had then altered the phrase to : “ [I]175-george saw [a fellow who ’d seen [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher]3364-a fellow who ’d seen benny upsher . ”[175-george] There was nothing out of the way in that : it simply showed that [he]175-george had written in haste and revised the sentence . But [he]175-george added : “ [The young lunatic]3365-the young lunatic looked very fit . ”[175-george] Well : that too was natural . [It]1466-it was “ [the fellow ”]3370-the fellow ”[1466-it] who reported [Benny]259-benny upsher as looking fit ; the phrase was rather elliptic , but [Campton]174-campton could hardly have said why it gave [him]174-campton the impression that it was [George]175-george [himself]175-george who had seen [Upsher]259-benny upsher . The idea was manifestly absurd , since there was the length of the front between [[George]175-george ’s staff - town]175-george and [the fiery pit]1467-the fiery pit yawning for [[his]175-george cousin]3131-his cousin . [Campton]174-campton laid aside the letter with the distinct wish that [[his]174-campton son]364-his son had not called [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher [a young lunatic]1470-a young lunatic . XIV When [Campton]174-campton took [his]174-campton sketch of [George]175-george to [Léonce Black]289-léonce black , [the dealer who specialized in “ [Camptons]224-the camptons]3371-the dealer who specialized in “ camptons , ”[289-léonce black] [he]174-campton was surprised at the magnitude of the sum which [the great picture - broker]1471-the great picture - broker , lounging in a glossy War Office uniform among [his]1471-the great picture - broker Gauguins and Vuillards , immediately offered . [Léonce Black]289-léonce black noted [his]174-campton surprise and smiled . “ [You]174-campton think there ’s nothing doing nowadays ? Do n’t [you]174-campton believe it , [Mr. Campton]174-campton . Now that [the big men]3372-the big men have stopped painting , [the collectors]3373-the collectors are all the keener to snap up what ’s left in [their]3373-the collectors portfolios . ”[289-léonce black] [He]289-léonce black placed the cheque in [Campton]174-campton ’s hand , and drew back to study the effect of the sketch , which [he]289-léonce black had slipped into a frame against a velvet curtain . “ Ah — — ”[289-léonce black] [he]289-léonce black said , as if [he]289-léonce black were tasting an old wine . Well , [you]174-campton ’re likely to have [a good many more calls of the same sort]3374-a good many more calls of the same sort before [we]3375-we get this war over , ”[1472-the dealer] [the dealer]1472-the dealer remarked philosophically . “ Anyhow , remember [I]1472-the dealer can place anything [you]174-campton ’ll give [me]1472-the dealer . When [people]378-people want [a Campton]3377-a campton it ’s to [me]1472-the dealer [they]378-people come . [I]1472-the dealer ’ve got standing orders from [two clients]3378-two clients ... both given before the war , and both good to - day . ”[1472-the dealer] [Campton]174-campton paused in the doorway , seized by [his]174-campton old fear of the painting ’s passing into [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s possession . “ Look here : where is this one going ? ”[1472-the dealer] [The dealer]1472-the dealer cocked [his]1472-the dealer handsome grey head and glanced archly through plump eyelids . “ Violation of professional secrecy ? Well .... Well ... under constraint [I]1472-the dealer ’ll confess it ’s to [a young lady]3379-a young lady : great admirer , [artist]3380-artist [herself]3379-a young lady . Been on the lookout ever since . ”[1472-the dealer] “ Oh , all right , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton answered , repocketing the money . [He]174-campton set out at once for “ [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ”[1472-the dealer] and [Léonce Black]289-léonce black , bound for [the Ministry of War]57-the ministry of war , walked by [his]174-campton side , regaling [him]174-campton alternately with the gossip of [the Ministry]899-the ministry and with racy anecdotes of [the dealers]1476-the dealers ’ world . In M. [Black]289-léonce black ’s opinion the war was an inexcusable blunder , since [Germany]55-germany was getting to be the best market for [the kind of freak painters out of whom [the dealers who “ know how to make [a man ‘ foam ’ ”]3382-a man ‘ foam ’ ”[1472-the dealer] can make a big turn over]1478-the dealers who “ know how to make a man ‘ foam ’ ” can make a big turn over]1477-the kind of freak painters out of whom the dealers who “ know how to make a man ‘ foam ’ ” can make a big turn over . “ [I]1472-the dealer do n’t know what [on earth]3383-on earth will become of all those poor devils now : [Paris]5-paris cared for [them]3384-them only because [she]3385-she knew [Germany]55-germany would give any money for [their]3384-them things . Personally , as [you]3386-you know , [I]1472-the dealer ’ve always preferred sounder goods : [I]1472-the dealer ’m a classic , [[my]1472-the dealer dear]2497-my dear [Campton]174-campton , and [I]1472-the dealer can feel only classic art , ”[1472-the dealer] said [the dealer]1472-the dealer , swelling out [his]1472-the dealer uniformed breast and stroking [his]1472-the dealer Assyrian nose as though its handsome curve followed the pure Delphic line . “ But , as long as things go on as they are at present in _ [[my]1472-the dealer _ department of [the administration]3389-the administration]3388-my _ department of the administration , the war ’s not going to end in a hurry , ”[1472-the dealer] [he]1472-the dealer continued . “ And now [we]3390-we ’re in for it , [we]3390-we ’ve got to see the thing through . ”[1472-the dealer] [Campton]174-campton found [Boylston]247-boylston , as usual , in [[his]247-boylston melancholy _ cabinet particulier _]1480-his melancholy _ cabinet particulier _ . [He]247-boylston was listening to the tale of [a young woman with streaming eyes and an extravagant hat]1481-a young woman with streaming eyes and an extravagant hat . [He]247-boylston was as much interested in the suppliant ’s tale as in watching [Boylston]247-boylston ’s way of listening . [That modest and commonplace - looking young man]1483-that modest and commonplace - looking young man was beginning to excite a lively curiosity in [Campton]174-campton . It was not only that [he]247-boylston remembered [George]175-george ’s commendation , for [he]247-boylston knew that the generous enthusiasms of youth may be inspired by trifles imperceptible to [the older]1484-the older . It was [Boylston]247-boylston [himself]247-boylston who interested [the painter]540-the painter . [He]247-boylston knew no more of [the young man]2749-the young man than the scant details [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony could give . [Boylston]247-boylston , it appeared , was the oldest hope of [a well - to - do Connecticut family]1487-a well - to - do connecticut family . On [his]247-boylston leaving college a place had been reserved for [him]247-boylston in the paternal business ; but [he]247-boylston had announced good - humouredly that [he]247-boylston did not mean to spend [his]247-boylston life in [an office]1488-an office , and one day , after a ten minutes ’ conversation with [[his]247-boylston father]580-his father , as to which details were lacking , [he]247-boylston had packed a suitcase and sailed for [France]18-france . There [he]247-boylston had lived ever since , in [shabby rooms in [the rue de Verneuil]1491-the rue de verneuil]1490-shabby rooms in the rue de verneuil , on the scant allowance remitted by [an irate parent]1492-an irate parent : apparently never running into debt , yet always ready to help [a friend]1493-a friend . [All the American art - students]1494-all the american art - students in [Paris]5-paris knew [Boylston]247-boylston ; and though [he]247-boylston was still in the early thirties , [they]1494-all the american art - students all looked up to [him]247-boylston . For [Boylston]247-boylston had one quality which always impresses [youth]1495-youth : [Boylston]247-boylston knew [everybody]3070-everybody . Whether [you]1497-you went with [him]247-boylston to [a smart restaurant in [the rue Royale]2675-the rue royale]1498-a smart restaurant in the rue royale , or to [a wine - shop of the Left Bank]1500-a wine - shop of the left bank , [the _ patron]1501-the _ patron _ welcomed [him]247-boylston with the same cordiality , and sent the same emphatic instructions to [the cook]1502-the cook . The first fresh peas and the tenderest spring chicken were always for [this quiet youth , who , when [he]247-boylston was alone , dined cheerfully on veal and _ vin ordinaire _]1503-this quiet youth , who , when he was alone , dined cheerfully on veal and _ vin ordinaire _ . If [you]1497-you wanted to know where to get the best [Burgundy]291-burgundy , [Boylston]247-boylston could tell [you]1497-you ; [he]247-boylston could also tell [you]1497-you where to buy an engagement ring for [[your]1497-you girl]1504-your girl , a Ford runabout going at half - price , or the _ papier timbré _ on which to address a summons to [a recalcitrant laundress]1505-a recalcitrant laundress . If [you]1497-you got into a row with [[your]1497-you landlady]1506-your landlady [you]1497-you found that [Boylston]247-boylston knew [her]1506-your landlady , and that at sight of [him]247-boylston [she]1506-your landlady melted and withdrew [her]1506-your landlady claim ; or , failing this , [he]247-boylston knew [the solicitor in whose office [[her]1506-your landlady son]3034-her son]1507-the solicitor in whose office her son was [a clerk]1509-a clerk , or had other means of reducing [her]1506-your landlady to reason . [Boylston]247-boylston also knew [a man who could make old clocks go , another who could clean flannels without [their]1511-their shrinking , and a third who could get [you]1497-you old picture - frames for a song]1510-a man who could make old clocks go , another who could clean flannels without their shrinking , and a third who could get you old picture - frames for a song ; and , best of all , when [any inexperienced American youth]1512-any inexperienced american youth was caught in the dark [Parisian]117-parisian cobweb ( and [the people at [home]502-home]1513-the people at home were on no account to hear about it ) [Boylston]247-boylston was found to be [the friend and familiar of [certain occult authorities who , with a smile and a word of warning , could break the mesh and free]1516-certain occult authorities who , with a smile and a word of warning , could break the mesh and free [the victim]1517-the victim]1515-the friend and familiar of certain occult authorities who , with a smile and a word of warning , could break the mesh and free the victim . The mystery was , how and why all [these people]2877-these people did what [Boylston]247-boylston wanted ; but the reason began to dawn on [Campton]174-campton as [he]247-boylston watched [the young woman in the foolish hat deliver [herself]1519-the young woman in the foolish hat deliver herself of her grievance of [her]1519-the young woman in the foolish hat deliver herself of her grievance grievance]1519-the young woman in the foolish hat deliver herself of her grievance . [Boylston]247-boylston was simply [a perfect listener]1520-a perfect listener — and most of [his]247-boylston life was spent in listening . Everything about [him]247-boylston listened : [his]247-boylston round forehead and peering screwed - up eyes , [his]247-boylston lips twitching responsively under the close - clipped moustache , and every crease and dimple of [his]247-boylston sagacious and humorous young countenance ; even the attitude of [his]247-boylston short fat body , with elbows comfortably bedded in heaped up papers , and fingers plunged into [his]247-boylston crinkled hair . There was never a hint of hurry or impatience about [him]247-boylston : having once asserted [his]247-boylston right to do what [he]247-boylston liked with [his]247-boylston life , [he]247-boylston was apparently content to let all [[his]247-boylston friends]2655-his friends prey on it . [You]1522-you never caught [his]247-boylston eye on the clock , or [his]247-boylston lips shaping an answer before [you]1522-you had turned the last corner of [your]1522-you story . Yet when the story was told , and [he]247-boylston had surveyed it in all its bearings , [you]1522-you could be sure [he]247-boylston would do what [he]247-boylston could for [you]1522-you , and do it before the day was over . “ Very well , [Mademoiselle]292-mademoiselle , ”[247-boylston] [he]247-boylston said , when [the young woman]1523-the young woman had finished . “ [I]247-boylston promise [you]1523-the young woman [I]247-boylston ’ll see [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite , and try to get [her]1523-the young woman to recognize [your]1523-the young woman claim . ”[247-boylston] “ Mind [you]1523-the young woman , [I]2938-the young lady do n’t ask [charity]3391-charity — [I]2938-the young lady wo n’t _ take _ charity from [[your]1523-the young woman committee]3392-your committee ! ”[2938-the young lady] [the young lady]2938-the young lady hissed , gathering up a tawdry hand - bag . “ Oh , [we]3393-we ’re not forcing it on [any one]3083-any one , ”[247-boylston] smiled [Boylston]247-boylston , opening the door for [her]1523-the young woman . When [he]247-boylston turned back to [Campton]174-campton [his]247-boylston face was flushed and frowning . “ [Poor thing]3395-poor thing ! [She]3395-poor thing ’s a nuisance , but [I]247-boylston ’ll fight to the last ditch for [her]3395-poor thing . [The chap [she]3395-poor thing lives with]3396-the chap she lives with was [[Beausite]176-beausite ’s secretary]3397-beausite ’s secretary and understudy , and devilled for [him]176-beausite before the war . [The poor fellow]3398-the poor fellow has come back from the front a complete wreck , and ca n’t even collect the salary [Beausite]176-beausite owes [him]176-beausite for the last three months before the war . [Beausite]176-beausite ’s plea is that [he]176-beausite ’s too poor , and that the war lets [him]176-beausite out of paying . Of course [he]176-beausite counts on [our]3399-our doing it for [him]176-beausite . ”[247-boylston] “ And [you]247-boylston ’re not going to ? ”[247-boylston] “ Well , ”[247-boylston] said [Boylston]247-boylston humorously , “ [I]247-boylston should n’t wonder if [he]176-beausite beat [us]3399-our in the long run . But [I]247-boylston ’ll have a try first ; and anyhow [the poor girl]3400-the poor girl need n’t know . [She]3400-the poor girl used to earn a little money doing fashion - articles , but of course there ’s no market for that now , and [I]247-boylston do n’t see how [the pair]3401-the pair can live . [They]3401-the pair have [a little boy]3402-a little boy , and there ’s [an infirm mother]3403-an infirm mother , and [they]3401-the pair ’re waiting to get married till [the girl]774-the girl can find a job . ”[247-boylston] “ [Good Lord]3405-good lord ! ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton groaned , with a sudden vision of [the countless little trades and traffics arrested by the war]1525-the countless little trades and traffics arrested by the war , and [all the industrious thousands reduced to querulous pauperism or slow death]1526-all the industrious thousands reduced to querulous pauperism or slow death . “ How _ do _ [they]3401-the pair live — [all these people]3406-all these people ? ”[247-boylston] “ [They]3401-the pair don’t — always . [I]247-boylston could tell [you]174-campton — — ”[247-boylston] “ Do n’t , for God ’s sake ; [I]174-campton ca n’t stand it . ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton drew out the cheque . “ Here : this is what [I]174-campton ’ve got for [the Davrils]288-the davrils . ”[174-campton] “ [Good Lord]272-good lord ! ”[247-boylston] said [Boylston]247-boylston , staring with round eyes . “ It will pull [them]3401-the pair through , anyhow , wo n’t it ? ”[247-boylston] [Campton]174-campton triumphed . “ Well — — ”[247-boylston] said [Boylston]247-boylston . “ It will if [you]174-campton ’ll endorse it , ”[247-boylston] [he]247-boylston added , smiling . [Campton]174-campton laughed and took up a pen . * * * * * A day or two later [Campton]174-campton , returning [home]502-home one afternoon , overtook [a small black - veiled figure with a limp like [his]174-campton own]1528-a small black - veiled figure with a limp like his own . [He]174-campton guessed at once that it was [the lame Davril girl]3357-the lame davril girl , come to thank [him]174-campton ; and [his]174-campton dislike of such ceremonies caused [him]174-campton to glance about for a way of escape . But as [he]174-campton did so [the girl]774-the girl turned with a smile that put [him]174-campton to shame . [He]174-campton remembered [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ’s saying , one day when [he]174-campton had found [her]774-the girl in [[her]774-the girl refugee office]1531-her refugee office patiently undergoing a like ordeal : “ [We]3407-we ’ve no right to refuse the only coin [they]208-the french can repay [us]3407-we in . ”[220-adele anthony] [The Davril girl]1532-the davril girl was a plain likeness of [[her]1532-the davril girl brother]1533-her brother , with the same hungry flame in [her]1532-the davril girl eyes . [She]1532-the davril girl wore the nondescript black that [Campton]174-campton had remarked at the funeral ; and knowing the importance which [the French]208-the french attach to every detail of conventional mourning , [he]174-campton wondered that [mother]821-mother and [daughter]1535-daughter had not laid out part of [his]174-campton gift in crape . If [the Davrils]288-the davrils were as proud as all that it was not worth while to have sold a sketch it had cost [him]540-the painter such a pang to part with . [He]540-the painter felt the exasperation of the would be philanthropist when [he]540-the painter first discovers that nothing complicates life as much as doing good . “ But , [Mademoiselle]292-mademoiselle — — ”[540-the painter] “ This money is not [ours]3409-we . The value of [Campton]174-campton ’s gift , [Mlle]294-mlle . davril . At any rate , it would mean work and not stagnation ; which is all that most charity produces . ”[1558-this clear - toned young woman] [She]1558-this clear - toned young woman developed [her]1558-this clear - toned young woman plan : for [the musicians]1559-the musicians , concerts in [private houses]1560-private houses ( hence [her]1558-this clear - toned young woman glance at the piano ) ; for [the painters]3415-the painters , small exhibitions in [the rooms of [the committee]1215-the committee]1562-the rooms of the committee , where [their]3415-the painters pictures would be sold with the deduction of a percentage , to be returned to [the general fund]1564-the general fund ; and for [the writers]1565-the writers — well , [their]1565-the writers lot was perhaps the hardest to deal with ; but an [employment agency]1566-employment agency might be opened , where [those who chose]1567-those who chose could put [their]1567-those who chose names down and take such work as was offered . Above all , [Mlle]294-mlle . davril . [Davril]294-mlle . davril again insisted , the fund created by [Campton]174-campton ’s gift was to be spent only in giving employment , not for mere relief . [Campton]174-campton listened with growing attention . Nothing hitherto had been less in the line of [his]174-campton interests than the large schemes of general amelioration which were coming to be classed under the transatlantic term of “ Social Welfare . ”[174-campton] If questioned on the subject a few months earlier [he]174-campton would probably have concealed [his]174-campton fundamental indifference under the profession of an extreme individualism , and the assertion of [every man]855-every man ’s right to suffer and starve in [his]855-every man own way . Even since [René Davril]284-rené davril ’s death had brought home to [him]174-campton the boundless havoc of the war , [he]174-campton had felt no more than the impulse to ease [his]174-campton own pain by putting [his]174-campton hand in [his]174-campton pocket when a particular case was too poignant to be ignored . Yet here were people who had already offered [their]1567-those who chose dearest to [France]18-france , and were now pleading to be allowed to give all the rest ; and who had had the courage and wisdom to think out in advance the form in which [their]1567-those who chose gift would do most good . [Campton]174-campton had the awe of [the unpractical man]1569-the unpractical man for anyone who knows how to apply [his]174-campton ideas . [He]174-campton felt that there was no use in disputing [Mlle]294-mlle . davril . [Davril]294-mlle . davril ’s plan : [he]174-campton must either agree to it or repocket [his]174-campton cheque . “ [I]174-campton ’ll do as [you]294-mlle . davril want , of course ; but [I]174-campton ’m not much good about details . Had n’t [you]294-mlle . davril better consult [some one else]3427-some one else ? ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton suggested . Oh , that was already done : [she]294-mlle . davril had outlined [her]294-mlle . davril project to [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [Mr. Boylston]247-boylston , who approved . All [she]294-mlle . davril wanted was [Campton]174-campton ’s consent ; and this [he]174-campton gave the more cordially when [he]174-campton learned that , for the present at least , nothing more was expected of [him]174-campton . First steps in beneficence , [he]174-campton felt , were unspeakably terrifying ; yet [he]174-campton was already aware that , resist as [he]174-campton might , [he]174-campton would never be able to keep [his]174-campton footing on the brink of [that abyss]1570-that abyss . Into it , as the days went by , [his]174-campton gaze was oftener and oftener plunged . [He]174-campton had begun to feel that pity was [his]174-campton only remaining link with [[his]174-campton kind]3224-his kind , the one barrier between [himself]174-campton and the dreadful solitude which awaited [him]174-campton when [he]174-campton returned to [[his]174-campton studio]536-his studio . What would there have been to think of [there]467-there , alone among [his]174-campton unfinished pictures and [his]174-campton broken memories , if not the wants and woes of [[people]378-people more bereft than [himself]174-campton]1575-people more bereft than himself ? [His]174-campton own future was not a thing to dwell on . [George]175-george was safe : but what [George]175-george and [he]175-george were likely to make of [each other]443-each other after the ordeal was over was a question [he]174-campton preferred to put aside . [He]174-campton was more and more taking [George]175-george and [his]175-george safety for granted , as a solid standing - ground from which to reach out a hand to [the thousands struggling in the depths]1577-the thousands struggling in the depths . As long as [the world]2535-the world ’s fate was in the balance it was [every man]855-every man ’s duty to throw into that balance [his]855-every man last ounce of brain and muscle . [Campton]174-campton wondered how [he]174-campton had ever thought that an accident of birth , a remoteness merely geographical , could justify , or even make possible , an attitude of moral aloofness . [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s reasons for wishing to annihilate [Germany]55-germany began to seem less grotesque than [his]174-campton own for standing aside . In the heat of [his]174-campton conversion [he]174-campton no longer grudged the hours given to [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew . [He]174-campton patiently led [[his]174-campton truculent relative]1580-his truculent relative from [one government office]1581-one government office to another , everywhere laying stress on [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s sympathy with [France]18-france and [his]174-campton desire to advocate [her]18-france cause in [the United States]119-the united states , and trying to curtail [his]174-campton enumeration of [his]174-campton grievances by a glance at the clock , and the reminder that [they]1582-they had [another Minister to see]1583-another minister to see . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew was not very manageable . [His]212-mr. mayhew adventure had grown with repetition , and [he]212-mr. mayhew was increasingly disposed to feel that the retaliation [he]212-mr. mayhew called down on [Germany]55-germany could best be justified by telling [every one]832-every one what [he]212-mr. mayhew had suffered from [her]18-france . Intensely aware of the value of time in [Utica]39-utica , [he]212-mr. mayhew was less sensible of it in [Paris]5-paris , and seemed to think that , since [he]212-mr. mayhew had left a flourishing business to preach the Holy War , [other people]607-other people ought to leave [their]607-other people affairs to give [him]212-mr. mayhew a hearing . But [his]212-mr. mayhew zeal and persistence were irresistible , and doors which [Campton]174-campton had seen barred against the most reasonable appeals flew open at the sound of [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s trumpet . [His]212-mr. mayhew pink face and silvery hair gave [him]212-mr. mayhew an apostolic air , and circles to which [America]2-america had hitherto been a mere speck in space suddenly discovered that [he]212-mr. mayhew represented that legendary character , [the Typical American]1586-the typical american . [The keen Boylston]247-boylston , prompt to note and utilize the fact , urged [Campton]174-campton to interest [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew in “ [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ”[247-boylston] and with considerable flourish [the former Peace Delegate]1587-the former peace delegate was produced at a committee meeting and given [his]212-mr. mayhew head . But [his]212-mr. mayhew interest flagged when [he]212-mr. mayhew found that [the “ Friends ”]3429-the “ friends ”[212-mr. mayhew] concerned [themselves]1588-their with Atrocities only in so far as any act of war is one , and that [their]1588-their immediate task was the humdrum one of feeding and clothing [the families of [the combatants]1590-the combatants]1589-the families of the combatants and sending “ comforts ”[1592-the treasurer] to [the trenches]3142-the trenches . [He]212-mr. mayhew served up , with a somewhat dog - eared eloquence , the usual account of [his]212-mr. mayhew own experiences , and pressed a modest gift upon [the treasurer]1592-the treasurer ; but when [he]212-mr. mayhew departed , after wringing [everybody]3070-everybody ’s hands , and leaving [the French members]1594-the french members bedewed with emotion , [Campton]174-campton had the conviction that [their]1588-their quiet weekly meetings would not often be fluttered by [his]174-campton presence . [Campton]174-campton was spending an increasing amount of time in [the Palais Royal restaurant]1595-the palais royal restaurant , where [he]174-campton performed any drudgery for which no initiative was required . Once or twice , when [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony was submerged by a fresh influx of [refugees]1181-refugees , [he]174-campton lent [her]221-miss anthony a hand too ; and on most days [he]174-campton dropped in late at [[her]221-miss anthony office]1597-her office , waited for [her]221-miss anthony to sift and dismiss the last applicants , and saw [her]221-miss anthony [home]502-home through the incessant rain . It interested [him]174-campton to note that the altruism [she]221-miss anthony had so long wasted on [pampered friends]1599-pampered friends was developing into [a wise and orderly beneficence]1600-a wise and orderly beneficence . [He]174-campton had always thought of [her]221-miss anthony as [an eternal schoolgirl]1601-an eternal schoolgirl ; now [she]221-miss anthony had grown into [a woman]760-a woman . Sometimes [he]174-campton fancied the change dated from the moment when [their]1603-their eyes had met across [the station]563-the station , the day [they]1603-their had seen [George]175-george off . [He]174-campton wondered whether it might not be interesting to paint [her]221-miss anthony new face , if ever painting became again thinkable . “ Passion — [I]174-campton suppose the great thing is a capacity for passion , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton mused . In [himself]174-campton [he]174-campton imagined the capacity to be quite dead . [He]174-campton loved [[his]174-campton son]364-his son : yes — but [he]174-campton was beginning to see that [he]174-campton loved [him]364-his son for certain qualities [he]174-campton had read into [him]364-his son , and that perhaps after all——. Well , perhaps after all the sin for which [he]174-campton was now atoning in loneliness was that of having been too exclusively [an artist]1165-an artist , of having cherished [George]175-george too egotistically and self - indulgently , too much as [his]174-campton own most beautiful creation . If [he]174-campton had loved [him]364-his son more humanly , more tenderly and recklessly , might [he]174-campton have not put into [[his]174-campton son]364-his son the tenderness and recklessness which were beginning to seem to [him]174-campton the qualities most supremely human ? [XV]295-xv A week or two later , coming [home]502-home late from a long day ’s work at [the office]1357-the office , [Campton]174-campton saw [Mme . Lebel]195-mme awaiting [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton always stopped for a word now ; fearing each time that there was bad news of [Jules Lebel]270-jules , but not wishing to seem to avoid [her]195-mme . To - day , however , [Mme . [Lebel]195-mme answered with simplicity . [Campton]174-campton went up apprehensively . The idea of [unknown persons in possession of [[his]174-campton studio]536-his studio]1610-unknown persons in possession of his studio always made [him]174-campton nervous . Whoever [they]1610-unknown persons in possession of his studio were , whatever errands [they]1610-unknown persons in possession of his studio came on , [they]1610-unknown persons in possession of his studio always — especially [women]738-women — disturbed the tranquil course of things , faced [him]174-campton with unexpected problems , unsettled [him]174-campton in one way or another . Bouncing in on [people]378-people suddenly was like dynamiting fish : it left [him]174-campton with [his]174-campton mind full of fragments of dismembered thoughts . As [he]174-campton entered [he]174-campton perceived from the temperate atmosphere that [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme had not only opened [the studio]370-the studio but made up the fire . [The lady]624-the lady ’s furs must indeed be magnificent . [She]624-the lady sat at the farther end of [the room]475-the room , in a high - backed chair near the stove , and when [she]624-the lady rose [he]174-campton recognized [[his]174-campton former wife]519-his former wife . The long sable cloak , which had slipped back over the chair , justified [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme ’s description , but the dress beneath it appeared to [Campton]174-campton simpler than [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s habitual raiment . The lamplight , striking up into [her]624-the lady powdered face , puffed out [her]624-the lady under - lids and made harsh hollows in [her]624-the lady cheeks . [She]624-the lady looked frightened , ill and yet determined . “ [John]174-campton — — ”[624-the lady] [she]624-the lady began , laying [her]624-the lady hand on [his]174-campton sleeve . It was the first time [she]624-the lady had ever set foot in [[his]174-campton shabby quarters]1618-his shabby quarters , and in [his]174-campton astonishment [he]174-campton could only stammer out : “ [Julia]194-julia — — ”[624-the lady] But as [he]174-campton looked at [her]624-the lady [he]174-campton saw that [her]624-the lady face was wet with tears . “ Not — bad news ? ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton broke out . [She]624-the lady shook [her]624-the lady head and , drawing a handkerchief from a diamond - monogrammed bag , wiped away the tears and the powder . Then [she]624-the lady pressed the handkerchief to [her]624-the lady lips , gazing at [him]174-campton with eyes as helpless as [a child]1072-a child ’s . “ Sit down , ”[624-the lady] said [Campton]174-campton . As [they]1620-they faced [each other]443-each other across the long table , with papers and paint - rags and writing materials pushed aside to make room for the threadbare napkin on which [his]174-campton plate and glass , and bottle of _ vin ordinaire _ , were set out , [he]174-campton wondered if the scene woke in [her]624-the lady any memory of [their]1620-they first days of gaiety and poverty , or if [she]624-the lady merely pitied [him]174-campton for still living in such squalor . And suddenly it occurred to [him]174-campton that when the war was over , and [George]175-george came back , it would be pleasant to hunt out [a little apartment in [an old house in [the Faubourg St. Germain]120-the faubourg st. germain]1623-an old house in the faubourg st. germain]1622-a little apartment in an old house in the faubourg st. germain , put some good furniture in [it]1623-an old house in the faubourg st. germain , and oppose the discreeter charm of such an interior to the heavy splendours of [the Avenue Marigny]548-the avenue marigny . How could [he]174-campton expect to hold [a luxury - loving youth]1625-a luxury - loving youth if [he]174-campton had only [this dingy studio to receive [him]174-campton in]1626-this dingy studio to receive him in ? [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant began to speak . “ [I]196-mrs. brant came here to see [you]174-campton because [I]196-mrs. brant did n’t wish [any one]3083-any one to know ; not [Adele]220-adele anthony , nor even [Anderson]196-mrs. brant . ”[196-mrs. brant] Leaning toward [him]174-campton [she]196-mrs. brant went on in short breathless sentences : “ [I]196-mrs. brant ’ve just left [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett : [you]174-campton know [her]282-madge talkett , [I]196-mrs. brant think ? [She]282-madge talkett ’s at Mme . [[de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s hospital]3438-de dolmetsch ’s hospital . Something dreadful has happened ... too dreadful . It seems that [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch was very much in love with [Ladislas Isador]190-ladislas isador ; [a writer]3439-a writer , was n’t [he]190-ladislas isador ? And poor [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch — [you]3444-you know [I]196-mrs. brant ’ve never approved of [her]179-de dolmetsch ; but things are so changed nowadays , and at any rate [she]179-de dolmetsch was madly attached to [him]190-ladislas isador , and had done everything to keep [him]190-ladislas isador in [Paris]5-paris : medical certificates , [people at [Headquarters]121-headquarters]3445-people at headquarters working for [her]179-de dolmetsch , and all the rest . But it seems there are no end of [officers]3446-officers always intriguing to get staff - jobs : [strong able - bodied young men who ought to be in the trenches]3447-strong able - bodied young men who ought to be in the trenches , and are fit for nothing else , but who are jealous of [the others]3170-the others . And last week , in spite of all [she]179-de dolmetsch could do , [poor Isador]190-ladislas isador was ordered to the front . ”[196-mrs. brant] [Campton]174-campton made an impatient movement . [[de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s lover]1629-de dolmetsch ’s lover . “ [I]174-campton ’m sorry , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said . “ But if [you]196-mrs. brant ’ve come to ask [me]174-campton to do something more about [George]175-george — take any new steps — it ’s no use . What a mad world it was , in which the same horrible and magnificent doom awaited [the coward]1632-the coward and [the hero]1633-the hero ! “ [Poor Mme]297-poor mme . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ! ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton muttered , remembering with a sense of remorse [her]196-mrs. brant desperate appeal and [his]174-campton curt rebuff . Once again [the poor creature]1634-the poor creature ’s love had enlightened [her]196-mrs. brant , and [she]196-mrs. brant had foreseen what [no one else]1635-no one else in [the world]2535-the world would have believed : that [[her]196-mrs. brant lover]406-her lover was to die like [a hero]3272-a hero . “ [Isador]190-ladislas isador was nearly forty , and had a weak heart ; and [she]196-mrs. brant ’d left nothing , literally nothing , undone to save [him]190-ladislas isador . ”[196-mrs. brant] [Campton]174-campton read in [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife ’s eyes what was coming . “ It ’s impossible _ now _ that [George]175-george should not be taken , ”[174-campton] [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant went on . [They]1640-they sat and looked at [each other]443-each other without speaking ; then [she]196-mrs. brant began again imploringly : “ [I]196-mrs. brant tell [you]174-campton there ’s not a moment to be lost ! ”[196-mrs. brant] [Campton]174-campton picked up a palette - knife and began absently to rub it with an oily rag . [He]174-campton threw back [his]174-campton shoulders , as if to shake off a weight . “ [I]174-campton — feel exactly as [Brant]196-mrs. brant does , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton declared . “ [You]196-mrs. brant — [you]196-mrs. brant feel as [he]3455-your husband does ? There ’s always something more that [he]1166-a father can do ! ”[174-campton] The words , breaking from [her]1642-her in a cry , seemed suddenly to change [her]1642-her from [an ageing doll]1643-an ageing doll into [a living and agonized woman]1644-a living and agonized woman . [Campton]174-campton had never before felt as near to [her]1642-her , as moved to the depths by [her]1642-her . [She]1642-her started up with a despairing exclamation . “ What ’s happened to [you]174-campton ? Who has influenced [you]174-campton ? What has changed [you]174-campton ? ”[1642-her] How could [he]174-campton answer [her]1642-her ? [He]174-campton hardly knew [himself]174-campton : had hardly been conscious of the change till [she]1642-her suddenly flung it in [his]174-campton face . If blind animal passion be the profoundest as well as the fiercest form of attachment , [his]174-campton love for [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy was at that moment as nothing to [hers]1642-her . Yet [his]174-campton feeling for [George]175-george , in spite of all the phrases [he]174-campton dressed it in , had formerly in its essence been no other . That [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy should survive — survive at any price — that had been all [he]174-campton cared for or sought to achieve . It had been convenient to justify [himself]174-campton by arguing that [George]175-george was not bound to fight for [France]18-france ; but [Campton]174-campton now knew that [he]174-campton would have made the same effort to protect [[his]174-campton son]364-his son if [the country]2496-the country engaged had been [his]174-campton own . In the careless pre - war world , as [George]175-george [himself]175-george had once said , it had seemed unbelievable that [people]378-people should ever again go off and die in a ditch to oblige [anybody]396-anybody . Even now , the automatic obedience of [the millions of the untaught]1653-the millions of the untaught and the unthinking , though it had its deep pathetic significance , did not move [Campton]174-campton like the clear - eyed sacrifice of [the few who knew why [they]1654-the few who knew why they were dying were dying]1654-the few who knew why they were dying . [Jean Fortin]287-jean fortin , [René Davril]284-rené davril , and [such lads as [young Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey]1655-such lads as young louis dastrey , with [his]174-campton reasoned horror of butchery and waste in general , and [his]174-campton instant grasp of the necessity of this particular sacrifice : it was [they]1656-they who had first shed light on the dark problem . [Campton]174-campton had never before , at least consciously , thought of [himself]174-campton and [the few beings [he]174-campton cared for]1657-the few beings he cared for as part of a greater whole , component elements of the immense amazing spectacle . But the last four months had shown [him]174-campton [man]1658-man as a defenceless animal suddenly torn from [his]1658-man [shell , stripped of all the interwoven tendrils of association , habit , background , daily ways and words , daily sights and sounds]1659-shell , stripped of all the interwoven tendrils of association , habit , background , daily ways and words , daily sights and sounds , and flung out of [the human habitable world]1660-the human habitable world into naked ether , where nothing breathes or lives . That was what war did ; that was why [those who best understood it]1661-those who best understood it in all [[its]1662-its farthest - reaching abomination]1663-its farthest - reaching abomination willingly gave [their]1661-those who best understood it lives to put an end to it . [He]174-campton heard [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant crying . “ [Julia]194-julia , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said , “ [Julia]194-julia , [I]174-campton wish [you]194-julia ’d try to see .... ”[174-campton] [She]196-mrs. brant dashed away [her]196-mrs. brant tears . “ See what ? All [I]174-campton see is _ [you]174-campton _ , sitting here safe and saying [you]174-campton can do nothing to save [him]174-campton ! But to have the right to say that [you]174-campton ought to be in [the trenches]3142-the trenches [yourself]174-campton ! What do [you]174-campton suppose [those young men out there]3462-those young men out there think of [[their]3462-those young men out there fathers]3463-their fathers , safe at [home]502-home , who are too high - minded and conscientious to protect [them]3462-those young men out there ? ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton looked at [her]196-mrs. brant compassionately . “ Yes , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said , “ that ’s the bitterest part of it . But for that , there would hardly be anything in the worst war for [us]3465-us [old people]3466-old people to lie awake about . ”[174-campton] [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant had stood up and was feverishly pulling on [her]196-mrs. brant gloves : [he]174-campton saw that [she]196-mrs. brant no longer heard [him]174-campton . There was nothing more that [either]1664-either could say . [He]174-campton lifted the lamp , and went out of the door ahead of [her]196-mrs. brant . “ [You]174-campton need n’t come down , ”[196-mrs. brant] [she]196-mrs. brant said in a sob ; but leaning over the rail into the darkness [he]174-campton answered : “ [I]174-campton ’ll give [you]174-campton a light : [the concierge]480-the concierge has forgotten the lamp on the stairs . ”[174-campton] [He]174-campton went ahead of [her]196-mrs. brant down [the long greasy flights]1665-the long greasy flights , and as [they]1666-they reached [the ground floor]1667-the ground floor [he]174-campton heard a noise of feet coming and going , and frightened voices exclaiming . In the doorway of [[the porter]1668-the porter ’s lodge [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s splendid chauffeur]1669-the porter ’s lodge mrs. brant ’s splendid chauffeur stood looking on compassionately at [a group of women gathered about [Mme . [The old woman]483-the old woman sat in [[her]483-the old woman den]1672-her den , [her]483-the old woman arms stretched across the table , [her]483-the old woman sewing fallen at [her]483-the old woman feet . On the table lay an open letter . [[The grocer]1673-the grocer ’s wife]1674-the grocer ’s wife from the corner stood by , sobbing .
