When [Campton]174-campton looked up again [he]174-campton saw [Julia Brant]194-julia , pale and bewildered , hurrying toward [her]194-julia motor , and [the vault of [the porte - cochère]1678-the porte - cochère]1677-the vault of the porte - cochère sent back [the chauffeur]1679-the chauffeur ’s answer to [her]194-julia startled question : “ [Poor old lady]3468-poor old lady — yes , [[her]3468-poor old lady only son]3469-her only son ’s been killed at the front . ”[1679-the chauffeur] [XVI Campton]298-xvi campton sat with [[his]174-campton friend]444-his friend [Dastrey]209-dastrey in [[the latter]1395-the latter ’s pleasant little _ entresol]1682-the latter ’s pleasant little _ entresol _ full of Chinese lacquer and Venetian furniture . [Dastrey]209-dastrey , in the last days of January , had been sent [home]502-home from [[his]209-dastrey ambulance]1684-his ambulance with an attack of rheumatism ; and when it became clear that [he]209-dastrey could no longer be of use in the mud and cold of [the army]981-the army zone [he]209-dastrey had reluctantly taken [his]209-dastrey place behind a desk at [the Ministry of War]1369-the ministry of war . [The friends]1687-the friends had dined early , so that [he]209-dastrey might get back to [his]209-dastrey night shift ; and [they]1687-the friends sat over coffee and liqueurs , the mist of [their]1687-the friends cigars floating across lustrous cabinet - fronts and the worn gilding of slender consoles . On the other side of the hearth [young Boylston]247-boylston , sunk in an armchair , smoked and listened . “ It always comes back to the same thing , ”[174-campton] [Campton]174-campton was saying nervously . “ What right have [useless old men like [me]174-campton]3470-useless old men like me , sitting here with [my]174-campton cigar by this good fire , to preach blood and butchery to [[boys]3471-boys like [George]175-george and [[your]3473-your nephew]3474-your nephew]3472-boys like george and your nephew ? ”[174-campton] Again and again , during the days since [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s visit , [he]209-dastrey had turned over in [his]209-dastrey mind the same torturing question . How was [he]209-dastrey to answer that last taunt of [hers]196-mrs. brant ? Not long ago , [Paul Dastrey]188-dastrey would have seemed [the last person to whom [he]209-dastrey could have submitted such a problem]1688-the last person to whom he could have submitted such a problem . [Dastrey]188-dastrey , in the black August days , starting for the front in such a frenzy of baffled blood - lust , had remained for [Campton]174-campton [the type of man with whom it was impossible to discuss the war]1689-the type of man with whom it was impossible to discuss the war . But three months of hard service in _ Postes de Secours _ and along the awful battle - edge had sent [him]188-dastrey [home]502-home with a mind no longer befogged by personal problems . [He]188-dastrey had done [his]188-dastrey utmost , and knew it ; and the fact gave [him]188-dastrey the professional calm which keeps [surgeons]1328-surgeons and [nurses]1337-nurses steady through all the horrors [they]1693-they are compelled to live among . Those few months had matured and mellowed [him]188-dastrey more than a lifetime of [Paris]5-paris . [He]209-dastrey leaned back with half - closed lids , quietly considering [[his]209-dastrey friend]444-his friend ’s difficulty . “ [I]209-dastrey see . [Your]209-dastrey idea is that , being unable to do even the humble kind of job that [I]209-dastrey ’ve been assigned to , [you]209-dastrey ’ve no right _ not _ to try to keep [[your]209-dastrey boy]863-your boy out of it if [you]209-dastrey can ? ”[209-dastrey] “ Well — by any honourable means . ”[188-dastrey] [Dastrey]188-dastrey laughed faintly , and [Campton]174-campton reddened . “ The word ’s not happy , [I]188-dastrey admit . ”[188-dastrey] “ [I]188-dastrey was n’t thinking of that : [I]188-dastrey was considering how the meaning had evaporated out of lots of [our]3476-our old words , as if the general smash - up had broken [their]3477-their stoppers . So many of [them]3477-their , [you]209-dastrey see , ”[188-dastrey] said [Dastrey]188-dastrey smiling , “ [we]3476-our ’d taken good care not to uncork for centuries . Since [I]188-dastrey ’ve been on the edge of what ’s going on fifty miles from here a good many of [my]188-dastrey own words have lost their meaning , and [I]188-dastrey ’m not prepared to say where honour lies in a case like [yours]209-dastrey . ”[188-dastrey] [He]188-dastrey mused a moment , and then went on : “ What would [George]175-george ’s view be ? ”[188-dastrey] [Campton]174-campton did not immediately reply . Not so many weeks ago [he]174-campton would have welcomed the chance of explaining that [George]175-george ’s view , thank [God]266-god , had remained perfectly detached and objective , and that the cheerful acceptance of duties forcibly imposed on [him]174-campton had not in the least obscured [his]174-campton sense of the fundamental injustice of [his]174-campton being mixed up in the thing at all . But how could [he]174-campton say this now ? If [George]175-george ’s view were still what [[his]174-campton father]580-his father had been in the habit of saying it was , then [he]174-campton held that view alone : [Campton]174-campton [himself]174-campton no longer thought that [any civilized man]1696-any civilized man could afford to stand aside from such a conflict . “ As far as [I]174-campton know , ”[174-campton] [he]174-campton said , “ [George]175-george has n’t changed [his]175-george mind . ”[174-campton] [Boylston]247-boylston stirred in [his]247-boylston armchair , knocked the ash from [his]247-boylston cigar , and looked up at the ceiling . “ [Whereas]299-whereas _ [you]174-campton _ — — ”[188-dastrey] [Dastrey]188-dastrey suggested . “ Yes , ”[174-campton] said [Campton]174-campton . “ [I]174-campton feel differently . [You]174-campton speak of the difference of having been in contact with what ’s going on out there . But how can [anybody _ not _ be in contact , who has any imagination , any sense of right and wrong]3478-anybody _ not _ be in contact , who has any imagination , any sense of right and wrong ? Do these pictures and hangings ever shut it out from [you]174-campton — or those books over there , when [you]174-campton turn to them after [your]174-campton day ’s work ? Perhaps [they]3478-anybody _ not _ be in contact , who has any imagination , any sense of right and wrong do , because [you]174-campton ’ve got a real job , a job [you]174-campton ’ve been ordered to do , and ca n’t not do . But for [a useless drifting devil like [me]174-campton]3479-a useless drifting devil like me — [[my]174-campton God]3265-my god , the sights and the sounds of it are always with [me]174-campton ! ”[174-campton] “ There are a good many people who would n’t call [you]174-campton useless , [Mr. Campton]174-campton , ”[247-boylston] said [Boylston]247-boylston . [Campton]174-campton shook [his]174-campton head . “ [I]174-campton wish there were any healing in the kind of thing [I]174-campton ’m doing ; perhaps there is to [you]174-campton , to whom it appears to come naturally to love [[your]174-campton kind]3481-your kind . ”[174-campton] ( [Boylston]247-boylston laughed . ) “ Service is of no use without conviction : that ’s one of the uncomfortable truths this stir - up has brought to the surface . [I]247-boylston was meant to paint pictures in a world at peace , and [I]247-boylston should have more respect for [myself]247-boylston if [I]247-boylston could go on unconcernedly doing it , instead of pining to be in all the places where [I]247-boylston ’m not wanted , and should be of no earthly use . That ’s why — — ”[247-boylston] [he]247-boylston paused , looked about [him]247-boylston , and sought understanding in [Dastrey]188-dastrey ’s friendly gaze : “ That ’s why [I]247-boylston respect [George]175-george ’s opinion , which really consists in not having any , and simply doing without comment the work assigned to [him]175-george . The whole thing is so far beyond human measure that one ’s individual rage and revolt seem of no more use than [a woman]760-a woman ’s scream at an accident [she]760-a woman is n’t in . ”[247-boylston] Even while [he]247-boylston spoke , [Campton]174-campton knew [he]247-boylston was arguing only against [himself]247-boylston . [He]247-boylston did not in the least believe that any individual sentiment counted for nothing at such a time , and [Dastrey]188-dastrey really spoke for [him]247-boylston in rejoining : “ [Every one]832-every one can at least contribute an attitude : as [you]247-boylston have , [[my]188-dastrey dear fellow]943-my dear fellow . [Boylston]247-boylston ’s here to confirm it . ”[188-dastrey] [Boylston]247-boylston grunted [his]247-boylston assent . “ An attitude — an attitude ? ”[247-boylston] [Campton]174-campton retorted . “ The word is revolting to [me]174-campton ! Anything [a man]2492-a man like [me]174-campton can do is too easy to be worth doing . And as for anything one can _ say _ : how dare one say anything , in the face of what is being done out there to keep [this room]3202-this room and this fire , and this ragged end of life , safe for such survivals as [you]247-boylston and [me]174-campton ? ”[174-campton] [He]247-boylston crossed to the table to take another cigar . As [he]247-boylston did so [he]247-boylston laid an apologetic pressure on [[his]247-boylston host]1221-his host ’s shoulder . “ [Men of]3487-men of [our]3487-men of age are [the chorus of the tragedy]3488-the chorus of the tragedy , [Dastrey]188-dastrey ; [we]3487-men of ca n’t help [ourselves]3487-men of . As soon as [I]247-boylston open [my]247-boylston lips to blame or praise [I]247-boylston see [myself]247-boylston in white petticoats , with a long beard held on by an elastic , goading on [the combatants]1590-the combatants in a cracked voice from [a safe corner of [the ramparts]3491-the ramparts]3490-a safe corner of the ramparts . On the whole [I]247-boylston ’d sooner be spinning among [the women]404-the women . ”[247-boylston] “ Well , ”[188-dastrey] said [Dastrey]188-dastrey , getting up , “ [I]188-dastrey ’ve got to get back to [my]188-dastrey spinning at [the Ministry]899-the ministry ; where , by the way , there are [some very pretty young women at the distaff]3494-some very pretty young women at the distaff . It ’s extraordinary how much better [pretty girls]3495-pretty girls type than [plain ones]3496-plain ones ; [I]188-dastrey see now why [they]3494-some very pretty young women at the distaff get all the jobs . ”[188-dastrey] [The three]1698-the three went out into the winter blackness . [They]1698-the three were used by this time to [the new Paris]1699-the new paris : to extinguished lamps , shuttered windows , [deserted streets]1061-deserted streets , the almost total cessation of wheeled traffic . All through the winter , life had seemed in suspense everywhere , as much on the battle - front as in the rear . Day after day , week after week , of rain and sleet and mud ; day after day , week after week , of vague non - committal news from [west and east]1701-west and east ; everywhere [the enemy]3139-the enemy baffled but still menacing , everywhere death , suffering , destruction , without any perceptible oscillation of the scales , any compensating hope of good to come out of the long slow endless waste . [The benumbed and darkened [Paris]5-paris of those February days]1703-the benumbed and darkened paris of those february days seemed the visible image of [a benumbed and darkened world]1704-a benumbed and darkened world . Down the empty asphalt sheeted with rain the rare street lights stretched interminable reflections . [The three men]634-the three men crossed [the bridge]1706-the bridge and stood watching the rush of [the Seine]29-the seine . Below [them]634-the three men gloomed the vague bulk of [deserted bath - houses]1707-deserted bath - houses , [unlit barges]1708-unlit barges , [river - steamers]1709-river - steamers out of commission . [The Seine]29-the seine too had ceased to live : only a single orange gleam , low on [the water]1710-the water ’s edge , undulated on the jetty waves like a streamer of seaweed . [The two Americans]1711-the two americans left [Dastrey]188-dastrey at [[his]188-dastrey Ministry]1712-his ministry , and [the painter]540-the painter strolled on to [[Boylston]247-boylston ’s lodging]1714-boylston ’s lodging before descending to [the underground railway]1715-the underground railway . [He]540-the painter , whom [his]540-the painter lameness had made so heavy and indolent , now limped about for hours at a time over wet pavements and under streaming skies : [these midnight tramps]1716-these midnight tramps had become a sort of expiatory need to [him]540-the painter . “ Out there — out there , if [they]1716-these midnight tramps had these wet stones under them [they]1716-these midnight tramps ’d think it was the floor of heaven , ”[540-the painter] [he]540-the painter used to muse , driving on obstinately through rain and darkness . The thought of “ Out there ”[540-the painter] besieged [him]540-the painter day and night , the phrase was always in [his]540-the painter ears . Wherever [he]540-the painter went [he]540-the painter was pursued by visions of [that land of doom]1717-that land of doom : visions of fathomless mud , [rat - haunted trenches]1718-rat - haunted trenches , freezing nights under the sleety sky , [men dying in the barbed wire between the lines]1719-men dying in the barbed wire between the lines or crawling out to save [a comrade and being shattered to death on the return]1720-a comrade and being shattered to death on the return . [His]540-the painter collaboration with [Boylston]247-boylston had brought [Campton]174-campton into close contact with these things . [He]540-the painter knew by heart the history of scores and scores of [young men of [George]175-george ’s age who were doggedly suffering and dying a few hours away from [the Palais Royal office where [their]1721-young men of george ’s age who were doggedly suffering and dying a few hours away from the palais royal office where their records were kept records were kept]1722-the palais royal office where their records were kept]1721-young men of george ’s age who were doggedly suffering and dying a few hours away from the palais royal office where their records were kept . Some of these histories were so heroically simple that the sense of pain was lost in beauty , as though one were looking at suffering transmuted into poetry . But others were abominable , unendurable , in [their]1723-their long - drawn useless horror : stories of cold and filth and hunger , of ineffectual effort , of hideous mutilation , of [men perishing of thirst in a shell - hole]1724-men perishing of thirst in a shell - hole , and half - dismembered bodies dragging [themselves]1723-their back to shelter only to die as [they]1723-their reached it . Worst of all were the perpetually recurring reports of military blunders , medical neglect , carelessness in high places : the torturing knowledge of the lives that might have been saved if this or [that officer]1725-that officer ’s brain , this or [that surgeon]1726-that surgeon ’s hand , had acted more promptly . An impression of waste , confusion , ignorance , obstinacy , prejudice , and the indifference of selfishness or of mortal fatigue , emanated from these narratives written [home]502-home from the front , or faltered out by white lips on hospital pillows . “ [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ”[1721-young men of george ’s age who were doggedly suffering and dying a few hours away from the palais royal office where their records were kept] especially since [they]1721-young men of george ’s age who were doggedly suffering and dying a few hours away from the palais royal office where their records were kept had enlarged [their]1721-young men of george ’s age who were doggedly suffering and dying a few hours away from the palais royal office where their records were kept range , had to do with [young men accustomed to the freest exercise of thought and criticism]1728-young men accustomed to the freest exercise of thought and criticism . [A nation in arms]1729-a nation in arms does not judge a war as simply as [an army of [professional soldiers]1731-professional soldiers]1730-an army of professional soldiers . [All these young intelligences]1732-all these young intelligences were so many subtly - adjusted instruments for the testing of the machinery of which [they]1732-all these young intelligences formed a part ; and [not one]1733-not one accepted the results passively . Yet in one respect all were agreed : the “ had to be ”[1735-the generation to meet it] of the first day was still on every lip . The German menace must be met : chance willed that [theirs]1734-theirs should be [the generation to meet it]1735-the generation to meet it ; on that point speculation was vain and discussion useless . The question that stirred [them]1732-all these young intelligences all was how [the country]2496-the country [they]1732-all these young intelligences were defending was helping [them]1732-all these young intelligences to carry on the struggle . There the evidence was cruelly clear , the comment often scathingly explicit ; and [Campton]174-campton , bending still lower over [the abyss]1737-the abyss , caught a shuddering glimpse of what might be — must be — if political blunders , inertia , tolerance , perhaps even evil ambitions and connivances , should at last outweigh the effort of the front . There was no logical argument against such a possibility . All civilizations had [their]1732-all these young intelligences orbit ; all societies rose and fell . Some day , no doubt , by the action of that law , everything that made [the world]2535-the world livable to [Campton]174-campton and [[his]174-campton kind]3224-his kind would crumble in new ruins above the old . Yes — but woe to [them]1740-them by whom such things came ; woe to [the generation that bowed to such a law]1741-the generation that bowed to such a law ! [The Powers of [Darkness]300-darkness]1742-the powers of darkness were always watching and seeking [their]1742-the powers of darkness hour ; but the past was a record of [their]1742-the powers of darkness failures as well as of [their]1742-the powers of darkness triumphs . [Campton]174-campton , brushing up [his]174-campton history , remembered the great turning - points of progress , saw how the liberties of [England]3-england had been born of the ruthless discipline of the Norman conquest , and how even out of the hideous welter of the French Revolution and the Napoleonic wars had come more freedom and a wiser order . The point was to remember that the efficacy of the sacrifice was always in proportion to the worth of [the victims]1743-the victims ; and there at least [his]174-campton faith was sure . [He]174-campton could not , [he]174-campton felt , leave [[his]174-campton former wife]519-his former wife ’s appeal unnoticed ; after a day or two [he]174-campton wrote to [George]175-george , telling [him]175-george of [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s anxiety , and asking in vague terms if [George]175-george [himself]175-george thought any change in [his]175-george situation probable . [His]174-campton letter ended abruptly : “ [I]174-campton suppose it ’s hardly time yet to ask for leave — — ”[174-campton] XVII Not long after [his]174-campton midnight tramp with [Boylston]247-boylston and [Dastrey]188-dastrey the post brought [Campton]174-campton two letters . One was postmarked [Paris]5-paris , the other bore [the military frank]1745-the military frank and was addressed in [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s hand : [he]174-campton laid it aside while [he]174-campton glanced at the first . It contained an engraved card : + ---------------------------------------------------+ | | | _ [Mrs. Anderson Brant _]196-mrs. brant | | | | _ At Home on February 20th at 4 o’clock _ | | | | _ [Mr. Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew will give an account of [his]212-mr. mayhew | | captivity in [Germany]55-germany | | [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch will sing _ | | | | _ For the benefit of [the “ Friends of French Art]3498-the “ friends of french art | | Committee ”[179-de dolmetsch] _ | | | | _ Tickets 100 francs _ | | | + ---------------------------------------------------+ Enclosed was the circular of the sub - committee in aid of Musicians at the Front , with which [Campton]174-campton was not directly associated . It bore the names of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett , [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite and a number of [other French and American ladies]1747-other french and american ladies . [Campton]174-campton tossed the card away . [He]174-campton was not annoyed by the invitation : [he]174-campton knew that [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [Mlle . Davril]294-mlle . davril were getting up a series of drawing - room entertainments for that branch of [the charity]1748-the charity , and that the card had been sent to [him]174-campton as a member of the Honorary Committee . But any reminder of the sort always gave a sharp twitch to the Brant nerve in [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton turned to [George]175-george ’s letter . It was no longer than usual ; but in other respects it was unlike [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s previous communications . [Campton]174-campton read it over two or three times . “ [Dear Dad]205-dad , thanks for yours of the tenth , which must have come to [me]174-campton on skis , the snow here is so deep . ”[174-campton] ( There had , in fact , been a heavy snow - fall in [the Argonne]81-the argonne ) . “ [Sorry mother]3499-sorry mother is bothering about things again ; as [you]205-dad ’ve often reminded [me]174-campton , [they]3500-they always have a way of ‘ being as [they]3500-they will be , ’ and even war does n’t seem to change it . Nothing to worry [her]1751-her in [my]174-campton case — but [you]205-dad ca n’t expect [her]1751-her to believe that , can [you]205-dad ? Neither [you]205-dad nor [I]174-campton can help it , [I]174-campton suppose . “[174-campton] There ’s one thing that might help , though ; and that is , [your]1750-you letting [her]1751-her feel that [you]1750-you ’re a little nearer to [her]1751-her . War makes a lot of things look differently , especially this sedentary kind of war : it ’s rather like going over all the old odds - and - ends in one ’s cupboards . And some of them do look so foolish . “ [I]1750-you wish [you]205-dad ’d see [her]1751-her now and then — just naturally , as if it had happened . [You]205-dad know [you]205-dad ’ve got one Inexhaustible Topic between [you]205-dad . The said I. T. is doing well , and has nothing new to communicate up to now except a change of address . Hereafter please write to [[my]1750-you Base]3501-my base instead of directing here , as there ’s some chance of a shift of H.Q. The precaution is probably just a new twist of the old red tape , signifying nothing ; but Base will always reach [me]1750-you if [we]3502-we _ are _ shifted . Let [mother]821-mother know , and explain , please ; otherwise [she]821-mother ’ll think the unthinkable . “[1750-you] Interrupted by big drive — quill - drive , of course ! “ As ever “[301-georgius scriblerius] [GEORGIUS SCRIBLERIUS]301-georgius scriblerius . “ P.S. Do n’t be too savage to [Uncle Andy]229-uncle andy either . “[301-georgius scriblerius] No . 2.—I _ had _ thought of leave ; but perhaps [you]1750-you ’re right about that . ” It was the first time [George]175-george had written in that way of [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother . [His]175-george smiling policy had always been to let things alone , and go on impartially dividing [his]175-george devotion between [[his]175-george parents]509-his parents , since [they]509-his parents refused to share even that common blessing . But war gave everything a new look ; and [he]175-george had evidently , as [he]175-george put it , been turning over the old things in [his]175-george cupboards . How was it possible , [Campton]174-campton wondered , that after such a turning over [he]175-george was still content to write “[1750-you] Nothing new to communicate , ” and to make jokes about another big quill - drive ? Glancing at the date of the letter , [Campton]174-campton saw that it had been written on the day after the first ineffectual infantry assault on [Vauquois]122-vauquois . And [George]175-george was sitting a few miles off , safe in headquarters at [Sainte Menehould]306-sainte menehould , with a stout roof over [his]175-george head and a beautiful brown gloss on [his]175-george boots , scribbling punning letters while [[his]175-george comrades]3506-his comrades fell back from that bloody summit .... Suddenly [Campton]174-campton ’s eyes filled . No ; [George]175-george had not written that letter for the sake of the joke : the joke was meant to cover what went before it . Ah , how young [the boy]416-the boy was to imagine that [[his]416-the boy father]580-his father would not see ! Yes , as [he]175-george said , war made so many of the old things look foolish .... [Campton]174-campton set out for [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal . [He]174-campton felt happier than for a long time past : the tone of [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ’s letter seemed to correspond with [his]174-campton own secret change of spirit . [He]174-campton knew the futility of attempting to bring [the Brants]203-the brants and [himself]174-campton together , but was glad that [George]175-george had made the suggestion . [He]174-campton resolved to see [Julia]194-julia that afternoon . At [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal [he]174-campton found [the indefatigable Boylston]247-boylston busy with an exhibition of paintings sent [home]502-home from the front , and [Mlle . Davril]294-mlle . davril helping to catalogue them . [Lamentable pensioners]3513-lamentable pensioners came and went , bringing fresh tales of death , fresh details of savagery ; the air was dark with poverty and sorrow . In the background [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite flitted about , tragic and ineffectual . [Boylston]247-boylston had not been able to extract a penny from [Beausite]176-beausite for [[his]247-boylston secretary]3514-his secretary and [the latter ’s left - handed family]3515-the latter ’s left - handed family ; but [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite had discovered [a newly - organized charity which lent money to “[1750-you] temporarily embarrassed ” [war - victims]3517-war - victims]3516-a newly - organized charity which lent money to “ temporarily embarrassed ” war - victims ; and with an artless self - satisfaction [she]194-julia had contrived to obtain a small loan for [the victim of [her]194-julia own thrift]3518-the victim of her own thrift . “[1750-you] For what other purpose are such charities founded ? ” [she]194-julia said , gently disclaiming in advance the praise which [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [Boylston]247-boylston had no thought of offering [her]194-julia . Whenever [Campton]174-campton came in [she]194-julia effaced [herself]194-julia behind a desk , where [she]194-julia bent [her]194-julia beautiful white head over a card - catalogue without any perceptible results . The telephone rang . [Boylston]247-boylston , after a moment , looked up from the receiver . “[174-campton] [Mr. Campton]174-campton ! ” [The painter]540-the painter glanced apprehensively at the instrument , which still seemed to [him]247-boylston charged with explosives . “[174-campton] Take the message , do . The thing always snaps at [me]0-i . ” There was a listening pause : then [Boylston]247-boylston said : “[1752-they] It ’s about [Upsher]259-benny upsher — — ” [Campton]174-campton started up . “[259-benny upsher] Killed — — ? ” “[259-benny upsher] Not sure .
