[Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony was not at [the office]1357-the office that morning , or [he]247-boylston would have turned to [her]221-miss anthony ; at least [she]221-miss anthony might have gone with [him]247-boylston on [his]247-boylston quest . [He]247-boylston could not ask [Boylston]247-boylston to leave [the office]1357-the office , and [he]247-boylston felt that curious incapacity to deal with the raw fact of sorrow which had often given an elfin unreality to the most poignant moments of [his]247-boylston life . It was as though experience had to enter into the very substance of [his]247-boylston soul before [he]247-boylston could even feel it . “[212-mr. mayhew] [Other people]607-other people , ” [he]247-boylston thought , “[607-other people] would know what to say , and [I]0-i sha n’t .... ” [Some one]839-some one , meanwhile , had fetched [a cab]3525-a cab , and [he]247-boylston drove to [the Nouveau Luxe]1265-the nouveau luxe , though with little hope of finding [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew . But [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew had grown [two secretaries]3527-two secretaries , and turned [the shrimp - pink drawing - room]3528-the shrimp - pink drawing - room into [an office]1488-an office . [One of [the secretaries]3531-the secretaries]3530-one of the secretaries was [there]467-there , hammering at a typewriter . [She]3530-one of the secretaries was [a competent young woman]3533-a competent young woman , who instantly extracted from [her]3530-one of the secretaries pocket - diary the fact that [[her]3530-one of the secretaries chief]3534-her chief was at [Mrs. Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s , rehearsing . “[212-mr. mayhew] Rehearsing — — ? ” “[212-mr. mayhew] Why , yes ; [he]1755-he ’s to speak at [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s next week on [Atrocities]124-atrocities , ” [she]3530-one of the secretaries said , surprised at [Campton]174-campton ’s ignorance . [She]3530-one of the secretaries suggested telephoning ; but in [the shrunken households of [the rich]3536-the rich]3535-the shrunken households of the rich , where but [one or two servants]3537-one or two servants remained , telephoning had become as difficult as in [the understaffed hotels]3538-the understaffed hotels ; and after one or two vain attempts [Campton]174-campton decided to go to [the Avenue Marigny]125-the avenue marigny . [He]174-campton felt that to get hold of [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew as soon as possible might still in some vague way help poor [Benny]259-benny upsher — since it was not yet sure that [he]259-benny upsher was dead . “[1755-he] Or else it ’s just the need to rush about , ” [he]174-campton thought , conscious that the only way [he]174-campton had yet found of dealing with calamity was a kind of ant - like agitation . On the way the round pink face of [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher continued to float before [him]174-campton in its very substance , with the tangibility that only [a painter]3289-a painter ’s visions wear . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to be _ in _ this thing , ” [he]174-campton heard [the boy]416-the boy repeating , as if impelled by some blind instinct flowing down through centuries and centuries of persistent childish minds . “[0-i] If [he]1756-he or [[his]1756-he forebears]1757-his forebears had ever thought things out [he]1756-he probably would have been alive and safe to - day , ” [Campton]174-campton mused , “[175-george] like [George]175-george .... [The average person]1758-the average person is always just obeying impulses stored up thousands of years ago , and never re - examined since . ” But this consideration , though drawn from [George]175-george ’s own philosophy , did not greatly comfort [[his]174-campton father]580-his father . At [the Brants ’]3542-the brants ’ [a bewildered concierge]3543-a bewildered concierge admitted [him]174-campton and rang a bell which [no one]2702-no one answered . [The vestibule]3545-the vestibule and the stairs were piled with bales of sheeting , bulging jute - bags , stacked - up hospital supplies . [A boy in scout]3546-a boy in scout ’s uniform swung inadequate legs from [the lofty porter]3547-the lofty porter ’s armchair beside the table with [its]3547-the lofty porter monumental bronze inkstand . Finally , from above , [a maid]3548-a maid called to [Campton]174-campton to ascend . In the drawing - room pictures and tapestries , bronzes and _ pâtes tendres _ , had vanished , and a plain moquette replaced [the priceless Savonnerie across whose pompous garlands [Campton]174-campton had walked on the day of [his]174-campton last visit]3549-the priceless savonnerie across whose pompous garlands campton had walked on the day of his last visit . [The maid]2738-the maid led [him]174-campton to [the ball - room]3551-the ball - room . Through double doors of glass [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s oratorical accents , accompanied by faint chords on the piano , reached [Campton]174-campton ’s ears : [he]174-campton paused and looked . At the far end of [the great gilded room]3552-the great gilded room , on a platform backed by velvet draperies , stood [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , a perfect pearl in [his]212-mr. mayhew tie and a perfect crease in [his]212-mr. mayhew trousers . Beside [him]212-mr. mayhew was a stage - property tripod surmounted by a classical perfume - burner ; and on it [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , swathed in black , leaned in an attitude of affliction . Beneath [the platform]3553-the platform [a bushy - headed pianist]3554-a bushy - headed pianist struck an occasional chord from [Chopin]302-chopin ’s Dead March ; and near the door [three or four Red Cross nurses]3555-three or four red cross nurses perched on bales of blankets and listened . Under one of [their]3555-three or four red cross nurses coifs [Campton]174-campton recognized [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . [She]255-mrs. talkett saw [him]174-campton and made a sign to [the lady nearest [her]255-mrs. talkett]3556-the lady nearest her ; and [the latter]1395-the latter , turning , revealed the astonished eyes of [Julia Brant]194-julia . [Campton]174-campton ’s first impression , while [they]3555-three or four red cross nurses shook hands under cover of [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s rolling periods , was of [[his]174-campton former wife]519-his former wife ’s gift of adaptation . [She]255-mrs. talkett had made [herself]255-mrs. talkett [a nurse]1354-a nurse ’s face ; not a theatrical imitation of it like [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s , nor yet the face of [a nurse on a war - poster]3560-a nurse on a war - poster , like [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s . [Her]255-mrs. talkett lovely hair smoothed away under [her]255-mrs. talkett strict coif , [her]255-mrs. talkett chin devoutly framed in linen , [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant looked serious , tender and efficient . Was it possible that [she]255-mrs. talkett had found [her]255-mrs. talkett vocation ? [She]255-mrs. talkett gave [him]174-campton a glance of alarm , but [his]174-campton eyes must have told [her]255-mrs. talkett that [he]174-campton had not come about [George]175-george , for with a reassured smile [she]255-mrs. talkett laid a finger on [her]255-mrs. talkett lip and pointed to [the platform]3553-the platform ; [Campton]174-campton noticed that [her]255-mrs. talkett nails were as beautifully polished as ever . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew was saying : “[1758-the average person] All that [I]0-i have to give , yes , all that is most precious to [me]0-i , [I]0-i am ready to surrender , to offer up , to lay down in the Great Struggle which is to save [the world]2535-the world from barbarism . [I]0-i , who was one of [the first Victims of that barbarism]1760-the first victims of that barbarism .... ” [He]0-i paused and looked impressively at the bales of blankets . The piano filled in the pause , and [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , without changing [her]179-de dolmetsch attitude , almost without moving [her]179-de dolmetsch lips , sang a few notes of lamentation . “[1760-the first victims of that barbarism] Of that hideous barbarism — — ” [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew began again . “[0-i] [I]0-i repeat that [I]0-i stand here ready to give up everything [I]0-i hold most dear — — ” “[0-i] Do stop [him]0-i , ” [Campton]174-campton whispered to [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant . [Little Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett , with the quick intuition [he]0-i had noted in [her]255-mrs. talkett , sprang up and threaded [her]255-mrs. talkett way to the stage . [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch flowed from [one widowed pose]3562-one widowed pose into another , and [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , majestically descending , approached [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant . “[1761-you] [You]1761-you agree with [me]0-i , [I]0-i hope ? [You]1761-you feel that anything more than [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s beautiful voice — anything in the way of a choral accompaniment — would only weaken [my]0-i effect ? Where the facts are so overwhelming it is enough to state them ; that is , ” [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew added modestly , “[179-de dolmetsch] if they are stated vigorously and tersely — as [I]0-i hope they are . ” Mme . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , with the gesture of [a marble mourner torn from [her]179-de dolmetsch cenotaph]3563-a marble mourner torn from her cenotaph , glided up behind [him]212-mr. mayhew and laid [her]179-de dolmetsch hand in [Campton]174-campton ’s . “[0-i] [Dear friend]1762-dear friend , [you]1762-dear friend ’ve heard ? ... [You]1762-dear friend remember [our]1763-our talk ? [I]0-i am [Cassandra]303-cassandra , cursed with the hideous gift of divination . ” Tears rained down [her]179-de dolmetsch cheeks , washing off the paint like mud swept by a shower . “[303-cassandra] [My]0-i only comfort , ” [she]179-de dolmetsch added , fixing [her]179-de dolmetsch perfect eyes on [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , “[303-cassandra] is to help [[our]1763-our great good friend]1764-our great good friend in this crusade against [the assassins of [my]0-i Ladislas]1765-the assassins of my ladislas . ” [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett had said a word to [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew . [Campton]174-campton saw [his]174-campton complacent face go to pieces as if it had been vitrioled . “[259-benny upsher] [Benny]259-benny upsher — [Benny]259-benny upsher — — ” [he]174-campton screamed , “[259-benny upsher] [Benny]259-benny upsher hurt ? [[My]0-i [Benny]259-benny upsher]1766-my benny ? It ’s some mistake ! What makes [you]0-i think — — ? ” [His]174-campton eyes met [Campton]174-campton ’s . “[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i God]3265-my god ! Why , [he]259-benny upsher ’s [[my]0-i sister ’s child]1768-my sister ’s child ! ” [he]174-campton cried , plunging [his]174-campton face into [his]174-campton soft manicured hands . In [the cab to which [Campton]174-campton led [him]174-campton]3564-the cab to which campton led him , [he]174-campton continued to sob with the full - throated sobs of a large invertebrate distress , beating [his]174-campton breast for an unfindable handkerchief , and , when [he]174-campton found it , immediately weeping it into pulp . [Campton]174-campton had meant to leave [him]174-campton at [the bank]917-the bank ; but when [the taxi]566-the taxi stopped [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew was in too pitiful a plight for [the painter]540-the painter to resist [his]212-mr. mayhew entreaty . “[0-i] It was [you]1769-you who saw [Benny]259-benny upsher last — [you]1769-you ca n’t leave [me]0-i ! ” [the poor man]3568-the poor man implored ; and [Campton]174-campton followed [him]3568-the poor man up [the majestic stairway]3569-the majestic stairway . [Their]3570-their names were taken in to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , and with a motion of wonder at the unaccountable humours of fate , [Campton]174-campton found [himself]174-campton for the first time entering [[the banker]547-the banker ’s private office]3572-the banker ’s private office . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was elsewhere in [the great glazed labyrinth]3573-the great glazed labyrinth , and while [the visitors]3574-the visitors waited , [the painter]540-the painter ’s registering eye took in the details of [the room]475-the room , from the Barye _ cire - perdue _ on a peach - coloured marble mantel to the blue morocco armchairs about a giant writing - table . On the table was an electric lamp in a celadon vase , and just the right number of neatly folded papers lay under a paper - weight of Chinese crystal . [The room]475-the room was as tidy as an expensive stage - setting or the cage of a well - kept canary : the only object marring its order was a telegram lying open on the desk . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , grey and glossy , slipped in on noiseless patent leather . [He]197-mr. brant shook hands with [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , bowed stiffly but deprecatingly to [Campton]174-campton , gave [his]197-mr. brant usual cough , and said : “[1769-you] This is terrible . ” And suddenly , as [the three men]634-the three men sat there , so impressive and important and powerless , with that fatal telegram marring the tidiness of the desk , [Campton]174-campton murmured to [himself]174-campton : “[1769-you] If this thing were to happen to [me]0-i [I]0-i could n’t bear it .... [I]0-i simply could n’t bear it .... ” [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher was not dead — at least [his]259-benny upsher death was not certain . [He]259-benny upsher had been seen to fall in a surprise attack near [Neuve Chapelle]126-neuve chapelle ; the telegram , from [[his]259-benny upsher commanding officer]3579-his commanding officer , reported [him]259-benny upsher as “[0-i] wounded and missing . ” The words had taken on a hideous significance in the last months . Freezing to death between the lines , mutilation and torture , or weeks of slow agony in [German hospitals]3580-german hospitals : these were the alternative visions associated with the now familiar formula . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew had spent a part of [his]212-mr. mayhew time collecting details about the treatment of [those who had fallen , alive but wounded]3581-those who had fallen , alive but wounded , into German hands ; and [Campton]174-campton guessed that as [he]174-campton sat there every one of these details , cruel , sanguinary , remorseless , had started to life , and that [all [their]634-the three men victims]3582-all their victims wore the face of [Benny]259-benny upsher . [The wretched man]3583-the wretched man sat speechless , so unhinged and swinging loose in [his]3583-the wretched man grief that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant and [Campton]174-campton could only look on , following the thoughts [he]3583-the wretched man was thinking , seeing the sights [he]3583-the wretched man was seeing , and each avoiding [the other]2914-the other ’s eye lest [they]634-the three men should betray to [one another]3585-one another the secret of [their]634-the three men shared exultation at [George]175-george ’s safety . Finally [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew was put in charge of [a confidential clerk]3586-a confidential clerk , who was to go with [him]212-mr. mayhew to [the English Military Mission]127-the english military mission in the hope of getting farther information . [He]212-mr. mayhew went away , small and shrunken , with the deprecating smile of [a man who seeks to ward off a blow]3587-a man who seeks to ward off a blow ; as [he]212-mr. mayhew left [the room]475-the room [Campton]174-campton heard [him]212-mr. mayhew say timidly to [the clerk]3589-the clerk : “[0-i] No doubt [you]1770-you speak French , [sir]2499-sir ? The words [I]0-i want do n’t seem to come to [me]0-i . ” [Campton]174-campton had meant to leave at the same time ; but some vague impulse held [him]174-campton back . [He]174-campton remembered [George]175-george ’s postscript : “[0-i] Do n’t be too savage to [Uncle Andy]229-uncle andy , ” and wished [he]174-campton could think of some friendly phrase to ease off [his]174-campton leave - taking . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant seemed to have the same wish . [He]197-mr. brant stood , erect and tightly buttoned , one small hand resting on the arm of [his]197-mr. brant desk - chair , as though [he]197-mr. brant were posing for a cabinet size , with [the photographer]3590-the photographer telling [him]197-mr. brant to look natural . [His]197-mr. brant lids twitched behind [his]197-mr. brant protective glasses , and [his]197-mr. brant upper lip , which was as straight as a ruler , detached itself by a hair ’s breadth from the lower ; but no word came . [Campton]174-campton glanced up and down the white - panelled walls , and spoke abruptly . “[229-uncle andy] There was no reason on [earth]2780-earth , ” [he]174-campton said , “[229-uncle andy] why [poor young [Upsher]259-benny upsher]1773-poor young upsher should ever have been in this thing . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant bowed . “[259-benny upsher] This sort of crazy impulse to rush into [[other people]607-other people ’s rows]1775-other people ’s rows , ” [Campton]174-campton continued with rising vehemence , “[259-benny upsher] is of no more use to a civilized state than any other unreasoned instinct . At bottom it ’s nothing but what [George]175-george calls the baseball spirit : just an ignorant passion for fisticuffs . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant looked at [him]174-campton intently . “[175-george] When did — [George]175-george say that ? ” [he]197-mr. brant asked , with [his]197-mr. brant usual cough before the name . [Campton]174-campton coloured . “[175-george] Oh — er — some time ago : in the very beginning , [I]0-i think . It was the view of [most thoughtful young fellows]1776-most thoughtful young fellows at that time . ” “[1776-most thoughtful young fellows] Quite so , ” said [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , cautiously stroking [his]197-mr. brant moustache . [Campton]174-campton ’s eyes again wandered about [the room]475-the room . “[1776-most thoughtful young fellows] _ Now _ , of course — — ” “[1776-most thoughtful young fellows] Ah—_now _ .... ” [The two men]442-the two men looked at [each other]443-each other , and [Campton]174-campton held out [his]174-campton hand . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , growing pink about the forehead , extended [his]197-mr. brant dry fingers , and [they]442-the two men shook hands in silence . XVIII In [the street]2680-the street [Campton]174-campton looked about [him]174-campton with the same confused sense as when [he]174-campton had watched [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze driving away to [Chalons]75-chalons , [[his]182-fortin - lescluze dead son]2593-his dead son ’s image in [his]182-fortin - lescluze eyes . Each time that [Campton]174-campton came in contact with [people on whom this calamity had fallen]3596-people on whom this calamity had fallen [he]174-campton grew more acutely aware of [his]174-campton own inadequacy . If [he]174-campton had been [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze it would have been impossible for [him]174-campton to go back to [Chalons]75-chalons and resume [his]174-campton task . If [he]174-campton had been [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , still less could [he]174-campton have accommodated [himself]174-campton to the intolerable , the really inconceivable , thought that [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher had vanished into that fiery furnace like a crumpled letter tossed into a grate . [Young Fortin]304-young fortin was defending [[his]304-young fortin country]1308-his country — but [Upsher]259-benny upsher , in [God]266-god ’s name what was [Benny Upsher of [Connecticut]128-connecticut]259-benny upsher doing in a war between [the continental powers]3598-the continental powers ? Suddenly [Campton]174-campton remembered that [he]174-campton had [George]175-george ’s letter in [his]174-campton pocket , and that [he]174-campton had meant to go back with it to [[Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s]1320-mrs. brant ’s . [He]174-campton had started out that morning full of the good intentions the letter had inspired ; but now [he]174-campton had no heart to carry them out . Yet [George]175-george had said : “[821-mother] Let [mother]821-mother know , and explain , please ; ” and such an injunction could not be disregarded . [He]174-campton was still hesitating on [a street corner]3600-a street corner when [he]174-campton remembered that [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony was probably on [her]221-miss anthony way [home]502-home for luncheon , and that if [he]174-campton made haste [he]174-campton might find [her]221-miss anthony despatching [her]221-miss anthony hurried meal . It was instinctive with [him]174-campton , in difficult hours , to turn to [her]221-miss anthony , less for counsel than for shelter ; [her]221-miss anthony simple unperplexed view of things was as comforting as [[his]174-campton mother]583-his mother ’s solution of the dark riddles [he]174-campton used to propound in [the nursery]3603-the nursery . [He]174-campton found [her]221-miss anthony in [[her]221-miss anthony little dining - room]3604-her little dining - room , with Delft plates askew on imitation Cordova leather , and a [Death ’s Head Pennon]305-death ’s head pennon and a Prussian helmet surmounting the nymph in cast bronze on the mantelpiece . In entering [he]174-campton faced the relentless light of a ground - glass window opening on an air - shaft ; and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony , flinging [him]174-campton a look , dropped [her]221-miss anthony fork and sprang up crying : “[175-george] [George]175-george — — ” “[175-george] [George]175-george — why [George]175-george ? ” [Campton]174-campton recovered [his]174-campton presence of mind under the shock of [her]221-miss anthony agitation . “[175-george] What made [you]175-george think of [George]175-george ? ” “[175-george] [Your]175-george — [your]175-george face , ” [she]221-miss anthony stammered , sitting down again . “[175-george] So absurd of [me]0-i .... But [you]175-george looked .... A seat for [monsieur]3217-monsieur , [Jeanne]287-jean fortin , ” [she]221-miss anthony cried over [her]221-miss anthony shoulder to [the pantry]3605-the pantry . “[287-jean fortin] Ah — [my]0-i face ? Yes , [I]0-i suppose so . [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher has disappeared — [I’ve]0-i just had to break it to [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew . ” “[0-i] Oh , [that poor young Upsher]259-benny upsher ? How dreadful ! ” [Her]221-miss anthony own face grew instantly serene . “[259-benny upsher] [I]0-i ’m so sorry — so very sorry .... Yes , yes , [you]175-george _ shall _ lunch with [me]0-i — [I]0-i know there ’s another cutlet , ” [she]221-miss anthony insisted . [He]175-george shook [his]175-george head . “[0-i] [I]0-i could n’t . ” “[0-i] Well , then , [I]0-i ’ve finished . ” [She]221-miss anthony led the way into [the drawing - room]3606-the drawing - room . There it was [her]221-miss anthony turn to face the light , and [he]175-george saw that [her]221-miss anthony own features were as perturbed as [she]221-miss anthony had apparently discovered [his]175-george to be . “[0-i] [Poor [Benny]259-benny upsher]1779-poor benny , [poor boy]1780-poor boy ! ” [she]221-miss anthony repeated , in the happy voice [she]221-miss anthony might have had if [she]221-miss anthony had been congratulating [Campton]174-campton on [the lad]1349-the lad ’s escape . [He]175-george saw that [she]221-miss anthony was still thinking not of [Upsher]259-benny upsher but of [George]175-george , and [her]221-miss anthony inability to fit [her]221-miss anthony intonation to [her]221-miss anthony words betrayed the violence of [her]221-miss anthony relief . But why had [she]221-miss anthony imagined [George]175-george to be in danger ? [Campton]174-campton recounted the scene at which [he]174-campton had just assisted , and while [she]221-miss anthony continued to murmur [her]221-miss anthony sympathy [he]175-george asked abruptly : “[1780-poor boy] Why on earth should [you]1781-you have been afraid for [George]175-george ? ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony had taken [her]221-miss anthony usual armchair . [It]3608-it was placed , as the armchairs of [elderly ladies]3609-elderly ladies usually are , with its high back to the light , and [Campton]174-campton could no longer observe the discrepancy between [her]221-miss anthony words and [her]221-miss anthony looks . This probably gave [her]221-miss anthony laugh its note of confidence . “[1781-you] [[My]0-i dear]2497-my dear , if [you]2497-my dear were to cut [me]0-i open [George]175-george ’s name would run out of every vein , ” [she]221-miss anthony said . “[2497-my dear] But in that tone — it was [your]2497-my dear tone . [You]2497-my dear thought [he]175-george ’d been — that something had happened , ” [Campton]174-campton insisted . “[2497-my dear] How could it , where [he]175-george is ? ” [She]221-miss anthony shrugged [her]221-miss anthony shoulders in the “[2497-my dear] foreign ” way [she]221-miss anthony had picked up in [her]221-miss anthony youth . The gesture was as incongruous as [her]221-miss anthony slang , but it had become part of [her]221-miss anthony physical self , which lay in a loose mosaic of incongruities over the solid crystal block of [her]221-miss anthony character . “[2497-my dear] Why , indeed ? [I]0-i suppose there are risks everywhere , are n’t [there]467-there ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know . ” [He]0-i pulled out the letter [he]0-i had received that morning . A sudden light had illuminated it , and [his]0-i hand shook . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t even know where [George]175-george is any longer . ” [She]221-miss anthony seemed to hesitate for a moment , and then asked calmly : “[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean ? ” “[0-i] Here — look at this . [We]1784-we ’re to write to [[his]175-george base]2568-his base . [I]0-i ’m to tell [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother of the change . ” [He]0-i waited , cursing the faint winter light , and the protecting back of [her]221-miss anthony chair . “[0-i] What can it mean , ” [he]0-i broke out , “[175-george] except that [he]175-george ’s left [Sainte Menehould]306-sainte menehould , that [he]175-george ’s been sent elsewhere , and that [he]175-george does n’t want [us]1784-we to find out where ? ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony bent [her]221-miss anthony long nose over the page . [Her]221-miss anthony hand held the letter steadily , and [he]0-i guessed , as [she]221-miss anthony perused it , that [she]221-miss anthony had had one of the same kind , and had already drawn [her]221-miss anthony own conclusions . What they were , that first startled “[175-george] [George]175-george ! ” seemed to say . But would [she]221-miss anthony ever let [Campton]174-campton see as far into [her]221-miss anthony thoughts again ? [He]0-i continued to watch [her]221-miss anthony hands patiently , since nothing was to be discovered of [her]221-miss anthony face . The hands folded the letter with precision , and handed it back to [him]0-i . “[175-george] Yes : [I]0-i see why [you]175-george thought that — [one]398-one might have , ” [she]221-miss anthony surprised [him]0-i by conceding . Then , darting at [his]0-i unprotected face a gaze [he]0-i seemed to feel though [he]0-i could not see it : “[175-george] If it had meant that [George]175-george had been ordered to the front , how would [you]175-george have felt ? ” [she]221-miss anthony demanded . [He]0-i had not expected the question , and though in the last weeks [he]0-i had so often propounded it to [himself]0-i , it caught [him]0-i in the chest like a blow . A sense of humiliation , a longing to lay [his]0-i weakness bare , suddenly rose in [him]0-i , and [he]0-i bowed [his]0-i head . “[175-george] [I]0-i could n’t ... [I]0-i could n’t bear it , ” [he]0-i stammered . [She]221-miss anthony was silent for an interval ; then [she]221-miss anthony stood up , and laying [her]221-miss anthony hand on [his]0-i shaking shoulder crossed [the room]475-the room to a desk in which [he]0-i knew [she]221-miss anthony kept [her]221-miss anthony private papers . [Her]221-miss anthony keys clinked , and a moment later [she]221-miss anthony handed [him]0-i a letter . It was in [George]175-george ’s writing , and dated on the same day as [his]0-i own . “[0-i] [Dearest old girl]1788-dearest old girl , nothing new but [my]0-i address . Hereafter please write to [[our]1789-our Base]1790-our base . This order has just been lowered from the empyrean at the end of an endless reel of red tape . What it means [nobody]882-nobody knows . It does not appear to imply an immediate change of Headquarters ; but even if such a change comes , [my]0-i job is likely to remain the same . [I]0-i ’m getting used to it , and no wonder , for one day differeth not from another , and [I]0-i ’ve had many of them now . Take care of [Dad]205-dad and [mother]821-mother , and of [[your]1788-dearest old girl matchless self]1793-your matchless self . [I]0-i ’m writing to [father]573-father to - day . [Your]1788-dearest old girl [George]175-george the First — and Last ( or [I]0-i ’ll know why ) . ” The two letters bore one another out in a way which carried conviction . [Campton]174-campton saw that [his]174-campton sudden doubts must have been produced ( since [he]174-campton had not felt [them]3611-them that morning ) by the agonizing experience [he]174-campton had undergone : the vision of [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher had unmanned [him]174-campton . [George]175-george was safe , and asked only to remain so : that was evident from both letters . And as the certainty of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s acquiescence once more penetrated [Campton]174-campton it brought with it a fresh reaction of shame . Ashamed — yes , [he]174-campton had begun to be ashamed of [George]175-george as well as of [himself]174-campton . Under the touch of [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ’s implacable honesty [his]174-campton last pretenses shrivelled up , and [he]174-campton longed to abase [himself]174-campton . [He]174-campton lifted [his]174-campton head and looked at [her]3613-her , remembering all [she]3613-her would be able to read in [his]174-campton eyes . “[1788-dearest old girl] [You]1795-you ’re satisfied ? ” [she]3613-her enquired . “[1795-you] Yes . If that ’s the word . ” [He]174-campton stretched [his]174-campton hand toward [her]3613-her , and then drew it back . “[266-god] But it ’s _ not _ : it ’s not the word any longer . ” [He]174-campton laboured with the need of self - expression , and the opposing instinct of concealing feelings too complex for [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s simple gaze . How could [he]174-campton say : “[266-god] [I]0-i ’m satisfied ; but [I]0-i wish to [God]266-god that [George]175-george were not ” ? And was [he]174-campton satisfied , after all ? And how could [he]174-campton define , or even be sure that [he]174-campton was actually experiencing , a feeling so contradictory that it seemed to be made up of anxiety for [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s safety , shame at that anxiety , shame at [George]175-george ’s own complacent acceptance of [his]175-george lot , and terror of a possible change in that lot ? There were hours when it seemed to [Campton]174-campton that [the Furies]3615-the furies were listening , and ready to fling [their]3615-the furies awful answer to [him]174-campton if [he]174-campton as much as whispered to [himself]174-campton : “[266-god] Would to [God]266-god that [George]175-george were not satisfied ! ” The sense of [their]3615-the furies haunting presence laid its clutch on [him]174-campton , and caused [him]174-campton , after a pause , to finish [his]174-campton phrase in another tone . “[266-god] No ; satisfied ’s not the word ; [I]0-i ’m _ glad _ [George]175-george is out of it ! ” [he]174-campton exclaimed . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony was folding away the letter as calmly as if it had been a refugee record . [She]1796-she did not appear to notice the change in [Campton]174-campton ’s voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t pretend to [your]1796-she sublime detachment : [you]1796-she ’ve never had [a child]1072-a child , ” [he]0-i sneered . ( Certainly , if [the Furies]307-the furies were listening , [they]3616-they would put that down to [his]0-i credit ! ) “[1796-she] Oh , [my]0-i poor [John]174-campton , ” [she]1796-she said ; then [she]1796-she locked the desk , took [her]1796-she hat from the lamp - chimney on which it had been hanging , jammed it down on [her]1796-she head like a helmet , and remarked : “[174-campton] [We]1798-we ’ll go together , shall [we]1798-we ? It ’s time [I]0-i got back to [the office]1357-the office . ” On the way [downstairs]2942-downstairs [both]2972-both were silent . [Campton]174-campton ’s ears echoed with [his]174-campton stupid taunt , and [he]174-campton glanced at [her]1796-she without daring to speak . On the last landing [she]1796-she paused and said : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll see [Julia]194-julia this evening about [George]175-george ’s change of address . [She]194-julia may be worried ; and [I]0-i can explain — [I]0-i can take [her]194-julia [my]0-i letter . ” “[194-julia] Oh , do , ” [he]174-campton assented . “[194-julia] And tell [her]194-julia — tell [her]194-julia — if [she]194-julia needs [me]0-i — — ” It was as much of a message as [he]174-campton found courage for . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony nodded . XIX One day [Mme . Lebel]195-mme said : “[194-julia] [The first horse - chestnuts]1800-the first horse - chestnuts are in bloom . And [monsieur]3217-monsieur must really buy [himself]3217-monsieur some new shirts . ” [Campton]174-campton looked at [her]195-mme in surprise . [She]195-mme spoke in a different voice ; [he]174-campton wondered if [she]195-mme had had good news of [[her]195-mme grandchildren]3619-her grandchildren . Then [he]174-campton saw that the furrows in [her]195-mme old face were as deep as ever , and that the change in [her]195-mme voice was simply an unconscious response to the general stirring of sap , the spring need to go on living , through everything and in spite of everything . _ On se fait une raison _ , as [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme would have said . Life had to go on , and new shirts had to be bought . [No one]2702-no one knew why it was necessary , but [every one]832-every one felt that it was ; and here were the horse - chestnuts once more actively confirming it . [Habit]308-habit laid its compelling grasp on the wires of the poor broken marionettes with which the Furies had been playing , and [they]832-every one responded , though with feebler flappings , to the accustomed jerk . In [Campton]174-campton the stirring of the sap had been a cold and languid process , chiefly felt in [his]174-campton reluctance to go on with [his]174-campton relief work . [He]174-campton had tried to close [his]174-campton ears to the whispers of [his]174-campton own lassitude , vexed , after the first impulse of self - dedication , to find that no vocation declared itself , that [his]174-campton task became each day more tedious as well as more painful . Theoretically , the pain ought to have stimulated [him]174-campton : perpetual immersion in that sea of anguish should have quickened [his]174-campton effort to help the poor creatures sinking under its waves . The woe of the war had had that effect on [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony , on [young Boylston]247-boylston , on [Mlle]294-mlle . davril . [Davril]294-mlle . davril , on [the greater number of [[his]174-campton friends]2655-his friends]3622-the greater number of his friends . But [their]832-every one ardour left [him]174-campton cold . [He]174-campton wanted to help , [he]174-campton wanted it , [he]174-campton was sure , as earnestly as [they]832-every one ; but the longing was not an inspiration to [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton felt more and more that to work listlessly was to work ineffectually . “[0-i] [I]0-i give [the poor devils]1802-the poor devils so many boots and money - orders a day ; [you]1803-you give [them]1802-the poor devils [yourself]1803-you , and so does [Boylston]247-boylston , ” [he]174-campton complained to [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ; who murmured : “[247-boylston] Ah , [_ Boylston]247-boylston _ — — ” as if that point of the remark were alone worth noticing . “[247-boylston] At [his]247-boylston age too ; it ’s extraordinary , the way [the boy]416-the boy ’s got out of [himself]247-boylston . ” “[416-the boy] Or into [himself]247-boylston , rather . [He]247-boylston _ was _ [a pottering boy]1805-a pottering boy before — now [he]247-boylston ’s [a man]2492-a man , with [a man]2492-a man ’s sense of things . ” “[247-boylston] Yes ; but [his]247-boylston patience , [his]247-boylston way of getting into [their]1802-the poor devils minds , [their]1802-the poor devils prejudices , [their]1802-the poor devils meannesses , [their]1802-the poor devils miseries ! [He]247-boylston does n’t seem to [me]0-i like [the kind who was meant to be a missionary]1808-the kind who was meant to be a missionary . ” “[247-boylston] Not a bit of it .... But [he]247-boylston ’s burnt up with shame at [our]1809-our not being in the war — as [all the young Americans]1810-all the young americans are . ” [Campton]174-campton made an impatient movement . “[259-benny upsher] [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher again — — ! Ca n’t [we]1809-our let [[our]1809-our government]1811-our government decide all that for [us]1809-our ? What else did [we]1809-our elect it for , [I]0-i wonder ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder , ” echoed [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony . Talks of this kind were irritating and unprofitable , and [Campton]174-campton did not again raise the question . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s vision was too simplifying to penetrate far into [his]247-boylston doubts , and after nearly a year ’s incessant contact with the most savage realities [her]221-miss anthony mind still seemed at ease in its old formulas . Simplicity , after all , was the best safeguard in such hours . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant was as absorbed in [her]196-mrs. brant task as [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony . Since [[the Brant villa]3624-the brant villa at [Deauville]6-deauville]3625-the brant villa at deauville had been turned into [a hospital]3626-a hospital [she]196-mrs. brant was always on [the road]3627-the road , in [a refulgent new motor emblazoned with a Red Cross]3628-a refulgent new motor emblazoned with a red cross , carrying supplies , rushing down with great surgeons , hurrying back to committee meetings and conferences with [the Service de Santé]3629-the service de santé ( for [she]196-mrs. brant and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant were now among [the leaders in American relief work in [Paris]5-paris]3630-the leaders in american relief work in paris ) , and throwing open [the Avenue Marigny drawing - rooms]3631-the avenue marigny drawing - rooms for concerts , lectures and such sober philanthropic gaieties as society was beginning to countenance . On the day when [Mme . Lebel]195-mme told [Campton]174-campton that the horse - chestnuts were in blossom and [he]247-boylston must buy some new shirts [he]247-boylston was particularly in need of such incentives . [He]247-boylston had made up [his]247-boylston mind to go to see [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant about a concert for “[0-i] The Friends of French Art ” which was to be held in [[her]196-mrs. brant house]3632-her house . Ever since [George]175-george had asked [him]247-boylston to see something of [[his]247-boylston mother]583-his mother [Campton]174-campton had used the pretext of charitable collaboration as the best way of getting over [their]3634-their fundamental lack of anything to say to [each other]443-each other . The appearance of [the Champs Elysées]309-the champs elysées confirmed [Mme . Lebel]195-mme ’s announcement . Everywhere the punctual rosy spikes were rising above unfolding green ; and [Campton]174-campton , looking up at them , remembered once thinking how [Nature]310-nature had adapted [herself]310-nature to the scene in overhanging with [her]310-nature own pink lamps and green fans the lamps and fans of the _ cafés chantants _ beneath . The latter lights had long since been extinguished , the fans folded up ; and as [he]247-boylston passed the bent and broken arches of electric light , the iron chairs and dead plants in paintless boxes , all heaped up like the scenery of [a bankrupt theatre]3636-a bankrupt theatre , [he]247-boylston felt the pang of [Nature]310-nature ’s obstinate renewal in a world of death . Yet [he]247-boylston also felt the stir of the blossoming trees in the form of a more restless discontent , a duller despair , a new sense of inadequacy . How could war go on when spring had come ? [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant , having reduced [[her]196-mrs. brant household]3637-her household and given over [[her]196-mrs. brant drawing - rooms]3638-her drawing - rooms to charity , received in [[her]196-mrs. brant boudoir]3639-her boudoir , [a small room contrived by a clever upholsterer to simulate a seclusion of which [she]196-mrs. brant had never felt the need]3640-a small room contrived by a clever upholsterer to simulate a seclusion of which she had never felt the need . Photographs strewed the low tables ; and facing the door [Campton]174-campton saw [George]175-george ’s last portrait , in uniform , enclosed in an expensive frame . [Campton]174-campton had received the same photograph , and thrust it into a drawer ; [he]174-campton thought [a young man on a safe staff job]3641-a young man on a safe staff job rather ridiculous in uniform , and at the same time the sight filled [him]174-campton with a secret dread . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant was bidding goodbye to [a lady in mourning whom [Campton]174-campton did not know]3642-a lady in mourning whom campton did not know . [His]174-campton approach through the carpeted antechamber had been unnoticed , and as [he]174-campton entered [the room]475-the room [he]174-campton heard [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant say in French , apparently in reply to a remark of [[her]196-mrs. brant visitor]2940-her visitor : “[311-bridge] [Bridge]311-bridge , _ chère Madame _ ? No ; not yet . [I]0-i confess [I]0-i have n’t the courage to take up [my]0-i old life . [[We]1812-we mothers]1813-we mothers with [sons]1814-sons at the front .... ” “[1813-we mothers] Ah , ” exclaimed [the other lady]3645-the other lady , “[1813-we mothers] there [I]0-i do n’t agree with [you]0-i . [I]0-i think one owes it to [them]1814-sons to go on as if [one]398-one were as little afraid as _ [they]1814-sons _ are . That is what all [[my]0-i sons]1816-my sons prefer .... Even , ” [she]3645-the other lady added , lowering [her]3645-the other lady voice but lifting [her]3645-the other lady head higher , “[0-i] even , [I]0-i ’m sure , [the one who is buried by [the Marne]265-the marne]1817-the one who is buried by the marne . ” With a flush on [her]3645-the other lady handsome face [she]3645-the other lady pressed [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s hand and passed out . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant had caught sight of [Campton]174-campton as [she]196-mrs. brant received the rebuke . [Her]196-mrs. brant colour rose slightly , and [she]196-mrs. brant said with a smile : “[1817-the one who is buried by the marne] So many women ca n’t get on without amusement . ” “[1817-the one who is buried by the marne] No , ” [he]174-campton agreed . There was a pause , and then [he]174-campton asked : “[1817-the one who is buried by the marne] Who was it ? ” “[1818-the widow] [The Marquise de Tranlay]312-the marquise de tranlay — [the widow]1818-the widow . ” “[1818-the widow] Where are [the sons [she]312-the marquise de tranlay spoke of]1819-the sons she spoke of ? ” “[1819-the sons she spoke of] There are three left : one in the _ Chasseurs à Pied _ ; [the youngest]1820-the youngest , who volunteered at seventeen , in [the artillery in [the Argonne]81-the argonne]1821-the artillery in the argonne ; [the third]1822-the third , badly wounded , in [hospital]1105-hospital at [Compiègne]65-compiègne . And [the eldest]1824-the eldest killed . [I]0-i simply ca n’t understand .... ” “[0-i] Why , ” [Campton]174-campton interrupted , “[0-i] did [you]0-i speak as if [George]175-george were at the front ? Do [you]0-i usually speak of [him]175-george in that way ? ” [Her]312-the marquise de tranlay silence and [her]312-the marquise de tranlay deepening flush made [him]0-i feel the unkindness of the question . “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t mean ... forgive [me]0-i , ” [he]0-i said . “[0-i] Only sometimes , when [I]0-i see [women like that]1825-women like that [I]0-i ’m — — ” “[0-i] Well ? ” [she]312-the marquise de tranlay questioned . [He]0-i was silent in [his]0-i turn , and [she]312-the marquise de tranlay did not insist . [They]3646-their sat facing [each other]443-each other , each forgetting the purpose of [their]3646-their meeting . For the hundredth time [he]0-i felt the uselessness of trying to carry out [George]175-george ’s filial injunction : between [himself]0-i and [[George]175-george ’s mother]3033-george ’s mother these months of fiery trial seemed to have loosed instead of tightening the links . [He]0-i wandered back to [Montmartre]1-montmartre through [the bereft and beautiful city]3649-the bereft and beautiful city . The light lay on [it]1-montmartre in wide silvery washes , harmonizing the grey stone , the pale foliage , and a sky piled with clouds which seemed to rebuild in translucid masses [the monuments below]3650-the monuments below . [He]0-i caught [himself]0-i once more viewing the details of the scene in the terms of [his]0-i trade . [River]130-river , [pavements]3651-pavements , terraces heavy with trees , the whole crowded sky - line from [Notre Dame]131-notre dame to [the Panthéon]3652-the panthéon , instead of presenting [themselves]3646-their in [their]3646-their bare reality , were transposed into [a painter]3289-a painter ’s vision . And the faces around [him]0-i became again the starting - point of rapid incessant combinations of line and colour , as if the visible world were once more at its old trick of weaving itself into magic designs . The reawakening of this instinct deepened [Campton]174-campton ’s sense of unrest , and made [him]174-campton feel more than ever unfitted for a life in which such things were no longer of account , in which it seemed a disloyalty even to think of them . [He]0-i returned to [the studio]370-the studio , having promised to deal with some office work which [he]0-i had carried [home]502-home the night before . The papers lay on the table ; but [he]0-i turned to the window and looked out over [his]0-i budding lilacs at [the new strange]3656-the new strange [Paris]5-paris . [He]0-i remembered that it was almost a year since [he]0-i had leaned in the same place , gazing down on [the wise and frivolous old city]3657-the wise and frivolous old city in [[her]3656-the new strange summer dishabille]3658-her summer dishabille while [he]0-i planned [his]0-i journey to [Africa]16-africa with [George]175-george ; and something [George]175-george had once quoted from [Faust]313-faust came drifting through [his]0-i mind : “[0-i] Take care ! [You]1826-you ’ve broken [[my]0-i beautiful world]1827-my beautiful world ! There ’ll be splinters .... ” Ah , yes , splinters , splinters ... [everybody]3070-everybody ’s hands were red with them ! What retribution devised by [man]1658-man could be commensurate with the crime of destroying [his]1658-man beautiful world ? [Campton]174-campton sat down to the task of collating [office]3661-office files . [His]174-campton bell rang , and [he]174-campton started up , as much surprised as if the simplest events had become unusual . It would be natural enough that [Dastrey]220-adele anthony or [Boylston]247-boylston should drop in — or even [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony — but [his]174-campton heart beat as if it might be [George]175-george . [He]174-campton limped to the door , and found [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . [She]255-mrs. talkett said : “[0-i] May [I]0-i come in ? ” and did so without waiting for [his]174-campton answer . The rapidity of [her]255-mrs. talkett entrance surprised [him]174-campton less than the change in [her]255-mrs. talkett appearance . But for the one glimpse of [her]255-mrs. talkett dishevelled elegance , when [she]255-mrs. talkett had rushed into [[Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s drawing - room]489-mrs. brant ’s drawing - room on the day after war was declared , [he]174-campton had seen [her]255-mrs. talkett only in a nursing uniform , as absorbed in [her]255-mrs. talkett work as if it had been a long - thwarted vocation . Now [she]255-mrs. talkett stood before [him]174-campton in raiment so delicately springlike that it seemed an emanation of the day . [Care]314-care had dropped from [her]255-mrs. talkett with [her]255-mrs. talkett professional garb , and [she]255-mrs. talkett smiled as though [he]174-campton must guess the reason . In ordinary times [he]174-campton would have thought : “[0-i] [She]1828-she ’s in love — — ” but that explanation was one which seemed to belong to other days . It reminded [him]174-campton , however , how little [he]174-campton knew of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett , who , after [René Davril]284-rené davril ’s death , had vanished from [his]174-campton life as abruptly as [she]255-mrs. talkett had entered it . Allusions to “[315-the talketts] [the Talketts]315-the talketts , ” picked up now and again at [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ’s , led [him]174-campton to conjecture [an invisible husband in the background]3663-an invisible husband in the background ; but all [he]174-campton knew of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett was what [she]255-mrs. talkett had told [him]174-campton of [her]255-mrs. talkett “[315-the talketts] artistic ” yearnings , and what [he]174-campton had been able to divine from [her]255-mrs. talkett empty questioning eyes , from certain sweet inflections when [she]255-mrs. talkett spoke of [[her]255-mrs. talkett wounded soldiers]3664-her wounded soldiers , and from the precise and finished language with which [she]255-mrs. talkett clothed [her]255-mrs. talkett unfinished and imprecise thoughts . All these indications made up an image not unlike that of the fashion - plate torn from its context of which [she]255-mrs. talkett had reminded [him]174-campton at [their]3665-their first meeting ; and [he]174-campton looked at [her]255-mrs. talkett with indifference , wondering why [she]255-mrs. talkett had come . With an abrupt gesture [she]255-mrs. talkett pulled the pin from [her]255-mrs. talkett heavily - plumed hat , tossed it on the divan , and said : “[315-the talketts] [Dear Master]3279-dear master , [I]0-i just want to sit with [you]3279-dear master and have [you]3279-dear master talk to [me]0-i . ” [She]255-mrs. talkett dropped down beside [her]255-mrs. talkett hat , clasped [her]255-mrs. talkett thin hands about [her]255-mrs. talkett thin knee , and broke out , as if [she]255-mrs. talkett had already forgotten that [she]255-mrs. talkett wanted [him]3279-dear master to talk to [her]255-mrs. talkett : “[3279-dear master] Do [you]3279-dear master know , [I]0-i ’ve made up [my]0-i mind to begin to live again — to live [my]0-i own life , [I]0-i mean , to be [my]0-i real _ [me]0-i _ , after all these dreadful months of exile from [myself]0-i . [I]0-i see now _ that _ that is [my]0-i real duty — just as it is [yours]1830-you , just as it is that of [every artist]1831-every artist and [every creator]1832-every creator . Do n’t [you]1830-you feel as [I]0-i do ? Do n’t [you]1830-you agree with [me]0-i ? [We]1833-we _ must _ save Beauty for [the world]2535-the world ; before it is too late [we]1833-we must save it out of this awful wreck and ruin . It sounds ridiculously presumptuous , does n’t it , to say ‘ [we]1833-we ’ in talking of [a great genius like [you]1830-you and a poor little speck of dust like [me]0-i]1835-a great genius like you and a poor little speck of dust like me ? But after all there is the same instinct in [us]1833-we , the same craving , the same desire to realize Beauty , though [you]1830-you do it so magnificently and so — so objectively , and [I]0-i ... ” [she]3666-she paused , unclasped [her]3666-she hands , and lifted [her]3666-she lovely bewildered eyes , “[0-i] [I]0-i do it only by a ribbon in [my]0-i hair , a flower in a vase , a way of looping a curtain , or placing a lacquer screen in the right light . But [I]0-i ought n’t to be ashamed of [my]0-i limitations , do [you]1830-you think [I]0-i ought ? Surely [every one]832-every one ought to be helping to save Beauty ; [every one]832-every one is needed , even [the humblest and most ignorant of [us]1833-we]1838-the humblest and most ignorant of us , or else [the world]2535-the world will be all death and ugliness . And after all , ugliness is the only _ real _ death , is n’t it ? ” [She]3666-she drew a deep breath and added : “[0-i] It has done [me]0-i good already to sit here and listen to [you]1830-you . ” [Campton]174-campton , a few weeks previously , would have been amused , or perhaps merely irritated . But in the interval [he]174-campton had become aware in [himself]174-campton of the same irresistible craving to “[0-i] live , ” as [she]3666-she put it , and as [he]174-campton had heard it formulated , that very day , by [the mourning mother who had so sharply rebuked [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant]3667-the mourning mother who had so sharply rebuked mrs. brant . The spring was stirring [them]1833-we all in [their]1833-we different ways , secreting in [them]1833-we the sap which craved to burst into bridge - parties , or the painting of masterpieces , or a consciousness of the need for new shirts . “[0-i] But what am [I]0-i in all this ? ” [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett rushed on , sparing [him]174-campton the trouble of a reply . “[0-i] Nothing but the match that lights the flame ! Sometimes [I]0-i imagine that [I]0-i might put what [I]0-i mean into poetry ... [I]0-i _ have _ scribbled a few things , [you]1830-you know ... but that ’s not what [I]0-i was going to tell [you]1830-you . It ’s [you]1830-you , [dear Master]3279-dear master , who must set [us]1841-our the example of getting back to [our]1841-our work , [our]1841-our real work , whatever it is . What have [you]1830-you done in all these dreadful months — the real [You]1830-you ? Nothing ! And [the world]2535-the world will be the poorer for it ever after . [Master]1843-master , [you]1830-you must paint again — [you]1830-you must begin to - day ! ” [Campton]174-campton gave an uneasy laugh . “[1843-master] Oh — paint ! ” [He]174-campton waved [his]174-campton hand toward the office files of “[1843-master] The Friends of French Art . ” “[1843-master] There ’s [my]0-i work . ” “[1830-you] Not the real [you]1830-you . It ’s [[your]1830-you dummy]1844-your dummy ’s work — just as [my]0-i nursing has been [mine]0-i . Oh , [one]398-one did [one]398-one ’s best — but all the while beauty and art and the eternal things were perishing ! And what will [the world]2535-the world be like without [them]1848-them ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i sha n’t be here , ” [Campton]174-campton growled . “[0-i] But [[your]1830-you son]924-your son will . ” [She]1830-you looked at [him]174-campton profoundly . “[0-i] [You]0-i know [I]0-i know [[your]0-i son]924-your son — [[we’re]1851-we’re [friends]1248-friends]1852-we’re friends . And [I]0-i ’m sure [he]924-your son would feel as [I]0-i feel — [he]924-your son would tell [you]0-i to go back to [your]0-i painting . ” For months past any allusion to [George]175-george had put [Campton]174-campton on [his]174-campton guard , stiffening [him]174-campton with improvised defences . But this appeal of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s found [him]174-campton unprepared , demoralized by the spring sweetness , and by [his]174-campton secret sense of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s connivance with it . What was war — any war — but an old European disease , an ancestral blood - madness seizing on the first pretext to slake its frenzy ? [Campton]174-campton reminded [himself]174-campton again that [he]174-campton was [the son of free institutions]3669-the son of free institutions , of [a country]473-a country in no way responsible for the centuries of sinister diplomacy which had brought [Europe]42-europe to ruin , and was now trying to drag down [America]2-america . [George]175-george was right , [the Brants]203-the brants were right , [this young woman through whose lips [Campton]174-campton ’s own secret instinct spoke]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke was right . [He]174-campton was silent so long that [she]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke rose with the anxious frown that appeared to be [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke way of blushing , and faltered out : “[924-your son] [I]0-i ’m boring [you]1854-you — [I’d]0-i better go . ” [She]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke picked up [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke hat and held its cataract of feathers poised above [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke slanted head . “[0-i] Wait — let [me]0-i do [you]0-i like that ! ” [Campton]174-campton cried . It had never before occurred to [him]174-campton that [she]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke was paintable ; but as [she]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke stood there with uplifted arm the long line flowing from [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke wrist to [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke hip suddenly wound itself about [him]174-campton like a net . “[0-i] [Me]0-i ? ” [she]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke stammered , standing motionless , as if frightened by the excess of [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke triumph . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i mind ? ” [he]174-campton queried ; and hardly hearing [her]3671-this young woman through whose lips campton ’s own secret instinct spoke faltered out : “[0-i] Mind ? When it was what [I]0-i came for ! ” [he]174-campton dragged forth an easel , flung on it the first canvas [he]174-campton could lay hands on ( though [he]174-campton knew it was the wrong shape and size ) , and found [himself]174-campton instantly transported into [the lost world]3672-the lost world which was the only real one . [XX]316-xx For a month [Campton]174-campton painted on in transcendent bliss . [His]174-campton first stroke carried [him]174-campton out of space and time , into [a region where all that had become numbed and atrophied in [him]174-campton]3673-a region where all that had become numbed and atrophied in him could expand and breathe . Lines , images , colours were again the sole facts : [he]174-campton plunged into their whirling circles like a stranded sea - creature into [the sea]3674-the sea . Once more every face was not a vague hieroglyph , a curtain drawn before an invisible aggregate of wants and woes , but a work of art , a flower in a pattern , to be dealt with on its own merits , like a bronze or a jewel . During the first day or two [his]174-campton hand halted ; but the sense of insufficiency was a goad , and [he]174-campton fought with [his]174-campton subject till [he]174-campton felt a strange ease in every renovated muscle , and [his]174-campton model became like a musical instrument on which [he]174-campton played with careless mastery . [He]174-campton had transferred [his]174-campton easel to [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s apartment]3675-mrs. talkett ’s apartment . [It]3675-mrs. talkett ’s apartment was [an odd patchwork place , full of bold beginnings and doubtful pauses]3676-an odd patchwork place , full of bold beginnings and doubtful pauses , rash surrenders to the newest fashions and abrupt insurrections against them , where [Louis Philippe mahogany]317-louis philippe mahogany had entrenched itself against the aggression of _ art nouveau _ hangings , and the frail grace of eighteenth - century armchairs shed derision on lumpy modern furniture painted like hobby - horses at a fair . It amused [Campton]174-campton to do [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett against such a background : [her]255-mrs. talkett thin personality needed to be filled out by the visible results of its many quests and cravings . There were people one could sit down before a blank wall , and all [their]3677-their world was there , in the curves of [their]3677-their faces and the way [their]3677-their hands lay in [their]3677-their laps ; others , like [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett , seemed to be made out of the reflection of what surrounded [them]3677-their , as if [they]3677-their had been born of a tricky grouping of looking - glasses , and would vanish if it were changed . At first [Campton]174-campton was steeped in the mere sensual joy of [his]174-campton art ; but after a few days the play of the mirrors began to interest [him]174-campton . [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett had abandoned [her]255-mrs. talkett hospital work , and was trying , as [she]255-mrs. talkett said , to “[1855-herself] recreate [herself]1855-herself . ” In this [she]255-mrs. talkett was aided by [a number of people who struck [Campton]174-campton as rather too young not to have found some other job , or too old to care any longer for that particular one]3678-a number of people who struck campton as rather too young not to have found some other job , or too old to care any longer for that particular one . But all this did not trouble [his]174-campton newly recovered serenity . [He]174-campton seemed to [himself]174-campton , somehow , like a drowned body — but drowned in a toy aquarium — still staring about with living eyes , but aware of [the other people only as shapes swimming by with a flash of exotic fins]3679-the other people only as shapes swimming by with a flash of exotic fins . [They]3677-their were enclosed together , all of [them]3677-their , in an unreal luminous sphere , mercifully screened against the reality from which a common impulse of horror had driven [them]3677-their ; and since [he]174-campton was among [them]3677-their it was not [his]174-campton business to wonder at [the others]3170-the others . So , through the cloud of [his]174-campton art , [he]174-campton looked out on [them]3170-the others impartially . [The high priestess of [the group]2772-the group]3681-the high priestess of the group was [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , with [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew as [[her]3681-the high priestess of the group acolyte]3683-her acolyte . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew was still in pursuit of Atrocities : [he]212-mr. mayhew was in fact almost the only member of [the group who did not rather ostentatiously disavow the obligation to “[1855-herself] carry on . ”]3684-the group who did not rather ostentatiously disavow the obligation to “ carry on . ” But [he]212-mr. mayhew had discovered that to discharge this sacred task [he]212-mr. mayhew must vary it by frequent intervals of relaxation . [He]212-mr. mayhew explained to [Campton]174-campton that [he]212-mr. mayhew had found it to be “[1856-his] [his]1856-his duty to rest ” ; and [he]212-mr. mayhew was indefatigable in the performance of duty . [He]212-mr. mayhew had therefore , with an expenditure of eloquence which [Campton]174-campton thought surprisingly slight , persuaded [Boylston]247-boylston to become [[his]212-mr. mayhew understudy]3685-his understudy , and devote several hours a day to the whirling activities of [the shrimp - pink Bureau of Atrocities]3686-the shrimp - pink bureau of atrocities at [the Nouveau Luxe]1265-the nouveau luxe . [Campton]174-campton , at first , could not understand how [the astute Boylston]247-boylston had allowed [himself]247-boylston to be drawn into the eddy ; but it turned out that [Boylston]247-boylston ’s astuteness had drawn [him]247-boylston in . “[1857-you] [You]1857-you see , there ’s an awful lot of money to be got out of it , one way and another , and [I]0-i know a use for every penny — that is , [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [I]0-i do , ” [the young man]2749-the young man modestly explained ; adding , in response to [the painter]540-the painter ’s puzzled stare , that [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s harrowing appeals were beginning to bring from [America]2-america immense sums for [the Victims]1743-the victims , and that [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , while immensely gratified by the effect of [his]212-mr. mayhew eloquence , and the prestige it was bringing [him]212-mr. mayhew in [French social and governmental circles]3691-french social and governmental circles , had not the cloudiest notion how the funds should be used , and had begged [Boylston]247-boylston to advise [him]212-mr. mayhew . It was owing to this that [the ex - Delegate to [the Hague]996-the hague]3692-the ex - delegate to the hague was able , with a light conscience , to seek the repose of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s company and , with a smile of the widest initiation , to listen to the subversive conversation of [[her]255-mrs. talkett familiars]3694-her familiars . “[0-i] Subversive ” was the motto of [the group]2772-the group . [Every one]832-every one was engaged in attacking some theory of art or life or letters which [nobody in particular]3697-nobody in particular defended . Even [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett — [a kindly young man with eye - glasses and glossy hair]3698-a kindly young man with eye - glasses and glossy hair , who roamed about straightening the furniture , like [a gentlemanly detective watching the presents at a wedding]3699-a gentlemanly detective watching the presents at a wedding — owned to [Campton]174-campton that _ [he]0-i _ was subversive ; and on [the painter]540-the painter ’s pressing for a definition , added : “[221-miss anthony] Why , [I]0-i do n’t believe in anything _ [she]1858-she _ does n’t believe in , ” while [his]0-i eye - glasses shyly followed [[his]0-i wife]516-his wife ’s course among the teacups . Mme . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , though obviously anxious to retain [her]179-de dolmetsch hold on [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , did not restrict [herself]179-de dolmetsch to such mild fare , but exercised [her]179-de dolmetsch matchless eyes on [a troop of followers]3702-a troop of followers : [the shock - haired pianist who accompanied [her]179-de dolmetsch recitations]3703-the shock - haired pianist who accompanied her recitations , [a straight - backed young American diplomatist whose collars seemed a part of [his]0-i career]3704-a straight - backed young american diplomatist whose collars seemed a part of his career , [a lustrous South American millionaire]3705-a lustrous south american millionaire , and [a short squat Sicilian who designed the costumes for [the pianist]3707-the pianist ’s unproduced ballets]3706-a short squat sicilian who designed the costumes for the pianist ’s unproduced ballets . [All these people]3406-all these people appeared to believe intensely in [each other]443-each other ’s reality and importance ; but it gradually came over [Campton]174-campton that all of [them]3406-all these people , excepting [[their]3406-all these people host]3710-their host and [hostess]3711-hostess , knew that [they]3406-all these people were merely masquerading . To [Campton]174-campton , used to the hard - working world of art , this playing at [Bohemia]132-bohemia seemed a nursery - game ; but the scene acquired an unexpected solidity from the appearance in it , one day , of [the banker Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein , who strolled in as naturally as if [he]180-jorgenstein had been dropping into [[Campton]174-campton ’s studio]393-campton ’s studio to enquire into the progress of [his]180-jorgenstein own portrait . “[1858-she] [I]0-i must come and look [you]1859-you up , [Campton]174-campton — get [you]1859-you to finish [me]0-i , ” [he]0-i said jovially , tapping [his]0-i fat boot with a malacca stick as [he]0-i looked over [the painter]540-the painter ’s head at the canvas on which [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s restless image seemed to flutter like a butterfly impaled . “[0-i] [You]1859-you ’ll owe it to _ [me]0-i _ if [he]0-i does [you]1859-you , ” [the sitter]3714-the sitter declared , smiling back at the leer which [Campton]174-campton divined behind [his]174-campton shoulder ; and [he]174-campton felt a sudden pity for [her]255-mrs. talkett innocence . “[1859-you] [[My]0-i wife]3210-my wife made [Campton]174-campton come back to [his]174-campton real work — doing [his]174-campton bit , [you]1859-you know , ” said [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett , straightening a curtain and disappearing again , like a diving animal ; and [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett turned [her]255-mrs. talkett plaintive eyes on [Campton]174-campton . “[174-campton] That kind of idiocy is all [I]0-i ’ve ever had , ” [they]3715-they seemed to say ; and [he]174-campton nearly cried back to [her]255-mrs. talkett : “[0-i] But , [[you]1859-you poor child]1861-you poor child , it ’s the only honest thing anywhere near [you]1859-you ! ” Absorbed in [his]174-campton picture , [he]174-campton hardly stopped to wonder at [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein ’s reappearance , at [his]174-campton air of bloated satisfaction or [his]174-campton easy allusions to [Cabinet Ministers]3716-cabinet ministers and [eminent statesmen]3717-eminent statesmen . The atmosphere of [the Talkett house]3718-the talkett house was so mirage - like that even the big red bulk of [the international financier]3719-the international financier became imponderable in it . [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey on leave ? But that was because [he]209-dastrey was at the front , the real front , in the trenches , had already had a slight wound and a fine citation . The thoughts excited by this encounter left [Campton]174-campton more than ever resolved to drug [himself]174-campton with work and frivolity . It was none of [his]174-campton business to pry into the consciences of [the people about [him]174-campton]3729-the people about him , not even into [Jorgenstein’s]321-jorgenstein’s — into which [one]398-one would presumably have had to be let down in [a diver]3731-a diver ’s suit , with oxygen pumping at top pressure . If [the government]2929-the government tolerated [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein ’s presence in [France]18-france , probably on the ground that [he]180-jorgenstein could be useful — so [the banker]547-the banker [himself]547-the banker let it be known — it was silly of [people like [Adele Anthony and Dastrey]220-adele anthony]3734-people like adele anthony and dastrey to wince at the mere mention of [his]180-jorgenstein name . There woke in [Campton]174-campton all the old spirit of aimless random defiance — revolt for revolt ’s sake — which had marked the first period of [his]174-campton life after [his]174-campton separation from [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife . [He]174-campton had long since come to regard it as a crude and juvenile phase — yet here [he]174-campton was reliving it . Though [he]174-campton knew of the intimacy between [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett and [the Brants]203-the brants [he]174-campton had no fear of meeting [Julia]194-julia : it was impossible to picture [her]194-julia neat head battling with the blasts of [that dishevelled drawing - room]3736-that dishevelled drawing - room . [Campton]174-campton remembered [Mme . de Tranlay]322-de tranlay ’s rebuke to [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant on the day when [he]0-i had last called in [the Avenue Marigny]548-the avenue marigny ; then [he]174-campton remembered also that it was on that very day that [he]174-campton had returned to [his]174-campton painting . “[1880-she] After all , [she]1880-she held out longer than [I]0-i did — poor [Julia]194-julia ! ” [he]174-campton mused , annoyed at the idea of [her]1880-she being the complacent victim of all the voracities [he]174-campton saw about [him]174-campton , and yet reflecting that [she]1880-she was at last living [her]1880-she life , as [they]3742-they called it at [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s . After all , the fact that [George]175-george was not at the front seemed to exonerate [[his]174-campton parents]509-his parents — unless , indeed , it did just the opposite . One day , coming earlier than usual to [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s to put in a last afternoon ’s work on [her]1880-she portrait , [Campton]174-campton , to [his]174-campton surprise , found [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife in front of it .
