[We]1883-we all need to ... to .... ” “[0-i] Oh , not [you]0-i and [I]0-i , do [we]1883-we ? ” [he]174-campton rejoined with a scornful laugh . [She]1880-she evidently caught the allusion , for [she]1880-she blushed all over [her]1880-she uncovered neck , up through the faintly wrinkled cheeks to the roots of [her]1880-she newly dyed hair ; then [he]174-campton saw [her]1880-she eyes fill . “[1882-her] What ’s [she]1882-her crying for ? Because [George]175-george is _ not _ in danger ? ” [he]174-campton wondered , busying [himself]174-campton with [his]174-campton palette . [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett hurried in with surprise and apologies ; and one by one [the habitués]3746-the habitués followed , with cheery greetings for [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant and a moment of constraint as [they]3746-the habitués noted [Campton]174-campton ’s presence , and the relation between [the two]459-the two was mutely passed about . Then the bridge - tables were brought , [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett began to straighten the cards nervously , and [the guests]3748-the guests broke up into groups , forgetting everything but [their]3748-the guests own affairs . As [Campton]174-campton turned back to [his]174-campton work [he]174-campton was aware of a last surprise in the sight of [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant serene and almost sparkling , waving [her]196-mrs. brant adieux to the bridge - tables , and going out followed by [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein , with whom [she]196-mrs. brant seemed on terms of playful friendliness . Of all strange war promiscuities , [Campton]174-campton thought this the strangest . XXI The next time [Campton]174-campton saw [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant was in [[his]174-campton own studio]3749-his own studio . [He]174-campton was preparing , one morning , to leave [the melancholy place]3750-the melancholy place , when the bell rang and [his]174-campton _ bonne _ let [her]196-mrs. brant in . [Her]196-mrs. brant dress was less frivolous than at [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s]3751-mrs. talkett ’s , and [she]196-mrs. brant wore a densely patterned veil , like [the ladies in cinema plays when [they]3752-the ladies in cinema plays when they visit their seducers or their accomplices visit [[their]3752-the ladies in cinema plays when they visit their seducers or their accomplices seducers]3753-their seducers or [[their]3752-the ladies in cinema plays when they visit their seducers or their accomplices accomplices]3754-their accomplices]3752-the ladies in cinema plays when they visit their seducers or their accomplices . Through the veil [she]196-mrs. brant looked at [him]174-campton agitatedly , and said : “[175-george] [George]175-george is not at [Sainte Menehould]306-sainte menehould . ” [He]174-campton stared . “[175-george] No . [Anderson]196-mrs. brant was [there]467-there the day before yesterday . ” “[196-mrs. brant] [Brant]196-mrs. brant ? At [Sainte Menehould]306-sainte menehould ? ” [Campton]174-campton felt the blood rush to [his]174-campton temples . What ! [He]175-george , [[the boy]416-the boy ’s father]3756-the boy ’s father , had not so much as dared to ask for the almost unattainable permission to go into [the war - zone]1245-the war - zone ; and [this other man]3758-this other man , who was nothing to [George]175-george , absolutely nothing , who had no right whatever to ask for leave to visit [him]1885-the devil , had somehow obtained the priceless favour , and instead of passing it on , instead of offering at least to share it with [[the boy]416-the boy ’s father]3756-the boy ’s father , had sneaked off secretly to feast on [the other]2914-the other ’s lawful privilege ! “[196-mrs. brant] How [the devil]1885-the devil — — ? ” [Campton]174-campton burst out . “[1885-the devil] Oh , [he]1885-the devil got [a Red Cross mission]1886-a red cross mission ; it was arranged very suddenly — through [a friend]1493-a friend .... ” “[1493-a friend] Yes — well ? ” [Campton]174-campton stammered , sitting down lest [his]174-campton legs should fail [him]174-campton , and signing to [her]1493-a friend to take a chair . “[1885-the devil] Well — [he]1885-the devil was not [there]467-there ! ” [she]1493-a friend repeated excitedly . “[1885-the devil] It ’s what [we]1889-we might have known — since [he]1885-the devil ’s changed [his]1885-the devil address . ” “[1885-the devil] Then [he]1885-the devil did n’t see [him]1885-the devil ? ” [Campton]174-campton interrupted , the ferocious joy of the discovery crowding out [his]174-campton wrath and wonder . “[196-mrs. brant] [Anderson]196-mrs. brant did n’t ? No . [He]1885-the devil was n’t [there]467-there , [I]0-i tell [you]0-i ! ” “[1885-the devil] [The H.Q.]134-the h.q. has been moved ? ” “[1885-the devil] No , it has n’t . [Anderson]196-mrs. brant saw [one of [the officers]1892-the officers]1891-one of the officers . [He]1885-the devil said [George]175-george had been sent on a mission . ” “[1885-the devil] To another H.Q. ? ” “[1892-the officers] That ’s what [they]1892-the officers said . [I]0-i do n’t believe it . ” “[0-i] What do [you]0-i believe ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know . [Anderson]196-mrs. brant ’s sure [they]1892-the officers told [him]1885-the devil the truth . [The officer [he]1885-the devil saw]1893-the officer he saw is [a friend of [George]175-george ’s]964-a friend of george ’s , and [he]1885-the devil said [George]175-george was expected back that very evening . ” [Campton]174-campton sat looking at [her]3762-she uncertainly . Did [she]3762-she dread , or did [she]3762-she rather wish , to disbelieve [the officer]1359-the officer ’s statement ? Where did [she]3762-she hope or fear that [George]175-george had gone ? And what were [Campton]174-campton ’s own emotions ? As confused , no doubt , as [hers]3762-she — as undefinable . The insecurity of [his]174-campton feelings moved [him]174-campton to a momentary compassion for [hers]3762-she , which were surely pitiable , whatever else they were . Then a savage impulse swept away every other , and [he]174-campton said : “[1885-the devil] Wherever [George]175-george was , [Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s visit will have done [him]175-george no good . ” [She]3762-she grew pale . “[196-mrs. brant] What do [you]1895-you mean ? ” “[1895-you] [I]0-i wonder it never occurred to [you]1895-you — or to [[your]1895-you husband]3455-your husband , since [he]3455-your husband ’s so solicitous , ” [Campton]174-campton went on , prolonging [her]3762-she distress . “[3455-your husband] Please tell [me]0-i what [you]1895-you mean , ” [she]3762-she pleaded with frightened eyes . “[1895-you] Why , in [God]266-god ’s name , could n’t [you]1895-you both let well enough alone ? Did n’t [you]1895-you guess why [George]175-george never asked for leave — why [I]0-i ’ve always advised [him]175-george not to ? Do n’t [you]1895-you know that nothing is as likely to get [a young fellow]1897-a young fellow into trouble as having [[his]1897-a young fellow family]794-his family force [their]794-his family way through to see [him]1897-a young fellow , use influence , seem to ask favours ? [I]0-i dare say that ’s how [that fool of a Dolmetsch woman]1899-that fool of a dolmetsch woman got [Isador]190-ladislas isador killed . [He]0-i [himself]0-i , during [the Russian lady]783-the russian lady ’s rule , had served an apprenticeship among [the soothsayers]3769-the soothsayers , and come away disgusted with the hours wasted in [their]3766-them company . [He]0-i suddenly remembered [the Spanish girl in [the little white house near the railway]3771-the little white house near the railway , who had told [his]0-i fortune in the hot afternoons with cards and olive - stones]3770-the spanish girl in the little white house near the railway , who had told his fortune in the hot afternoons with cards and olive - stones , and had found , by irrefutable signs , that [he]0-i and [she]1923-she would “[1921-you] come together ” again . “[1923-she] Well , it was better than this pseudo - scientific humbug , ” [he]0-i mused , “[1923-she] because it was picturesque — and so was [she]1923-she — and [she]1923-she believed in it . ” [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant rang , and [Campton]174-campton followed [her]196-mrs. brant into [a narrow hall]3772-a narrow hall . [A servant - woman]3773-a servant - woman showed [them]3766-them into [a _ salon]3774-a _ salon _ which was as commonplace as [[a doctor]3775-a doctor ’s waiting - room]3776-a doctor ’s waiting - room . On the mantelpiece were vases of Pampas grass , and a stuffed monkey swung from the electrolier . Evidently Mme . [Olida]323-olida was superior to the class of [fortune - tellers who prepare a special stage - setting]3777-fortune - tellers who prepare a special stage - setting , and [[no astrologer]3778-no astrologer ’s robe or [witch]3780-witch ’s kitchen]3779-no astrologer ’s robe or witch ’s kitchen was to be feared . [A voluminous woman in loose black]3784-a voluminous woman in loose black rose from a sofa . But [he]174-campton noticed that [her]3785-the spanish girl who used to read his fortune in the house by the railway hands , which were small and fat , trembled a little as [she]3785-the spanish girl who used to read his fortune in the house by the railway pointed to two chairs . “[1923-she] Sit down , please , ” [she]3785-the spanish girl who used to read his fortune in the house by the railway said in a low rough voice , speaking in French . [Olida]323-olida fell back in a trance - like attitude , let [her]323-olida lips droop over [her]323-olida magnificent eyes , and rested [her]323-olida head against a soiled sofa - pillow . [He]174-campton grasped [her]323-olida hand firmly , and [she]323-olida lifted [her]323-olida eyes , looked straight into [his]174-campton with [her]323-olida heavy velvety stare , and said : “[1924-you] [You]1924-you should hold [my]0-i hand more loosely ; the currents must not be compressed . ” [She]323-olida turned [her]323-olida palm upward , so that [his]174-campton finger - tips rested on it as if on a keyboard ; [he]174-campton noticed that [she]323-olida did not do the same with the hand [she]323-olida had placed in [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s . Suddenly [he]174-campton remembered that one sultry noon , lying under the olives , [she]323-olida had taught [him]174-campton , by signals tapped on [his]174-campton own knee , how to say what [he]174-campton chose to [her]323-olida without [[her]323-olida brothers]3790-her brothers ’ knowing it . [He]174-campton looked at [the huge woman]3791-the huge woman , seeking the curve of the bowed upper lip on which what used to be a faint blue shadow had now become a line as thick as [her]323-olida eyebrows , and recalling how [her]323-olida laugh used to lift the lip above [her]323-olida little round teeth while [she]323-olida threw back [her]323-olida head , showing the Agnus Dei in [her]323-olida neck . Now [her]323-olida mouth was like a withered flower , and in a crease of [her]323-olida neck a string of pearls was embedded . “[1924-you] Take hands , please , ” [she]323-olida commanded . [Julia]194-julia gave [Campton]174-campton [her]194-julia ungloved hand , and [he]174-campton sat between [the two women]1075-the two women . “[1924-you] [You]1929-you are [the parents]1119-the parents ? [Olida]323-olida sat as if labouring with difficult visions . The noises of [the street]2680-the street came faintly through the closed windows and a smell of garlic and cheap scent oppressed [Campton]174-campton ’s lungs and awakened old associations . With a final effort of memory [he]174-campton fixed [his]174-campton eyes on the _ clairvoyante ’s _ darkened mask , and tapped [her]196-mrs. brant palm once or twice . [She]196-mrs. brant neither stirred nor looked at [him]174-campton . “[0-i] [I]0-i see — [I]0-i see — — ” [she]196-mrs. brant began in the consecrated phrase . “[0-i] A veil — a thick veil of smoke between [me]0-i and a face which is young and fair , with a short nose and reddish hair : thick , thick , thick hair , exactly like [this gentleman]1933-this gentleman ’s when [he]1933-this gentleman was young .... ” [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s hand trembled in [Campton]174-campton ’s . “[0-i] It ’s true , ” [she]196-mrs. brant whispered , “[0-i] before [your]1933-this gentleman hair turned grey it used to be as red as [Georgie]175-george ’s . ” “[0-i] The veil grows denser — there are awful noises ; there ’s a face with blood — but not that first face . This is [a very young man]1934-a very young man , as innocent as when [he]1934-a very young man was born , with blue eyes like flax - flowers , but blood , blood ... why do [I]0-i see that face ? Ah , now it is on a hospital pillow — not [[your]1933-this gentleman son]924-your son ’s face , the other ; there is [no one near]1936-no one near , [no one]2702-no one but [some German soldiers]1938-some german soldiers laughing and drinking ; the lips move , the hands are stretched out in agony ; but [no one]2702-no one notices . It is a face that has something to say to [the gentleman]1940-the gentleman ; not to [you]1933-this gentleman , [Madame]258-de dolmetsch . The uniform is different — is it an English uniform ? ... Ah , now the face turns grey ; the eyes shut , there is foam on the lips . Now it is gone — there ’s [another man]1941-another man ’s head on the pillow .... Now , now [[your]1933-this gentleman son]924-your son ’s face comes back ; but not near those others . The smoke has cleared ... [Olida]323-olida reminded [her]196-mrs. brant . [He]174-campton was touched by [her]194-julia maternal passion , and ashamed of having allowed [her]194-julia so small a share in [his]174-campton jealous worship of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . XXII Two days later , to [Campton]174-campton ’s surprise , [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant appeared in the morning at [the studio]370-the studio . [Campton]174-campton , finishing a late breakfast in [careless studio - garb]3801-careless studio - garb , saw [[his]174-campton visitor]1441-his visitor peer cautiously about , as though fearing [undressed models behind the screens]3803-undressed models behind the screens or empty beer - bottles under the tables . It was the first time that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had entered [the studio]370-the studio since [his]197-mr. brant attempt to buy [George]175-george ’s portrait , and [Campton]174-campton guessed at once that [he]197-mr. brant had come again about [George]175-george . [He]174-campton looked at [the painter]540-the painter shyly , as if oppressed by the indiscretion of intruding at that hour . “[175-george] It was [my]0-i — [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant who insisted — when [she]196-mrs. brant got this letter , ” [he]0-i brought out between precautionary coughs . [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]540-the painter tolerantly : a barrier seemed to have fallen between [them]3806-them since [their]3806-them brief exchange of words about [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher . The letter , as [Campton]174-campton had expected , was a line from [George]175-george to [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother , written two days after [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s visit to [Sainte Menehould]306-sainte menehould . [It]3808-it expressed , in [George]175-george ’s usual staccato style , [his]175-george regret at having been away . “[196-mrs. brant] Hard luck , when one is riveted to [the same square yard of earth]1955-the same square yard of earth for weeks on end , to have just happened to be somewhere else the day [Uncle Andy]229-uncle andy broke through . ” It was always the same tone of fluent banter , in which [Campton]174-campton fancied [he]174-campton detected a lurking stridency , like the scrape of an overworked gramophone containing only comic disks . “[229-uncle andy] Ah , well — [[his]1956-his mother]583-his mother must be satisfied , ” [Campton]174-campton said as [he]174-campton gave the letter back . “[583-his mother] Oh , completely . So much so that [I]0-i ’ve induced [her]583-his mother to go off for a while to [Biarritz]66-biarritz . [The doctor]840-the doctor finds [her]583-his mother overdone ; [she]583-his mother ’d got it into [her]583-his mother head that [George]175-george had been sent to the front ; [I]0-i could n’t convince [her]583-his mother to the contrary . ” [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]0-i . “[583-his mother] [You]0-i [yourself]0-i never believed it ? ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , who had half risen , as though feeling that [his]197-mr. brant errand was done , slid back into [his]197-mr. brant seat and clasped [his]197-mr. brant small hands on [his]197-mr. brant agate - headed stick . “[0-i] Oh , never . ” “[0-i] It was not , ” [Campton]174-campton pursued , “[0-i] with that idea that [you]0-i went to [Sainte Menehould]306-sainte menehould ? ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant glanced at [him]174-campton in surprise . “[306-sainte menehould] No . On the contrary — — ” “[583-his mother] On the contrary ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i understood from — from [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother that , in the circumstances , [you]0-i were opposed to [his]175-george asking for leave ; thought it unadvisable , that is . So , as it was such a long time since [we]1960-we ’d seen [him]175-george — — ” The “[1960-we] [we]1960-we , ” pulling [him]175-george up short , spread a brick - red blush over [his]175-george baldness . “[1960-we] Not longer than since [I]0-i have — but then [I]0-i ’ve not [your]0-i opportunities , ” [Campton]174-campton retorted , the sneer breaking out in spite of [him]175-george . Though [he]175-george had grown kindly disposed toward [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant when [they]1960-we were apart , the old resentments still broke out in [his]175-george presence . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant clasped and unclasped the knob of [his]197-mr. brant stick . “[0-i] [I]0-i took the first chance that offered ; [I]0-i had [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother to think of . ” [Campton]174-campton made no answer , and [he]174-campton continued : “[0-i] [I]0-i was sorry to hear [you]0-i thought [I]0-i ’d perhaps been imprudent . ” “[0-i] There ’s no perhaps about it , ” [Campton]174-campton retorted . “[0-i] Since [you]0-i say [you]0-i were not anxious about [the boy]416-the boy [I]0-i ca n’t imagine why [you]0-i made the attempt . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was silent . [He]197-mr. brant seemed overwhelmed by [the other]2914-the other ’s disapprobation , and unable to find any argument in [his]197-mr. brant own defence . “[0-i] [I]0-i never dreamed it could cause any trouble , ” [he]0-i said at length . “[0-i] That ’s the ground [you]0-i ’ve always taken in [your]0-i interference with [[my]0-i son]856-my son ! ” [Campton]174-campton had risen , pushing back [his]174-campton chair , and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant stood up also . [They]3810-they faced [each other]443-each other without speaking . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry , ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant began , “[0-i] that [you]0-i should take such a view . It seemed to [me]0-i natural ... , when [Mr. Jorgenstein]325-jorgenstein gave [me]0-i the chance — — ” “[325-jorgenstein] [Jorgenstein]325-jorgenstein ! It was [Jorgenstein]325-jorgenstein who took [you]0-i to the front ? Took [you]0-i to see [[my]0-i son]856-my son ? ” [Campton]174-campton threw [his]174-campton head back and laughed . “[325-jorgenstein] That ’s complete — that ’s really complete ! ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant reddened as if the laugh had been a blow . [He]197-mr. brant stood very erect , [his]197-mr. brant lips as tightly closed as a shut penknife . [He]197-mr. brant had the attitude of [a civilian under fire]3812-a civilian under fire , considerably perturbed , but obliged to set the example of fortitude . [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]197-mr. brant . At last [he]174-campton had [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant at a disadvantage . [Their]3813-their respective situations were reversed , and [he]174-campton saw that [the banker]547-the banker was aware of it , and oppressed by the fear that [he]547-the banker might have done harm to [George]175-george . [He]174-campton evidently wanted to say all this and did not know how . [His]174-campton distress moved [Campton]174-campton , in whose ears the sound of [his]174-campton own outburst still echoed unpleasantly . If only [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant would have kept out of [his]197-mr. brant way [he]197-mr. brant would have found it so easy to be fair to [him]197-mr. brant ! “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry , ” [he]0-i began in a quieter tone . “[0-i] [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i ’m unjust — perhaps it ’s in the nature of [our]1965-our relation . Ca n’t [you]1966-you understand how [I]0-i ’ve felt , looking on helplessly all these years , while [you]1966-you ’ve done for [the boy]416-the boy everything [I]0-i wanted to do for [him]416-the boy [myself]0-i ? Have n’t [you]1966-you guessed why [I]0-i jumped at [my]0-i first success , and nursed [my]0-i celebrity till [I]0-i ’d got [half the fools in [Europe]42-europe]1968-half the fools in europe lining up to be painted ? ” [His]0-i excitement was mastering [him]0-i again , and [he]0-i went on hurriedly : “[1966-you] Do [you]1966-you suppose [I]0-i ’d have wasted all these precious years over [their]1968-half the fools in europe stupid faces if [I]0-i had n’t wanted to make [[my]0-i son]856-my son independent of [you]1966-you ? And [he]856-my son _ would _ have been , if the war had n’t come ; been [[my]0-i own son]1970-my own son again and [nobody else]3230-nobody else ’s , leading [his]856-my son own life , whatever [he]856-my son chose it to be , instead of having to waste [his]856-my son youth in [[your]1966-you bank]1972-your bank , learning how to multiply [your]1966-you millions . ” The futility of this retrospect , and the inconsistency of [his]0-i whole attitude , exasperated [Campton]174-campton more than anything [[his]0-i visitor]1441-his visitor could do or say , and [he]0-i stopped , embarrassed by the sound of [his]0-i own words , yet seeing no escape save to bury them under more and more . But [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had opened [his]197-mr. brant lips . “[1973-they] [They]1973-they ’ll be _ [his]856-my son _ , [you]1966-you know : the millions , ” [he]197-mr. brant said . [Campton]174-campton ’s anger dropped : [he]174-campton felt [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant at last too completely at [his]174-campton mercy . [He]174-campton waited for a moment before speaking . “[1966-you] [You]1966-you tried to buy [his]856-my son portrait once — [you]1966-you remember [I]0-i told [you]1966-you it was not for sale , ” [he]0-i then said . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant stood motionless , grasping [his]197-mr. brant stick in one hand and stroking [his]197-mr. brant moustache with the other . For a while [he]197-mr. brant seemed to be considering [Campton]174-campton ’s words without feeling their sting . “[0-i] It was not the money ... ” [he]197-mr. brant stammered out at length , from the depth of some unutterable plea for understanding ; then [he]197-mr. brant added : “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]1966-you a good morning , ” and walked out with [his]197-mr. brant little stiff steps . [XXIII Campton]326-xxiii campton was thoroughly ashamed of what [he]197-mr. brant had said to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , or rather of [his]197-mr. brant manner of saying it . If [he]197-mr. brant could have put the same facts quietly , ironically , without forfeiting [his]197-mr. brant dignity , and with the added emphasis which deliberateness and composure give , [he]197-mr. brant would scarcely have regretted the opportunity . [He]197-mr. brant had always secretly accused [himself]197-mr. brant of a lack of courage in accepting [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s heavy benefactions for [George]175-george when [the boy]416-the boy was too young to know what [they]3817-they might pledge [him]416-the boy to ; and it had been a disappointment that [George]175-george , on reaching the age of discrimination , had not appeared to find the burden heavy , or the obligations unpleasant . [Campton]174-campton , having accepted [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s help , could hardly reproach [[his]174-campton son]364-his son for feeling grateful for it , and had therefore thought it “[0-i] more decent ” to postpone disparagement of [[their]3817-they common benefactor]3819-their common benefactor till [his]197-mr. brant own efforts had set [them]3817-they both free . Even then , it would be impossible to pay off the past — but the past might have been left to bury itself . Now [his]197-mr. brant own wrath had dug it up , and [he]197-mr. brant had paid for the brief joy of casting its bones in [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s face by a deep disgust at [his]197-mr. brant own weakness . All these things would have weighed on [him]197-mr. brant even more if the outer weight of events had not been so much heavier . [He]197-mr. brant had not returned to [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s]3751-mrs. talkett ’s since [the banker]547-the banker ’s visit ; [he]197-mr. brant did not wish to meet [Jorgenstein]325-jorgenstein , and [his]197-mr. brant talk with [the banker]547-the banker , and [his]197-mr. brant visit to the _ clairvoyante _ , had somehow combined to send that whole factitious world tumbling about [his]197-mr. brant ears . It was absurd to attach any importance to poor [Olida]323-olida ’s vaticinations ; but the vividness of [her]323-olida description of [the baby - faced boy dying in [a German hospital]3798-a german hospital]3823-the baby - faced boy dying in a german hospital haunted [Campton]174-campton ’s nights . If it were not the portrait of [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher it was at least that of hundreds and [thousands of lads like [him]259-benny upsher , who were thus groping and agonizing and stretching out vain hands , while in [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room well - fed men]3826-mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room well - fed men]3825-thousands of lads like him , who were thus groping and agonizing and stretching out vain hands , while in mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room well - fed men and [expensive women]3827-expensive women heroically “[0-i] forgot the war . ” [Campton]174-campton , seeking to expiate [his]174-campton own brief forgetfulness by a passion of renewed activity , announced to [Boylston]247-boylston the next afternoon that [he]174-campton was coming back to [the office]1357-the office . [Boylston]247-boylston hardly responded : [he]247-boylston looked up from [his]247-boylston desk with a face so strange that [Campton]174-campton broke off to cry out : “[0-i] What ’s happened ? ” [The young man]2749-the young man held out a newspaper . “[0-i] [They]1974-they ’ve done it — they’ve done it ! ” [he]2749-the young man shouted . Across the page the name of [the _ Lusitania _]3830-the _ lusitania _ blazed out like the writing on the wall . The Berserker light on [Boylston]247-boylston ’s placid features transformed [him]247-boylston into an avenging cherub . “[1974-they] Ah , now [we]1975-we ’re in it — [we’re]1975-we in it at last ! ” [he]2749-the young man exulted , as if the horror of the catastrophe were already swallowed up in its result . [The two]459-the two looked at [each other]443-each other without further words ; but [the older man]3130-the older man ’s first thought had been for [[his]3130-the older man son]364-his son . Now , indeed , [America]2-america was “[1975-we] in it ” : the gross tangible proof for which [[her]2-america government]3835-her government had forced [her]2-america to wait was there in all its unimagined horror . [Ca]327-ca nt and cowardice in high places had drugged and stupefied [her]2-america into the strange belief that [she]2-america was too proud to fight for [others]644-others ; and here [she]2-america was brutally forced to fight for [herself]2-america . [Campton]174-campton waited with a straining heart for [[his]3130-the older man son]364-his son ’s first comment on the new fact that [they]459-the two were “[1974-they] in it . ” But [his]3130-the older man excitement and [Boylston]247-boylston ’s exultation were short - lived . Before many days it became apparent that [the proud nation which had flamed up overnight at the unproved outrage of the _ Maine _]3838-the proud nation which had flamed up overnight at the unproved outrage of the _ maine _ was lying supine under the flagrant provocation of the _ Lusitania _ . The days which followed were , to [many Americans]3839-many americans , the bitterest of the war : to [Campton]174-campton they seemed the ironic justification of the phase of indifference and self - absorption through which [he]174-campton had just passed . [He]174-campton could not go back to [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett and [[her]255-mrs. talkett group]3840-her group ; but neither could [he]174-campton take up [his]174-campton work with even [his]174-campton former zeal . The bitter taste of the national humiliation was perpetually on [his]174-campton lips : [he]174-campton went about like [a man]2492-a man dishonoured . [He]174-campton wondered , as the days and the weeks passed , at having no word from [George]175-george . Had [he]174-campton refrained from writing because [he]174-campton too felt the national humiliation too deeply either to speak of it or to leave it unmentioned ? Or was [he]174-campton so sunk in security that [he]174-campton felt only a mean thankfulness that nothing was changed ? From such thoughts [Campton]174-campton ’s soul recoiled ; but they lay close under the surface of [his]174-campton tenderness , and reared [their]3842-their evil heads whenever [they]3842-their caught [him]174-campton alone . As the summer dragged itself out [he]174-campton was more and more alone . [Dastrey]220-adele anthony , cured of [his]220-adele anthony rheumatism , had left [the Ministry]899-the ministry to resume [his]220-adele anthony ambulance work . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony was submerged under the ever - mounting tide of [refugees]1181-refugees . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant had taken [a small house at [Deauville]6-deauville]3845-a small house at deauville ( on the pretext of being near [[her]196-mrs. brant hospital]3846-her hospital ) , and [Campton]174-campton heard of [the Talketts]315-the talketts ’ being with [her]196-mrs. brant , and [others of [their]315-the talketts set]3847-others of their set . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew appeared at [the studio]370-the studio one day , in tennis flannels and a new straw hat , announcing that [he]0-i “[1974-they] needed rest , ” and rather sheepishly adding that [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant had suggested [his]0-i spending “[1978-his] a quiet fortnight ” with [her]196-mrs. brant . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve _ got _ to do it , if [I]0-i ’m to see this thing through , ” [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew added in a stern voice , as if commanding [himself]0-i not to waver . A few days later , glancing over the _ Herald _ , [Campton]174-campton read that [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , “[1976-the celebrated _ artiste _] [the celebrated _ artiste _]1976-the celebrated _ artiste _ , ” was staying with [Mr.]3849-mr. and [Mrs. Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant at [Deauville]6-deauville , where [she]196-mrs. brant had gone to give recitations for [the wounded in [hospital]1105-hospital]3850-the wounded in hospital . [Campton]174-campton smiled , and then thought with a tightening heart of [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher and [Ladislas Isador]190-ladislas isador , so incredibly unlike in [their]3852-their lives , so strangely one in [their]3852-their death . Finally , not long afterward , [he]174-campton read that [the celebrated financier]3853-the celebrated financier , [Sir Cyril Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein ( recently knighted by [the British Government]135-the british government ) had bestowed a gift of a hundred thousand francs upon [[Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s hospital]3854-mrs. brant ’s hospital . It was rumoured , the paragraph ended , that [Sir Cyril]180-jorgenstein would soon receive the Legion of Honour for [his]180-jorgenstein magnificent liberalities to [France]18-france . And still the flood of war rolled on . Success here , failure there , the menace of disaster elsewhere — [Russia]56-russia retreating to [the San]99-san , [Italy]137-italy declaring war on [Austria]228-austria and preparing to cross [the Isonzo]139-the isonzo , the British advance at [Anzac]140-anzac , and from the near East news of [the new landing at [Suvla]141-suvla]3855-the new landing at suvla . Through all this alternating of tragedy and triumph ran the million and million individual threads of hope , fear , fortitude , resolve , with which the fortune of the war was obscurely but fatally interwoven . [Campton]174-campton remembered [his]174-campton sneer at [Dastrey]220-adele anthony ’s phrase : “[1976-the celebrated _ artiste _] [One]398-one can at least contribute an attitude . ” [He]174-campton had begun to feel the force of that , to understand the need of [every human being]3856-every human being ’s “[1978-his] pulling [his]1978-his weight ” in the struggle , had begun to scan every face in [the street]2680-the street in the passionate effort to distinguish between the stones in the wall of resistance and the cracks through which discouragement might filter . [The shabby office of [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal]3858-the shabby office of the palais royal again became [[his]174-campton only haven]3860-his only haven . [His]174-campton portrait of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett had brought [him]174-campton many new orders ; but [he]174-campton refused them all , and declined even to finish the pictures interrupted by the war . One of [his]174-campton abrupt revulsions of feeling had flung [him]174-campton back , heart and brain , into the horror [he]174-campton had tried to escape from . “[1978-his] If [thou]1979-thou ascend up into [heaven]1980-heaven [I]0-i am there ; if [thou]1979-thou make [thy]1979-thou bed in hell , behold [I]0-i am there , ” the war said to [him]174-campton ; and as the daily head - lines shrieked out the names of [new battle - fields]3861-new battle - fields , from [the Arctic shore]3862-the arctic shore to [the Pacific]142-the pacific , [he]174-campton groaned back like [the Psalmist]3863-the psalmist : “[0-i] Whither shall [I]0-i go from [thee]1979-thou ? ” [The people about [him]174-campton]3729-the people about him — [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony , [Boylston]247-boylston , [Mlle . Davril]294-mlle . davril , and all [[their]3729-the people about him band of [tired resolute workers]3866-tired resolute workers]3865-their band of tired resolute workers — plodded ahead , [their]3729-the people about him eyes on [their]3729-the people about him task , seeming to find in its fulfillment a partial escape from the intolerable oppression . [The women]404-the women especially , with [their]404-the women gift of living in the particular , appeared hardly aware of the appalling development of the catastrophe ; and [Campton]174-campton felt [himself]174-campton almost as lonely among [these people who thought of nothing but the war]3868-these people who thought of nothing but the war as among [those who hardly thought of it at all]3869-those who hardly thought of it at all . It was only when [he]174-campton and [Boylston]247-boylston , after a hard morning ’s work , went out to lunch together , that what [he]174-campton called the _ Lusitania look _ , suddenly darkening [the younger man]3870-the younger man ’s face , moved [the painter]540-the painter with an anguish like [his]174-campton own . [Boylston]247-boylston , breaking through [his]247-boylston habitual shyness , had one day remonstrated with [Campton]174-campton for not going on with [his]247-boylston painting : but [the latter]1395-the latter had merely rejoined : “[1979-thou] [We]1981-we ’ve [each of [us]1981-we]1982-each of us got to worry through this thing in [our]1981-we own way — ” and the subject was not again raised between [them]1981-we . The intervals between [George]175-george ’s letters were growing longer . [Campton]174-campton , who noted in [his]174-campton pocket - diary the dates of all that [he]174-campton received , as well as those addressed to [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony , had not had one to record since the middle of June . And in that there was no allusion to the _ Lusitania _ . “[1981-we] It ’s queer , ” [he]0-i said to [Boylston]247-boylston , one day toward the end of July ; “[1981-we] [I]0-i do n’t know yet what [George]175-george thinks about the _ Lusitania _ . ” “[175-george] Oh , yes , [you]0-i do , [sir]2499-sir ! ” [Boylston]247-boylston returned , laughing ; “[0-i] but all the mails from [the war - zone]1245-the war - zone , ” [he]247-boylston added , “[1981-we] have been very much delayed lately . When there ’s a big attack on [anywhere]1985-anywhere [they]1986-they hold up everything along the line . And besides , no end of letters are lost . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose so , ” said [Campton]174-campton , pocketing the diary , and trying for the millionth time to call up a vision of [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy , seated at a desk in [some still unvisualized place]3874-some still unvisualized place , [his]570-his boy rumpled fair head bent above columns of figures or files of correspondence , while day after day the roof above [him]570-his boy shook with the roar of the attacks which held up [his]570-his boy letters . BOOK III XXIV [The gates of [Paris]5-paris]3875-the gates of paris were behind [them]3875-the gates of paris , and [they]3875-the gates of paris were rushing through an icy twilight between long lines of [houses]3876-houses , [factory chimneys]3877-factory chimneys and [city - girt fields]3878-city - girt fields , when [Campton]174-campton at last roused [himself]174-campton and understood . It was [he]174-campton , [John Campton]174-campton , who sat in [that car]3879-that car — [that noiseless swiftly - sliding car]3880-that noiseless swiftly - sliding car , so cushioned and commodious , so ingeniously fitted for all the exigencies and emergencies of travel , that it might have been a section of [the Nouveau Luxe on wheels]3881-the nouveau luxe on wheels ; and the figure next to [him]174-campton , on the extreme other side of the deeply upholstered seat , was that of [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant . This , for the moment , was as far as [Campton]174-campton ’s dazed perceptions carried [him]174-campton .... [The motor]1081-the motor was among [real fields]3883-real fields and [orchards]3884-orchards , and the icy half - light which might just as well have been dusk was turning definitely to dawn , when at last , disentangling [his]174-campton mind from a tight coil of passport and permit problems , [he]174-campton thought : “[0-i] But this is [the road north of [Paris]5-paris]1987-the road north of paris — that must have been [St. Denis]143-st. denis . ” Among all the multiplied strangenesses of the last strange hours it had hardly struck [him]174-campton before that , now [he]174-campton was finally on [his]174-campton way to [George]175-george , it was not to [the Argonne]81-the argonne that [he]174-campton was going , but in the opposite direction . The discovery held [his]174-campton floating mind for a moment , but for a moment only , before it drifted away again , to be caught on some other projecting strangeness . Chief among these was [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s presence at [his]174-campton side , and the fact that [the motor [they]1988-they were sitting in]3885-the motor they were sitting in was [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s . But [Campton]174-campton felt that such enormities were not to be dealt with yet . [He]174-campton had neither slept nor eaten since the morning before , and whenever [he]174-campton tried to grasp the situation in its entirety [his]174-campton spirit fainted away again into outer darkness .... [[His]174-campton companion]3886-his companion presently coughed , and said , in a voice even more than usually colourless and expressionless : “[1988-they] [We]1988-they are at [Luzarches]145-luzarches already . ” It was the first time , [Campton]174-campton was sure , that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had spoken since [they]1988-they had got into [the car]3887-the car together , hours earlier as it seemed to [him]174-campton , in [the dark street before [the studio in [Montmartre]1-montmartre]3889-the studio in montmartre]3888-the dark street before the studio in montmartre ; the first , at least , except to ask , as [the chauffeur]1679-the chauffeur touched the self - starter : “[1988-they] Will [you]1989-you have the rug over [you]1989-you ? ” [The two travellers]3891-the two travellers did not share a rug : a separate one , soft as fur and light as down , lay neatly folded on the grey carpet before each seat ; but [Campton]174-campton , though the early air was biting , had left [his]174-campton where it lay , and had not answered . Now [he]174-campton was beginning to feel that [he]174-campton could not decently remain silent any longer ; and with an effort which seemed as mechanical and external as the movements of the chauffeur whose back [he]174-campton viewed through the wide single sheet of plate - glass , [he]174-campton brought out , like a far - off echo : “[1989-you] [Luzarches]145-luzarches ... ? ” It was not that there lingered in [him]174-campton any of [his]174-campton old sense of antipathy toward [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . In [the new world into which [he]174-campton had been abruptly hurled]3892-the new world into which he had been abruptly hurled , the previous morning , by the coming of that letter which looked so exactly like any other letter — in [this new world]3143-this new world [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was nothing more than [the possessor of the motor and of the “[1989-you] pull ”]3894-the possessor of the motor and of the “ pull ” that were to get [him]174-campton , [Campton]174-campton , in the shortest possible time , to the spot of earth where [[his]174-campton son]364-his son lay dying . Once assured of this , [Campton]174-campton had promptly and indifferently acquiesced in [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s hurried suggestion that it would be only decent to let [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant go to [Doullens]146-doullens with [him]174-campton . But the exchange of speech with [any one]3083-any one , whether [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant or another , was for the time being manifestly impossible . The effort , to [Campton]174-campton , to rise out of [his]174-campton grief , was like that of [a dying person struggling back from regions too remote for [his]174-campton voice to reach the ears of [the living]3898-the living]3897-a dying person struggling back from regions too remote for his voice to reach the ears of the living . [He]174-campton shrank into [his]174-campton corner , and tried once more to fix [his]174-campton attention on the flying landscape . All that [he]174-campton saw in it , speeding ahead of [him]174-campton even faster than [their]3899-their own flight , was the ghostly vision of another motor , carrying a figure bowed like [his]174-campton , mute like [his]174-campton : the figure of [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , as [he]174-campton had seen [it]3900-it plunge away into the winter darkness after [[the physician]415-the physician ’s son]3902-the physician ’s son had been killed . [Campton]174-campton remembered asking [himself]174-campton then , as [he]174-campton had asked [himself]174-campton so often since : “[2499-sir] How should [I]0-i bear it if it happened to [me]0-i ? ” [He]174-campton knew the answer to that now , as [he]174-campton knew everything else [a man]2492-a man could know : so it had seemed to [his]174-campton astonished soul since the truth had flashed at [him]174-campton out of that fatal letter . Ever since then [he]174-campton had been turning about and about in a vast glare of initiation : of all the old crowded misty world which the letter had emptied at a stroke , nothing remained but a few memories of [George]175-george ’s boyhood , like a closet of toys in [a house knocked down by an earthquake]3904-a house knocked down by an earthquake . The vision of [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze ’s motor vanished , and in its place [Campton]174-campton suddenly saw [Boylston]247-boylston ’s screwed - up eyes staring out at [him]174-campton under furrows of anguish . [Campton]174-campton remembered , the evening before , pushing the letter over to [him]247-boylston across [the office]1357-the office table , and stammering : “[2499-sir] Read it — read it to [me]0-i . [I]0-i ca n’t — — ” and [Boylston]247-boylston ’s sudden sobbing explosion : “[0-i] But [I]0-i _ knew _ , [sir]2499-sir — [I’ve]0-i known all along ... ” and then the endless pause before [Campton]174-campton gathered [himself]174-campton up to falter out ( like [a child deciphering the words in a primer]3906-a child deciphering the words in a primer ): “[2499-sir] [You]2499-sir _ knew_—knew that [George]175-george was wounded ? ” “[2499-sir] No , no , not that ; but that [he]175-george might be — oh , at any minute ! Forgive [me]0-i — oh , do forgive [me]0-i ! [He]175-george would n’t let [me]0-i tell [you]2499-sir that [he]175-george was at the front , ” [Boylston]247-boylston had faltered through [his]247-boylston sobs . “[0-i] Let [you]2499-sir tell [me]0-i — — ? ” “[2499-sir] [You]2499-sir and [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother : [he]175-george refused a citation last March so that [you]2499-sir should n’t find out that [he]175-george ’d exchanged into [an infantry regiment]1992-an infantry regiment . [He]175-george was determined to from the first . [He]175-george ’s been fighting for months ; [he]175-george ’s been magnificent ; [he]175-george got away from [the Argonne]81-the argonne last February ; but [you]2499-sir were none of [you]2499-sir to know . ” “[2499-sir] But why — why — why ? ” [Campton]174-campton had flashed out ; then [his]174-campton heart stood still , and [he]174-campton awaited the answer with lowered head . “[175-george] Well , [you]2499-sir see , [he]175-george was afraid : afraid [you]2499-sir might prevent ... use [your]2499-sir influence ... [you]2499-sir and [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant .... ” [Campton]174-campton looked up again , challenging [the other]2914-the other . “[175-george] [He]175-george imagined perhaps that [we]1993-we _ had_—in the beginning ? ” “[175-george] Oh , yes”—Boylston was perfectly calm about [it—“he]175-george[175-george] knew all about that . And [he]175-george made [us]1993-we swear not to speak ; [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [me]0-i . [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony knew .... If this thing happened , ” [Boylston]247-boylston ended in a stricken voice , “[175-george] [you]2499-sir were not to be unfair to [her]221-miss anthony , [he]175-george said . ” Over and over again that short dialogue distilled itself syllable by syllable , pang by pang , into [Campton]174-campton ’s cowering soul . [He]174-campton had had to learn all this , this overwhelming unbelievable truth about [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ; and at the same instant to learn that [that son]3909-that son was grievously wounded , perhaps dying ( what else , in such circumstances , did the giving of [the Legion of Honour]3910-the legion of honour ever mean ? ) ; and to deal with it all in the wild minutes of preparation for departure , of intercession with [the authorities]2932-the authorities , sittings at [the photographer]3590-the photographer ’s , and a crisscross of confused telephone - calls from [the Embassy]2907-the embassy , [the Prefecture]329-the prefecture and [the War Office]1253-the war office . From this welter of images [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s face next detached itself : white and withered , yet with a look which triumphed over its own ruin , and over [Campton]174-campton ’s wrath . “[175-george] Ah — [you]2499-sir knew too , did [you]2499-sir ? [You]2499-sir were [[his]175-george other confidant]1994-his other confidant ? How [you]2499-sir all kept it up — how [you]2499-sir all lied to [us]1995-us ! ” [Campton]174-campton had burst out at [her]221-miss anthony . [She]221-miss anthony took it firmly . “[0-i] [I]0-i showed [you]2499-sir [his]175-george letters . ” “[0-i] Yes : the letters [he]175-george wrote to [you]2499-sir to be shown . ” [She]221-miss anthony received this in silence , and [he]174-campton followed it up . “[2499-sir] It was [you]2499-sir who drove [him]175-george to the front — it was [you]2499-sir who sent [[my]0-i son]856-my son to [his]175-george death ! ” Without flinching , [she]221-miss anthony gazed back at [him]174-campton . “[2499-sir] Oh , [John]174-campton — it was [you]174-campton ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i ? What do [you]174-campton mean ? [I]0-i never as much as lifted a finger — — ” “[0-i] No ? ” [She]221-miss anthony gave [him]174-campton a wan smile . “[0-i] Then it must have been [the old man who invented [the Mangle]217-the mangle]1997-the old man who invented the mangle ! ” [she]221-miss anthony cried , and cast [herself]221-miss anthony on [Campton]174-campton ’s breast . [He]174-campton held [her]221-miss anthony there for a long moment , stroking [her]221-miss anthony lank hair , and saying “[220-adele anthony] [Adele]220-adele anthony — [Adele]220-adele anthony , ” because in that rush of understanding [he]174-campton could not think of anything else to say . At length [he]174-campton stooped and laid on [her]221-miss anthony lips the strangest kiss [he]174-campton had ever given or taken ; and it was then that , drawing back , [she]221-miss anthony exclaimed : “[220-adele anthony] That ’s for [George]175-george , when [you]175-george get to [him]175-george . Remember ! ” The image of [[George]175-george ’s mother]3033-george ’s mother rose last on the whirling ground of [Campton]174-campton ’s thoughts : an uncertain image , blurred by distance , indistinct as some wraith of Mme . [Olida]323-olida ’s evoking . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant was still at [Biarritz]66-biarritz ; there had been no possibility of [her]196-mrs. brant getting back in time to share the journey to the front . Even [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s power in high places must have fallen short of such an attempt ; and it was not made . [Boylston]247-boylston , despatched in haste to bear the news of [George]175-george ’s wounding to [the banker]547-the banker , had reported that the utmost [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant could do was to write at once to [[his]197-mr. brant wife]516-his wife , and arrange for [her]516-his wife return to [Paris]5-paris , since telegrams to [the frontier departments]3918-the frontier departments travelled more slowly than letters , and in nine cases out of ten were delayed indefinitely . [Campton]174-campton had asked no more at the time ; but in the last moment before leaving [Paris]5-paris [he]174-campton remembered having said to [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony : “[1998-you] [You]1998-you ’ll be there when [Julia]194-julia comes ? ” and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony had nodded back : “[194-julia] At [the station]563-the station . ” The word , it appeared , roused the same memory in both of [them]3919-them ; meeting [her]516-his wife eyes , [he]174-campton saw there [the Gare de l’Est]3039-the gare de l’est in the summer morning , [the noisily manœuvring trains]3921-the noisily manœuvring trains jammed with bright young heads , the flowers , the waving handkerchiefs , and [everybody on the platform]3922-everybody on the platform smiling fixedly till some particular carriage - window slid out of sight . The scene , at the time , had been a vast blur to [Campton]174-campton : would [he]174-campton ever again , [he]174-campton wondered , see anything as clearly as [he]174-campton saw it now , in all its unmerciful distinctness ? [He]174-campton heard the sobs of [the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to [the young _ Chasseur Alpin _]271-the _ chasseur alpin _]3923-the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to the young _ chasseur alpin _ , [he]174-campton saw [her]3923-the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to the young _ chasseur alpin _ going away , led by [[her]3923-the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to the young _ chasseur alpin _ elderly companion]3924-her elderly companion , and powdering [her]3923-the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to the young _ chasseur alpin _ nose at the _ laiterie _ over the cup of coffee [she]3923-the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to the young _ chasseur alpin _ could not swallow . And this was what [her]3923-the girl who had said such a blithe goodbye to the young _ chasseur alpin _ sobs had meant .... “[194-julia] [This place]2000-this place , ” said [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , with [his]197-mr. brant usual preliminary cough , “[194-julia] must be — — ” [He]197-mr. brant bent over a motor - map , trying to decipher the name ; but after fumbling for [his]197-mr. brant eye - glasses , and rubbing them with a beautifully monogrammed cambric handkerchief , [he]197-mr. brant folded the map up again and slipped it into one of the many pockets which honeycombed the interior of [the car]3887-the car . [Campton]174-campton recalled the deathlike neatness of [[the banker]547-the banker ’s private office]3572-the banker ’s private office on the day when the one spot of disorder in [it]3572-the banker ’s private office had been the torn telegram announcing [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher ’s disappearance . [The motor]1081-the motor lowered [its]1081-the motor speed to make way for [a long train of army lorries]3929-a long train of army lorries . Close upon [them]3929-a long train of army lorries clattered a file of [gun - wagons]3930-gun - wagons , with [unshaven soldiers bestriding the gaunt horses]3931-unshaven soldiers bestriding the gaunt horses . [Torpedo - cars]3932-torpedo - cars carrying [officers]3446-officers slipped cleverly in and out of the tangle , and motor - cycles , incessantly rushing by , peppered the air with [their]3929-a long train of army lorries explosions . “[194-julia] This is the sort of thing [he]2001-he ’s been living in — living in for months and months , ” [Campton]174-campton mused . [He]174-campton [himself]174-campton had seen something of the same kind when [he]174-campton had gone to [Châlons]147-châlons in the early days to appeal to [Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze ; but at that time the dread significance of the machinery of war had passed almost unnoticed in [his]174-campton preoccupation about [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy . Now [he]174-campton realized that for a year that machinery had been the setting of [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ’s life ; for months past such sights and sounds as these had formed the whole of [George]175-george ’s world ; and [Campton]174-campton ’s eyes took in every detail with an agonized avidity . “[194-julia] What ’s that ? ” [he]174-campton exclaimed . A huge continuous roar , seeming to fall from the low clouds above [them]3936-their , silenced the puny rumble and clatter of [the road]3627-the road . On and on it went , in a slow pulsating rhythm , like the boom of waves driven by a gale on [some far - distant coast]3938-some far - distant coast . “[194-julia] That ? The guns — — ” said [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . “[194-julia] At the front ? ” “[2002-they] Oh , sometimes [they]2002-they seem much nearer . Depends on the wind . ” [Campton]174-campton sat bewildered . Had [he]174-campton ever before heard that sinister roar ? At [Châlons]147-châlons ? [He]174-campton could not be sure . But the sound had assuredly not been the same ; now it overwhelmed [him]174-campton like the crash of [the sea]3674-the sea over a drowning head . [He]174-campton cowered back in [his]174-campton corner . Would it ever stop , [he]174-campton asked [himself]174-campton ? Or was it always like this , day and night , in the hell of hells that [they]3936-their were bound for ? Was that merciless thud forever in the ears of [the dying]3940-the dying ? [A sentinel]3941-a sentinel stopped the motor and asked for [their]3936-their pass . [He]3941-a sentinel turned it about and about , holding it upside - down in [his]3941-a sentinel horny hands , and wrinkling [his]3941-a sentinel brows in the effort to decipher the inverted characters . “[2002-they] How can [I]0-i tell — — ? ” [he]0-i grumbled doubtfully , looking from the faces of [the two travellers]3891-the two travellers to [their]3936-their unrecognizable photographs . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was already feeling for [his]197-mr. brant pocket , and furtively extracting a bank - note . “[0-i] For [God]266-god ’s sake — not that ! ” [Campton]174-campton cried , bringing [his]174-campton hand down on [the banker]547-the banker ’s . Leaning over , [he]197-mr. brant spoke to [the sentinel]3944-the sentinel . “[0-i] [[My]0-i son]856-my son ’s dying at the front . Ca n’t [you]0-i see it when [you]0-i look at [me]0-i ? ” [The man]546-the man looked , and slowly gave back the paper . “[0-i] [You]0-i can pass , ” [he]197-mr. brant said , shouldering [his]197-mr. brant rifle . The motor shot on , and [the two men]442-the two men drew back into [their]442-the two men corners . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant fidgeted with [his]197-mr. brant eye - glasses , and after an interval coughed again . “[0-i] [I]0-i must thank [you]0-i , ” [he]0-i began , “[0-i] for — for saving [me]0-i just now from an inexcusable blunder . It was done mechanically ... [one]398-one gets into the habit .... ” “[398-one] Quite so , ” said [Campton]174-campton drily . “[398-one] But there are cases — — ” “[0-i] Of course — of course . ” Silence fell once more . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant sat bolt upright , [his]197-mr. brant profile detached against [the wintry fields]3947-the wintry fields . [Campton]174-campton , sunk into [his]174-campton corner , glanced now and then at the neat grey silhouette , in which the perpendicular glint of the eye - glass nearest [him]197-mr. brant was the only point of light . [He]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton that [the man]546-the man was no doubt suffering horribly ; but [he]546-the man was not conscious of any impulse of compassion . [He]546-the man and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant were like [two strangers pinned down together in a railway - smash]3949-two strangers pinned down together in a railway - smash : the shared agony did not bring [them]3949-two strangers pinned down together in a railway - smash nearer . On the contrary , [Campton]174-campton , as the hours passed , felt [himself]174-campton more and more exasperated by the mute anguish at [his]174-campton side . What right had [this man]1055-this man to be suffering as [he]1055-this man [himself]1055-this man was suffering , what right to be here with [him]1055-this man at all ? It was simply in the exercise of what [the banker]547-the banker called [his]1055-this man “[0-i] habit”—the habit of paying , of buying everything , [people]378-people and privileges and possessions — that [he]1055-this man had acquired this ghastly claim to share in an agony which was not [his]1055-this man . “[0-i] [I]0-i sha n’t even have [[my]0-i boy]983-my boy to [myself]0-i on [his]983-my boy deathbed , ” [the father]568-the father thought in desperation ; and the mute presence at [his]0-i side became once more the symbol of [his]0-i own failure . [The motor]1081-the motor , with frequent halts , continued to crawl slowly on between lorries , [field - kitchens]3955-field - kitchens , [artillery wagons]3956-artillery wagons , [companies of haggard infantry]3957-companies of haggard infantry returning to [[their]3957-companies of haggard infantry cantonments]3958-their cantonments , and more and more vanloads of [troops pressing forward]3959-troops pressing forward ; it seemed to [Campton]174-campton that hours elapsed before [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant again spoke . “[0-i] This must be [Amiens]148-amiens , ” [he]197-mr. brant said , in a voice even lower than usual . [The father]568-the father roused [himself]568-the father and looked out . [They]3961-they were passing through [the streets of [a town]3963-a town swarming with [troops]2865-troops]3962-the streets of a town swarming with troops — but [he]568-the father was still barely conscious of what [he]568-the father looked at . [He]568-the father perceived that [he]568-the father had been half - asleep , and dreaming of [George]175-george as [a little boy]3402-a little boy , when [he]568-the father used to have such bad colds . [Campton]174-campton remembered in particular the day [he]174-campton had found [the lad]1349-the lad in bed , in a scarlet sweater , in [[his]174-campton luxurious overheated room]584-his luxurious overheated room , reading the first edition of [Lavengro]32-lavengro . It was on that day that [he]174-campton and [[his]174-campton son]364-his son had first really got to know [each other]443-each other ; but what was it that had marked the date to [George]175-george ? The fact that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , learning of [his]174-campton joy in the book , had instantly presented it to [him]174-campton — with the price - label left inside the cover . “[0-i] And it ’ll be worth a lot more than that by the time [you]2006-you ’re grown up , ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had told [[his]197-mr. brant stepson]590-his stepson ; to which [George]175-george was recorded to have answered sturdily : “[2006-you] No , it wo n’t , if [I]0-i find other stories [I]0-i like better . ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony had assisted at the conversation and reported it triumphantly to [Campton]174-campton ; but [the painter]540-the painter , who had to save up to give [[his]540-the painter boy]570-his boy even a simple present , could see in the incident only one more attempt to rob [him]540-the painter of [his]540-the painter rights . “[2007-they] [They]2007-they wo n’t succeed , though , [they]2007-they wo n’t succeed : [they]2007-they do n’t know how to go about it , thank [the Lord]453-the lord , ” [he]540-the painter had said . But [they]2007-they had succeeded after all ; what better proof of it was there than [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s tacit right to be sitting here beside [him]197-mr. brant to - day ; than the fact that but for [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant it might have been impossible for [Campton]174-campton to get to [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ’s side in time ? Oh , that pitiless incessant hammering of the guns ! As [the travellers]3974-the travellers advanced the noise grew louder , fiercer , more unbroken ; the closely - fitted panes of [the car]3887-the car rattled and danced like those of an old omnibus . [Sentinels]330-sentinels stopped [the chauffeur]1679-the chauffeur more frequently ; [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had to produce the blue paper again and again . The day was wearing on — [Campton]174-campton began again to be aware of a sick weariness , a growing remoteness and confusion of mind . Through it [he]174-campton perceived that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , diving into deeper recesses of upholstery , had brought out a silver sandwich - box , a flask and glasses . As by magic [they]2007-they stood on a shiny shelf which slid out of another recess , and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was proffering the box . “[453-the lord] It ’s a long way yet ; [you]2009-you ’ll need all [your]2009-you strength , ” [he]197-mr. brant said . [Campton]174-campton , who had half turned from the invitation , seized a sandwich and emptied one of the glasses . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was right ; [he]197-mr. brant must not let [himself]197-mr. brant float away into the void , seductive as its drowsy shimmer was . [His]197-mr. brant wits returned , and with [them]2007-they a more intolerable sense of reality . [He]197-mr. brant was all alive now . Every crash of the guns seemed to tear a piece of flesh from [his]197-mr. brant body ; and it was always the piece nearest the heart . [The nurse]1373-the nurse ’s few lines had said : “[453-the lord] A shell wound : the right arm fractured , fear for the lungs . ” And one of these awful crashes had done it : bursting in mystery from that innocent - looking sky , and rushing inoffensively over [hundreds of [other young men]3979-other young men]3978-hundreds of other young men till it reached its destined prey , found [George]175-george , and dug a red grave for [him]175-george . [Campton]174-campton was convinced now that [[his]174-campton son]364-his son was dead . It was not only that [he]174-campton had received [the Legion of Honour]3910-the legion of honour ; it was the appalling all - destroying thunder of the shells as they went on crashing and bursting . What could [they]3982-they leave behind [them]3982-they but mismated fragments ? Gathering up all [his]174-campton strength in the effort not to recoil from the vision , [Campton]174-campton saw [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s beautiful body like a carcass tumbled out of [a butcher]3984-a butcher ’s cart .... * * * * * “[331-campton] [Doullens]331-campton , ” said [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . [They]3982-they were in [a town]3963-a town , and [the motor]1081-the motor had turned into [the court of [a great barrack - like building]3988-a great barrack - like building]3987-the court of a great barrack - like building . Before [them]3982-they stood a line of empty stretchers such as [Campton]174-campton had seen at [Châlons]147-châlons . [A young doctor in a cotton blouse]3989-a young doctor in a cotton blouse was lighting a cigarette and laughing with [a nurse]1354-a nurse — laughing ! At regular intervals the cannonade shook the windows ; it seemed the heart - beat of [the place]2614-the place . [Campton]174-campton noticed that many of the window - panes had been broken , and patched with paper . Inside [they]3982-they found [another official , who called to [another nurse]1407-another nurse as [she]1407-another nurse passed by laden with fresh towels]3992-another official , who called to another nurse as she passed by laden with fresh towels . [She]1407-another nurse disappeared into [a room]2782-a room where heaps of bloody linen were being stacked into baskets , returned , looked at [Campton]174-campton and nodded . [He]174-campton looked back at [her]1407-another nurse blunt tired features and kindly eyes , and said to [himself]174-campton that they had perhaps been [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s last sight on [earth]2780-earth . [The nurse]1373-the nurse smiled . “[331-campton] It ’s three flights up , ” [she]1373-the nurse said ; “[4010-a white voice ”] [he]2010-he ’ll be glad . ” Glad ! [He]2010-he was not dead , then ; [he]2010-he could even be glad ! In the staggering rush of relief [the father]568-the father turned instinctively to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ; [he]568-the father felt that there was enough joy to be shared . But [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , though [he]197-mr. brant must have heard what [the nurse]1373-the nurse had said , was moving away ; [he]197-mr. brant did not seem to understand . “[4010-a white voice ”] This way — — ” [Campton]174-campton called after [him]197-mr. brant , pointing to [the nurse , who was already on the first step of the stairs]4000-the nurse , who was already on the first step of the stairs . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant looked slightly puzzled ; then , as the other ’s meaning reached [him]197-mr. brant , [he]197-mr. brant coloured a little , bent [his]197-mr. brant head stiffly , and waved [his]197-mr. brant stick toward the door . “[4010-a white voice ”] Thanks , ” [he]197-mr. brant said , “[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i ’ll take a stroll first ... stretch [my]0-i legs .... ” and [Campton]174-campton , with a rush of gratitude , understood that [he]174-campton was to be left alone with [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . XXV [He]174-campton followed [[his]174-campton guide]4002-his guide up the steep flights , which seemed to become buoyant and lift [him]174-campton like waves . It was as if the muscle that always dragged back [his]174-campton lame leg had suddenly regained its elasticity . [He]174-campton floated up as one mounts stairs in a dream . A smell of disinfectants hung in the cold air , and once , through a half - open door , a sickening odour came : [he]174-campton remembered it at [Châlons]147-châlons , and [Fortin]182-fortin - lescluze ’s murmured : “[4010-a white voice ”] Gangrene — ah , if only [we]2011-they could get them sooner ! ” How soon had [they]2011-they got _ [[his]174-campton _ boy]2584-his _ boy , [Campton]174-campton wondered ? The letter , mercifully sent by hand to [Paris]5-paris , had reached [him]174-campton on the third day after [George]175-george ’s arrival at [the Doullens hospital]4004-the doullens hospital ; but [he]174-campton did not yet know how long before that the shell - splinter had done its work . [The nurse]1373-the nurse did not know either . How could [she]1373-the nurse remember ? [They]2011-they had so many ! [The administrator]4006-the administrator would look up the files and tell [him]174-campton . Only there was no time for that now . On [a landing]4007-a landing [Campton]174-campton heard a babble and scream : a nauseating scream in a queer bleached voice that might have been [man]1658-man , [woman]4009-woman or monkey ’s . Perhaps that was what [the French]208-the french meant by “[4010-a white voice ”] [a white voice ”]4010-a white voice ” : this voice which was as featureless as some of [the poor men]4011-the poor men ’s obliterated faces ! [Campton]174-campton shot an anguished look at [[his]174-campton companion]3886-his companion , and [she]3886-his companion understood and shook [her]3886-his companion head . “[4010-a white voice ”] Oh , no : that ’s in [the big ward]2012-the big ward . It ’s the way [they]2013-they scream after a dressing .... ” [She]3886-his companion opened a door , and [he]174-campton was in [a room with three beds in [it]4013-a room with three beds in it]4013-a room with three beds in it , wooden pallets hastily knocked together and spread with rough grey blankets . In spite of the cold , flies still swarmed on the unwashed panes , and there were big holes in the fly - net over the bed nearest the window . Under the net lay [a middle - aged bearded man]4014-a middle - aged bearded man , heavily bandaged about the chest and left arm : [he]4014-a middle - aged bearded man was snoring , [his]4014-a middle - aged bearded man mouth open , [his]4014-a middle - aged bearded man gaunt cheeks drawn in with the fight for breath . [Campton]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton that if [[his]174-campton own boy]4015-his own boy lived [he]174-campton should like some day to do something for [this poor devil who was [[his]174-campton roommate]4017-his roommate]4016-this poor devil who was his roommate . Then [he]174-campton looked about [him]4014-a middle - aged bearded man and saw that [the two other beds]4018-the two other beds were empty . [He]174-campton drew back . [The nurse]1373-the nurse was bending over [the bearded man]4020-the bearded man . “[2013-they] [He]2014-he ’ll wake presently — [I’ll]2015-i’ll leave [you]2014-he ” ; and [she]1373-the nurse slipped out . [Campton]174-campton looked again at [the stranger]4021-the stranger ; then [his]174-campton glance travelled to the scarred brown hand on the sheet , a hand with broken nails and blackened finger - tips . It was [George]175-george ’s hand , [[his]175-george son]364-his son ’s , swollen , disfigured but unmistakable . [The father]568-the father knelt down and laid [his]568-the father lips on it . * * * * * “[2015-i’ll] What was the first thing [you]2014-he felt ? ” [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony asked [him]2014-he afterward : and [he]2014-he answered : “[2014-he] Nothing . ” “[2014-he] Yes — at the very first , [I]0-i know : it ’s always like that . But the first thing _ after _ [you]2014-he began to feel anything ? ” [He]2014-he considered , and then said slowly : “[2014-he] The difference . ” “[2014-he] The difference in _ [him]2014-he _ ? ” “[2014-he] In [him]2014-he — in life — in everything . ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony , who understood as a rule , was evidently puzzled . “[2014-he] What kind of a difference ? ” “[2014-he] Oh , a complete difference . ” With that [she]221-miss anthony had to be content . The sense of it had first come to [Campton]174-campton when [the bearded man]4020-the bearded man , raising [his]4020-the bearded man lids , looked at [him]174-campton from far off with [George]175-george ’s eyes , and touched [him]174-campton , very feebly , with [George]175-george ’s hand . It was in the moment of identifying [[his]568-the father son]364-his son that [he]568-the father felt [the son [he]568-the father had known to be lost to [him]568-the father forever]4026-the son he had known to be lost to him forever . [George]175-george ’s lips were moving , and [the father]568-the father laid [his]568-the father ear to them ; perhaps these were last words that [[his]568-the father boy]570-his boy was saying . “[2014-he] [Old Dad]332-dad — in [a motor]2016-a motor ? ” [Campton]174-campton nodded . The fact seemed faintly to interest [George]175-george , who continued to examine [him]174-campton with those distant eyes . “[332-dad] [Uncle Andy ’s]229-uncle andy ? ” [Campton]174-campton nodded again . “[333-mother] [Mother]333-mother — — ? ” “[333-mother] [She]333-mother ’s coming too — very soon . ” [George]175-george ’s lips were screwed into a whimsical smile . “[333-mother] [I]0-i must have a shave first , ” [he]175-george said , and drowsed off again , [his]175-george hand in [Campton]174-campton ’s .... * * * * * “[2017-the other gentleman] [The other gentleman]2017-the other gentleman — ? ” [the nurse]1373-the nurse questioned the next morning . [Campton]174-campton had spent the night in [the hospital]1368-the hospital , stretched on the floor at [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s threshold . It was a breach of rules , but for once [the major]4032-the major had condoned it . As for [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , [Campton]174-campton had forgotten all about [him]197-mr. brant , and at first did not know what [the nurse]1373-the nurse meant . Then [he]174-campton woke with a start to the consciousness of [[his]174-campton fellow - traveller]4034-his fellow - traveller ’s nearness . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , [the nurse]1373-the nurse explained , had come to [the hospital]1368-the hospital early , and had been waiting below for the last two hours . [Campton]174-campton , almost as gaunt and unshorn as [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , pulled [himself]174-campton to [his]174-campton feet and went down . In [the hall]2690-the hall [the banker , very white , but smooth and trim as ever]4039-the banker , very white , but smooth and trim as ever , was patiently measuring the muddy flags . “[2017-the other gentleman] Less temperature this morning , ” [Campton]174-campton called from the last flight . “[2017-the other gentleman] Oh , ” stammered [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , red and pale by turns . [Campton]174-campton smiled haggardly and pulled [himself]174-campton together in an effort of communicativeness . “[2017-the other gentleman] Look here — [he]2018-he ’s asked for [you]2019-you ; [you]2019-you ’d better go up . Only for a few minutes , please ; [he]2018-he ’s awfully weak . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , speechless , stood stiffly waiting to be conducted . [Campton]174-campton noticed the mist in [his]197-mr. brant eyes , and took pity on [him]197-mr. brant . “[0-i] [I]0-i say — where ’s [the hotel]662-the hotel ? Just a step away ? [I]0-i ’ll go around , then , and get a shave and a wash while [you]2019-you ’re with [him]2018-he , ” [the father]568-the father said , with a magnanimity which [he]568-the father somehow felt [the powers]465-the powers might take account of in [their]465-the powers subsequent dealings with [George]175-george . If [the boy]416-the boy was to live [Campton]174-campton could afford to be generous ; and [he]174-campton had decided to assume that [the boy]416-the boy would live , and to order [his]2018-he behaviour accordingly . “[0-i] [I]0-i — thank [you]2019-you , ” said [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , turning toward the stairs . “[2019-you] Five minutes at the outside ! ” [Campton]174-campton cautioned [him]197-mr. brant , and hurried out into the morning air through which the guns still crashed methodically . When [he]174-campton got back to [the hospital]1368-the hospital , refreshed and decent , [he]174-campton was surprised , and for a moment alarmed , to find that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had not come down . “[2019-you] Sending up [his]2018-he temperature , of course — damn [him]2018-he ! ” [Campton]174-campton raged , scrambling up [the stairs]482-the stairs as fast as [his]174-campton stiff leg permitted . But outside of [George]175-george ’s door [he]174-campton saw [a small figure patiently mounting guard]4046-a small figure patiently mounting guard . “[2019-you] [I]0-i stayed with [him]2018-he less than five minutes ; [I]0-i was merely waiting to thank [you]2019-you . ” “[0-i] Oh , that ’s all right . ” [Campton]174-campton paused , and then made [his]174-campton supreme effort . “[0-i] How does [he]2018-he strike [you]2019-you ? ” “[2018-he] Hopefully — hopefully . [He]2018-he had [his]2018-he joke as usual , ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant said with a twitching smile . “[2018-he] Oh , _ that _ — — ! But [his]2018-he temperature ’s decidedly lower . Of course [they]2021-they may have to take the ball out of the lung ; but perhaps before [they]2021-they do it [he]2018-he can be moved from this hell . ” [The two men]442-the two men were silent , the same passion of anxiety consuming [them]442-the two men , and no means left of communicating it to [each other]443-each other . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll look in again later . Shall [I]0-i have something to eat sent round to [you]2019-you from [the hotel]662-the hotel ? ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant suggested . “[2019-you] Oh , thanks — if [you]2019-you would . ” [Campton]174-campton put out [his]174-campton hand and crushed [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s dry fingers . But for [this man]1055-this man [he]174-campton might not have got to [[his]174-campton son]364-his son in time ; and [this man]1055-this man had not once made use of the fact to press [his]1055-this man own claim on [George]175-george . With pity in [his]174-campton heart , [the father]568-the father , privileged to remain at [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s bedside , watched [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s small figure retreating alone . How ghastly to sit all day in [that squalid hotel]4054-that squalid hotel , [his]174-campton eyes on [his]174-campton watch , with nothing to do but to wonder and wonder about the temperature of [[another man]1941-another man ’s son]4056-another man ’s son ! * * * * * The next day was worse ; so much worse that everything disappeared from [Campton]174-campton ’s view but the present agony of watching , hovering , hanging helplessly on the words of [nurse]4057-nurse and [doctor]1028-doctor , and spying on the glances [they]4059-they exchanged behind [his]174-campton back . There could be no thought yet of extracting the bullet ; [a great surgeon , passing through the wards on a hasty tour of inspection]4060-a great surgeon , passing through the wards on a hasty tour of inspection , had confirmed this verdict . Oh , to have kept [the surgeon]3162-the surgeon [there]467-there — to have had [him]3162-the surgeon at hand to watch for the propitious moment and seize it without an instant ’s delay !
