Suddenly the vision which to [Campton]174-campton had been among the most hideous of all [his]174-campton crowding nightmares — that of [George]175-george stretched naked on an operating - table , [his]175-george face hidden by a chloroform mask , and [an orderly]1336-an orderly hurrying away with a pile of red towels like those perpetually carried through [the passages below]4064-the passages below — this vision became to [the father]568-the father ’s fevered mind as soothing as a glimpse of [Paradise]334-paradise . If only [George]175-george ’s temperature would go down — if only [the doctors]4066-the doctors would pronounce [him]175-george strong enough to have the bullet taken out ! What would anything else matter then ? [Campton]174-campton would feel as safe as [he]174-campton used to years ago , when after the recurring months of separation [the boy]416-the boy came back from [school]4068-school , and [he]174-campton could take [him]416-the boy in [his]174-campton arms and make sure that [he]416-the boy was [the same Georgie]4069-the same georgie , only bigger , browner , with thicker curlier hair , and tougher muscles under [his]416-the boy jacket . What if [the great surgeon]4070-the great surgeon , on [his]4070-the great surgeon way back from the front , were to pass through [the town]861-the town again that evening , reverse [his]4070-the great surgeon verdict , and perhaps even perform the operation then and there ? Was there no way of prevailing on [him]4070-the great surgeon to stop and take another look at [George]175-george on the return ? The idea took immediate possession of [Campton]174-campton , crowding out [his]174-campton intolerable anguish , and bringing such relief that for a few seconds [he]174-campton felt as if some life - saving operation had been performed on [himself]174-campton . As [he]174-campton stood watching [the great man]388-the great man ’s retreat , followed by [doctors]4073-doctors and [nurses]1337-nurses , [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant suddenly touched [his]174-campton arm , and the eyes of [the two]459-the two met . [Campton]174-campton understood and gasped out : “[2019-you] Yes , yes ; [we]2023-we must manage to get [him]2024-he back . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant nodded . “[2019-you] At all costs . ” [He]197-mr. brant paused , again interrogated [Campton]174-campton ’s eyes , and stammered : “[2025-you] [You]2025-you authorize — — ? ” “[2025-you] Oh , God — anything ! ” “[2024-he] [He]2024-he ’s dined at [[my]0-i house in [Paris]5-paris]2026-my house in paris , ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant threw in , as if trying to justify [himself]0-i . “[2024-he] Oh , go—_go _ ! ” [Campton]174-campton almost pushed [him]2024-he down [the stairs]482-the stairs . Ten minutes later [he]2024-he reappeared , modest but exultant . “[2024-he] Well ? ” “[2024-he] [He]2024-he would n’t commit [himself]2024-he , before [the others]3170-the others — — ” “[3170-the others] Oh — — ” “[3170-the others] But to [me]0-i , as [he]2024-he was getting into [the motor]1081-the motor — — ” “[2024-he] Well ? ” “[2024-he] Yes : if possible . Somewhere about midnight . ” [Campton]174-campton turned away , choking , and stumped off toward the tall window at the end of [the passage]4077-the passage . Below [him]174-campton lay [the court]4078-the court . A line of stretchers was being carried across [it]4078-the court , not empty this time , but each one with a bloody burden . [Doctors]4073-doctors , [nurses]1337-nurses , [orderlies]4081-orderlies hurried to and fro . [Drub]335-drub , [drub]4082-drub , drub , went the guns , shaking the windows , rolling [their]2030-their fierce din along the cloudy sky , down [the corridors of [the hospital]1368-the hospital]4083-the corridors of the hospital and [the pavement of [the streets]2562-the streets]4085-the pavement of the streets , like huge bowls crashing through story above story of a kind of sky - scraping [bowling alley]4087-bowling alley . “[2030-their] Even [the dead underground]2029-the dead underground must hear [them]2030-their ! ” [Campton]174-campton muttered . The word made [him]174-campton shudder superstitiously , and [he]174-campton crept back to [George]175-george ’s door and opened it ; but [the nurse]1373-the nurse , within , shook [her]1373-the nurse head . “[2029-the dead underground] [He]2031-he must sleep after the examination . Better go . ” [Campton]174-campton turned and saw [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant waiting . A bell rang twelve . [The two]459-the two , in silence , walked down [the stairs]482-the stairs , crossed [the court]4078-the court ( averting [their]459-the two eyes from the stretchers ) and went to [the hotel]662-the hotel to get something to eat . * * * * * Midnight came . [It]4093-it passed . [No one in the hurried confused world of [the hospital]1368-the hospital]4094-no one in the hurried confused world of the hospital had heard of the possibility of [the surgeon]3162-the surgeon ’s returning . When [Campton]174-campton mentioned it to [the nurse]1373-the nurse [she]1373-the nurse smiled [her]1373-the nurse tired smile , and said : “[2031-he] [He]2031-he could have done nothing . ” Done nothing ! How could [she]1373-the nurse know ? How could [any one]3083-any one , but [the surgeon]3162-the surgeon [himself]3162-the surgeon ? Would [he]3162-the surgeon have promised if [he]3162-the surgeon had not thought there was some chance ? [Campton]174-campton , stretched out on a blanket and [his]174-campton rolled - up coat , lay through the long restless hours staring at the moonlit sky framed by the window of [the corridor]4100-the corridor . Great clouds swept over that cold indifferent vault : they seemed like the smoke from the guns which had not once ceased through the night . At last [he]174-campton got up , turned [his]174-campton back on the window , and lay down again facing [the stairs]482-the stairs . The moonlight unrolled a white strip along the stone floor . [A church]4102-a church - bell rang one ... two ... there were noises and movements below . [Campton]174-campton raised [himself]174-campton , [his]174-campton heart beating all over [his]174-campton body . Steps came echoing up . “[2031-he] Careful ! ” [some one]839-some one called . A stretcher rounded the stair - rail ; another , and then another . [An orderly with a lantern]4104-an orderly with a lantern preceded [them]4105-them , followed by [one of [the doctors]4066-the doctors]4106-one of the doctors , [an old bunched - up man in a muddy uniform , who stopped furtively to take a pinch of snuff]4108-an old bunched - up man in a muddy uniform , who stopped furtively to take a pinch of snuff . [Campton]174-campton could not believe [his]174-campton eyes ; did n’t [the hospital people]4109-the hospital people know that every bed on that floor was full ? Every bed , that is , but the two in [[George]175-george ’s room]801-george ’s room ; and [the nurse]1373-the nurse had given [Campton]174-campton the hope , the promise almost , that as long as [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy was so ill [she]1373-the nurse would keep those empty . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll manage somehow , ” [she]1373-the nurse had said . For a mad moment [Campton]174-campton was on the point of throwing [himself]174-campton in the way of the tragic procession , barring the threshold with [his]174-campton arms . “[0-i] What does this mean ? ” [he]174-campton stammered to [the nurse]1373-the nurse , who had appeared from [another room]4114-another room with [her]1373-the nurse little lamp . [She]1373-the nurse gave a shrug . “[2032-more casualties] [More casualties]2032-more casualties — [every hospital]2033-every hospital is like this . ” [He]174-campton stood aside , wrathful , impotent . At least if [Brant]197-mr. brant had been [there]467-there , perhaps by some offer of money — but how , to whom ? Of what earthly use , after all , was [Brant]197-mr. brant ’s boasted “[2032-more casualties] influence ” ? [These people]2877-these people would only laugh at [him]174-campton — perhaps put [them]2877-these people both out of [the hospital]1368-the hospital ! [He]174-campton turned despairingly to [the nurse]1373-the nurse . “[2034-you] [You]2034-you might as well have left [him]2035-him in [the trenches]3142-the trenches . ” “[2034-you] Do n’t say that , [sir]2499-sir , ” [she]1373-the nurse answered ; and the echo of [his]174-campton own words horrified [him]174-campton like a sacrilege . [Two of the stretchers]4119-two of the stretchers were carried into [[George]175-george ’s room]801-george ’s room . [Campton]174-campton caught a glimpse of [George]175-george , muttering and tossing ; the moonlight lay in the hollows of [his]175-george bearded face , and again [the father]568-the father had the sense of utter alienation from [that dark delirious man who for brief intervals suddenly became [[his]568-the father son]364-his son , and then as suddenly wandered off into strangeness]4122-that dark delirious man who for brief intervals suddenly became his son , and then as suddenly wandered off into strangeness . [The nurse]1373-the nurse slipped out of [the room]475-the room and signed to [him]2499-sir . “[2972-both] [Both]2972-both nearly gone ... [they]2972-both wo n’t trouble [him]2499-sir long , ” [she]1373-the nurse whispered . [The man on the third stretcher]4126-the man on the third stretcher was taken to [a room at the other end of [the corridor]4100-the corridor]4127-a room at the other end of the corridor . [Campton]174-campton watched [him]4126-the man on the third stretcher being lifted in . [He]4126-the man on the third stretcher was to lie on the floor , then ? For in [that room]4129-that room there was certainly no vacancy . But presently [he]174-campton had the answer . [The bearers]4130-the bearers did not come out empty - handed ; [they]4130-the bearers carried [another man]1941-another man whom [they]4130-the bearers laid on the empty stretcher . [Lucky , lucky devil]4132-lucky , lucky devil ; going , no doubt , to [a hospital at the rear]4133-a hospital at the rear ! As [the procession]4134-the procession reached the stairs the lantern swung above [the lucky devil]4135-the lucky devil ’s face : [his]2499-sir eyes stared ceilingward from black orbits . One arm , swinging loose , dangled down , the hand stealthily counting the steps as [he]2499-sir descended — and [no one]2702-no one troubled , for [he]2499-sir was dead . At dawn [Campton , who must have been asleep , started up , again hearing steps]4137-campton , who must have been asleep , started up , again hearing steps . [The surgeon]3162-the surgeon ? Oh , if this time it were [the surgeon]3162-the surgeon ! But only [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant detached [himself]197-mr. brant from the shadows accumulated in [the long corridor]4140-the long corridor : [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , crumpled and unshorn , with blood - shot eyes , and gloves on [his]197-mr. brant unconscious hands . [Campton]174-campton glared at [him]197-mr. brant resentfully . “[2972-both] Well — how about [[your]2039-your surgeon]2040-your surgeon ? [I]0-i do n’t see [him]2040-your surgeon ! ” [he]0-i exclaimed . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant shook [his]197-mr. brant head despondently . “[0-i] No — [I’ve]0-i been waiting all night in [the court]4078-the court . [I]0-i thought if [he]2040-your surgeon came back [I]0-i should be the first to catch [him]2040-your surgeon . But [he]2040-your surgeon has just sent [[his]2040-your surgeon orderly]2042-his orderly for instruments ; [he]2040-your surgeon ’s not coming . There ’s been terrible fighting — — ” [Campton]174-campton saw two tears running down [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s face : [they]4141-they did not move [him]197-mr. brant . [The banker]547-the banker glanced toward [George]175-george ’s door , full of the question [he]547-the banker dared not put . [Campton]174-campton answered it . “[0-i] [You]0-i want to know how [he]2040-your surgeon is ? Well , how should [he]2040-your surgeon be , with that bullet in [him]2040-your surgeon , and the fever eating [him]2040-your surgeon inch by inch , and [two more wounded men]2043-two more wounded men in [[his]2040-your surgeon room]2991-his room ? _ That ’s _ how [he]2040-your surgeon is ! ” [Campton]174-campton almost shouted . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was trembling all over . “[2045-two more men] [Two more men]2045-two more men — in [[his]2040-your surgeon room]2991-his room ? ” [he]197-mr. brant echoed shrilly . “[2045-two more men] Yes — bad cases ; dying . ” [Campton]174-campton drew a deep breath . “[2045-two more men] [You]0-i see there are times when [your]0-i money and [your]0-i influence and [your]0-i knowing [everybody]3070-everybody are no more use than so much sawdust — — ” [The nurse]1373-the nurse opened the door and looked out . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’re talking too loudly , ” [she]1373-the nurse said . [She]1373-the nurse shut the door , and [the two men]442-the two men stood silent , abashed ; finally [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant turned away . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll go and try again . There must be [other surgeons]2048-other surgeons ... other ways ... ” [he]0-i whispered . “[2049-your surgeons] Oh , [[your]0-i surgeons]2049-your surgeons ... oh , [your]0-i ways ! ” [Campton]174-campton sneered after [him]0-i , in the same whisper . XXVI From [the room where [he]0-i sat at the foot of [George]175-george ’s glossy white bed]4145-the room where he sat at the foot of george ’s glossy white bed , [Campton]174-campton , through the open door , could watch the November sun slanting down a white ward where , in the lane between other white beds , pots of chrysanthemums stood on white - covered tables . Through the window [his]0-i eyes rested incredulously on [a court enclosed in monastic arches of grey stone , with squares of turf bordered by box hedges]4146-a court enclosed in monastic arches of grey stone , with squares of turf bordered by box hedges , and [a fountain playing]4147-a fountain playing . Beyond [the court]4078-the court sloped the faded foliage of [a park not yet entirely stripped by Channel gales]4149-a park not yet entirely stripped by channel gales ; and on days without wind , instead of the boom of the guns , the roar of [the sea]3674-the sea came faintly over intervening heights and hollows . [Campton]174-campton ’s ears were even more incredulous than [his]0-i eyes . [He]174-campton was gradually coming to believe in [[George]175-george ’s white room]4151-george ’s white room , [the ward beyond]4152-the ward beyond , the flowers between the beds , the fountain in [the court]4078-the court ; but the sound of [the sea]3674-the sea still came to [him]174-campton , intolerably but unescapably , as the crash of guns . When the impression was too overwhelming [he]174-campton would turn away from the window and cast [his]174-campton glance on the bed ; but only to find that [the smooth young face on the pillow]4155-the smooth young face on the pillow had suddenly changed into that of [the haggard bearded stranger on the wooden pallet at [Doullens]146-doullens]4156-the haggard bearded stranger on the wooden pallet at doullens . And [Campton]174-campton would have to get up , lean over , and catch the twinkle in [George]175-george ’s eyes before the evil spell was broken . Few words passed between [them]4157-them . [George]175-george , after all these days , was still too weak for much talk ; and silence had always been [Campton]174-campton ’s escape from feeling . [He]174-campton never had the need to speak in times of inward stress , unless it were to vent [his]174-campton anger — as in that hateful scene at [Doullens]146-doullens between [himself]174-campton and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . But [he]174-campton was sure that [George]175-george always knew what was passing through [his]174-campton mind ; that when [the sea]3674-the sea boomed [their]4157-them thoughts flew back together to that other scene , but a few miles and a few days distant , yet already as far off , as much an affair [they]4157-them were both rid of , as a nightmare to [a wakened sleeper]4159-a wakened sleeper ; and that for a moment the same vision clutched [them]4157-them both , mocking [their]4157-them attempts at indifference . Not that the sound , to [Campton]174-campton at any rate , suggested any abstract conception of war . Looking back afterward at this phase of [his]174-campton life [he]174-campton perceived that at no time had [he]174-campton thought so little of the war . The noise of [the sea]3674-the sea was to [him]174-campton simply the voice of the engine which had so nearly destroyed [[his]174-campton son]364-his son : that association , deeply embedded in [his]174-campton half - dazed consciousness , left no room for [others]644-others . The general impression of unreality was enhanced by [his]174-campton not having yet been able to learn the details of [George]175-george ’s wounding . After a week during which [the boy]416-the boy had hung near death , [the great surgeon]4070-the great surgeon — returning to [Doullens]146-doullens just as [Campton]174-campton had finally ceased to hope for [him]416-the boy — had announced that , though [George]175-george ’s state was still grave , [he]416-the boy might be moved to [a hospital at the rear]4133-a hospital at the rear . So one day , miraculously , the perilous transfer had been made , in one of [[Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s own motor - ambulances]4166-mrs. brant ’s own motor - ambulances ; and for a week now [George]175-george had lain in [his]175-george white bed , hung over by white - gowned [Sisters]336-sisters , in an atmosphere of sweetness and order which almost made it seem as if [he]175-george were [a child]1072-a child recovering from illness in [[his]175-george own nursery]4168-his own nursery , or [a red - haired baby sparring with dimpled fists]4169-a red - haired baby sparring with dimpled fists at a new world . In truth , [Campton]174-campton found [[his]174-campton son]364-his son as hard to get at as [a baby]4171-a baby ; [he]174-campton looked at [[his]174-campton father]580-his father with eyes as void of experience , or at least of any means of conveying it . [Campton]174-campton , at first , could only marvel and wait ; and the isolation in which [the two]459-the two were enclosed by [George]175-george ’s weakness , and by [[his]174-campton father]580-his father ’s inability to learn from [others]644-others what [the boy]416-the boy was not yet able to tell [him]174-campton , gave a strange remoteness to everything but the things which count in [an infant]4177-an infant ’s world : food , warmth , sleep . [Campton]174-campton ’s nearest approach to reality was [his]174-campton daily scrutiny of the temperature - chart . [He]174-campton studied it as [he]174-campton used to study the _ communiqués _ which [he]174-campton now no longer even thought of . Sometimes when [George]175-george was asleep [Campton]174-campton would sit pondering on the days at [Doullens]146-doullens . There was an exquisite joy in silently building up , on that foundation of darkness and anguish , the walls of peace that now surrounded [him]174-campton , a structure so transparent that [one]398-one could peer through it at the routed Furies , yet so impenetrable that [he]174-campton sat there in a kind of god - like aloofness . For one thing [he]174-campton was especially thankful — and that was the conclusion of [his]174-campton unseemly wrangle with [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ; thankful that , almost at once , [he]174-campton had hurried after [the banker]547-the banker , caught up with [him]547-the banker , and stammered out , clutching [his]547-the banker hand : “[0-i] [I]0-i know — [I]0-i know how [you]2050-you feel . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s reactions were never rapid , and the events of the preceding days had called upon faculties that were almost atrophied . [He]197-mr. brant had merely looked at [Campton]174-campton in mute distress , returned [his]197-mr. brant pressure , and silently remounted [the hospital stairs]4180-the hospital stairs with [him]197-mr. brant . [Campton]174-campton hated [himself]174-campton for [his]174-campton ill - temper , but was glad , even at the time , that no interested motive had prompted [his]174-campton apology . [He]174-campton should have hated [himself]174-campton even more if [he]174-campton had asked [the banker]547-the banker ’s pardon because of [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s “[2050-you] pull , ” and the uses to which it might be put ; or even if [he]174-campton had associated [his]174-campton excuses with any past motives of gratitude , such as the fact that but for [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant [he]174-campton might never have reached [George]175-george ’s side . Instead of that , [he]174-campton simply felt that once more [his]174-campton senseless violence had got the better of [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton was sorry that [he]174-campton had behaved like a brute to [a man who loved [George]175-george]4182-a man who loved george , and was suffering almost as much as [he]174-campton was at the thought that [George]175-george might die .... After that episode , and [Campton]174-campton ’s apology , the relations of [the two men]442-the two men became so easy that [each]4184-each gradually came to take [the other]2914-the other for granted ; and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , relieved of a perpetual hostile scrutiny , was free to exercise [his]197-mr. brant ingenuity in planning and managing . It was owing to [him]174-campton — [Campton]174-campton no longer minded admitting it — that [the famous surgeon]4186-the famous surgeon had hastened [his]174-campton return to [Doullens]146-doullens , that [George]175-george ’s translation to [the sweet monastic building near [the sea]3674-the sea]4187-the sweet monastic building near the sea had been so rapidly effected , and that [the great man]388-the great man , appearing [there]467-there soon afterward , had extracted the bullet with [his]388-the great man own hand . But for [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s persistence even the leave to bring one of [[Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s motor - ambulances]4191-mrs. brant ’s motor - ambulances to [Doullens]146-doullens would never have been given ; and it might have been fatal to [George]175-george to make the journey in [a slow and jolting military train]4192-a slow and jolting military train . But for [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , again , [he]2051-his would have been sent to [a crowded military hospital]4193-a crowded military hospital instead of being brought to [this white heaven of rest]4194-this white heaven of rest . “[2050-you] And all that just because [I]0-i overtook [him]2051-his in time to prevent [his]2051-his jumping into [his]2051-his motor and going back to [Paris]5-paris in order to get out of [my]0-i way ! ” [Campton]174-campton , at the thought , lowered [his]174-campton spirit into new depths of contrition . * * * * * [George]175-george , who had been asleep , opened [his]175-george eyes and looked at [[his]175-george father]580-his father . “[229-uncle andy] Where ’s [Uncle Andy]229-uncle andy ? ” “[229-uncle andy] Gone to [Paris]5-paris to get [[your]229-uncle andy mother]944-your mother . ” “[229-uncle andy] Yes . Of course . [He]229-uncle andy told [me]0-i — — ” [George]175-george smiled , and withdrew once more into [his]175-george secret world . But [Campton]174-campton ’s state of mind was less happy . As the time of [Julia]194-julia ’s arrival approached [he]174-campton began to ask [himself]174-campton with increasing apprehension how [she]194-julia would fit into the situation . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant _ had _ fitted into it — perfectly . [Campton]174-campton had actually begun to feel a secret dependence on [him]174-campton , a fidgety uneasiness since [he]174-campton had left for [Paris]5-paris , sweet though it was to be alone with [George]175-george . But [Julia]194-julia — what might [she]194-julia not do and say to unsettle things , break the spell , agitate and unnerve [them]4196-them all ? [Campton]174-campton did not question [her]194-julia love for [[her]194-julia son]3034-her son ; but [he]174-campton was not sure what form it would take in conditions to which [she]194-julia was so unsuited . How could [she]194-julia ever penetrate into the mystery of peace which enclosed [him]174-campton and [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy ? And if [she]194-julia felt them thus mysteriously shut off would [she]194-julia not dimly resent [her]194-julia exclusion ? If only [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had been coming too ! [Campton]174-campton had urged [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant to bring [her]194-julia ; but [the banker]547-the banker had failed to obtain a permit for [any one but [[the boy]416-the boy ’s mother]4202-the boy ’s mother]4200-any one but the boy ’s mother . [He]174-campton had even found it difficult to get [his]174-campton own leave renewed ; it was only after a first trip to [Paris]5-paris , and repeated efforts at [the War Office]1253-the war office , that [he]174-campton had been allowed to go to [Paris]5-paris and fetch [[his]174-campton wife , who was just arriving from [Biarritz]66-biarritz]4204-his wife , who was just arriving from biarritz . Well — for the moment , at any rate , [Campton]174-campton had [the boy]416-the boy to [himself]174-campton . As [he]174-campton sat there , trying to picture the gradual resurrection of [George]175-george ’s pre - war face out of the delicately pencilled white mask on the pillow , [he]174-campton noted the curious change of planes produced by suffering and emaciation , and the altered relation of lights and shadows . Materially speaking , the new [George]175-george looked like [the old one seen in the bowl of a spoon]4206-the old one seen in the bowl of a spoon , and through blue spectacles : peaked , narrow , livid , with elongated nose and sunken eye - sockets . But these altered proportions were not what had really changed [him]175-george . There was something in the curve of the mouth that fever and emaciation could not account for . In that new line , and in the look of [his]175-george eyes — the look travelling slowly outward through a long blue tunnel , like some mysterious creature rising from the depths of [the sea]3674-the sea — that was where [the new George]1092-the new george lurked , [the George]4209-the george to be watched and lain in wait for , patiently and slowly puzzled out .... [He]174-campton reopened [his]174-campton eyes . “[229-uncle andy] [Adele]220-adele anthony too ? ” [Campton]174-campton had learned to bridge over the spaces between the questions . “[220-adele anthony] No ; not this time . [We]2053-we tried , but it could n’t be managed . A little later , [I]0-i hope — — ” “[0-i] [She]2054-she ’s all right ? ” “[2054-she] Rather ! [Blooming]337-blooming . ” “[337-blooming] And [Boylston]247-boylston ? ” “[337-blooming] [Blooming]337-blooming too . ” [George]175-george ’s lids closed contentedly , like doors shutting [him]175-george away from [the world]2535-the world . It was the first time since [his]175-george operation that [he]175-george had asked about [any of [[his]175-george friends]2655-his friends]4211-any of his friends , or had appeared to think [they]4211-any of his friends might come to see [him]175-george . But [his]175-george mind , like [his]175-george stomach , could receive very little nutriment at a time ; [he]175-george liked to have one mouthful given to [him]175-george , and then to lie ruminating it in the lengthening intervals between [his]175-george attacks of pain . Each time [he]175-george asked for news of any one [[his]175-george father]580-his father wondered what name would next come to [his]175-george lips . Even during [his]175-george delirium [he]175-george had mentioned [no one]2702-no one but [[his]175-george parents]509-his parents , [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony and [Boylston]247-boylston ; yet it was not possible , [Campton]174-campton thought , that these formed the circumference of [his]175-george life , that some contracted fold of memory did not hold a nearer image , a more secret name .... [The father]568-the father ’s heart beat faster , half from curiosity , half from a kind of shy delicacy , at the thought that at any moment that name might wake in [George]175-george and utter itself . [Campton]174-campton ’s thoughts again turned to [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife . With [Julia]194-julia there was never any knowing . Ten to one [she]194-julia would send [the boy]416-the boy ’s temperature up . [He]174-campton was thankful that , owing to the difficulty of getting the news to [her]194-julia , and then of bringing [her]194-julia back from [a frontier department]4219-a frontier department , so many days had had to elapse . But when [she]194-julia arrived , nothing , after all , happened as [he]174-campton had expected . [She]194-julia had put on [[her]194-julia [nurse]4057-nurse]4220-her nurse ’s dress for the journey ( [he]174-campton thought it rather theatrical of [her]194-julia , till [he]174-campton remembered how much easier it was to get about in any sort of uniform ) ; but there was not a trace of coquetry in [her]194-julia appearance . As a frame for [her]194-julia haggard unpowdered face the white coif looked harsh and unbecoming ; [she]194-julia reminded [him]174-campton , as [she]194-julia got out of [the motor]1081-the motor , of [some mortified Jansenist nun from one of [Philippe de Champaigne]338-philippe de champaigne]4223-some mortified jansenist nun from one of philippe de champaigne ’s canvases . [Campton]174-campton led [her]194-julia to [George]175-george ’s door , but left [her]194-julia there ; [she]194-julia did not appear to notice whether or not [he]174-campton was following [her]194-julia . [He]174-campton whispered : “[337-blooming] Careful about [his]2055-his temperature ; [he]2055-his ’s very weak , ” and [she]194-julia bent [her]194-julia profile silently as [she]194-julia went in . XXVII [George]175-george , that evening , seemed rather better , and [his]2055-his temperature had not gone up : [Campton]174-campton had to repress a movement of jealousy at [Julia]194-julia ’s having done [[her]194-julia son]3034-her son no harm . [Her]194-julia experience as [a nurse]1354-a nurse , disciplining a vague gift for [the sickroom]4226-the sickroom , had developed in [her]194-julia the faculty of self - command : before the war , if [George]175-george had met with a dangerous accident , [she]194-julia would have been more encumbering than helpful . [Campton]174-campton had to admit the change , but it did not draw [them]4227-they any nearer . [Her]194-julia manner of loving [[their]4227-they son]4228-their son was too different . Nowadays , when [he]174-campton and [Anderson Brant]196-mrs. brant were together , [he]174-campton felt that [they]4227-they were thinking of the same things in the same way ; but [Julia]194-julia ’s face , even aged and humanized by grief , was still a mere mask to [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton could never tell what form [her]194-julia thoughts about [George]175-george might be taking . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , on [[his]197-mr. brant wife]516-his wife ’s arrival , had judged it discreet to efface [himself]197-mr. brant . [Campton]174-campton hunted for [him]197-mr. brant in vain in [the park]4230-the park , and under [the cloister]4231-the cloister ; [he]197-mr. brant remained invisible till [they]4227-they met at the early dinner which [they]4227-they shared with [the staff]4232-the staff . But the meal did not last long , and when it was over , and [nurses]1337-nurses and [doctors]4073-doctors scattered , [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant again slipped away , leaving [[his]197-mr. brant wife]516-his wife and [Campton]174-campton alone . [Campton]174-campton glanced after [him]197-mr. brant , surprised . “[2055-his] Why does [he]2056-he go ? ” [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant pursed [her]196-mrs. brant lips , evidently as much surprised by [his]174-campton question as [he]174-campton by [[her]196-mrs. brant husband]539-her husband ’s withdrawal . “[2056-he] [I]0-i suppose [he]2056-he ’s going to bed — to be ready for [his]2056-he early start to - morrow . ” “[2056-he] A start ? ” [She]196-mrs. brant stared . “[2056-he] [He]2056-he ’s going back to [Paris]5-paris . ” [Campton]174-campton was genuinely astonished . “[2056-he] Is [he]2056-he ? [I]0-i ’m sorry . ” “[0-i] Oh — — ” [She]196-mrs. brant seemed unprepared for this . “[0-i] After all , [you]0-i must see — [we]2057-we ca n’t very well ... [all three of [us]2057-we]2058-all three of us ... especially with [these nuns]2059-these nuns .... ” “[0-i] Oh , if it ’s only _ that _ — — ” [She]196-mrs. brant did not take this up , and one of [their]2057-we usual silences followed . [Campton]174-campton was thinking that it was all nonsense about [the nuns]4237-the nuns , and meditating on the advisability of going in pursuit of [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant to tell [him]174-campton so . [He]174-campton dreaded the prospect of a long succession of days alone between [George]175-george and [[George]175-george ’s mother]3033-george ’s mother . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant spoke again . “[0-i] [I]0-i was sorry to find that [the Sisters]715-the sisters have been kept on [here]2489-here . Are [they]715-the sisters much with [George]175-george ? ” “[336-sisters] [The Sisters]336-sisters ? [I]0-i do n’t know . [The upper nurses]2062-the upper nurses are [Red Cross]151-red cross , as [you]2063-you saw . But of course the others are about a good deal . What ’s wrong ? [They]715-the sisters seem to [me]0-i perfect . ” [She]196-mrs. brant hesitated and coloured a little . “[715-the sisters] [I]0-i do n’t want [them]715-the sisters to find out — about the Extreme Unction , ” [she]196-mrs. brant finally said . [Campton]174-campton repeated [her]196-mrs. brant words blankly . [He]174-campton began to think that anxiety and fatigue had confused [her]196-mrs. brant mind . [She]196-mrs. brant coloured more deeply . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i forgot — [you]2063-you do n’t know . [I]0-i could n’t think of anything but [George]175-george at first ... and the whole thing is so painful to [me]0-i .... Where ’s [my]0-i bag ? ” [She]196-mrs. brant groped for [her]196-mrs. brant reticule , found it in the folds of the cloak [she]196-mrs. brant had kept about [her]196-mrs. brant shoulders , and fumbled in it with wrinkled jewelled fingers . “[196-mrs. brant] [Anderson]196-mrs. brant has n’t spoken to [you]2063-you , then — spoken about [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ? ” [she]196-mrs. brant asked suddenly . “[196-mrs. brant] About [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ? Why should [he]175-george ? What on earth has happened ? ” “[175-george] Oh , [I]0-i would n’t see [her]255-mrs. talkett [myself]0-i ... [I]0-i could n’t ... so [he]175-george had to . [She]255-mrs. talkett had to be thanked , of course ... but it seems to [me]0-i so dreadful , so very dreadful ... _ [[our]2064-our _ boy]2065-our _ boy ... [that woman]2066-that woman .... ” [Campton]174-campton did not press [her]196-mrs. brant further . [He]174-campton sat dumbfounded , trying to take in what [she]196-mrs. brant was so obviously trying to communicate , and yet instinctively resisting the approach of the revelation [he]174-campton foresaw . “[2066-that woman] [George—_Mrs . Talkett]339-george—_mrs . talkett _ ? ” [He]174-campton forced [himself]174-campton to couple the two names , unnatural as [their]2064-our union seemed . “[0-i] [I]0-i supposed [you]2066-that woman knew . Is n’t it dreadful ? [A woman old enough]2067-a woman old enough — — ” [She]196-mrs. brant drew a letter from [her]196-mrs. brant bag . [He]174-campton interrupted [her]196-mrs. brant . “[2067-a woman old enough] Is that letter what [you]2066-that woman want to show [me]0-i ? ” “[2066-that woman] Yes . [She]2066-that woman insisted on [Anderson]196-mrs. brant ’s keeping it — for [you]0-i . [She]2066-that woman said it belonged to [us]2068-us , [I]0-i believe .... It seems there was a promise — made the night before [he]0-i was mobilised — that if anything happened [he]0-i would get word to [her]2066-that woman .... No thought of _ [us]2068-us _ ! ” [She]196-mrs. brant began to whimper . [Campton]174-campton reached out for the letter . [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett — [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett and [George]175-george ! That was where [the boy]416-the boy had gone then , that last night when [[his]416-the boy father]580-his father , left alone at [the Crillon]28-the crillon , had been so hurt by [his]580-his father desertion ! That was the name which , in [his]174-campton hours of vigil in [the little white room]4241-the little white room , [Campton]174-campton had watched for on [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s lips , the name which , one day , sooner or later , [he]174-campton would have to hear [them]4243-them pronounce .... How little [he]174-campton had thought , as [he]174-campton sat studying the mysterious beauty of [George]175-george ’s face , what a commonplace secret it concealed ! The writing was not [George]175-george ’s , but that of [an unlettered French soldier]4244-an unlettered french soldier . [Campton]174-campton , glancing at the signature , recalled it as that of [[[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as [George]175-george , and sent for twenty - four hours to [the same hospital]4247-the same hospital at [Doullens]146-doullens]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens . [He]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens had been at [George]175-george ’s side when [he]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens fell , and with the simple directness often natural to [his]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens class in [France]18-france [he]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens told the tale of [[his]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens lieutenant]4248-his lieutenant ’s wounding , in circumstances which appeared to have given [George]175-george great glory in the eyes of [[his]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens men]4249-his men . [They]4249-his men thought the wound mortal ; but [the orderly]4250-the orderly and [a stretcher - bearer]4251-a stretcher - bearer had managed to get [the young man]2749-the young man into the shelter of a little wood . [The stretcher - bearer]4253-the stretcher - bearer , it turned out , was [a priest]4254-a priest . [He]4253-the stretcher - bearer had at once applied the consecrated oil , and [George]175-george , still conscious , had received it “[2066-that woman] with a beautiful smile ” ; then [the orderly , thinking all was over]4255-the orderly , thinking all was over , had hurried back to the fighting , and been wounded . There was too much to be taken in all at once ; and , as usual in moments of deep disturbance , [he]4246-his son ’s orderly , who had been slightly wounded in the same attack as george , and sent for twenty - four hours to the same hospital at doullens wanted to be alone , above all wanted to be away from [Julia]194-julia . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s face had clouded again . “[2074-her] It ’s all so dreadful — and this Extreme Unction too ! What is it exactly , do [you]2075-you know ? A sort of baptism ? [I]0-i ’ve seen such advantage taken of [the wounded]2084-the wounded when [they]2083-they were too weak to resist ... did n’t know what [they]2083-they were saying or doing .... ” [Her]194-julia eyes filled with tears . “[4254-a priest] [A priest]4254-a priest and [a woman]760-a woman — [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i ’d lost [[my]0-i boy]983-my boy ! ” The words went through [Campton]174-campton like a sword , and [he]174-campton sprang to [his]174-campton feet . “[0-i] Oh , for [God]266-god ’s sake be quiet — don’t say it ! What does anything matter but that [he]983-my boy ’s alive ? ” “[340-....] Of course , of course ... [I]0-i did n’t mean [....]340-.... [The latter]1395-the latter was smoking a last cigar as [he]983-my boy paced up and down [the cloister]4231-the cloister with upturned coat - collar . [Silence]341-silence lay on [the carefully darkened building]4272-the carefully darkened building , crouching low under an icy sea - fog ; at intervals , through the hush , the waves continued to mimic the booming of the guns . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant turned to continue [his]197-mr. brant round , and [Campton]174-campton went up to [the whitewashed cell in which [he]174-campton was lodged]4275-the whitewashed cell in which he was lodged . Screening [his]197-mr. brant candle to keep the least light from leaking through the shutters , [he]197-mr. brant re - read the story of [George]175-george ’s wounding , copied out in the cramped tremulous writing of [a man who never took pen in hand but to sign a daily batch of typed letters]4276-a man who never took pen in hand but to sign a daily batch of typed letters . The “[0-i] hand - made ” copy of a letter by [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant represented something like the pious toil expended by [a monkish scribe on the page of a missal]4277-a monkish scribe on the page of a missal ; and [Campton]174-campton was moved by [the little man]441-the little man ’s devotion . As for the letter , [Campton]174-campton had no sooner begun to re - read it than [he]174-campton entirely forgot that it was a message of love , addressed at [George]175-george ’s request to [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett , and saw in it only the record of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s bravery . And for the first time [he]174-campton understood that from the moment of [George]175-george ’s wounding until now [he]174-campton had never really thought of [him]441-the little man in relation to the war , never thought of [his]174-campton judgment on the war , of all the unknown emotions , resolves and actions which had drawn [him]174-campton so many months ago from [[his]174-campton safe shelter in [the Argonne]81-the argonne]4280-his safe shelter in the argonne . These things [Campton]174-campton , unconsciously , had put out of [his]174-campton mind , or rather had lost out of [his]174-campton mind , from the moment when [he]174-campton had heard of [George]175-george ’s wounding . By - and - bye , [he]174-campton knew , the sense of [them]4281-them , and of the questions [they]4281-them raised , would come back and possess [him]174-campton ; but meanwhile , emptied of all else , [he]174-campton brimmed with the mere fact of [George]175-george ’s bodily presence , with the physical signs of [him]175-george , [his]175-george weakness , [his]175-george temperature , the pain in [his]175-george arm , the oppression on [his]175-george lung , all the daily insistent details involved in coaxing [him]175-george slowly back to life . [The father]568-the father could bear no more ; [he]568-the father put the letter away , as [a man]2492-a man might put away something of which [his]2492-a man heart was too full to measure it . Later — yes ; now , all [he]568-the father knew was that [[his]568-the father son]364-his son was alive . * * * * * But the hour of [Campton]174-campton ’s entering into glory came when , two or three days later , [George]175-george asked with a sudden smile : “[0-i] When [I]0-i exchanged regiments [I]0-i did what [you]2096-you ’d always hoped [I]0-i would , eh , [Dad]332-dad ? ” It was the first allusion , on the part of either , to the mystery of [George]175-george ’s transit from [the Argonne]81-the argonne to the front . At [Doullens]146-doullens [he]175-george had been too weak to be questioned , and as [he]175-george grew stronger , and entered upon the successive stages of [his]175-george convalescence , [he]175-george gave the impression of having travelled far beyond such matters , and of living [his]175-george real life in some inconceivable region from which , with that new smile of [his]175-george , [he]175-george continued to look down unseeingly on [[his]175-george parents]509-his parents . “[332-dad] It ’s exactly as if [he]2097-he were dead , ” [the father]568-the father thought . “[2097-he] And if [he]2097-he were , [he]2097-he might go on watching [us]2098-us with just such a smile . ” And then , one morning as [they]2098-us were taking a few steps on [a sunny terrace]4287-a sunny terrace , [Campton]174-campton had felt the pressure of [the boy]416-the boy ’s sound arm , and caught [the old George]175-george in [his]175-george look . “[2097-he] [I]0-i ... [good Lord]3405-good lord ... at any rate [I]0-i ’m glad [you]2100-you felt sure of [me]0-i , ” [Campton]174-campton could only stammer in reply . [George]175-george laughed . “[2100-you] Well — rather ! ” There was a long silence full of sea - murmurs , too drowsy and indolent , for once , to simulate the horror of the guns . “[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i only wish [you]2100-you ’d felt [you]2100-you could trust [me]0-i about it from the first , as [you]2100-you did [Adele]220-adele anthony and [Boylston]247-boylston , ” [the father]568-the father continued . “[2100-you] But , [[my]0-i dear fellow]943-my dear fellow , [I]0-i did feel it ! [I]0-i swear [I]0-i did ! Only , [you]2100-you see , there was [mother]821-mother . [I]0-i thought it all over , and decided it would be easier for [you]2100-you both if [I]0-i said nothing . And , after all , [I]0-i ’m glad now that [I]0-i didn’t — that is , if [you]2100-you really do understand . ” “[2100-you] Yes ; [I]0-i understand . ” “[2100-you] That ’s jolly . ” [George]175-george ’s eyes turned from [his]175-george and rested with a joyful gravity on [the little round - faced Sister who hurried up to say that [he]175-george ’d been out long enough]4290-the little round - faced sister who hurried up to say that he ’d been out long enough . [Campton]174-campton often caught [him]175-george fixing this look of serene benevolence on [the people who were gradually repeopling [[his]175-george world]4292-his world , a look which seemed to say that [they]4293-they were new to [him]175-george , yet dimly familiar]4291-the people who were gradually repeopling his world , a look which seemed to say that they were new to him , yet dimly familiar . [He]175-george was like [a traveller returning after incommunicable adventures to [the place where [he]175-george had lived as [a child]1072-a child]4295-the place where he had lived as a child]4294-a traveller returning after incommunicable adventures to the place where he had lived as a child ; and , as happens with [such wanderers]4297-such wanderers , the trivial and insignificant things , the things [a newcomer]4298-a newcomer would not have noticed , seemed often to interest [him]175-george most of all . [He]175-george said nothing more about [himself]175-george , but with the look of recovered humanness which made [him]175-george more lovable if less remotely beautiful , began to question [[his]175-george father]580-his father . “[2100-you] [Boylston]247-boylston wrote that [you]247-boylston ’d begun to paint again . [People who wanted to ‘ secure [a Campton]174-campton]2104-people who wanted to ‘ secure a campton . ’ Oh , and then [the dealers]1476-the dealers — [God]266-god ! ” [George]175-george seemed unimpressed . “[1476-the dealers] After all , life ’s got to go on . ” “[1476-the dealers] Yes — that ’s what [they]1476-the dealers say ! And the only result is to make [me]0-i doubt if _ theirs _ has . ” [[His]580-his father son]364-his son laughed , and then threw off : “[247-boylston] [You]247-boylston did [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ? ” “[255-mrs. talkett] Yes , ” [Campton]174-campton snapped , off [his]174-campton guard . “[255-mrs. talkett] [She]2106-she ’s [a pretty creature]2107-a pretty creature , ” said [George]175-george ; and at that moment [his]175-george eyes , resting again on [the little nurse , who was waiting at [his]175-george door with a cup of cocoa]4301-the little nurse , who was waiting at his door with a cup of cocoa , lit up with celestial gratitude . “[2106-she] The _ communiqué ’s _ good to - day , ” [she]4301-the little nurse , who was waiting at his door with a cup of cocoa cried ; and [he]175-george smiled at [her]4301-the little nurse , who was waiting at his door with a cup of cocoa boyishly . The war was beginning to interest [him]175-george again : [Campton]174-campton was sure that every moment [he]175-george could spare from that unimaginable region which [his]175-george blue eyes guarded like a sword was spent among [[his]175-george comrades]3506-his comrades at the front . * * * * * As the day approached for the return to [Paris]5-paris , [Campton]174-campton began to penetrate more deeply into the meaning of [George]175-george ’s remoteness . [He]175-george [himself]175-george , [he]175-george discovered , had been all unawares in [a far country]4303-a far country , [a country guarded by [a wingèd sentry]4305-a wingèd sentry , as the old hymn had it]4304-a country guarded by a wingèd sentry , as the old hymn had it : the region of silent incessant communion with [[his]175-george son]364-his son . Just [they]4307-they two : everything else effaced ; not discarded , destroyed , not disregarded even , but blotted out by a soft silver haze , as the brown slopes and distances were , on certain days , from the windows of [the seaward - gazing hospital]4308-the seaward - gazing hospital . It was not that [Campton]174-campton had been unconscious of the presence of other suffering about [them]4307-they . As [George]175-george grew stronger , and took [his]175-george first steps in [the wards]4309-the wards , [he]175-george and [[his]175-george father]580-his father were inevitably brought into contact with the life of [the hospital]1368-the hospital . [George]175-george had even found [a few friends]4312-a few friends , and [two or three regimental comrades]4313-two or three regimental comrades , among [the officers]1892-the officers perpetually coming and going , or enduring the long weeks of agony which led up to the end . But that was only toward the close of [their]4307-they sojourn , when [George]175-george was about to yield [his]175-george place to [others]644-others , and be taken to [Paris]5-paris for the re - education of [his]175-george shattered arm . And by that time the weeks of solitary communion had left such an imprint on [Campton]174-campton that , once [the hospital]1368-the hospital was behind [him]174-campton , and no more than a phase of memory , it became to [him]174-campton as one of [its]1368-the hospital own sea - mists , in which [he]174-campton and [[his]174-campton son]364-his son might have been peacefully shut away together from [all the rest of [the world]2535-the world]4318-all the rest of the world . XXVIII “[2106-she] Preparedness ! ” cried [Boylston]247-boylston in an exultant crow . [His]247-boylston round brown face with its curly crest and peering half - blind eyes beamed at [Campton]174-campton in the old way across the desk of [the Palais Royal office]4320-the palais royal office ; and from the corner where [she]4321-she had sunk down on one of the broken - springed divans , [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony echoed : “[2106-she] Preparedness ! ” It was the first time that [Campton]174-campton had heard the word ; but the sense of it had been in the air ever since [he]174-campton and [George]175-george had got back to [Paris]5-paris . [He]174-campton remembered , on the very day of [their]4322-their arrival , noticing something different in both [Boylston]247-boylston and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ; and the change had shown itself in the same way : both seemed more vivid yet more remote . It had struck [Campton]174-campton in the moment of first meeting [them]4322-their , in [the [Paris]5-paris hospital near [the Bois de Boulogne]4324-the bois de boulogne]4323-the paris hospital near the bois de boulogne — [Fortin - Lescluze ’s old Nursing - Home]4325-fortin - lescluze ’s old nursing - home transformed into [a House of Re - education]4326-a house of re - education — to which [George]175-george had been taken . In [the little cell]4327-the little cell crowded with flowers — almost too many flowers , [[his]174-campton father]580-his father thought , for [the patient]4329-the patient ’s aching head and tired eyes — [Campton]174-campton , watching the entrance of [the two visitors]4330-the two visitors , [the first to be admitted after [Julia]194-julia and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant]4331-the first to be admitted after julia and mr. brant , had instantly remarked the air [they]4322-their had of sharing something so secret and important that [their]4322-their joy at seeing [George]175-george seemed only the overflow of another deeper joy . [Their]4322-their look had just such a vividness as [George]175-george ’s own ; as [their]4322-their glances crossed , [Campton]174-campton saw the same light in the eyes of all three . And now , a few weeks later , the clue to it came to [him]174-campton in [Boylston]247-boylston ’s new word . _ Preparedness ! _ [America]2-america , it appeared , had caught it up from east to west , in that sudden incalculable way [she]194-julia had of flinging [herself]194-julia on a new idea ; from [a little group of discerning spirits the contagion]4332-a little group of discerning spirits the contagion had spread like a prairie fire , sweeping away all the other catchwords of the hour , devouring [them]4332-a little group of discerning spirits the contagion in one great blaze of wrath and enthusiasm . [America]2-america meant to be prepared ! First had come the creation of [the training camp at [Plattsburg]152-plattsburg]4333-the training camp at plattsburg , for which , after long delays and much difficulty , permission had been wrung from [a reluctant government]4334-a reluctant government ; then , as [candidates]4335-candidates flocked to it , as [the whole young manhood of]4336-the whole young manhood of [the Eastern States]4337-the eastern states rose to the call , [other camps]4338-other camps , rapidly planned , were springing up at [Fort Oglethorpe]153-fort oglethorpe in [Georgia]154-georgia , at [Fort Sheridan in [Illinois]156-illinois]155-fort sheridan in illinois , at [The Presidio in [California]157-california]4339-the presidio in california ; for the idea was spreading through [the West]158-the west , and the torch kindled beside [the Atlantic seaboard]4340-the atlantic seaboard already flashed its light on [the Pacific]142-the pacific . For hours at a time [Campton]174-campton heard [Boylston]247-boylston talking about [these training camps]4341-these training camps with [the young Americans who helped [him]247-boylston in [his]247-boylston work , or dropped in to seek [his]247-boylston counsel]4342-the young americans who helped him in his work , or dropped in to seek his counsel . More than ever , now , [he]247-boylston was [an authority and an oracle to [these stray youths who were expending [their]4344-these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery enthusiasm for [France]18-france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery]4344-these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery : [students of the Beaux Arts]4345-students of the beaux arts or [the University]599-the university , or [young men of leisure]4347-young men of leisure discouraged by the indifference of [[their]4344-these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery country]4348-their country and the dilatoriness of [[their]4344-these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery government]4349-their government , and fired by the desire to take part in a struggle in which [they]4344-these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery had instantly felt [[their]4344-these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery own country]4350-their own country]4343-an authority and an oracle to these stray youths who were expending their enthusiasm for france in the humblest of philanthropic drudgery : students of the beaux arts or the university , or young men of leisure discouraged by the indifference of their country and the dilatoriness of their government , and fired by the desire to take part in a struggle in which they had instantly felt their own country to be involved in spite of geographical distance . [None of [these young men]4352-these young men]4351-none of these young men had heard [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher ’s imperious call to be “[2106-she] in it ” from the first , no matter how or at what cost . [They]4352-these young men were of the kind to wait for a lead — and now [Boylston]247-boylston was giving it to [them]4352-these young men with [his]247-boylston passionate variations on the great theme of Preparedness . [George]175-george , meanwhile , lay there in [his]175-george bed and smiled ; and now and then [Boylston]247-boylston brought one or two of [the more privileged candidates]4353-the more privileged candidates to see [him]175-george . One day [Campton]174-campton found [young Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey [there]467-there , worn and haggard after a bad wound , and preparing to leave for [America]2-america as [instructor]4355-instructor in [one of [the new camps]4357-the new camps]4356-one of the new camps . That seemed to bring the movement closer than ever , to bring it into [their]2108-their very lives . The thought flashed through [Campton]174-campton : “[2109-her] When [George]175-george is up , [we]2108-their ’ll get [him]175-george sent out too ” ; and once again a delicious sense of security crept through [him]174-campton . [George]175-george , as yet , was only sitting up for a few hours a day ; the wound in the lung was slow in healing , and [his]175-george fractured arm in recovering its flexibility . But in another fortnight [he]175-george was to leave [the hospital]1368-the hospital and complete [his]175-george convalescence at [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother ’s . The thought was bitter to [Campton]174-campton ; [he]174-campton had had all kinds of wild plans — of taking [George]175-george to [the Crillon]28-the crillon , or hiring [an apartment for [him]175-george]4360-an apartment for him , or even camping with [him]175-george at [the studio]370-the studio . But [George]175-george had smiled all this away . [He]175-george meant to return to [the Avenue Marigny]125-the avenue marigny , where [he]175-george always stayed when [he]175-george came to [Paris]5-paris , and where it was natural that [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother should want [him]175-george now . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony pointed out to [Campton]174-campton how natural it was , one day as [he]174-campton and [she]583-his mother left [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal together . [They]4364-they were going to lunch at [a near - by restaurant]4365-a near - by restaurant , as [they]4364-they often did on leaving [the office]1357-the office , and [Campton]174-campton had begun to speak of [George]175-george ’s future arrangements . [He]174-campton would be well enough to leave [the hospital]1368-the hospital in another week , and then no doubt a staff - job could be obtained for [him]174-campton in [Paris—“with]159-paris—“with[194-julia] [Brant]194-julia ’s pull , [you]2109-her know , ” [Campton]174-campton concluded , hardly aware that [he]174-campton had uttered the detested phrase without even a tinge of irony . But [Adele]220-adele anthony was aware , as [he]174-campton saw by the faint pucker of [her]2109-her thin lips . [He]174-campton shrugged [her]2109-her smile away indifferently . “[194-julia] Oh , well — hang it , yes ! Everything ’s changed now , is n’t it ? After what [the boy]416-the boy ’s been through [I]0-i consider that [we]2111-we ’re more than justified in using [Brant]194-julia ’s pull in [his]416-the boy favour — or [anybody else]2112-anybody else ’s . ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony nodded and unfolded [her]221-miss anthony napkin . “[0-i] Well , then , ” [Campton]174-campton continued [his]174-campton argument , “[416-the boy] as [he]416-the boy ’s likely to be in [Paris]5-paris now till the war is over — which means some time next year , [they]2113-they all say — why should n’t [I]0-i take [a jolly apartment]2114-a jolly apartment somewhere for [the two of [us]2111-we]2115-the two of us ? Those pictures [I]0-i did last spring brought [me]0-i in a lot of money , and there ’s no reason — — ” [His]174-campton face lit up . “[2116-servants] [Servants]2116-servants , [you]0-i say ? Why , [[my]0-i poor [Mariette]187-mariette]2117-my poor mariette may be back from [Lille]14-lille any time now . [They]2116-servants tell [me]0-i there ’s sure to be a big push in the spring . [They]2116-servants ’re saving up for that all along the line . Ask [Dastrey]220-adele anthony ... ask .... ” “[0-i] [You]0-i ’d better let [George]175-george go to [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother , ” said [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony concisely . “[0-i] Why ? ” “[0-i] Because it ’s natural — it ’s human . _ [You]0-i ’re _ not always , [you]0-i know , ” [she]221-miss anthony added with another pucker . “[0-i] Not human ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t mean that [you]0-i ’re inhuman . But [you]0-i see things differently . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t want to see anything but one ; and that ’s [[my]0-i own son]1970-my own son . How shall [I]0-i ever see [George]175-george if [he]175-george ’s at [the Avenue Marigny]125-the avenue marigny ? ” “[175-george] [He]175-george ’ll come to [you]0-i . ” “[175-george] Yes — when [he]175-george ’s not at [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s ! ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony frowned . The subject had been touched upon between [them]4368-them soon after [Campton]174-campton ’s return , but [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony had little light to throw on it : [George]175-george had been as mute with [her]255-mrs. talkett as with [every one else]4369-every one else , and [she]255-mrs. talkett knew [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett but slightly , and seldom saw [her]255-mrs. talkett .
