And it might be useful . But [I]0-i can’t — [I]0-i ca n’t ! ” [Campton]174-campton said within [himself]0-i : “[738-women] Oh , [women]738-women — — ! ” For [his]0-i own resentment had died out long ago . [He]0-i could think of the affair now as one of hundreds such as happen to [young men]4371-young men ; [he]0-i was even conscious of regarding it , in some unlit secret fold of [himself]0-i , as a probable guarantee of [George]175-george ’s wanting to remain in [Paris]5-paris , another subterranean way of keeping [him]2121-him , should such be needed . Perhaps that was what [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony meant by saying that [her]221-miss anthony liking [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett might be “[738-women] useful . ” “[738-women] Why should n’t [he]2121-him be with [me]0-i ? ” [the father]568-the father persisted . “[2121-him] [He]2121-him and [I]0-i were going off together when the war begun . [I]0-i was defrauded of that — why should n’t [I]0-i have [him]2121-him now ? ” [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony smiled . “[0-i] Well , for one thing , because of that very ‘ pull ’ [you]0-i were speaking of . ” “[0-i] Oh , [the Brants]203-the brants , [the Brants]203-the brants ! ” [Campton]174-campton glanced impatiently at the bill - of - fare , grumbled : “[203-the brants] _ Déjeuner du jour _ , [I]0-i suppose ? ” and went on : “[203-the brants] Yes ; [I]0-i might have known it — [he]2121-him belongs to [them]2122-them . From the minute [we]2123-we got back , and [I]0-i saw [them]2122-them at [the station]563-the station , with [their]2122-them motor waiting , and everything arranged as only money can arrange it , [I]0-i knew [I]0-i ’d lost [[my]0-i boy]983-my boy again . ” [He]174-campton stared moodily before [him]174-campton . “[0-i] And yet if the war had n’t come [I]0-i should have got [him]2121-him back — [I]0-i almost had . ” [[His]174-campton companion]3886-his companion still smiled , a little wistfully . [She]3886-his companion leaned over and laid [her]3886-his companion hand on [his]174-campton , under cover of the bill - of - fare . “[0-i] [You]0-i did get [him]2121-him back , [John]174-campton , forever and always , the day [he]2121-him exchanged into [the infantry]3098-the infantry . Is n’t that enough ? ” [Campton]174-campton answered [her]3886-his companion smile . “[0-i] [You]0-i [gallant old chap]2127-gallant old chap , [you]0-i ! ” [he]174-campton said ; and [they]4374-they began to lunch . * * * * * [George]175-george was able to be up now , able to drive out , and to see [more people]3456-more people ; and [Campton]174-campton was not surprised , on approaching [his]174-campton door a day or two later , to hear several voices in animated argument . The voices ( and this did surprise [him]174-campton ) were [all men]3192-all men ’s . In one [he]174-campton recognized [Boylston]247-boylston ’s deep round notes ; but the answering voice , flat , toneless and yet eager , puzzled [him]174-campton with a sense of something familiar but forgotten . [He]174-campton opened the door , and saw , at the tea - tray between [George]175-george and [Boylston]247-boylston , the smoothly - brushed figure of [Roger Talkett]319-mr. talkett . [Campton]174-campton had not seen [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s husband]4377-mrs. talkett ’s husband for months , and in the interval so much had happened that [the young man , always somewhat faintly - drawn , had become as dim as a daguerreotype held at the wrong angle]4378-the young man , always somewhat faintly - drawn , had become as dim as a daguerreotype held at the wrong angle . [The painter]540-the painter hung back , slightly embarrassed ; but [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett did not seem in the least disturbed by [his]174-campton appearance , or by the fact of [himself]174-campton being where [he]174-campton was . It was evident that , on whatever terms [George]175-george might be with [[his]175-george wife]516-his wife , [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett was determined to shed on [him]174-campton the same impartial beam as on all [[her]516-his wife other visitors]4381-her other visitors . [His]319-mr. talkett eye - glasses glinted blandly up at [Campton]174-campton . “[0-i] Now [I]0-i daresay [I]0-i _ am _ subversive , ” [he]0-i began , going on with what [he]0-i had been saying , but in a tone intended to include [the newcomer]4382-the newcomer . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t say [I]0-i ’m not . [We]2128-we _ are _ [a subversive lot at [home]502-home]2129-a subversive lot at home , [all of [us]2128-we]2131-all of us — [you]0-i must have noticed that , have n’t [you]0-i , [Mr. Campton]174-campton ? ” [Boylston]247-boylston emitted a faint growl . “[0-i] What ’s that got to do with it ? ” [he]247-boylston asked . [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett ’s glasses slanted in [his]247-boylston direction . “[0-i] Why — everything ! Resistance to the herd - instinct ( to borrow one of [[my]0-i wife]3210-my wife ’s expressions ) is really innate in [me]0-i . And the idea of giving in now , of sacrificing [my]0-i convictions , just because of all this deafening noise about [America]2-america ’s danger and [America]2-america ’s duties — well , _ no _ , ” said [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett , straightening [his]0-i glasses , “[3210-my wife] Philistinism wo n’t go down with [me]0-i , in whatever form it tries to disguise itself . ” Instinctively , [he]0-i stretched a neat hand toward the teacups , as if [he]0-i had been rearranging the furniture at one of [[his]0-i wife]516-his wife ’s parties . “[3210-my wife] But — but — but — — ” [Boylston]247-boylston stuttered , red with rage . [George]175-george burst into a laugh . [He]175-george seemed to take a boyish amusement in the dispute . “[573-father] Tea , [father]573-father ? ” [he]175-george suggested , reaching across the tray for a cigarette . [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett jerked [himself]255-mrs. talkett to [his]0-i feet . “[573-father] Take [my]0-i chair , now do , [Mr. Campton]174-campton . [You]174-campton ’ll be more comfortable . Here , let [me]0-i shake up this cushion for [you]174-campton — — ” ( “[0-i] _ Cushion ! _ ” [Boylston]247-boylston interjected scornfully . ) “[175-george] A light , [George]175-george ? Now do n’t move!—I do n’t say , of course , [old chap]2134-old chap , ” [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett continued , as [he]0-i held the match deferentially to [George]175-george ’s cigarette , “[2134-old chap] that this sort of talk would be safe — or advisable — just now in public ; subversive talk never is . But when [two or three of [the Elect]2136-the elect]2135-two or three of the elect are gathered together — well , [[your]174-campton father]2137-your father sees [my]0-i point , [I]0-i know . [The Hero]1633-the hero , ” [he]0-i nodded at [George]175-george , “[1633-the hero] has [his]1633-the hero job , and [the Artist]763-the artist , ” with a slant at [Campton]174-campton , “[763-the artist] [his]763-the artist . In [Germany]55-germany , for instance , as [we]2140-we ’re beginning to find out , the creative minds , [the Intelligentsia]2141-the intelligentsia ( to use another of [[my]0-i wife]3210-my wife ’s expressions ) , have been carefully protected from the beginning , given jobs , vitally important jobs of course , but where [their]2136-the elect lives were not exposed . [The country]2496-the country needs [them]2136-the elect too much in other ways ; [they]2136-the elect would probably be [wretched fighters]2144-wretched fighters , and [they]2136-the elect ’re of colossal service in [their]2136-the elect own line . Whereas in [France]18-france and [England]3-england — — ” [he]0-i suddenly seemed to see [his]0-i chance——“Well[174-campton] , look here , [Mr. Campton]174-campton , [I]0-i appeal to [you]174-campton , [I]0-i appeal to [the great creative Artist]2145-the great creative artist : in [any country]2146-any country but [France]18-france and [England]3-england , would [a fellow of [George]175-george ’s brains]2147-a fellow of george ’s brains have been _ allowed _ , even at this stage of the war , to chuck an important staff job , requiring intellect , tact and _ savoir faire _ , and try to get [himself]2147-a fellow of george ’s brains killed like [any unbaked boy]2148-any unbaked boy — like [[your]174-campton poor cousin]2149-your poor cousin [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher , for instance ? Would [he]259-benny upsher ? ” “[259-benny upsher] Yes — in [America]2-america ! ” shouted [Boylston]247-boylston ; and [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett ’s tallowy cheeks turned pink . “[175-george] [George]175-george knows how [I]0-i feel about these things , ” [he]0-i stammered . [George]175-george still laughed in [his]175-george remote impartial way , and [Boylston]247-boylston asked with a grin : “[175-george] Why do n’t [you]175-george get [yourself]175-george naturalized — a neutral ? ” [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett ’s pinkness deepened . “[0-i] [I]0-i have lived too much among [Artists]2150-artists — — ” [he]0-i began ; and [George]175-george interrupted gaily : “[0-i] There ’s a lot to be said on [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s side too . Going , [Roger]319-mr. talkett ? Well , [I]0-i shall be able to look in on [you]319-mr. talkett now in a few days . Remember [me]0-i to [Madge]282-madge talkett . Goodbye . ” [Boylston]247-boylston rose also , and [Campton]174-campton remained alone with [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . “[0-i] Remember [me]0-i to [Madge]282-madge talkett ! ” That was the way in which [the modern young man]4385-the modern young man spoke of [[his]4385-the modern young man beloved]4386-his beloved to [[[his]4385-the modern young man beloved]4386-his beloved ’s proprietor]4388-his beloved ’s proprietor . There had not been a shadow of constraint in [George]175-george ’s tone ; and now , glancing at the door which had closed on [Mr. Talkett]319-mr. talkett , [he]175-george merely said , as if apostrophizing [the latter]1395-the latter ’s neat back : “[456-poor devil] [Poor devil]456-poor devil ! [He]456-poor devil ’s torn to pieces with [it]2152-it . ” “[456-poor devil] With what ? ” asked [Campton]174-campton , startled . “[456-poor devil] Why , with [Boylston]247-boylston ’s Preparedness . Wanting to do the proper thing — and never before having had to decide between anything more vital than straight or turned - down collars . [It]2153-it ’s playing the very deuce with [him]247-boylston . ” [His]175-george eyes grew thoughtful . Was [he]175-george going to pronounce [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s name — at last ? But no ; [he]175-george wandered back to [[her]255-mrs. talkett husband]539-her husband . “[2153-it] [Poor little ass]2154-poor little ass ! Of course [he]247-boylston ’ll decide against . ” [He]175-george shrugged [his]175-george shoulders . “[247-boylston] And [Boylston]247-boylston ’s just as badly torn in the other direction . ” “[247-boylston] [Boylston]247-boylston ? ” “[247-boylston] Yes . Knowing that [he]247-boylston would n’t be taken [himself]247-boylston , on account of [his]247-boylston bad heart and [his]247-boylston blind eyes , and wondering if , in spite of [his]247-boylston disabilities , [he]247-boylston ’s got the right to preach to [all these young chaps here who hang on [his]247-boylston words like the gospel]2155-all these young chaps here who hang on his words like the gospel . One of [them]2155-all these young chaps here who hang on his words like the gospel taunted [him]247-boylston with it the other day . ” “[2155-all these young chaps here who hang on his words like the gospel] [The cur]2156-the cur ! ” “[2155-all these young chaps here who hang on his words like the gospel] Yes . And ever since , of course , [Boylston]247-boylston ’s been twice as fierce , and overworking [himself]247-boylston to calm [his]247-boylston frenzy . [The men who ca n’t go]2157-the men who ca n’t go are all like that , when [they]2157-the men who ca n’t go know it ’s [their]2157-the men who ca n’t go proper work . It is n’t [everybody]3070-everybody ’s billet out there — [I’ve]2159-i’ve learnt that since [I]0-i ’ve had a look at it — but it would be [Boylston]247-boylston ’s if [he]247-boylston had the health , and [he]247-boylston knows it , and that ’s what drives [him]247-boylston wild . ” [George]175-george looked at [[his]175-george father]580-his father with a smile . “[2160-you] [You]2160-you do n’t know how [I]0-i thank [my]0-i stars that there were n’t any ‘ problems ’ for [me]0-i , but just a plain job that picked [me]0-i up by the collar , and dropped [me]0-i down where [I]0-i belonged . ” [He]175-george reached for another cigarette . “[245-old adele] [Old Adele]245-old adele ’s coming presently . Do [you]2160-you suppose [we]2161-we could rake up some fresh tea ? ” [he]175-george asked . XXIX Coming out of the unlit rainy March night , it was agreeable but almost startling to [Campton]174-campton to enter [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room]4392-mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room . In the softness of shaded lamplight , against curtains closely drawn , [young women dressed with extravagant elegance]4393-young women dressed with extravagant elegance chatted with [much - decorated officers in the new “[2160-you] horizon ” uniform]4394-much - decorated officers in the new “ horizon ” uniform , with here and there among [them]4393-young women dressed with extravagant elegance [an elderly civilian head]4395-an elderly civilian head , such as [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s silvery thatch and the square rapacious skull of [the newly - knighted patriot]4396-the newly - knighted patriot , [Sir Cyril Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein . [Campton]174-campton had gone to [Mrs. Talkett ’s]255-mrs. talkett that afternoon because [she]255-mrs. talkett had lent [[her]255-mrs. talkett apartment]4397-her apartment to “[3228-the friends of french art] [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ” who were giving a concert organized by [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [Mlle . Davril]294-mlle . davril , with [[Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s pianist]4398-mme . de dolmetsch ’s pianist as [[their]3228-the friends of french art leading performer]4399-their leading performer . It would have been ungracious to deprive [the indefatigable group]4400-the indefatigable group of the lustre [they]3228-the friends of french art fancied [Campton]174-campton ’s presence would confer ; and [he]174-campton was not altogether sorry to be [there]467-there . [He]174-campton knew that [George]175-george had promised [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony to come ; and [he]174-campton wanted to see [[his]174-campton son]364-his son with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . An abyss seemed to divide [this careless throng of people]4403-this careless throng of people , so obviously assembled for [their]4403-this careless throng of people own pleasure , [the women]404-the women to show [their]404-the women clothes , [the men]408-the men to admire [them]404-the women , from [the worn preoccupied audiences of the first war - charity entertainments]4406-the worn preoccupied audiences of the first war - charity entertainments . The war still raged ; wild hopes had given way to dogged resignation ; each day added to the sum of public anguish and private woe . But the strain had been too long , the tragedy too awful . [The idle]4407-the idle and [the useless]4408-the useless had reached [their]4403-this careless throng of people emotional limit , and once more [they]4403-this careless throng of people dressed and painted , smiled , gossiped , flirted as though the long agony were over . On a sofa stacked with orange - velvet cushions [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch reclined in a sort of serpent - coil of flexible grey - green hung with strange amulets . [Her]179-de dolmetsch eyes , in which fabulous islands seemed to dream , were fixed on [the bushy - haired young man at the piano]4409-the bushy - haired young man at the piano . Close by , upright and tight - waisted , sat [the Marquise de Tranlay]312-the marquise de tranlay , [her]179-de dolmetsch mourning veil thrown back from a helmetlike hat . [She]179-de dolmetsch had planted [herself]179-de dolmetsch in a Louis Philippe armchair , as if appealing to its sturdy frame to protect [her]179-de dolmetsch from the anarchy of [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s furniture ; and beside [her]179-de dolmetsch was [the daughter]4410-the daughter for whose sake [she]179-de dolmetsch had doubtless come — [a frowning beauty who , in spite of [her]179-de dolmetsch dowdy dress and ugly boots , somehow declared [herself]179-de dolmetsch as having already broken away from the maternal tradition . [Mme .]179-de dolmetsch [de Tranlay]312-the marquise de tranlay ’s presence in [that drawing - room]4412-that drawing - room]4411-a frowning beauty who , in spite of her dowdy dress and ugly boots , somehow declared herself as having already broken away from the maternal tradition . mme . de tranlay ’s presence in that drawing - room was characteristic enough . It meant — how often [one]398-one heard it [nowadays!—that mothers]4414-nowadays!—that mothers had to take [[their]4414-nowadays!—that mothers daughters]4415-their daughters wherever there was a chance of [their]4414-nowadays!—that mothers meeting [young men]4371-young men , and that such chances were found only in [the few “[3228-the friends of french art] foreign ” houses]4417-the few “ foreign ” houses where , discreetly , almost clandestinely , entertaining had been resumed . [You]4418-you had to take [them]4415-their daughters [there]467-there , [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Tranlay]312-the marquise de tranlay ’s look seemed to say , because [they]4415-their daughters had to be married ( the sooner the better in these wild times , with all the old barriers down ) , and because [the young men]2843-the young men were growing so tragically few , and the competition was so fierce , and because in such emergencies [a French mother]4421-a french mother , whose first thought is always for [[her]4421-a french mother children]4422-her children , must learn to accept , even to seek , propinquities from which [her]4421-a french mother inmost soul , and all the ancestral souls within [her]4421-a french mother , would normally recoil . [Campton]174-campton remembered [her]312-the marquise de tranlay gallant attitude on the day when , under [her]312-the marquise de tranlay fresh crape , [she]312-the marquise de tranlay had rebuked [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant ’s despondency . “[2163-she] But how [she]2163-she hates it here — how [she]2163-she must loathe sitting next to [that woman]2066-that woman ! ” [he]174-campton thought ; and just then [he]174-campton saw [her]312-the marquise de tranlay turn toward [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch with a stiff bend from the waist , and heard [her]312-the marquise de tranlay say in [her]312-the marquise de tranlay most conciliatory tone : “[2163-she] [[Your]2165-your great friend]2166-your great friend , [the rich American]2167-the rich american , _ chère Madame _ , [the benefactor of [France]18-france]2168-the benefactor of france — [we]2169-we should so like to thank [him]2166-your great friend , [Claire]343-claire and [I]0-i , for all [he]2166-your great friend is doing for [[our]2169-we country]2170-our country . ” Beckoned to by [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch , [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , all pink and silver and prominent pearl scarf - pin , bowed before [the Tranlay ladies]4423-the tranlay ladies , while [the Marquise]4424-the marquise deeply murmured : “[2169-we] [We]2169-we are grateful — [we]2169-we shall not forget — ” and [Mademoiselle de Tranlay]292-mademoiselle , holding [him]2166-your great friend with [her]292-mademoiselle rich gaze , added in fluent English : “[344-mamma] [Mamma]344-mamma hopes [you]2166-your great friend ’ll come to tea on Sunday — with [no one]2702-no one but [[my]0-i uncle]896-my uncle [the Duc de Montlhéry]198-duc de montlhéry — so that [we]2169-we may thank [you]2166-your great friend better than [we]2169-we can [here]2489-here . ” “[2174-great women] [Great women]2174-great women — [great women]2174-great women ! ” [Campton]174-campton mused . [He]174-campton was still watching [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Tranlay]292-mademoiselle ’s dauntless mask when [her]179-de dolmetsch glance deserted [the gratified Mayhew]4425-the gratified mayhew to seize on [a younger figure]4426-a younger figure . It was that of [George]175-george , who had just entered . [Mme . de Tranlay]322-de tranlay , with a quick turn , caught [Campton]174-campton ’s eye , greeted [him]174-campton with [her]179-de dolmetsch trenchant cordiality , and asked , in a voice like the pounce of talons : “[2174-great women] [The young officer who has the Legion of Honour]2176-the young officer who has the legion of honour — [the one [you]2166-your great friend just nodded to — with reddish hair and [his]2176-the young officer who has the legion of honour left arm in a sling]2177-the one you just nodded to — with reddish hair and his left arm in a sling ? [French]208-the french , [I]0-i suppose , from [his]2176-the young officer who has the legion of honour uniform ; and yet — — ? Yes , talking to [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . Can [you]2166-your great friend tell [me]0-i — — ? ” “[2166-your great friend] [[My]0-i son]856-my son , ” said [Campton]174-campton with satisfaction . The effect was instantaneous , though [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Tranlay]322-de tranlay kept [her]179-de dolmetsch radiant steadiness . “[2166-your great friend] How charming — charming — charming ! ” And , after a proper interval : “[2166-your great friend] But , [Claire]343-claire , [[my]0-i child]949-my child , [we]2180-we ’ve not yet spoken to [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant , whom [I]0-i see over there . ” And [she]179-de dolmetsch steered [[her]179-de dolmetsch daughter]4427-her daughter swiftly toward [Julia]194-julia . [Campton]174-campton ’s eyes returned to [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . [George]175-george was still with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett , but [they]2180-we had only had time for a word or two before [she]255-mrs. talkett was called away to seat [an important dowager]4429-an important dowager . In that moment , however , [the father]568-the father noted many things . [George]175-george , as usual nowadays , kept [his]175-george air of guarded kindliness , though the blue of [his]175-george eyes grew deeper ; but [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett seemed bathed in light . It was such a self - revelation that [Campton]174-campton ’s curiosity was lost in [the artist]763-the artist ’s abstract joy . “[196-mrs. brant] If [I]0-i could have painted [her]2181-her like that ! ” [he]174-campton thought , reminded of having caught [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch transfigured by fear for [[her]179-de dolmetsch lover]406-her lover ; but an instant later [he]174-campton remembered . “[2182-poor little thing] [Poor little thing]2182-poor little thing ! ” [he]174-campton murmured . [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett turned [her]255-mrs. talkett head , as if [his]174-campton thought had reached [her]255-mrs. talkett . “[2182-poor little thing] Oh , yes — oh , yes ; come and let [me]0-i tell [you]2183-you all about it , ” [her]255-mrs. talkett eyes entreated [him]174-campton . But [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew and [Sir Cyril Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein were between [them]4433-them . “[175-george] [George]175-george ! ” [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant called ; and across the intervening groups [Campton]174-campton saw [[his]174-campton son]364-his son bowing to [the Marquise de Tranlay]312-the marquise de tranlay . [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch jumped up , [her]179-de dolmetsch bracelets jangling like [a prompter]4435-a prompter ’s call . “[175-george] Silence ! ” [she]179-de dolmetsch cried . [The ladies]4436-the ladies squeezed into [their]4436-the ladies seats , [the men]408-the men resigned [themselves]408-the men to door - posts and window - embrasures , and [the pianist]3707-the pianist attacked [Stravinsky]345-stravinsky .... “[175-george] Dancing ? ” [Campton]174-campton heard [[his]174-campton hostess]487-his hostess answering [some one]839-some one . “[175-george] N — no : not _ quite _ yet , [I]0-i think . The music was over , and scanning [the groups]4442-the groups at the tea - tables , [Campton]174-campton saw [Adele]245-old adele and [Mlle]294-mlle . davril . [Davril]294-mlle . davril squeezed away in [the remotest corner of [the room]475-the room]4443-the remotest corner of the room . [He]174-campton took a chair at [their]4442-the groups table , and [Boylston]247-boylston presently blinked [his]247-boylston way to [them]4442-the groups through [the crowd]613-the crowd . [They]4442-the groups seemed , all four , more like [unauthorized intruders on the brilliant scene]4446-unauthorized intruders on the brilliant scene than [its laborious organizers]4447-its laborious organizers . The entertainment , escaping from [their]4442-the groups control , had speedily reverted to its true purpose of feeding and amusing [a crowd of bored and restless people]4448-a crowd of bored and restless people ; and [the little group]4449-the little group recognized the fact , and joked over it in [their]4449-the little group different ways . But [Mlle]294-mlle . davril . [Davril]294-mlle . davril was happy at the sale of tickets , which must have been immense to judge from [the crowd]613-the crowd ( spying about the entrance , [she]294-mlle . davril had seen [furious fine ladies]4451-furious fine ladies turn away ticketless ) ; and [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony was exhilarated by the nearness of [people]378-people [she]294-mlle . davril did not know , or wish to know , but with whose names and private histories [she]294-mlle . davril was minutely and passionately familiar . “[255-mrs. talkett] That ’s the old [Duchesse de Murols]346-duchesse de murols with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett — there , [she]255-mrs. talkett ’s put [her]346-duchesse de murols at the Beausite ’s table ! Well , of all places ! Ah , but [you]2187-you ’re all too young to know about [Beausite]176-beausite ’s early history . And now , of course , it makes no earthly difference to [anybody]396-anybody . But there must be times when [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite remembers , and grins . Now that [she]346-duchesse de murols ’s begun to rouge again [she]346-duchesse de murols looks twenty years younger than [the Duchess.——Ah]2189-the duchess.——ah , ” [she]255-mrs. talkett broke off , abruptly signing to [Campton]174-campton . [He]174-campton followed [her]255-mrs. talkett glance to a table at which [Julia Brant]194-julia was seating [herself]194-julia with [the Tranlay ladies]4423-the tranlay ladies and [George]175-george . [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew joined [them]2190-them , nobly deferential , and [the elder ladies]4454-the elder ladies lent [him]174-campton [their]4454-the elder ladies intensest attention , isolating [George]175-george with [the young girl]4455-the young girl . “[2189-the duchess.——ah] H’m , ” [Adele]220-adele anthony murmured , “[2189-the duchess.——ah] not such a bad thing ! [They]2190-them say [the girl]774-the girl will have half of [old Montlhéry]198-duc de montlhéry ’s money — [he]2192-he ’s [[her]774-the girl mother ’s uncle]2193-her mother ’s uncle . And [she]774-the girl ’s heaps handsomer than the other — not that _ that _ seems to count any more ! ” [Campton]174-campton shrugged the subject away . Yes ; it would be a good thing if [George]175-george could be drawn from what [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother ( with a retrospective pinching of the lips ) called [his]175-george “[774-the girl] wretched infatuation . ” But the idea that [the boy]416-the boy might be coaxed into a marriage — and a rich marriage — by [the Brants]203-the brants , was even more distasteful to [Campton]174-campton . If [he]174-campton really loved [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett better stick to [her]282-madge talkett than let [himself]174-campton be cajoled away for such reasons . * * * * * As the second part of the programme began , [Campton]174-campton and [Boylston]247-boylston slipped out together . [Campton]174-campton was oppressed and disturbed . “[774-the girl] It ’s queer , ” [he]174-campton said , taking [Boylston]247-boylston ’s arm to steer [him]247-boylston through the dense darkness of [the streets]2562-the streets ; “[774-the girl] all [these people who ’ve forgotten the war]2194-these people who ’ve forgotten the war have suddenly made [me]0-i remember it . ” [Boylston]247-boylston laughed . “[2194-these people who ’ve forgotten the war] Yes , [I]0-i know . ” [He]247-boylston seemed preoccupied and communicative , and [the painter]540-the painter fancied [he]247-boylston was going to lead the talk , as usual , to Preparedness and [America]2-america ’s intervention ; but after a pause [he]247-boylston said : “[2194-these people who ’ve forgotten the war] [You]0-i have n’t been much at [the office]1357-the office lately — — ” “[0-i] No , ” [Campton]174-campton interrupted . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve shirked abominably since [George]175-george got back . But now that [he]175-george ’s gone to [the Brants ’]3542-the brants ’ [you]0-i ’ll see — — ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i did n’t mean it as a reproach , [sir]2499-sir ! How could [you]2499-sir think it ? [We]2198-we ’re running smoothly enough , as far as organization goes . That ’s not what bothers [me]0-i — — ” “[2499-sir] [You]2499-sir ’re bothered ? ” Yes ; [he]2499-sir was — and so , [he]2499-sir added , was [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony . The trouble was , [he]2499-sir went on to explain , that [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , after months of total indifference ( except when asked to “[2499-sir] represent ” [them]3228-the friends of french art on official platforms ) had developed a disquieting interest in “[3228-the friends of french art] [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art . ” [He]2499-sir had brought [them]3228-the friends of french art , in the beginning , a certain amount of money ( none of which came out of [his]2499-sir own pocket ) , and in consequence had been imprudently put on [the Financial Committee]4460-the financial committee , so that [he]2499-sir had a voice in the disposal of funds , though till lately [he]2499-sir had never made it heard . But now , apparently , “[4461-atrocities ”] [Atrocities ”]4461-atrocities ” were losing their novelty , and [he]2499-sir was disposed to transfer [his]2499-sir whole attention to “[3228-the friends of french art] [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ” with results which seemed incomprehensibly disturbing to [Boylston]247-boylston , until [he]2499-sir let drop the name of [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch . [Campton]174-campton exclaimed at it . “[3228-the friends of french art] Well — yes . [You]2201-you must have noticed that [she]2202-she and [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew have been getting pretty chummy . [You]2201-you see , [he]212-mr. mayhew ’s done such a lot of talking that [people]378-people think [he]212-mr. mayhew ’s at least [an Oil King]2204-an oil king ; and [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch is dazzled . But [she]179-de dolmetsch ’s got [her]179-de dolmetsch musical prodigy to provide for — — ” and [Boylston]247-boylston outlined the situation which [his]247-boylston astuteness had detected while it developed unperceived under [Campton]174-campton ’s dreaming eyes . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew was attending all [their]4462-they meetings now , finding fault , criticizing , asking to have the accounts investigated , though [they]4462-they had always been audited at regular intervals by [expert accountants]4463-expert accountants ; and all this zeal originated in the desire to put [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch in [[Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s place]4464-miss anthony ’s place , on the plea that [her]179-de dolmetsch greater social experience , [her]179-de dolmetsch gift of attracting and interesting , would bring in immense sums of money — whereas , [Boylston]247-boylston grimly hinted , [they]4462-they already had a large balance in the bank , and it was with an eye to that balance that [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch was forcing [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew to press [her]179-de dolmetsch claim . “[179-de dolmetsch] [You]2205-you see , [sir]2499-sir , [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew never turns out to be as liberal as [they]2207-they expect when [they]2207-they first hear [him]212-mr. mayhew talk ; and though [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch has [him]212-mr. mayhew in [her]179-de dolmetsch noose [she]179-de dolmetsch ’s not getting what [she]179-de dolmetsch wants — by a long way . And so [they]2207-they ’ve cooked this up between [them]2207-they — [she]179-de dolmetsch and [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [Beausite]176-beausite — without [his]212-mr. mayhew actually knowing what [they]2207-they ’re after . ” [Campton]174-campton stopped short , releasing [Boylston]247-boylston ’s arm . “[2499-sir] But what [you]2499-sir suggest is abominable , ” [he]0-i exclaimed . “[2499-sir] Yes . [I]0-i know it . ” But [the young man]2749-the young man ’s voice remained steady . “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i wish [you]2499-sir ’d come to [our]2208-our meetings , now [you]2499-sir ’re back . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will — [I]0-i will ! But [I]0-i ’m no earthly use on financial questions . [You]2499-sir ’re much stronger there . ” [He]2749-the young man felt [Boylston]247-boylston ’s grin through the darkness . “[2499-sir] Oh , [they]2207-they ’ll have [me]0-i out too before long . ” “[2499-sir] [You]2499-sir ? Nonsense ! What do [you]2499-sir mean ? ” “[2499-sir] [I]0-i mean that [lots of people]2209-lots of people are beginning to speculate in war charities — oh , in all sorts of ways . Sometimes [I]0-i ’m sick to the point of chucking it all . But [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony keeps [me]0-i going . ” “[221-miss anthony] Ah , [she]221-miss anthony would ! ” [Campton]174-campton agreed . As [he]174-campton walked [home]502-home [his]174-campton mind was burdened with [Boylston]247-boylston ’s warning . It was not merely the affair itself , but all it symbolized , that made [his]174-campton gorge rise , made [him]174-campton , as [Boylston]247-boylston said , sick to the point of wanting to chuck it all — to chuck everything connected with this hideous world that was dancing and flirting and money - making on the great red mounds of dead . [He]174-campton grinned at the thought that [he]174-campton had once believed in the regenerative power of war — the salutary shock of great moral and social upheavals . Yet [he]174-campton _ had _ believed in it , and never more intensely than at [George]175-george ’s bedside at [Doullens]146-doullens , in that air so cleansed by passion and pain that mere living seemed a meaningless gesture compared to the chosen surrender of life . But in [the [Paris]5-paris to which [he]174-campton had returned after barely four months of absence]4467-the paris to which he had returned after barely four months of absence the instinct of self - preservation seemed to have wiped all meaning from such words . [Poor fatuous Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew dancing to [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch ’s piping , [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein sinking under the weight of [his]180-jorgenstein international honours , Mme . [de Tranlay]312-the marquise de tranlay intriguing to push [[her]312-the marquise de tranlay daughter]4427-her daughter in such society , and [Julia]194-julia placidly abetting [her]312-the marquise de tranlay — [Campton]174-campton hardly knew from which of these sorry visions [he]174-campton turned with a completer loathing .... There were still the others , to be sure , [the huge obscure majority]4469-the huge obscure majority ; out there in the night , [the millions]4470-the millions giving [their]4470-the millions lives for [this handful of trivial puppets]4471-this handful of trivial puppets , and here in [Paris]5-paris , and everywhere , in [every country]4472-every country , [men]2525-men and [women]738-women toiling unweariedly to help and heal ; but in [[Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room]4392-mrs. talkett ’s drawing - room both [fighters]4476-fighters and [toilers]4477-toilers seemed to count as little in relation to [the merrymakers]4478-the merrymakers as [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [Mlle . Davril]294-mlle . davril in relation to [the brilliant people who had crowded [their]4479-the brilliant people who had crowded their table into the obscurest corner of the room table into the obscurest corner of [the room]475-the room]4479-the brilliant people who had crowded their table into the obscurest corner of the room . XXX These thoughts continued to weigh on [Campton]174-campton ; to shake [them]4481-them off [he]174-campton decided , with one of [his]174-campton habitual quick jerks of resolution , to get back to work . [He]174-campton knew that [George]175-george would approve , and would perhaps be oftener with [him]174-campton if [he]174-campton had something interesting on [his]174-campton easel . [Sir Cyril Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein had suggested that [he]174-campton would like to have [his]174-campton portrait finished — with the Legion of Honour added to [his]174-campton lapel , no doubt . And [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , rosy and embarrassed , had dropped in to hint that , if [Campton]174-campton could find time to do a charcoal head — oh , just one of those brilliant sketches of [his]174-campton — of [the young musical genius in whose career [[their]4479-the brilliant people who had crowded their table into the obscurest corner of the room friend]4483-their friend [Mme . de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch]4482-the young musical genius in whose career their friend mme . de dolmetsch was so much interested .... But [Campton]174-campton had cut [them]4479-the brilliant people who had crowded their table into the obscurest corner of the room both short . [He]174-campton was not working — [he]174-campton had no plans for the present . And in truth [he]174-campton had not thought even of attempting a portrait of [George]175-george . The impulse had come to [him]174-campton , once , as [he]174-campton sat by [the boy]416-the boy ’s bed ; but the face was too incomprehensible . [He]174-campton should have to learn and unlearn too many things first — — At last , one day , it occurred to [him]174-campton to make a study of [Mme]179-de dolmetsch . [Lebel]195-mme . [He]174-campton saw _ [her]179-de dolmetsch _ in charcoal : [her]179-de dolmetsch simple unquestioning anguish had turned [her]179-de dolmetsch old face to sculpture . [Campton]174-campton set [his]174-campton canvas on the easel , and started to shout for [her]179-de dolmetsch down [the stairs]482-the stairs ; but as [he]174-campton opened the door [he]174-campton found [himself]174-campton face to face with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . “[221-miss anthony] Oh , ” [she]179-de dolmetsch began at once , in [her]179-de dolmetsch breathless way , “[483-the old woman] [you]2210-you ’re here ? [The old woman]483-the old woman [downstairs]2942-downstairs was n’t sure — and [I]0-i could n’t leave all this money with [her]483-the old woman , could [I]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Money ? What money ? ” [he]174-campton echoed . [She]179-de dolmetsch was very simply dressed , and a veil , drooping low from [her]179-de dolmetsch hat - brim , gave to [her]179-de dolmetsch over - eager face a shadowy youthful calm . “[0-i] [I]0-i _ may _ come in ? ” [she]179-de dolmetsch questioned , almost timidly ; and as [Campton]174-campton let [her]2210-you pass [she]179-de dolmetsch added : “[0-i] The money from the concert , of course — heaps and heaps of it ! [I]0-i ’d no idea [we]2213-we ’d made so much . And [I]0-i wanted to give it to [you]2210-you [myself]0-i . ” [She]179-de dolmetsch shook a bulging bag out of [her]179-de dolmetsch immense muff , while [Campton]174-campton continued to stare at [her]179-de dolmetsch . “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t know [you]0-i went out so early , ” [he]174-campton finally stammered , trying to push a newspaper over the disordered remains of [his]174-campton breakfast . [She]179-de dolmetsch lifted interrogative eyebrows . “[0-i] That means that [I]0-i ’m in the way ? ” “[0-i] No . But why did [you]2210-you bring that money here ? ” [She]179-de dolmetsch looked surprised . “[2210-you] Why not ? Are n’t [you]2210-you the head — [the real head of the committee]2214-the real head of the committee ? And was n’t the concert given in [[my]0-i house]2215-my house ? ” [Her]179-de dolmetsch eyes rested on [him]174-campton with renewed timidity . “[2214-the real head of the committee] Is it — disagreeable to [you]2210-you to see [me]0-i ? ” [she]179-de dolmetsch asked . “[2214-the real head of the committee] Disagreeable ? [[My]0-i dear child]2216-my dear child , no . ” [He]174-campton paused , increasingly embarrassed . What did [she]179-de dolmetsch expect [him]174-campton to say next ? To thank [her]179-de dolmetsch for having sent [him]174-campton [the orderly]4250-the orderly ’s letter ? It seemed to [him]174-campton impossible to plunge into the subject uninvited . Surely it was for [her]179-de dolmetsch to give [him]174-campton the opening , if [she]179-de dolmetsch wished to . “[0-i] Well , no ! ” [she]179-de dolmetsch broke out . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve never once pretended to [you]2210-you , have [I]0-i ? The money ’s a pretext . [I]0-i wanted to see [you]2210-you — here , alone , with [no one]2702-no one to disturb [us]2218-us . ” [Campton]174-campton felt a confused stirring of relief and fear . All [his]174-campton old dread of scenes , commotions , disturbing emergencies — of anything that should upset [his]174-campton perpetually vibrating balance — was blent with the passionate desire to hear what [[his]174-campton visitor]1441-his visitor had to say . “[0-i] [You]0-i — it was good of [you]0-i to think of sending [us]2218-us that letter , ” [he]174-campton faltered . [She]1441-his visitor frowned in [her]1441-his visitor anxious way and looked away from [him]174-campton . “[0-i] Afterward [I]0-i was afraid [you]2210-you ’d be angry . ” “[2210-you] Angry ? How could [I]0-i ? ” [He]174-campton groped for a word . “[0-i] Surprised — yes . [I]0-i knew nothing ... nothing about [you]0-i and .... ” “[0-i] Not even that it was [I]0-i who bought the sketch of [him]2219-him — the one that [Léonce Black]289-léonce black sold for [you]2210-you last year ? ” The blood rushed to [Campton]174-campton ’s face . Suddenly [he]174-campton felt [himself]174-campton trapped and betrayed . “[289-léonce black] [You—_you]2210-you _ ? [You]2210-you ’ve got that sketch ? ” The thought was somehow intolerable to [him]174-campton . “[2210-you] Ah , now [you]2210-you _ are _ angry , ” [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett murmured . “[2210-you] No , no ; but [I]0-i never imagined — — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know . That was what frightened [me]0-i — [your]0-i suspecting nothing . ” [She]255-mrs. talkett glanced about [her]255-mrs. talkett , dropped to a corner of the divan , and tossed off [her]255-mrs. talkett hat with the old familiar gesture . “[0-i] Oh , can [I]0-i talk to [you]2210-you ? ” [she]255-mrs. talkett pleaded . [Campton]174-campton nodded . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]0-i ’d light [your]0-i pipe , then , and sit down too . ” [He]174-campton reached for [his]174-campton pipe , struck a match , and slowly seated [himself]174-campton . “[0-i] [You]2210-you always smoke a pipe in the morning , do n’t [you]2210-you ? _ [He]2220-he _ told [me]0-i that , ” [she]255-mrs. talkett went on ; then [she]255-mrs. talkett paused again and drew a long anxious breath . “[2220-he] Oh , [he]2220-he ’s so changed ! [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i did n’t know [him]2220-he any longer — do _ [you]2210-you _ ? ” [Campton]174-campton looked at [her]255-mrs. talkett with deepening wonder . This was more surprising than discovering [her]255-mrs. talkett to be [the possessor of the picture]4488-the possessor of the picture ; [he]174-campton had not expected deep to call unto deep in [their]4489-their talk . “[2210-you] [I]0-i ’m not sure that [I]0-i do , ” [he]174-campton confessed . [Her]255-mrs. talkett fidgeting eyes deepened and grew quieter . “[0-i] [Your]0-i saying so makes [me]0-i feel less lonely , ” [she]255-mrs. talkett sighed , half to [herself]255-mrs. talkett . “[0-i] But has [he]2220-he told [you]0-i nothing since [he]2220-he came back — really nothing ? ” “[2220-he] Nothing . After all — how could [he]2220-he ? [I]0-i mean , without indiscretion ? ” “[0-i] Indiscretion ? Oh — — ” [She]255-mrs. talkett shrugged the word away with half a smile , as though such considerations belonged to a prehistoric order of things . “[2220-he] Then [he]2220-he has n’t even told [you]0-i that [he]2220-he wants [me]0-i to get a divorce ? ” “[2220-he] A divorce ? ” [Campton]174-campton exclaimed . [He]174-campton sat staring at [her]255-mrs. talkett as if the weight of [his]174-campton gaze might pin [her]255-mrs. talkett down , keep [her]255-mrs. talkett from fluttering away and breaking up into luminous splinters . [George]175-george wanted [her]255-mrs. talkett to get a divorce — wanted , therefore , to marry [her]255-mrs. talkett ! [His]174-campton passion went as deep for [her]255-mrs. talkett as that — too deep , [Campton]174-campton conjectured , for the poor little ephemeral creature , who struck [him]174-campton as wriggling on it like a butterfly impaled . “[2220-he] Please tell [me]0-i , ” [he]174-campton said at length ; and suddenly , in short inconsequent sentences , the confession poured from [her]255-mrs. talkett . [George]175-george , it seemed , during the previous winter in [New York]21-new york , when [they]4490-they had seen so much of [each other]443-each other , had been deeply attracted , had wanted “[2220-he] everything , ” and at once — and there had been moments of tension and estrangement , when [she]255-mrs. talkett had been held back by scruples [she]255-mrs. talkett confessed [she]255-mrs. talkett no longer understood ( inherited prejudices , [she]255-mrs. talkett supposed ) , and when [her]255-mrs. talkett reluctance must have made [her]255-mrs. talkett appear to be trifling , whereas , really it was just that [she]255-mrs. talkett could n’t ... could n’t .... So [they]4490-they had gone on for several months , with the usual emotional ups - and - downs , till [he]174-campton had left for [Europe]42-europe to join [[his]174-campton father]580-his father ; and when [they]4490-they had parted [she]255-mrs. talkett had given [him]174-campton the half - promise that if [they]4490-they met [abroad]4493-abroad during the summer [she]255-mrs. talkett would perhaps ... after all .... Then came the war . [George]175-george had been with [her]255-mrs. talkett during those few last hours in [Paris]5-paris , and had dined with [her]255-mrs. talkett and [[her]255-mrs. talkett husband]539-her husband ( had [Campton]174-campton forgiven [her]255-mrs. talkett ? ) the night before [he]174-campton was mobilised . And then , when [he]174-campton was gone , [she]255-mrs. talkett had understood that only timidity , vanity , the phantom barriers of old terrors and traditions , had prevented [her]255-mrs. talkett being to [him]174-campton all that [he]174-campton wanted .... [She]255-mrs. talkett broke off abruptly , put in a few conventional words about an ill - assorted marriage , and never having been “[2221-he] really understood , ” and then , as if guessing that [she]255-mrs. talkett was on the wrong tack , jumped up , walked to the other end of [the studio]370-the studio , and turned back to [Campton]174-campton with the tears running down [her]255-mrs. talkett ravaged face . “[2221-he] And now — and now — [he]2221-he says [he]2221-he wo n’t have [me]0-i ! ” [she]255-mrs. talkett lamented . “[2221-he] Wo n’t have [you]2221-he ? But [you]2221-he tell [me]0-i [he]2221-he wants [you]2221-he to be divorced . ” [She]255-mrs. talkett nodded , wiped away the tears , and in so doing stole an unconscious glance at the mirror above the divan . Then , seeing that the glance was detected , [she]255-mrs. talkett burst into a sort of sobbing laugh . “[2221-he] [My]0-i nose gets so dreadfully red when [I]0-i cry , ” [she]255-mrs. talkett stammered . [Campton]174-campton took no notice , and [she]255-mrs. talkett went on : “[0-i] A divorce ? Yes . And unless [I]0-i do — unless [I]0-i agree to marry [him]2221-he — [we’re]2222-we’re never to be anything but [friends]1248-friends . ” “[2221-he] That ’s what [he]2221-he says ? ” “[2221-he] Yes . Oh , [we]2222-we’re ’ve been all in and out of it a hundred times . ” [She]255-mrs. talkett pulled out a gold - mesh bag and furtively restored [her]255-mrs. talkett complexion , as [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant had once done in [the same place]4496-the same place . [Campton]174-campton sat still , considering . [He]174-campton had let [his]174-campton pipe go out . Nothing could have been farther from the revelation [he]174-campton had expected , and [his]174-campton own perplexity was hardly less great than [[his]174-campton visitor]1441-his visitor ’s . Certainly it was not the way in which [young men]4371-young men had behaved in [his]174-campton day — nor , evidently , had it been [George]175-george ’s before the war . Finally [he]174-campton made up [his]174-campton mind to put the question : “[255-mrs. talkett] And [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ? ” [She]1441-his visitor burst out at once : “[255-mrs. talkett] Ah , that ’s what [I]0-i say — it ’s not so simple ! ” “[0-i] What is n’t ? ” “[0-i] Breaking up — [all one]2224-all one ’s life . ” [She]1441-his visitor paused with a deepening embarrassment . “[0-i] Of course [Roger]319-mr. talkett has made [me]0-i utterly miserable — but then [I]0-i know [he]319-mr. talkett really has n’t meant to . ” “[319-mr. talkett] Have [you]0-i told [George]175-george that ? ” “[0-i] Yes . But [he]175-george says [we]2225-we must first of all be aboveboard . [He]175-george says [he]175-george sees everything differently now . That ’s what [I]0-i mean when [I]0-i say that [I]0-i do n’t understand [him]175-george . [He]175-george says love ’s not the same kind of feeling to [him]175-george that it was . There ’s something of [Meredith]347-meredith ’s that [he]175-george quotes — [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could remember it — something about a mortal lease . ” “[175-george] [Good Lord]272-good lord , ” [Campton]174-campton groaned , not so much at the hopelessness of the case as at the hopelessness of quoting [Meredith]347-meredith to [her]347-meredith . Do [you]272-good lord think [he]175-george ’s as much in love with [you]272-good lord as ever ? ” [He]174-campton had been half afraid of offending [her]347-meredith : but [she]347-meredith appeared to consider the question impartially , and without a shadow of resentment . “[272-good lord] Sometimes [I]0-i think more — because in the beginning it was n’t meant to last . And now — if [he]175-george wants to marry [me]0-i ? Oh , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i knew what to do ! ” [Campton]174-campton continued to ponder . “[255-mrs. talkett] There ’s one more question , since [we]2226-we ’re talking frankly : what does [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett know of all this ? ” [She]347-meredith looked frightened . “[255-mrs. talkett] Oh , nothing , nothing ! ” “[255-mrs. talkett] And [you]0-i ’ve no idea how [he]175-george would take it ? ” [She]347-meredith examined the question with tortured eyebrows , and at length , to [Campton]174-campton ’s astonishment , brought out : “[0-i] Magnificently — — ” “[0-i] [He]175-george ’d be generous , [you]0-i mean ? But it would go hard with [him]175-george ? ” “[0-i] Oh , dreadfully , dreadfully ! ” [She]347-meredith seemed to need the assurance to restore [her]347-meredith shaken self - approval . [Campton]174-campton rose with a movement of pity and laid [his]174-campton hand on [her]2216-my dear child shoulder . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear child]2216-my dear child , if [[your]2216-my dear child husband]3455-your husband cares for [you]2216-my dear child , give up [[my]0-i son]856-my son . ” [Her]347-meredith face fell , and [she]347-meredith drew back . “[0-i] Oh , but [you]0-i do n’t understand — not in the least ! It ’s not possible — it ’s not moral——. [You]0-i know [I]0-i ’m all for the new morality . First of all , [we]2230-we must be true to self . ” [She]347-meredith paused , and then broke out : “[0-i] [You]0-i tell [me]0-i to give [him]856-my son up because [you]0-i think [he]856-my son ’s tired of [me]0-i . But [he]856-my son ’s not — [I]0-i know [he]856-my son ’s not ! It ’s [his]856-my son new ideas that [you]0-i do n’t understand , any more than [I]0-i do . It ’s the war that has changed [him]856-my son . [He]856-my son says [he]856-my son wants only things that last — that are permanent — things that hold [a man]2492-a man fast . That sometimes [he]856-my son feels as if [he]856-my son were being swept away on a flood , and were trying to catch at things — at anything — as [he]856-my son ’s rushed along under the waves .... [He]856-my son says [he]856-my son wants quiet , monotony ... to be sure the same things will happen every day . When [we]2232-we go out together [he]856-my son sometimes stands for a quarter of an hour and stares at [the same building]2233-the same building , or at [the Seine under the bridges]2234-the seine under the bridges . But [he]856-my son ’s happy , [I]0-i ’m sure .... [I]0-i ’ve never seen [him]856-my son happier ... only it ’s in a way [I]0-i ca n’t make out .... ” “[0-i] Ah , [[my]0-i dear]2497-my dear , if it comes to that — [I’m]0-i not sure that [I]0-i can . Not sure enough to help [you]2497-my dear , [I]0-i ’m afraid . ” [She]2497-my dear looked at [him]2497-my dear , disappointed . “[0-i] [You]0-i wo n’t speak to [him]856-my son then ? ” “[0-i] Not unless [he]856-my son speaks to [me]0-i . ” “[856-my son] Ah , [he]856-my son frightens [you]2497-my dear — just as [he]856-my son does [me]0-i ! ” [She]2497-my dear pulled [her]2497-my dear hat down on [her]2497-my dear troubled brow , gathered up [her]2497-my dear furs , and took another sidelong peep at the glass . Then [she]2497-my dear turned toward the door . On the threshold [she]2497-my dear paused and looked back at [Campton]174-campton . “[856-my son] Do n’t [you]2497-my dear see , ” [she]2497-my dear cried , “[2497-my dear] that if [I]0-i were to give [George]175-george up [he]175-george ’d get [himself]175-george sent straight back to the front ? ” [Campton]174-campton ’s heart gave an angry leap ; for a second [he]174-campton felt the impulse to strike [her]2497-my dear , to catch [her]2497-my dear by the shoulders and bundle [her]2497-my dear out of [the room]475-the room . With a great effort [he]174-campton controlled [himself]174-campton and opened the door . “[2497-my dear] [You]2497-my dear do n’t understand — [you]2497-my dear do n’t understand ! ” [she]2497-my dear called back to [him]174-campton once again from [the landing]4500-the landing . * * * * * [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett had asked [him]174-campton to speak to [[his]174-campton son]364-his son : [he]174-campton had refused , and [she]2497-my dear had retaliated by planting that poisoned shaft in [him]174-campton . But what had retaliation to do with it ? [She]2497-my dear had probably spoken the simple truth , and with the natural desire to enlighten [him]174-campton . If [George]175-george wanted to marry [her]2497-my dear , it must be ( since human nature , though it might change its vocabulary , kept its instincts ) , it must be that [he]175-george was very much in love — and in that case [her]2497-my dear refusal would in truth go hard with [him]175-george , and it would be natural that [he]175-george should try to get [himself]175-george sent away from [Paris]5-paris .... From [Paris]5-paris , yes ; but not necessarily to the front . After such wounds and such honours [he]174-campton had only to choose ; a staff - appointment could easily be got . Or , no doubt , with [his]174-campton two languages , [he]174-campton might , if [he]174-campton preferred , have [himself]174-campton sent on a military mission to [America]2-america . With all this propaganda talk , was n’t [he]175-george [the very type of officer [they]4503-they wanted for [the neutral countries]4504-the neutral countries]4502-the very type of officer they wanted for the neutral countries ? It was [Campton]174-campton ’s dearest wish that [George]175-george should stay where [he]175-george was ; [he]174-campton knew [his]174-campton peace of mind would vanish the moment [[his]174-campton son]364-his son was out of sight . But [he]174-campton suspected that [George]175-george would soon weary of staff - work , or of any form of soldiering at the rear , and try for the trenches if [he]175-george left [Paris]5-paris ; whereas , in [Paris]5-paris , [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett might hold [him]175-george — as [she]282-madge talkett had meant [[his]364-his son father]580-his father to see . The first thing , then , was to make sure of a job at [the War Office]1253-the war office . [Campton]174-campton turned and tossed like [a sick man]4508-a sick man on the hard bed of [his]174-campton problem . To plan , to scheme , to plot and circumvent — nothing was more hateful to [him]174-campton , there was nothing in which [he]174-campton was less skilled . If only [he]174-campton dared to consult [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ! But [Adele]220-adele anthony was still incorrigibly warlike , and [her]282-madge talkett having been in [[George]175-george ’s secret]4509-george ’s secret while [[his]364-his son parents]509-his parents were excluded from it left no doubt as to the side on which [her]282-madge talkett influence would bear . [She]282-madge talkett loved [the boy]416-the boy , [Campton]174-campton sometimes thought , even more passionately than [[his]364-his son mother]583-his mother did ; but — how did the old song go?—she loved honour , or [her]282-madge talkett queer conception of it , more . Ponder as [he]174-campton would , [he]174-campton could not picture [her]282-madge talkett , even now , lifting a finger to keep [George]175-george back . [Campton]174-campton struggled all the morning with these questions . After lunch [he]174-campton pocketed [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s moneybag and carried it to [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal , where [he]174-campton discovered [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew in confabulation with [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite , who still trailed [her]282-madge talkett ineffectual beauty about [the office]1357-the office . [The painter]540-the painter thought [he]174-campton detected a faint embarrassment in the glance with which [they]2236-our both greeted [him]174-campton . “[2497-my dear] [Hallo]348-hallo , [Campton]174-campton ! Looking for [[our]2236-our good friend]2237-our good friend [Boylston]247-boylston ? [He]247-boylston ’s off duty this afternoon , [Mme]176-beausite . Will [you]943-my dear fellow please tell [Boylston]247-boylston [I]0-i ’ve deposited it ? ” [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s benevolent pink turned to an angry red . For a moment [Campton]174-campton thought [he]174-campton was about to say something foolish . But [he]174-campton merely bent [his]174-campton head stiffly , muttered a vague phrase about “[943-my dear fellow] irregular proceedings , ” and returned to [his]174-campton seat by [Mme]176-beausite . [Beausite]176-beausite ’s desk . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant was [the only person with whom , at this particular juncture , [he]174-campton cared to talk of [George]175-george]4518-the only person with whom , at this particular juncture , he cared to talk of george . [[XXXI Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s private office]4519-xxxi mr. brant ’s private office was as glitteringly neat as when [Campton]174-campton had entered [it]4519-xxxi mr. brant ’s private office for the first time , and seen the fatal telegram about [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher marring the order of the desk . Now [he]174-campton crossed the threshold with different feelings . To have [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant look up and smile , to shake hands with [him]174-campton , accept one of [his]197-mr. brant cigars , and sink into one of the blue leather armchairs , seemed to be in the natural order of things . [He]197-mr. brant felt only the relief of finding [himself]197-mr. brant with [the one person]4520-the one person likely to understand . “[943-my dear fellow] About [George]175-george — — ” [he]197-mr. brant began . “[175-george] Yes ? ” said [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant briskly . “[175-george] It ’s curious — [I]0-i was just thinking of looking [you]2246-you up . [He]568-the father had not come to talk of birthdays ; nor did [he]568-the father need to be reminded of [[his]568-the father son]364-his son ’s by [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . [He]568-the father concluded that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant would be less easy to get on with in [Paris]5-paris than at the front . “[2246-you] And [we]2247-we thought of celebrating the day by a little party — a dinner , with perhaps the smallest kind of a dance : or just bridge — yes , probably just bridge , ” [the banker]547-the banker added tentatively . “[583-his mother] Opinions differ as to the suitability — it ’s for [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother to decide . [Our]2247-we only object is to amuse [him]175-george — to divert [his]175-george mind from this wretched entanglement . ” It was doubtful if [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had ever before made so long a speech , except perhaps at a board meeting ; and then only when [he]197-mr. brant read the annual report . [He]197-mr. brant turned pink and stared over [Campton]174-campton ’s shoulder at the panelled white wall , on which a false Reynolds hung . [Campton]174-campton meditated . The blush was the blush of [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , but the voice was the voice of [Julia]194-julia . Still , it was probable that [neither husband]4524-neither husband nor [wife]497-wife was aware how far matters had gone with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . “[175-george] [George]175-george is more involved than [you]2246-you think , ” [Campton]174-campton said . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant looked startled . “[175-george] In what way ? ” “[175-george] [He]175-george means to marry [her]2249-her . [He]175-george insists on [her]2249-her getting a divorce . ” “[175-george] A divorce ? Good gracious , ” murmured [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . [He]197-mr. brant turned over a jade paper - cutter , trying its edge absently on [his]197-mr. brant nail . “[175-george] Does [Julia]194-julia — — ? ” [he]197-mr. brant began at length . [Campton]174-campton shook [his]174-campton head . “[194-julia] No ; [I]0-i wanted to speak to [you]2246-you first . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant gave [his]197-mr. brant quick bow . [He]197-mr. brant was evidently gratified , and the sentiment stimulated [his]197-mr. brant faculties , as it had when [he]197-mr. brant found that [Campton]174-campton no longer resented [his]197-mr. brant presence at [the hospital]1368-the hospital . [His]197-mr. brant small effaced features took on a businesslike sharpness , and [he]197-mr. brant readjusted [his]197-mr. brant eye - glasses and straightened the paper - cutter , which [he]197-mr. brant had put back on the desk a fraction of an inch out of its habitual place . “[0-i] [You]2246-you had this from [George]175-george ? ” [he]197-mr. brant asked . “[175-george] No ; from [her]2250-she . [She]2250-she ’s been to see [me]0-i . _ [She]2250-she _ does n’t want to divorce . [She]2250-she ’s in love with [him]175-george ; in [her]2250-she way , that is ; but [she]2250-she ’s frightened . ” “[2250-she] And that makes [him]175-george the more eager ? ” “[2250-she] The more determined , at any rate . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant appeared to seize the distinction . “[2250-she] [George]175-george can be very determined . ” “[175-george] Yes . [I]0-i think [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother ought to be made to understand that all this talk about a wretched entanglement is n’t likely to make [him]175-george any less so . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s look seemed to say that making [Julia]194-julia understand had proved a no less onerous task for [his]197-mr. brant maturity than for [[Campton]174-campton ’s youth]4527-campton ’s youth . “[583-his mother] If [you]0-i do n’t object — perhaps the matter might , for the present , continue to be kept between [you]0-i and [me]0-i , ” [he]0-i suggested . “[0-i] Oh , by all means . [She]2253-she ’s too much like — — ” [He]0-i broke off , frightened at what [he]0-i had been about to say . “[2253-she] Too much , ” [he]0-i emended , “[2253-she] like the usual fool of [a woman that [every boy of [George]175-george ’s age]2255-every boy of george ’s age]2254-a woman that every boy of george ’s age thinks [he]2255-every boy of george ’s age wants simply because [he]2255-every boy of george ’s age ca n’t get [her]2253-she . ” “[0-i] And [you]0-i say [she]2253-she came to [you]0-i for advice ? ” “[2253-she] [She]2253-she came to [me]0-i to persuade [him]175-george to give up the idea of a divorce . [She]2253-she seems sorry for [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett in a way . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant marked [his]197-mr. brant sense of the weight of this by a succession of attentive nods . Do n’t [you]0-i see ? ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant exclaimed , almost impatiently . “[0-i] Do n’t [you]0-i see that if [she]2253-she turns [him]175-george down definitely [he]175-george ’ll be scheming to get away , to get back to the front , the minute [his]175-george leave is over ? [Campton]174-campton felt the blood rising to [his]174-campton forehead , not so much in anger at [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant as at the sense of [his]174-campton own inward complicity . “[2261-this girl] There ’s no earthly reason why [George]175-george should ever go back to the front , ” [he]175-george said . “[175-george] None whatever . [We]2258-we can get [him]175-george any staff - job [he]175-george chooses . [[His]175-george mother]583-his mother ’s already got the half - promise of a post for [him]175-george at [the War Office]1253-the war office . But [you]2264-you ’ll see , [you]2264-you ’ll see ! [We]2258-we ca n’t stop [him]175-george . Did [we]2258-we before ? That [any one]3083-any one should have been fool enough to pay a big price for such a patent fraud seemed to [him]174-campton as incomprehensible as [his]174-campton own present obtuseness seemed to [the banker]547-the banker . “[2264-you] [You]2264-you do see , do n’t [you]2264-you ? ” argued [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant anxiously . “[2264-you] Oh , [I]0-i suppose so . ” [Campton]174-campton slowly got to [his]174-campton feet . The adroit brushwork of the forged picture fascinated [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton went up to look at it more closely . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant pursued [him]174-campton with a gratified glance . “[2264-you] Ah , [you]2264-you ’re admiring [[my]0-i [Reynolds]349-reynolds]2266-my reynolds . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant seemed suddenly divided from [him]174-campton by the whole width of the gulf between that daub on the wall and a real [Reynolds]349-reynolds . [They]4534-they had nothing more to say to [each other]443-each other — nothing whatever . “[0-i] Well , goodbye . ” [He]174-campton held out [his]174-campton hand . “[0-i] Think it over — think it over , ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant called out after [him]174-campton as [he]174-campton enfiladed [the sumptuous offices]4536-the sumptuous offices , [a medalled veteran]4537-a medalled veteran holding back each door . It was not until [Campton]174-campton was back at [Montmartre]1-montmartre , and throwing off [his]174-campton coat to get into [his]174-campton old studio clothes , that [he]174-campton felt in [his]174-campton pocket the weight of the forgotten concert - money . It was too late in the day to take it back to [the bank]917-the bank , even if [he]174-campton had had the energy to retrace [his]174-campton steps ; and [he]174-campton decided to hand the bag over to [Boylston]247-boylston , with whom [he]174-campton was dining that night to meet [the elder Dastrey]220-adele anthony , [home]502-home on a brief leave from [[his]174-campton ambulance]1684-his ambulance . * * * * * “[0-i] Think it over ! ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s adjuration continued to echo in [Campton]174-campton ’s ears . As if [he]174-campton needed to be told to think it over ! Once again the war - worn world had vanished from [his]174-campton mind , and [he]174-campton saw only [George]175-george , [himself]174-campton and [George]175-george , [George]175-george and safety , [George]175-george and peace . [They]4541-they blamed [women who were cowards about [[their]4542-women who were cowards about their husbands , mistresses who schemed to protect their lovers husbands]4543-their husbands , mistresses who schemed to protect [[their]4542-women who were cowards about their husbands , mistresses who schemed to protect their lovers lovers]4544-their lovers]4542-women who were cowards about their husbands , mistresses who schemed to protect their lovers ! Well — [he]174-campton was as bad as [any one of [them]4541-they]4545-any one of them , if it came to that . [[His]174-campton son]364-his son had bought [his]364-his son freedom , had once offered [his]364-his son life and nearly lost it . [Brant]197-mr. brant was right : at all costs [they]4541-they must keep [him]174-campton from rushing back into that hell . That [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett should be the means of securing [his]174-campton safety was bitter enough . [This trivial barren creature]4547-this trivial barren creature to be [his]174-campton all — it seemed the parody of [Campton]174-campton ’s own youth ! And [Julia]194-julia , after all , had been only [a girl]4548-a girl when [he]174-campton had met [her]194-julia , inexperienced and still malleable . [A man less absorbed in [his]174-campton art]4549-a man less absorbed in his art , less oblivious of the daily material details of life , might conceivably have made something of [her]194-julia . But this little creature , with [her]194-julia farrago of false ideas , [her]194-julia vanity , [her]194-julia restlessness , [her]194-julia undisguised desire to keep [George]175-george and yet not lose [[her]194-julia world]4550-her world , had probably reached the term of [her]194-julia development , and would trip on through an eternal infancy of fads and frenzies . Luckily , as [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant said , [they]4551-they could use [her]194-julia for the time ; use [her]194-julia better , no doubt , than had [she]194-julia been [a more finely tempered instrument]4552-a more finely tempered instrument . [Campton]174-campton was still pondering on these things as [he]174-campton set out for [the restaurant where [he]174-campton had agreed to meet [Boylston]247-boylston and [Dastrey]220-adele anthony]4553-the restaurant where he had agreed to meet boylston and dastrey . At the foot of [his]174-campton own stairs [he]174-campton was surprised to run against [Boylston]247-boylston under [the porte - cochère]1678-the porte - cochère . [They]4551-they gave [each other]443-each other a quick questioning look , as [men]2525-men did when [they]2525-men encountered [each other]443-each other unexpectedly in those days . “[0-i] Anything up ? Oh , the money — [you’ve]2267-you’ve come for the money ? ” [Campton]174-campton remembered that [he]174-campton had left the bag [upstairs]2704-upstairs . “[2267-you’ve] The money ? Have n’t [you]2267-you’ve heard ? [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s killed , ” said [Boylston]247-boylston . [They]4551-they stood side by side in the doorway , while [Campton]174-campton ’s darkened mind struggled anew with the mystery of fate . Almost every day now the same readjustment had to be gone through : the cowering averted mind dragged upward and forced to visualize a new gap in the ranks , and summon [the remaining familiar figures]4559-the remaining familiar figures to fill it up and blot it out . And to - day this cruel gymnastic was to be performed for [[George]175-george ’s best friend]4560-george ’s best friend , [the elder Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s sole stake in life ! Only a few days ago [the lad]1349-the lad had passed through [Paris]5-paris , just back from [America]2-america , and in haste to rejoin [[his]1349-the lad regiment]816-his regiment ; alive and eager , throbbing with ideas , with courage , mirth and irony — the very material [France]18-france needed to rebuild [her]18-france ruins and beget [[her]18-france sons]4563-her sons ! And now , struck down as [George]175-george had been — not to rise like [George]175-george .... Once more the inner voice in [Campton]174-campton questioned distinctly : “[209-dastrey] Could [you]2268-you bear it ? ” and again [he]174-campton answered : “[209-dastrey] Less than ever ! ” Aloud [he]174-campton asked : “[188-dastrey] [Paul]188-dastrey ? ” “[188-dastrey] Oh , [he]188-dastrey went off at once . To break the news to [[Louis]209-dastrey ’ mother]2269-louis ’ mother in [the country]2496-the country . ” “[188-dastrey] [The boy]416-the boy was all [Paul]188-dastrey had left . ” “[188-dastrey] Yes . ” “[188-dastrey] What difference would it have made in the war , if [he]188-dastrey ’d just stayed on at [his]188-dastrey job in [America]2-america ? ” [Boylston]247-boylston did not answer , and [the two]459-the two stood silent , looking out unseeingly at [the black empty street]4565-the black empty street . There was nothing left to say , nowadays , when such blows fell ; hardly anything left to feel , it sometimes seemed . “[188-dastrey] Well , [I]0-i suppose [we]2272-we must go and eat something , ” [the older man]3130-the older man said ; and arm in arm [they]2272-we went out into the darkness . When [Campton]174-campton returned [home]502-home that night [he]174-campton sat down and , with the help of several pipes , wrote a note to [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett asking when [she]255-mrs. talkett would receive [him]174-campton . * * * * * Thereafter [he]174-campton tried to go back to [his]174-campton painting and to continue [his]174-campton daily visits to [the Palais Royal office]4320-the palais royal office . But for the time nothing seemed to succeed with [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton threw aside [his]174-campton study of [Mme]176-beausite . [Lebel]195-mme — [he]174-campton hung about [the office]1357-the office , confused and idle , and with the ever clearer sense that there also things were disintegrating . [George]175-george ’s birthday party had been given up on account of [young Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s death . [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant evidently thought the postponement unnecessary ; since [George]175-george ’s return [she]196-mrs. brant had gone over heart and soul to the “[0-i] business as usual ” party . But [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant quietly sided with [George]175-george ; and [Campton]174-campton was glad to be spared the necessity of celebrating the day in such a setting . It was some time since [Campton]174-campton had seen [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ; but the fault was not [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s . [The painter]540-the painter was aware of having voluntarily avoided [George]175-george . [He]0-i said to [himself]0-i : “[0-i] As long as [I]0-i know [he]2273-him ’s safe why should [I]0-i bother [him]2273-him ? ” But in reality [he]0-i did not feel [himself]0-i to be fit company for [any one]3083-any one , and had even shunned poor [Paul Dastrey]188-dastrey on [the latter]1395-the latter ’s hurried passage through [Paris]5-paris , when [he]0-i had come back from carrying the fatal news to [[young Dastrey]188-dastrey ’s mother]4575-young dastrey ’s mother . “[0-i] What on earth could [Paul]188-dastrey and [I]0-i have found to say to [each other]443-each other ? ” [Campton]174-campton argued with [himself]174-campton . “[188-dastrey] For [men of [our]2276-our age]2275-men of our age there ’s nothing left to say nowadays . The only thing [I]0-i can do is to try to work up one of [my]0-i old studies of [Louis]209-dastrey . That might please [him]2273-him a little — later on . ” But after one or two attempts [he]0-i pushed away that canvas too . At length one afternoon [George]175-george came in . [They]2276-our had not met for over a week , and as [George]175-george ’s blue uniform detached itself against the blurred tapestries of [the studio]370-the studio , the north light modelling the fresh curves of [his]175-george face , [the father]568-the father ’s heart gave a leap of pride . [[His]568-the father son]364-his son had never seemed to [him]568-the father so young and strong and vivid . [George]175-george , with a sudden blush , took [his]332-dad hand in a long pressure . “[0-i] [I]0-i say , [Dad]332-dad — [Madge]282-madge talkett has told [me]0-i . Told [me]0-i that [you]332-dad know about [us]2277-us and that [you]332-dad ’ve persuaded [her]282-madge talkett to see things as [I]0-i do . [She]282-madge talkett had n’t had a chance to speak to [me]0-i of [your]332-dad visit till last night . ” [Campton]174-campton felt [his]174-campton colour rising ; but though [his]174-campton own part in the business still embarrassed [him]174-campton [he]174-campton was glad that the barriers were down . “[282-madge talkett] [I]0-i did n’t want , ” [George]175-george continued , still flushed and slightly constrained , “[282-madge talkett] to say anything to [you]332-dad about all this till [I]0-i could say : ‘ Here ’s [[my]0-i wife]3210-my wife . ’ And now [she]282-madge talkett ’s promised . ” “[282-madge talkett] [She]282-madge talkett ’s promised ? ” “[282-madge talkett] Thanks to [you]332-dad , [you]332-dad know . [Your]332-dad visit to [her]282-madge talkett did it . [She]282-madge talkett told [me]0-i the whole thing yesterday . How [she]282-madge talkett ’d come [here]2489-here in desperation , to ask [you]332-dad to help [her]282-madge talkett , to have [her]282-madge talkett mind cleared up for [her]282-madge talkett ; and how [you]332-dad ’d thought it all over , and then gone to see [her]282-madge talkett , and how wise and perfect [you]332-dad ’d been about it all . [Poor child]2280-poor child — if [you]332-dad knew the difference it ’s made to [her]282-madge talkett ! ” [They]4579-they were seated now , the littered table between [them]4579-they . [Campton]174-campton , [his]174-campton elbows on it , [his]174-campton chin on [his]174-campton hands , looked across at [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , who faced the light . “[332-dad] The difference to [you]332-dad too ? ” [he]174-campton questioned . [George]175-george smiled : it was exactly the same detached smile which [he]175-george used to shed on [the little nurse who brought [him]175-george [his]175-george cocoa]4581-the little nurse who brought him his cocoa . “[332-dad] Of course . Now [I]0-i can go back without worrying . ” [He]0-i let the words fall as carelessly as if there were nothing in them to challenge attention . “[332-dad] Go back ? ” [Campton]174-campton stared at [him]175-george with a blank countenance . Had [he]174-campton heard aright ? The noise of [a passing lorry]4582-a passing lorry suddenly roared in [his]0-i ears like the guns of the front . “[332-dad] Did [you]332-dad say : _ go back _ ? ” [George]175-george opened [his]175-george blue eyes wide . “[332-dad] Why , of course ; as soon as ever [I]0-i ’m patched up .
