[You]332-dad did n’t think — — ? ” “[332-dad] [I]0-i thought [you]332-dad had the sense to realize that [you]332-dad ’ve done [your]332-dad share in one line , and that [your]332-dad business now is to do it in another . ” The same detached smile again brushed [George]175-george ’s lips . “[332-dad] But if [I]0-i happen to have only one line ? ” “[0-i] Nonsense ! [You]332-dad know [they]2281-they do n’t think that at [the War Office]1253-the war office . ” “[2281-they] [I]0-i do n’t believe [the War Office]1253-the war office will shut down if [I]0-i leave [it]1253-the war office . ” “[2281-they] What an argument ! It sounds like — — ” [Campton]174-campton , breaking off on a sharp breath , closed [his]174-campton lids for a second . [He]174-campton had been gazing too steadily into [George]175-george ’s eyes , and now at last [he]174-campton knew what that mysterious look in them meant . It was [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher ’s look , of course — inaccessible to reason , beyond reason , belonging to other spaces , other weights and measures , over the edge , somehow , of the tangible calculable world .... “[2492-a man] [A man]2492-a man ca n’t do more than [his]2492-a man duty : [you]332-dad ’ve done that , ” [he]174-campton growled . But [George]175-george insisted with [his]175-george gentle obstinacy : “[332-dad] [You]332-dad ’ll feel differently about it when [America]2-america comes in . ” [Campton]174-campton shook [his]174-campton head . “[332-dad] Never about [your]332-dad case . ” “[332-dad] [You]332-dad will — when [you]332-dad see how [we]2285-we all feel . When [we]2285-we ’re all in it [you]332-dad would n’t have [me]0-i looking on , would [you]332-dad ? And then there are [[my]0-i men]2286-my men — [I’ve]0-i got to get back to [[my]0-i men]2286-my men . ” “[0-i] But [you]332-dad ’ve no right to go now ; no business , ” [[his]175-george father]580-his father broke in violently . “[332-dad] Persuading [that poor girl]2288-that poor girl to wreck [her]2288-that poor girl life ... and then leaving [her]2288-that poor girl , planting [her]2288-that poor girl there with [her]2288-that poor girl past ruined , and [her]2288-that poor girl future .... [George]175-george , [you]332-dad ca n’t ! ” [George]175-george , in [his]175-george long months of illness , had lost [his]175-george old ruddiness of complexion . At [[his]175-george father]580-his father ’s challenge the blood again rose the more visibly to [his]175-george still - gaunt cheeks and white forehead : [he]175-george was evidently struck . “[175-george] [You]332-dad ’ll kill [her]2288-that poor girl — and kill [[your]332-dad mother]944-your mother ! ” [Campton]174-campton stormed . “[332-dad] Oh , it ’s not for to - morrow . Not for a long time , perhaps . [My]0-i shoulder ’s still too stiff . [I]0-i was stupid , ” [the young man]2749-the young man haltingly added , “[0-i] to put it as [I]0-i did . Of course [I]0-i ’ve got to think of [Madge]282-madge talkett now , ” [he]0-i acknowledged , “[821-mother] as well as [mother]821-mother . ” The blood flowed slowly back to [Campton]174-campton ’s heart . “[282-madge talkett] [You]332-dad ’ve got to think of — just the mere common - sense of the thing . That ’s all [I]0-i ask . [You]332-dad ’ve done [your]332-dad turn ; [you]332-dad ’ve done more . But never mind that . Now it ’s different . [You]332-dad ’re barely patched up : [you]332-dad ’re of use , immense use , for staff - work , and [you]332-dad know it . And [you]332-dad ’ve asked [a woman]760-a woman to tie up [her]760-a woman future to [yours]332-dad — at what cost [you]332-dad know too . It ’s as much [your]332-dad duty to keep away from the front now as it was before — well , [I]0-i admit it — to go there . [You]332-dad ’ve done just what [I]0-i should have wanted [[my]0-i son]856-my son to do , up to this minute — — ” [George]175-george laid a hand on [his]175-george a little wistfully . “[332-dad] Then just go on trusting [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do — to see that [I]0-i ’m right ! If [I]0-i ca n’t convince [you]332-dad , ask [Boylston]247-boylston — ask [Adele]220-adele anthony ! ” [George]175-george sat staring down at the table . For the first time since [they]4586-they had met at [Doullens Campton]331-campton was conscious of reaching [[his]0-i son]364-his son ’s inner mind , and of influencing it . “[220-adele anthony] [I]0-i wonder if [you]332-dad really love [her]2293-her ? ” [he]0-i suddenly risked . The question did not seem to offend [George]175-george , scarcely to surprise [him]175-george . “[220-adele anthony] Of course , ” [he]0-i said simply . “[220-adele anthony] Only — well , everything ’s different nowadays , is n’t it ? So many of the old ideas have come to seem such humbug . That ’s what [I]0-i want to drag [her]2293-her out of — the coils and coils of stale humbug . [They]2294-they were killing [her]2293-her . ” “[2294-they] Well — take care _ [you]332-dad _ do n’t , ” [Campton]331-campton said , thinking that everything was different indeed , as [he]331-campton recalled the reasons [young men]4371-young men had had for loving and marrying in [his]331-campton own time . A faint look of amusement came into [George]175-george ’s eyes . “[2294-they] Kill [her]2293-her ? Oh , no . [I]0-i ’m gradually bringing [her]2293-her to life . But all this is hard to talk about — yet . By - and - bye [you]332-dad ’ll understand ; [she]2293-her ’ll show [you]332-dad , [we]2295-we ’ll show [you]332-dad together . But at present nothing ’s to be said — to [any one]3083-any one , please , not even to [mother]821-mother . [Madge]282-madge talkett thinks this is no time for such things . There , of course , [I]0-i do n’t agree ; but [I]0-i must be patient . The secrecy , the under - handedness , are hateful to [me]0-i ; but for [her]2293-her it ’s all a part of [the sacred humbug]2298-the sacred humbug . ” [He]0-i rose listlessly , as if the discussion had bled all the life out of [him]0-i , and took [himself]0-i away . When [he]0-i had gone [[his]0-i father]580-his father drew a deep breath . Yes — [the boy]416-the boy would stay in [Paris]5-paris ; [he]416-the boy would almost certainly stay ; for the present , at any rate . And [people]378-people were still prophesying that in the spring there would be a big push all along the line ; and after that the nightmare might be over . [Campton]331-campton was glad [he]331-campton had gone to see [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett . [He]331-campton was glad , above all , that if the thing had to be done it was over , and that , by [Madge]282-madge talkett ’s wish , [no one]2702-no one was to know of what had passed between [them]4593-them . It was a distinct relief , in spite of what [he]331-campton had suggested to [George]175-george , not to have to carry that particular problem to [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony or [Boylston]247-boylston . A few days later [George]175-george accepted a staff - appointment in [Paris]5-paris . BOOK IV XXXII Heavily the weeks went by . [The world]2535-the world continued to roar on through smoke and flame , and contrasted with that headlong race was the slow dragging lapse of hours and days to [those who had to wait on events inactively]4595-those who had to wait on events inactively . When [Campton]331-campton met [Paul Dastrey]188-dastrey for the first time after the death of [[the latter]1395-the latter ’s nephew]4597-the latter ’s nephew , [the two men]442-the two men exchanged a long hand - clasp and then sat silent . As [Campton]331-campton had felt from the first , there was nothing left for [them]442-the two men to say to [each other]443-each other . If [young men like [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey]4600-young men like louis dastrey must continue to be sacrificed by [hundreds of thousands]4601-hundreds of thousands to save [[their]4600-young men like louis dastrey country]4348-their country , for whom was [the country]2496-the country being saved ? Was it for [the wasp - waisted youths in sham uniforms who haunted [the reawakening hotels and [restaurants]4606-restaurants]4605-the reawakening hotels and restaurants , in the frequent intervals between [their]4600-young men like louis dastrey ambulance trips to safe distances from the front]4604-the wasp - waisted youths in sham uniforms who haunted the reawakening hotels and restaurants , in the frequent intervals between their ambulance trips to safe distances from the front ? Or for [the elderly men like [Dastrey]209-dastrey and [Campton]331-campton , who could only sit facing [each other]443-each other with the spectre of the lost between [them]442-the two men]4607-the elderly men like dastrey and campton , who could only sit facing each other with the spectre of the lost between them ? [Young Dastrey]350-young dastrey , [young Fortin - Lescluze]182-fortin - lescluze , [René Davril]284-rené davril , [Benny Upsher]259-benny upsher — and how many hundreds more each day ! And not even [a child left by most of [them]442-the two men]4609-a child left by most of them , to carry on the faith [they]442-the two men had died for .... “[2298-the sacred humbug] If [we]2299-we ’re giving all [we]2299-we care for so that those little worms can reopen [[their]2300-their dance - halls]2301-their dance - halls on [the ruins]2302-the ruins , what in [God]266-god ’s name _ is _ left ? ” [Campton]331-campton questioned . [Dastrey]209-dastrey sat looking at the ground , [his]209-dastrey grey head bent between [his]209-dastrey hands . “[266-god] [France]18-france , ” [he]209-dastrey said . “[266-god] What ’s [France]18-france , with [no men left]2303-no men left ? ” “[0-i] Well — [I]0-i suppose , an Idea . ” “[0-i] Yes . [I]0-i suppose so . ” [Campton]331-campton stood up heavily . An Idea : [they]2299-we must cling to that . If [Dastrey]209-dastrey , from the depths of [his]209-dastrey destitution , could still feel it and live by it , why did it not help [Campton]331-campton more ? An Idea : that was what [France]18-france , ever since [she]18-france had existed , had always been in the story of civilization ; a luminous point about which striving visions and purposes could rally . And in that sense [she]18-france had been as much [[Campton]331-campton ’s spiritual home as [Dastrey]209-dastrey ’s]4610-campton ’s spiritual home as dastrey ’s ; to [thinkers]4611-thinkers , [artists]2150-artists , to [all creators]4613-all creators , [she]18-france had always been [a second country]4614-a second country . If [France]18-france went , [western civilization]4615-western civilization went with [her]18-france ; and then all [they]2299-we had believed in and been guided by would perish . That was what [George]175-george had felt ; it was what had driven [him]175-george from [the Argonne]81-the argonne to [the Aisne]88-aisne . [Campton]331-campton felt it too ; but dully , through a fog . [[His]331-campton son]364-his son was safe ; yes — but [too many other men ’s sons]4617-too many other men ’s sons were dying . There was no spot where [his]331-campton thoughts could rest : there were moments when the sight of [George]175-george , intact and immaculate — [his]175-george arm at last out of its sling — rose before [[his]364-his son father]580-his father like a reproach . The feeling was senseless ; but there it was . Whenever [the young man]2749-the young man entered [the room]475-the room [Campton]331-campton saw [him]2749-the young man attended by [the invisible host of [[his]2749-the young man comrades]3506-his comrades]4621-the invisible host of his comrades , [the fevered]4623-the fevered , [the maimed]4624-the maimed and the dying . [The Germans]854-the germans had attacked at [Verdun]91-verdun : horrible daily details of the struggle were pouring in . [No one at the rear]4626-no one at the rear had really known , except in swift fitful flashes , about the individual suffering of the first months of the war ; now such information was systematized and distributed everywhere , daily , with a cold impartial hand . And every night , when one laid [one]398-one ’s old bones on one ’s bed , there were those others , [the young in [their]4628-the young in their thousands thousands]4628-the young in their thousands , lying [down , perhaps never to rise again , in the mud and blood of the trenches]4629-down , perhaps never to rise again , in the mud and blood of the trenches . Even [Boylston]247-boylston ’s Preparedness was beginning to get on [Campton]331-campton ’s nerves . [He]331-campton tried to picture to [himself]331-campton how [he]331-campton should exult when [[his]331-campton country]1308-his country at last fell into line ; but [he]331-campton could realize only what [his]331-campton humiliation would be if [she]4631-she did not . It was almost a relief , at this time , to have [his]331-campton mind diverted to the dissensions among “[0-i] [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art , ” where , at a stormy meeting , [Harvey Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , as [a member of [the Finance Committee]4633-the finance committee]4632-a member of the finance committee , had asked for an accounting of the money taken in at [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s concert . This money , [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew stated , had passed through a number of hands . It should have been taken over by [Mr. Boylston]247-boylston , as [treasurer]4634-treasurer , at the close of the performance ; but [he]247-boylston had failed to claim it — had , in fact , been unfindable when [the organizers of the concert]4635-the organizers of the concert brought [their]4635-the organizers of the concert takings to [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett — and the money , knocking about from hand to hand , had finally been carried by [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett [herself]255-mrs. talkett to [Mr. Campton]174-campton . [The latter]1395-the latter , when asked to entrust it to [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , had refused on the ground that [he]331-campton had already deposited it in [the bank]917-the bank ; but a number of days later it was known to be still in [his]331-campton possession . All this time [Mr. Boylston]247-boylston , [treasurer]4634-treasurer , and [chairman of [the Financial Committee]4460-the financial committee]4639-chairman of the financial committee , appeared to think it quite in order that the funds should have been ( as [he]331-campton assumed ) deposited in the bank by [a member who was not on [that particular committee]4642-that particular committee , and who , in reality , had forgotten that they were in [his]331-campton possession]4641-a member who was not on that particular committee , and who , in reality , had forgotten that they were in his possession . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew delivered [himself]212-mr. mayhew of this indictment amid an embarrassed silence . To [Campton]174-campton it had seemed as if a burst of protest must instantly clear the air . But after [he]331-campton [himself]331-campton had apologized for [his]331-campton negligence in not depositing the money , and [Boylston]247-boylston had disengaged [his]247-boylston responsibility in a few quiet words , there followed another blank interval . Then [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew suddenly suggested a complete reorganization of the work . [He]212-mr. mayhew had something to criticize in [every department]4643-every department . [He]212-mr. mayhew , who so seldom showed [himself]212-mr. mayhew at [the office]1357-the office , now presented a list of omissions and commissions against which one after another of [the active members]4645-the active members rose to enter a mild denial . It was clear that [some one belonging to [the organization]4647-the organization , and who was playing into [his]212-mr. mayhew hands]4646-some one belonging to the organization , and who was playing into his hands , had provided [him]212-mr. mayhew with a series of cleverly falsified charges against [the whole group of workers]4648-the whole group of workers . [Presently Campton]174-campton could stand it no longer , and , jumping up , suddenly articulate , [he]212-mr. mayhew flung into [[his]212-mr. mayhew cousin]3131-his cousin ’s face a handful of home - truths under which [he]212-mr. mayhew expected that glossy countenance to lose its lustre . But [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew bore the assault with urbanity . It did not behove [him]212-mr. mayhew , [he]212-mr. mayhew said , to take up the reproaches addressed to [him]212-mr. mayhew by [the most distinguished member of [their]4648-the whole group of workers committee]4650-the most distinguished member of their committee — the most distinguished , [he]212-mr. mayhew might surely say without offence to any of [the others]3170-the others ( a murmur of assent ) ; it did not behove [him]212-mr. mayhew , because one of the few occasions on which [a great artist]4652-a great artist may be said to be at a disadvantage is when [he]212-mr. mayhew is trying to discuss business matters with [a man of business]4653-a man of business . [He]212-mr. mayhew , [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , was only that , nothing more ; but [he]212-mr. mayhew _ was _ that , and [he]212-mr. mayhew had been trained to answer random abuse by hard facts . In no way did [he]212-mr. mayhew intend to reflect on the devoted labours of [certain ladies of [the committee]1215-the committee]4654-certain ladies of the committee , nor on [[their]4648-the whole group of workers sympathetic treasurer]4656-their sympathetic treasurer ’s gallant efforts to acquire , amid all [his]212-mr. mayhew other pressing interests , the rudiments of business habits ; but [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony had all along been dividing [her]221-miss anthony time between two widely different charities , and [Mr. Boylston]247-boylston , like [[his]247-boylston distinguished champion]4657-his distinguished champion , was first of all [an artist]1165-an artist , with the habits of [the studio]370-the studio rather than of [the office]1357-the office . In the circumstances — — [Campton]174-campton jumped to [his]174-campton feet again . If [he]174-campton stayed a moment longer [he]174-campton felt [he]174-campton should knock [Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew down . [He]174-campton jammed [his]174-campton hat on , shouted out “[0-i] [I]0-i resign , ” and limped out of [the room]475-the room . It was the way in which [his]174-campton encounters with practical difficulties always ended . The consciousness of [his]174-campton inferiority in argument , [the visionary]4662-the visionary ’s bewilderment when incomprehensible facts are thrust on [him]174-campton by [fluent people]4663-fluent people , the helpless sense of not knowing what to answer , and of seeing [his]174-campton dream - world smashed in the rough - and - tumble of shabby motives — it all gave [him]174-campton the feeling that [he]174-campton was drowning , and must fight [his]174-campton way to the surface before [they]4663-fluent people had [him]174-campton under . In [the street]2680-the street [he]174-campton stood in a cold sweat of remorse . [He]174-campton knew the charges of negligence against [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony and [Boylston]247-boylston were trumped up . [He]174-campton knew there was an answer to be made , and that [he]174-campton was [the man to make it]4665-the man to make it ; and [his]174-campton eyes filled with tears of rage and self - pity at [his]174-campton own incompetence . But then [he]174-campton took heart at the thought of [Boylston]247-boylston ’s astuteness and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ’s courage . [They]4663-fluent people would not let [themselves]4663-fluent people be beaten — probably [they]4663-fluent people would fight [their]4663-fluent people battle better without [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton tried to protect [his]174-campton retreat with such arguments , and when [he]174-campton got back to [the studio]370-the studio [he]174-campton called up [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme , and plunged again into [his]174-campton charcoal study of [her]195-mme head . [He]174-campton did not remember having ever worked with such supernatural felicity : it was as if _ that [_]4667-_ were [his]174-campton victorious answer to all [their]4663-fluent people lies and intrigues .... But [the Mayhew party]4668-the mayhew party was victorious too . How it came about a mind like [Campton]174-campton ’s could not grasp . [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew , it appeared , had let fall that a very large gift of money from [the world - renowned philanthropist]4669-the world - renowned philanthropist , [Sir Cyril Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein ( obtained through [the good offices of [Mmes]351-mmes . [de Dolmetsch]179-de dolmetsch and [Beausite]176-beausite]4670-the good offices of mmes . de dolmetsch and beausite ) was contingent on certain immediate changes in [the organization]4647-the organization ( “[0-i] drastic changes ” was [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s phrase ) ; and thereupon [several hitherto passive members]4672-several hitherto passive members had suddenly found voice to assert the duty of not losing this gift . After that the way was clear . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony and [Boylston]247-boylston were offered ornamental posts which [they]4672-several hitherto passive members declined , and within a week [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal saw [them]4672-several hitherto passive members no more , and [Paris drawing - rooms]4674-paris drawing - rooms echoed with the usual rumours of committee wrangles and dark discoveries . The episode left [Campton]174-campton with a bitter taste in [his]174-campton soul . It seemed to [him]174-campton like an ugly little allegory of [Germany]55-germany ’s manœuvring [the world]2535-the world into war . The speciousness of [Mr. Mayhew]212-mr. mayhew ’s arguments , the sleight - of - hand by which [he]212-mr. mayhew had dislodged [the real workers]4676-the real workers and replaced [them]4676-the real workers by [[his]212-mr. mayhew satellites]4677-his satellites , reminded [the painter]540-the painter of [the neutrals who were beginning to say that there were two sides to every question]4679-the neutrals who were beginning to say that there were two sides to every question , that war was always cruel , and how about the Russian atrocities in [Silesia]162-silesia ? As the months dragged on a breath of lukewarmness had begun to blow through [the world]2535-the world , damping [men]2525-men ’s souls , confusing plain issues , casting a doubt on the worth of everything . [People]378-people were beginning to ask what [one]398-one knew , after all , of the secret motives which had impelled [half - a - dozen self - indulgent old men ensconced in [Ministerial offices]4685-ministerial offices]4684-half - a - dozen self - indulgent old men ensconced in ministerial offices to plunge [the world]2535-the world in ruin . [No one]2702-no one seemed to feel any longer that life is something more than being alive ; apparently [the only people not tired of the thought of death]4688-the only people not tired of the thought of death were [the young men still pouring out to it in [their]4689-the young men still pouring out to it in their thousands thousands]4689-the young men still pouring out to it in their thousands . Still [those thousands]4690-those thousands poured ; still [the young]4691-the young died ; still , wherever [Campton]174-campton went , [he]174-campton met elderly faces , known and unknown , disfigured by grief , shrunken with renunciation . And still the months wore on without result . One day in crossing [the Tuileries]680-the tuileries [he]174-campton felt the same soft sparkle which , just about a year earlier , had abruptly stirred the sap in [him]174-campton . Yes — it was nearly a year since the day when [he]174-campton had noticed the first horse - chestnut blossoms , and been reminded by [Mme . Lebel]195-mme that [he]174-campton ought to buy some new shirts ; and though to - day the horse - chestnuts were still leafless they were already misty with buds , and the tall white clouds above them full - uddered with spring showers . It was spring again , spring with [her]195-mme deluding promises — [her]195-mme gilding of worn stones and chilly water , the mystery of [her]195-mme distances , the finish and brilliance of [her]195-mme nearer strokes . [Campton]174-campton , in spite of [himself]174-campton , drank down the life - giving draught and felt its murmur in [his]174-campton veins . And just then , across the width of [the gardens]4693-the gardens [he]174-campton saw , beyond a stretch of turf and clipped shrubs , [two people]4694-two people , also motionless , who seemed to have the same cup at [their]4694-two people lips . [He]174-campton recognized [[his]174-campton son]364-his son and [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett . [Their]4694-two people backs were toward [him]174-campton , and [they]4694-two people stood close together , looking with the same eyes at the same sight : [an Apollo touched with flying sunlight]4696-an apollo touched with flying sunlight . After a while [they]4694-two people walked on again , slowly and close to [each other]443-each other . [George]175-george , as [they]4694-two people moved , seemed now and then to point out some beauty of sculpture , or the colour of a lichened urn ; and once [they]4694-two people turned and took [their]4694-two people fill of the great perspective tapering to the Arch — the Arch on which [[Rude]250-rude ’s Mænad - [Marseillaise]352-marseillaise]163-rude ’s mænad - marseillaise still yelled [her]163-rude ’s mænad - marseillaise battalions on to death . XXXIII [Campton]174-campton finished [his]174-campton charcoal of [Mme . Lebel]195-mme ; then [he]174-campton attacked [her]195-mme in oils . Now that [his]174-campton work at [the Palais Royal]1431-the palais royal was ended , painting was once more [his]174-campton only refuge . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had returned to [[her]195-mme refugees]3347-her refugees ; [Boylston]247-boylston , pale and obstinate , toiled on at Preparedness . But [Campton]174-campton found it impossible to take up any new form of work ; [his]174-campton philanthropic ardour was exhausted . [He]174-campton could only shut [himself]174-campton up , for long solitary hours , in the empty and echoing temple of [his]174-campton art . [George]175-george emphatically approved of [his]174-campton course : [George]175-george was as insistent as [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant on the duty of “[0-i] business as usual . ” But on [the young man]2749-the young man ’s lips the phrase had a different meaning ; it seemed the result of that altered perspective which [Campton]174-campton was conscious of whenever , nowadays , [he]174-campton tried to see things as [[his]174-campton son]364-his son saw them . [George]175-george was not indifferent , [he]175-george was not callous ; but [he]175-george seemed to feel [himself]175-george mysteriously set apart , destined to some other task for which [he]175-george was passively waiting . Even the split among “[3228-the friends of french art] [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art ” left [him]175-george , despite of [his]175-george admiration for [Boylston]247-boylston , curiously unperturbed . [He]175-george seemed to have taken the measure of all such ephemeral agitations , and to regard [them]2310-them with an indulgent pity which was worse than coldness . “[2306-he] [He]2306-he feels that all [we]2307-we do is so useless , ” [Campton]174-campton said to [Dastrey]220-adele anthony ; “[2306-he] [he]2306-he ’s like a gardener watching ants rebuild [[their]2308-their hill]2309-their hill in the middle of a path , and knowing all the while that hill and path are going to be wiped out by [his]2306-he pick . ” “[2310-them] Ah , [they]2310-them ’re all like that , ” [Dastrey]220-adele anthony murmured . * * * * * Mme . [Lebel]195-mme came up to [the studio]370-the studio every afternoon . [The charcoal study]4703-the charcoal study had been only of [her]195-mme head ; but for the painting [Campton]174-campton had seated [her]195-mme in [her]195-mme own horsehair armchair , [her]195-mme smoky lamp beside [her]195-mme , [her]195-mme sewing in [her]195-mme lap . More than ever [he]174-campton saw in [the wise old face]4704-the wise old face something typical of its race and class : the obstinate French gift , as [some one]839-some one had put it , of making one more effort after the last effort . [The old woman]483-the old woman could not imagine why [he]174-campton wanted to paint [her]195-mme ; but when one day [he]174-campton told [her]483-the old woman it was for [[her]483-the old woman grandsons]486-her grandsons , [her]483-the old woman eyes filled , and [she]483-the old woman said : “[2310-them] For which one , [sir]2499-sir ? For [they]2312-they ’re both at [Verdun]91-verdun . ” One autumn afternoon [he]174-campton was late in getting back to [the studio]370-the studio , where [he]174-campton knew [she]483-the old woman was waiting for [him]174-campton . [He]174-campton pushed the door open , and there , in the beaten - down attitude in which [he]174-campton had once before seen [her]483-the old woman , [she]483-the old woman lay across the table , [her]483-the old woman cap awry , [her]483-the old woman hands clutching [her]483-the old woman sewing , and [George]175-george kneeling at [her]483-the old woman side . [The young man]2749-the young man ’s arm was about [her]483-the old woman , [his]2749-the young man head pressed against [her]483-the old woman breast ; and on the floor lay the letter , the fatal letter which was always , nowadays , the key to such scenes . Neither [George]175-george nor [the old woman]483-the old woman had heard [Campton]174-campton enter ; and for a moment [he]174-campton stood and watched [them]1121-these two . [George]175-george ’s face , so fair and ruddy against [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme ’s rusty black , wore a look of boyish compassion which [Campton]174-campton had never seen on it . Mme . [Lebel]195-mme had sunk into [his]174-campton hold as if it soothed and hushed [her]483-the old woman ; and [Campton]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton : “[2312-they] [These two]1121-these two are closer to each other than [George]175-george and [I]0-i , because [they]1121-these two ’ve both seen the horror face to face . [He]175-george knows what to say to [her]2314-her ever so much better than [he]175-george knows what to say to [[his]175-george mother]583-his mother or [me]0-i . ” But apparently there was no need to say much . [George]175-george continued to kneel in silence ; presently [he]175-george bent and kissed [the old woman]483-the old woman ’s cheek ; then [he]175-george got to [his]175-george feet and saw [[his]175-george father]580-his father . “[175-george] The _ Chasseur Alpin _ , ” [he]175-george merely said , picking up the letter and handing it to [Campton]174-campton . “[175-george] It was [the grandson [she]2314-her counted on most]2316-the grandson she counted on most . ” Mme . [Lebel]195-mme caught sight of [Campton]174-campton , smoothed [herself]195-mme and stood up also . “[0-i] [I]0-i had found [him]2316-the grandson she counted on most [a wife]1114-a wife — [a strong healthy girl with a good _ dot _]2318-a strong healthy girl with a good _ dot _ . There go [[my]0-i last great - grandchildren]2319-my last great - grandchildren ! For the other will be killed too . [I]0-i do n’t understand any more , do [you]0-i ? ” [She]195-mme made an automatic attempt to straighten the things on the table , but [her]195-mme hands beat the air and [George]175-george had to lead [her]195-mme [downstairs]2942-downstairs . It was that day that [Campton]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton : “[0-i] [We]2320-we sha n’t keep [him]2316-the grandson she counted on most in [Paris]5-paris much longer . ” But the heavy weeks of spring and summer passed , the inconclusive conflict at the front went on with its daily toll of dead , and [George]175-george still stuck to [his]175-george job . [Campton]174-campton , during this time , continued to avoid [the Brants]203-the brants as much as possible . [[His]174-campton wife]516-his wife ’s conversation was intolerable to [him]174-campton ; [her]195-mme obtuse optimism , now that [she]195-mme had got [[her]195-mme son]3034-her son back , was even harder to bear than the guiltily averted glance of [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , between whom and [Campton]174-campton [their]2320-we last talk had hung a lasting shadow of complicity . But most of all [Campton]174-campton dreaded to meet [the Talketts]315-the talketts ; [the wife]3109-the wife with [her]195-mme flushed cheek - bones and fixed eyes , [the husband]4717-the husband still affably and continuously arguing against Philistinism . One afternoon [the painter]540-the painter stumbled on [them]2320-we , taking tea with [George]175-george in [[Boylston]247-boylston ’s little flat]4719-boylston ’s little flat ; but [he]540-the painter went away again , unable to bear the interminable discussion between [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett and [Boylston]247-boylston , and [the pacifist]4720-the pacifist ’s reiterated phrase : “[0-i] To borrow one of [[my]0-i wife]3210-my wife ’s expressions”—while [George]175-george , with a closed brooding face , sat silent , laughing drily now and then . What a different [George]175-george from the one [[his]175-george father]580-his father had found , in silence also , kneeling beside [Mme . Lebel]195-mme ! Once again [Campton]174-campton was vouchsafed a glimpse of that secret [George]175-george . [He]174-campton had walked back with [[his]174-campton son]364-his son after the funeral mass for [young Lebel]195-mme ; and in [[the porter]1668-the porter ’s lodge of [the Avenue Marigny]548-the avenue marigny]4724-the porter ’s lodge of the avenue marigny [they]4726-they found [a soldier]1016-a soldier waiting — [a young square - built fellow , with a shock of straw - coloured hair above [his]1016-a soldier sunburnt rural face]4728-a young square - built fellow , with a shock of straw - coloured hair above his sunburnt rural face . [Campton]174-campton was turning from the door when [George]175-george dashed past [him]174-campton , caught [the young man]2749-the young man by both shoulders , and shouted out [his]2749-the young man name . It was that of [the orderly who had carried [him]2749-the young man out of [the firing - line]4731-the firing - line and hunted [him]2749-the young man up the next day in [the Doullens hospital]4004-the doullens hospital]4730-the orderly who had carried him out of the firing - line and hunted him up the next day in the doullens hospital . [Campton]174-campton saw the look [the two]459-the two exchanged : it lasted only for the taking of a breath ; a moment later [officer]4734-officer and [soldier]4735-soldier were laughing like [boys]3471-boys , and [the orderly]4250-the orderly was being drawn forth to shake hands with [Campton]174-campton . But again the glance was an illumination ; it came straight from [that far country]4738-that far country , [the [Benny]259-benny upsher [Upsher country]4740-upsher country , which [Campton]174-campton so feared to see in [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s eyes]4739-the benny upsher country , which campton so feared to see in his son ’s eyes . [The orderly]4250-the orderly had been visiting [[his]4250-the orderly family]794-his family , fugitives from [the invaded regions who had taken shelter in one of [[Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ’s suburban colonies]4745-adele anthony ’s suburban colonies]4744-the invaded regions who had taken shelter in one of adele anthony ’s suburban colonies . [He]4250-the orderly had obtained permission to stop in [Paris]5-paris on [his]4250-the orderly way back to the front ; and for two joyful days [he]4250-the orderly was lodged and feasted in [the Avenue Marigny]125-the avenue marigny . [Boylston]247-boylston provided [him]4250-the orderly with an evening at [Montmartre]1-montmartre , [George]175-george and [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant took [him]4250-the orderly to [the theatre]4746-the theatre and [the cinema]4747-the cinema , and on the last day of [his]4250-the orderly leave [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony invited [him]4250-the orderly to tea with [Campton]174-campton , [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant and [Boylston]247-boylston . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , as [they]4748-they left [this entertainment]4749-this entertainment , hung back on the stairs to say in a whisper to [Campton]174-campton : “[0-i] [The family]2768-the family are provided for — amply . [I]0-i ’ve asked [George]175-george to mention the fact to [the young man]2749-the young man ; but not until just as [he]2749-the young man ’s starting . ” [Campton]174-campton nodded . For [George]175-george ’s sake [he]174-campton was glad ; yet [he]174-campton could not repress a twinge of [his]174-campton dormant jealousy . Was it always to be [Brant]197-mr. brant who thought first of the things to make [George]175-george happy — always [Brant]197-mr. brant who would [alone have the power to carry them out]4750-alone have the power to carry them out ? “[2749-the young man] But [he]2749-the young man ca n’t prevent [that poor fellow]2324-that poor fellow ’s getting killed to - morrow , ” [Campton]174-campton thought almost savagely , as [the young soldier]1353-the young soldier beamed forth from [the taxi in which [George]175-george was hurrying [him]174-campton]4752-the taxi in which george was hurrying him to [the station]563-the station . * * * * * It was not many days afterward that [George]175-george looked in at [the studio]370-the studio early one morning . [Campton]174-campton , over [his]174-campton breakfast , had been reading the _ communiqué _ . There was heavy news from [Verdun]91-verdun ; from east to west the air was dark with calamity ; but [George]175-george ’s face had the look it had worn when [he]175-george greeted [[his]175-george orderly]2042-his orderly . “[332-dad] [Dad]332-dad , [I]0-i ’m off , ” [he]0-i said ; and sitting down at the table , [he]0-i unceremoniously poured [himself]0-i some coffee into [[his]0-i father]580-his father ’s empty cup . “[0-i] [The battalion]2325-the battalion ’s been ordered back . [I]0-i leave to - night . Let ’s lunch together somewhere presently , shall [we]2326-we ? ” [His]174-campton eye was clear , [his]174-campton smile confident : a great weight seemed to have fallen from [him]174-campton , and [he]174-campton looked like [the little boy]4757-the little boy sitting up in bed with [[his]4757-the little boy Lavengro]4758-his lavengro . “[2326-we] After ten months of [Paris]5-paris — — ” [he]174-campton added , stretching [his]174-campton arms over [his]174-campton head with a great yawn . “[2326-we] Yes — the routine — — ” stammered [Campton]174-campton , not knowing what [he]174-campton said . Yet [he]174-campton was glad too ; yes , in [his]174-campton heart of hearts [he]174-campton knew [he]174-campton was glad ; though , as always happened , [his]174-campton emotion took [him]174-campton by the throat and silenced [him]174-campton . But it did not matter , for [George]175-george was talking . “[2326-we] [I]0-i shall have leave a good deal oftener nowadays , ” [he]0-i said with animation . “[0-i] And everything is ever so much better organized — letters and all that . [I]0-i sha n’t seem so awfully far away . [You]2327-you ’ll see . ” [Campton]174-campton still gazed at [him]175-george , struggling for expression . [Their]4759-their hands met . [Campton]174-campton said — or imagined [he]174-campton said : “[0-i] [I]0-i see — [I]0-i do see , already — — ” though afterward [he]174-campton was not even sure that [he]174-campton had spoken . What [he]174-campton saw , with an almost blinding distinctness , was the extent to which [his]174-campton own feeling , during the long months , had imperceptibly changed , and how [his]174-campton inmost impulse , now that the blow had fallen , was not of resistance to it , but of acquiescence , since it made [him]174-campton once more one with [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . [He]174-campton would have liked to tell that to [George]175-george ; but speech was impossible . And perhaps , after all , it did n’t matter ; it did n’t matter , because [George]175-george understood . [Their]4759-their hand - clasp had made that clear , and an hour or two later [they]4759-their were lunching together almost gaily . [Boylston]247-boylston joined [them]4759-their , and [the three]1698-the three went on together to say goodbye to [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony . [Adele]220-adele anthony , for once , was unprepared : it was almost a relief to [Campton]174-campton , who had winced in advance at the thought of [her]364-his son warlike attitude . The poor thing was far from warlike : [her]364-his son pale eyes clung to [George]175-george ’s in a frightened stare , while [her]364-his son lips , a little stiffly , repeated the stock phrases of good cheer . “[0-i] Such a relief .... [I]0-i congratulate [you]2328-you ... getting out of all this _ paperasserie _ and red tape .... If [I]0-i ’d been [you]2328-you [I]0-i could n’t have stood [Paris]5-paris another minute .... [The only hopeful people]2329-the only hopeful people left are at the front .... ” It was the formula that sped [every departing soldier]4762-every departing soldier . The day wore on . To [Campton]174-campton its hours seemed as interminable yet as rapid as those before [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s first departure , nearly two years earlier . [George]175-george had begged [[his]175-george father]580-his father to come in the evening to [the Avenue Marigny]125-the avenue marigny , where [he]174-campton was dining with [the Brants]203-the brants . It was easier for [Campton]174-campton nowadays to fall in with such requests : during the months of [George]175-george ’s sojourn in [Paris]5-paris a good many angles had had their edges rubbed off . Besides , at that moment [he]174-campton would have done anything for [[his]174-campton son]364-his son — [[his]174-campton son]364-his son again at last ! In [their]4767-their hand - clasp that morning [the old George]175-george had come back to [him]174-campton , simple , boyish , just as [he]175-george used to be ; and [Campton]174-campton ’s dread of the future was lightened by a great glow of pride . In [the Avenue Marigny dining - room]4768-the avenue marigny dining - room [the Brants]203-the brants and [George]175-george were still sitting together about the delicate silver and porcelain . There were no flowers : [Julia]194-julia , always correct , had long since banished them as a superfluity . But there was champagne for [George]175-george ’s farewell , and a glimpse of rich fare being removed . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant rose to greet [Campton]174-campton . [His]197-mr. brant concise features were drawn with anxiety , and with the effort to hide it ; but [[his]197-mr. brant wife]516-his wife appeared to [Campton]174-campton curiously unperturbed , and the leave - taking was less painful and uselessly drawn out than [he]197-mr. brant had expected . [George]175-george and [[his]175-george father]580-his father were to be sent to [the station]563-the station in [[Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s motor]4772-mr. brant ’s motor . [Campton]174-campton , as [he]174-campton got in , remembered with a shiver the grey morning , before daylight , when the same motor had stood at [the studio]370-the studio door , waiting to carry [him]197-mr. brant to [Doullens]146-doullens ; between [himself]197-mr. brant and [[his]197-mr. brant son]364-his son [he]174-campton seemed to see [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s small suffering profile . To shake off the memory [he]174-campton said : “[944-your mother] [[Your]2330-your mother]944-your mother ’s in wonderfully good form . [I]0-i was glad to see [she]944-your mother was n’t nervous . ” [George]175-george laughed . “[944-your mother] No . [Madge]282-madge talkett met [her]282-madge talkett this morning at [the new _ clairvoyante’s_.—It]2332-the new _ clairvoyante’s_.—it does [them]2333-them all a lot of good , ” [he]175-george added , with [his]175-george all - embracing tolerance . [Campton]174-campton shivered again . That universal smiling comprehension of [George]175-george ’s always made [him]2334-him seem remoter than ever . “[2334-him] It makes [him]2334-him seem so old — a thousand years older than [I]0-i am . ” But [he]2334-him forced an acquiescent laugh , and presently [George]175-george went on : “[2334-him] About [Madge]282-madge talkett — [you’ll]2335-you be awfully good to [her]282-madge talkett , wo n’t [you]2335-you , if [I]0-i get smashed ? ” “[977-my dear boy] [[My]0-i dear boy]977-my dear boy ! ” There was another pause , and then [Campton]174-campton risked a question . “[977-my dear boy] Just how do things stand ? [I]0-i know so little , after all . ” For a moment [George]175-george seemed to hesitate : [his]175-george thick fair eyebrows were drawn into a puzzled frown . “[0-i] [I]0-i know — [I’ve]0-i never explained it to [you]2335-you properly . [I]0-i ’ve tried to ; but [I]0-i was never sure that [I]0-i could make [you]2335-you see . ” [He]0-i paused and added quietly : “[0-i] [I]0-i know now that [she]282-madge talkett ’ll never divorce [Talkett]282-madge talkett . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i know — — ? ” [Campton]174-campton exclaimed with a great surge of relief . “[0-i] [She]282-madge talkett thinks [she]282-madge talkett will ; but [I]0-i see that the idea still frightens [her]282-madge talkett . And [I]0-i ’ve kept on using the divorce argument only as a pretext . ” The words thrust [Campton]174-campton back into new depths of perplexity . “[0-i] A pretext ? ” [he]174-campton echoed . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear old [Dad]332-dad]2337-my dear old dad — don’t [you]332-dad guess ? [She]282-madge talkett ’s come to care for [me]0-i awfully ; if [we]2338-we ’d gone all the lengths [she]282-madge talkett wanted , and then [I]0-i ’d got killed , there would have been nothing on [earth]2780-earth left for [her]282-madge talkett . [I]0-i had n’t the right , do n’t [you]332-dad see ? [We]2338-we [chaps]2340-chaps have n’t any futures to dispose of till this job [we]2338-we ’re in is finished . Of course , if [I]0-i come back , and [she]282-madge talkett can make up [her]282-madge talkett mind to break with everything [she]282-madge talkett ’s used to , [we]2338-we shall marry ; but if things go wrong [I]0-i ’d rather leave [her]282-madge talkett as [she]282-madge talkett is , safe in [[her]282-madge talkett little old rut]2341-her little old rut . [So many people]2342-so many people ca n’t live out of one — and [she]282-madge talkett ’s one of [them]2342-so many people , [poor child]2280-poor child , though [she]282-madge talkett ’s so positive [she]282-madge talkett is n’t . ” [Campton]174-campton sat chilled and speechless as [the motor]1081-the motor whirled [them]2345-they on through [the hushed streets]4776-the hushed streets . It paralyzed [his]174-campton faculties to think that in a moment more [they]2345-they would be at [the station]563-the station . “[282-madge talkett] It ’s awfully fine : [your]2344-you idea , ” [he]174-campton stammered at length . “[2344-you] Awfully — magnanimous . ” But [he]174-campton still felt the chill down [his]174-campton spine . “[2344-you] Oh , it ’s only that things look to [us]2345-they so different — so indescribably different — and always will , [I]0-i suppose , even after this business is over . [We]2345-they seem to be sealed to it for life . ” “[2345-they] [Poor girl]2346-poor girl — [poor girl]2346-poor girl ! ” [Campton]174-campton thought within [himself]174-campton . Aloud [he]174-campton said : “[2345-they] [[My]0-i dear chap]934-my dear chap , of course [you]2344-you can count on [my]0-i being — [my]0-i doing — — ” “[2344-you] Of course , of course , [old Dad]2349-old dad . ” [They]2345-they were at [the station]563-the station . [Father]573-father and [son]574-son got out and walked toward [the train]768-the train . [Campton]174-campton put both hands on [George]175-george ’s shoulders . “[2349-old dad] Look here , ” [George]175-george broke out , “[2349-old dad] there ’s one thing more . [I]0-i want to tell [you]2344-you that [I]0-i know what a lot [I]0-i owe to [you]2344-you and [Adele]220-adele anthony . [You]2344-you ’ve both been awfully fine : did [you]2344-you know it ? [You]2344-you two first made [me]0-i feel a lot of things [I]0-i had n’t felt before . And [you]2344-you know this _ is _ [my]0-i job ; [I]0-i ’ve never been surer of it than at this minute . ” [They]2344-you clasped hands in silence , each looking [his]0-i fill of [the other]2914-the other ; then [the crowd]613-the crowd closed in , [George]175-george exclaimed : “[0-i] [My]0-i kit - bag ! ” and somehow , in the confusion , the parting was over , and [Campton]174-campton , straining blurred eyes , saw [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s smile — the smile of [the light - hearted lad of old days]4785-the light - hearted lad of old days — flash out at [him]174-campton from [the moving train]4786-the moving train . For an instant [the father]568-the father had the illusion that it was the goodbye look of [the boy]416-the boy [George]175-george , going back to [school]4068-school after the holidays . * * * * * [Campton]174-campton , as [he]174-campton came out of [the station]563-the station , stumbled , to [his]174-campton surprise , on [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . [The little man]441-the little man , as [they]4792-they met , flushed and paled , and sought the customary support from [his]441-the little man eye - glasses . “[0-i] [I]0-i followed [you]0-i in [the other motor]2350-the other motor , ” [he]441-the little man said , looking away . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i say — — ” [Campton]174-campton murmured ; then , with an effort : “[0-i] Should n’t [you]0-i like [me]0-i to drive back with [you]0-i ? ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant shook [his]197-mr. brant head . “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i . Thank [you]0-i very much . But it ’s late and [you]0-i ’ll want to be getting [home]502-home . [I]0-i ’ll be glad if [you]0-i ’ll use [[my]0-i car]2352-my car . ” Together [they]4793-they strolled slowly across [the station court]4794-the station court to the place where [the private motors waited]4795-the private motors waited ; but there [Campton]174-campton held out [his]174-campton hand . “[0-i] Much obliged ; [I]0-i think [I]0-i ’ll walk . ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant nodded ; then [he]197-mr. brant said abruptly : “[0-i] This _ clairvoyante _ business : is there anything in it , do [you]0-i think ? [You]0-i saw how calm — er — [Julia]194-julia was just now : [she]194-julia wished [me]0-i to tell [you]0-i that [that Spanish woman [she]194-julia goes to]2353-that spanish woman she goes to — [her]2353-that spanish woman she goes to name is [Olida]323-olida , [I]0-i think — had absolutely reassured [her]194-julia about ... about the future . [The woman]3323-the woman says [she]3323-the woman knows that [George]175-george will come back soon , and never be sent to the front again . Those were the exact words , [I]0-i believe . _ Never be sent to the front again . _ [Julia]194-julia put every kind of question , and could n’t trip [her]194-julia up ; [she]194-julia wanted [me]0-i to tell [you]0-i so . It does sound ... ? Well , at any rate , it ’s a help to [the mothers]2355-the mothers . ” XXXIV The next morning [Campton]174-campton said to [himself]0-i : “[0-i] [I]0-i can catch that goodbye look if [I]0-i get it down at once — — ” and pulled out a canvas before [Mme]323-olida . [Lebel]195-mme came in with [his]0-i coffee . As sometimes happened to [him]0-i , the violent emotions of the last twenty - four hours had almost immediately been clarified and transmuted into vision . [He]0-i felt that [he]0-i could think contentedly of [George]175-george if [he]0-i could sit down at once and paint [him]175-george . The picture grew under [his]0-i feverish fingers — feverish , yet how firm ! [He]0-i always wondered anew at the way in which , at such hours , the inner flame and smoke issued in a clear guiding radiance . [He]0-i saw — [he]0-i saw ; and the mere act of [his]0-i seeing seemed to hold [George]175-george safe in some pure impenetrable medium . [[His]0-i boy]570-his boy was there , sitting to [him]0-i , the old [George]175-george [he]0-i knew and understood , essentially , vividly face to face with [him]0-i . [He]0-i was interrupted by a ring . [Mme]195-mme . [Lebel]195-mme , tray in hand , opened the door , and [a swathed and voluminous figure , sweeping in on a wave of musk]4797-a swathed and voluminous figure , sweeping in on a wave of musk , blotted [her]195-mme out . [Campton]174-campton , exasperated at the interruption , turned to face [Mme]195-mme . [Olida]323-olida . So remote were [his]174-campton thoughts that [he]174-campton would hardly have recognized [her]195-mme had [she]195-mme not breathed , on the old familiar guttural : “[0-i] [Juanito]353-juanito ! ” [He]174-campton was less surprised at [her]195-mme intrusion than annoyed at being torn from [his]174-campton picture . “[353-juanito] Did n’t [you]2356-you see a sign on the door ? ‘ No admission before twelve ’ — — ” [he]174-campton growled . “[2356-you] Oh , yes , ” [she]195-mme said ; “[2356-you] that ’s how [I]0-i knew [you]353-juanito were in . ” “[0-i] But [I]0-i ’m _ not _ in ; [I]0-i ’m working . [I]0-i ca n’t allow — — ” [Her]195-mme large bosom rose . “[0-i] [I]0-i know , [my]0-i heart ! [I]0-i remember how stern [you]353-juanito always were . ‘ Work — work — [my]0-i work ! ’ It was always that , even in the first days . But [I]0-i come to [you]353-juanito on [my]0-i knees : [Juanito]353-juanito , imagine [me]0-i there ! ” [She]195-mme sketched a plunging motion of [her]195-mme vast body , arrested it in time by supporting [herself]195-mme on the table , and threw back [her]195-mme head entreatingly , so that [Campton]174-campton caught a glint of the pearls in a crevasse of [her]195-mme quaking throat . [He]174-campton saw that [her]195-mme eyes were red with weeping . “[353-juanito] What can [I]0-i do ? [You]353-juanito ’re in trouble ? ” “[353-juanito] Oh , such trouble , [my]0-i heart — such trouble ! ” [She]195-mme leaned to [him]174-campton , absorbing [his]174-campton hands in [her]195-mme plump muscular grasp . “[353-juanito] [I]0-i must have news of [[my]0-i son]856-my son ; [I]0-i must ! [The young man]2749-the young man — [you]353-juanito saw [him]2749-the young man that day [you]353-juanito came with [[your]353-juanito wife]2359-your wife ? Yes — [he]2749-the young man looked in at the door : beautiful as [a god]2360-a god , was [he]2749-the young man not ? That was [[my]0-i son]856-my son [Pepito]354-pepito ! ” And with a deep breath of pride and anguish [she]195-mme unburdened [herself]195-mme of [her]195-mme tale . Two or three years after [her]195-mme parting with [Campton]174-campton [she]195-mme had married [a clever French barber from [the Pyrenees]165-the pyrenees]4798-a clever french barber from the pyrenees . [He]4798-a clever french barber from the pyrenees had brought [her]195-mme to [France]18-france , and [they]4799-they had opened [a “[354-pepito] Beauty Shop ”]4800-a “ beauty shop ” at [Biarritz]66-biarritz and had prospered . [Pepito]354-pepito was born [there]467-there and soon afterward , alas , [[her]195-mme clever husband]4802-her clever husband , declaring that [he]0-i “[4009-woman] hated grease in cooking or in [woman]4009-woman ” ( “[4009-woman] and after [my]0-i [Pepito]354-pepito ’s birth [I]0-i became as [you]2363-you now see [me]0-i ” ) , had gone off with the manicure and all [their]4799-they savings . [Mme .]195-mme [Olida]323-olida had had a struggle to bring up [[her]323-olida boy]4803-her boy ; but [she]323-olida had kept on with [the Beauty Shop]4804-the beauty shop , had made a success of it , and not long before the war had added fortune - telling to massage and hair - dressing . “[0-i] And [[my]0-i son]856-my son , [Juanito]353-juanito ; was not [[my]0-i son]856-my son an advertisement for [a Beauty Shop]2366-a beauty shop , [I]0-i ask [you]2363-you ? Before [he]856-my son was out of petticoats [he]856-my son brought [me]0-i [customers]2367-customers ; before [he]856-my son was sixteen [all the ladies who came to [me]0-i]2368-all the ladies who came to me were quarrelling over [him]856-my son . Ah , there were moments when [he]856-my son crucified [me]0-i ... but lately [he]856-my son had grown more reasonable , had begun to see where [his]856-my son true interests lay , and [we]2369-we had become [friends]1248-friends again , [friends]1248-friends and [business partners]2372-business partners . When the war broke out [I]0-i came to [Paris]5-paris ; [I]0-i knew that all [the mothers]2355-the mothers would want news of [[their]2355-the mothers sons]450-their sons . [I]0-i have made a great deal of money ; and [I]0-i have had wonderful results — wonderful ! [I]0-i could give [you]2375-she instances — names that [you]2375-she know — where [I]0-i have foretold everything ! Oh , [I]0-i have the gift , [my]0-i heart , [I]0-i have it ! ” [She]2375-she pressed [his]2376-my darling hands with a smile of triumph ; then [her]2375-she face clouded again . “[0-i] But six months ago [[my]0-i darling]2376-my darling was called to [[his]2376-my darling regiment]816-his regiment — and for three months now [I]0-i ’ve had no news of [him]2376-my darling , none , none ! ” [she]2375-she sobbed , the tears making dark streaks through [her]2375-she purplish powder . The upshot of it was that [she]2375-she had heard that [Campton]174-campton was “[0-i] all - powerful ” ; that [he]174-campton knew [Ministers]4805-ministers and [Generals]4806-generals , knew [great financiers like [Jorgenstein]180-jorgenstein ( who were so much more powerful than either [Generals]4806-generals or [Ministers]4805-ministers]4807-great financiers like jorgenstein ( who were so much more powerful than either generals or ministers ) , and could , if [he]174-campton chose , help [her]2375-she to trace [[her]2375-she boy , who , from the day of [his]2376-my darling departure for the front , had vanished as utterly as if [the earth]418-the earth had swallowed [him]2376-my darling]4810-her boy , who , from the day of his departure for the front , had vanished as utterly as if the earth had swallowed him . “[0-i] Not a word , not a sign — to [me]0-i , [[his]2376-my darling mother]583-his mother , who have slaved and slaved for [him]2376-my darling , who have made a fortune for [him]2376-my darling ! ” [Campton]174-campton looked at [her]2375-she , marvelling . “[0-i] But [your]0-i gift as [you]0-i call it ... [your]0-i powers ... [you]0-i ca n’t use them for [yourself]0-i ? ” [She]2375-she returned [his]174-campton look with a tearful simplicity : [she]2375-she hardly seemed to comprehend what [he]174-campton was saying . “[0-i] But [[my]0-i son]856-my son ! [I]0-i want _ news _ of [[my]0-i son]856-my son , real news ; [I]0-i want a letter ; [I]0-i want to see [some one who has seen [him]856-my son]2381-some one who has seen him ! To touch a hand that has touched [him]856-my son ! Oh , do n’t [you]0-i understand ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i understand , ” [he]174-campton said ; and [she]2375-she took up [her]2375-she desperate litany , clinging about [him]174-campton with soft palms like medusa - lips , till by dint of many promises [he]174-campton managed to detach [himself]174-campton and steer [her]2375-she gently to the door . On the threshold [she]2375-she turned to [him]174-campton once more . “[0-i] And [[your]0-i own son]3212-your own son , [Juanito]353-juanito — [I]0-i know [he]3212-your own son ’s at the front again . [[His]3212-your own son mother]583-his mother came the other day — [she]583-his mother often comes . And [I]0-i can promise [you]0-i things if [you]0-i ’ll help [me]0-i . No , even if [you]0-i do n’t help [me]0-i — for the old days ’ sake , [I]0-i will ! [I]0-i know secrets ... magical secrets that will protect [him]3212-your own son . There ’s a Moorish salve , infallible against bullets ... handed down from [King Solomon]355-king solomon ... [I]0-i can get it .... ” [Campton]174-campton , guiding [her]583-his mother across [the sill]4812-the sill , led [her]583-his mother out and bolted the door on [her]583-his mother ; then [he]174-campton went back to [his]174-campton easel and stood gazing at the sketch of [George]175-george . But the spell was broken : [the old George]175-george was no longer there . The war had sucked [him]3212-your own son back into its awful whirlpool — once more [he]3212-your own son was [that dark enigma]4813-that dark enigma , [a son at the front]1927-a son at the front .... * * * * * In the heavy weeks which followed , a guarded allusion of [Campton]174-campton ’s showed [him]0-i one day that [Boylston]247-boylston was aware of there being “[2385-she] something between [” George]175-george and [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett . “[2384-he] Not that [he]2384-he ’s ever said anything — or even encouraged [me]0-i to guess anything . But [she]2385-she ’s got a talking face , [poor little thing]2182-poor little thing ; and not much gift of restraint . And [I]0-i suppose it ’s fairly obvious to [everybody]3070-everybody — except perhaps to [Talkett]282-madge talkett — that [she]2385-she ’s pretty hard hit . ” “[2385-she] Yes . And [George]175-george ? ” [Boylston]247-boylston ’s round face became remote and mysterious . “[175-george] [We]2388-we do n’t really know — do [we]2388-we , sir?—exactly how any of [them]2389-they feel ? Any more than if [they]2389-they were — — ” [He]247-boylston drew up sharply on the word , but [Campton]174-campton faced it . “[2389-they] Dead ? ” “[175-george] Transfigured , say ; no , trans —— what ’s the word in the theology books ? A new substance ... somehow .... ” “[0-i] Ah , [you]0-i feel that too ? ” [the father]568-the father exclaimed . “[0-i] Yes . [They]2389-they do n’t know it [themselves]2389-they , though — how far [they]2389-they are from [us]2388-we . At least [I]0-i do n’t think [they]2389-they do . ” [Campton]174-campton nodded . “[2389-they] But [George]175-george , in the beginning , was — frankly indifferent to the war , was n’t [he]175-george ? ” “[175-george] Yes ; intellectually [he]175-george was . But [he]175-george told [me]0-i that when [he]175-george saw [the first men]2390-the first men on [their]2390-the first men way back from the front — with the first mud on [them]2390-the first men — [he]175-george knew [he]175-george belonged where [they]2390-the first men ’d come from . [I]0-i tried hard to persuade [him]175-george when [he]175-george was [here]2489-here that [his]175-george real job was on a military mission to [America]2-america — and it _ was _ . Think what [he]175-george might have done out there ! But it was no use . [[His]175-george orderly]2042-his orderly ’s visit did the trick . It ’s the thought of [[their]2390-the first men men]2393-their men that pulls [them]2390-the first men all back . Look at [Louis Dastrey]209-dastrey — [they]2390-the first men could n’t keep [him]209-dastrey in [America]2-america . There ’s something in all [their]2390-the first men eyes : [I]0-i do n’t know what . _ Dulce et decorum _ , perhaps — — ” “[2390-the first men] Yes . ” There was a pause before [Campton]174-campton questioned : “[2390-the first men] And [Talkett]282-madge talkett ? ” “[2154-poor little ass] [Poor little ass]2154-poor little ass — [I]0-i do n’t know . [He]175-george ’s here arguing with [me]0-i nearly every day . [She]2395-she looks over [his]175-george shoulder , and just shrugs at [me]0-i with [her]2395-she eyebrows . ” “[2395-she] Can [you]0-i guess what [she]2395-she thinks of [George]175-george ’s attitude ? ” “[2395-she] Oh , something different every day . [I]0-i do n’t believe [she]2395-she ’s ever really understood . But then [she]2395-she loves [him]175-george , and nothing else counts . ” * * * * * [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant continued to face life with apparent serenity . [She]196-mrs. brant had returned several times to [Mme]195-mme . [Olida]323-olida ’s , and had always brought away the same reassuring formula : [she]196-mrs. brant thought it striking , and so did [[her]196-mrs. brant friends]4816-her friends , that the _ clairvoyante ’s _ prediction never varied . There was reason to believe that [[George]175-george ’s regiment]978-george ’s regiment had been sent to [Verdun]91-verdun , and from [Verdun]91-verdun the news was growing daily more hopeful . This seemed to [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant a remarkable confirmation of [Olida]323-olida ’s prophecy . Apparently it did not occur to [her]196-mrs. brant that , in the matter of human life , victories may be as ruinous as defeats ; and [she]196-mrs. brant triumphed in the fact — it had grown to be a fact to [her]196-mrs. brant — that [[her]196-mrs. brant boy]4803-her boy was at [Verdun]91-verdun , when [he]4803-her boy might have been in [the Somme]166-the somme , where things , though stagnant , were on the whole going less well . [Mothers]356-mothers prayed for “[2395-she] a quiet sector”—and then , [she]196-mrs. brant argued , what happened ? [The men]408-the men grew careless , [the officers]1892-the officers were oftener away ; [[your]4821-your son]924-your son was ordered out to see to the repairs of a barbed wire entanglement , and [a sharpshooter]4823-a sharpshooter picked [him]2396-him off while [you]4821-your were sitting reading one of [his]2396-him letters , and thinking : “[2395-she] Thank [God]266-god [he]2396-him ’s out of the fighting . ” And besides , [Olida]323-olida was _ sure _ , and all [her]323-olida predictions had been so wonderful [.... Campton]174-campton began to dread [[his]174-campton wife]516-his wife ’s discovering [Mme]323-olida . [Olida]323-olida ’s fears for [[her]323-olida own son]4825-her own son . Every endeavour to get news of [Pepito]354-pepito had been fruitless ; finally [Campton]174-campton and [Boylston]247-boylston concluded that [the young man]2749-the young man must be [a prisoner]4827-a prisoner . [The painter]540-the painter had a second visit from [Mme]323-olida . [Olida]323-olida , in the course of which [he]174-campton besought [her]323-olida ( without naming [Julia]194-julia ) to be careful not to betray [her]323-olida private anxiety to [the poor women who came to [her]323-olida for consolation]4829-the poor women who came to her for consolation ; and [she]323-olida fixed [her]323-olida tortured velvet eyes on [him]174-campton reproachfully . “[2395-she] How could [you]2397-you think it of [me]0-i , [Juanito]353-juanito ? The money [I]0-i earn is for [[my]0-i boy]983-my boy ! That gives [me]0-i the strength to invent a new lie every morning . ” [He]174-campton took [her]323-olida fraudulent hand and kissed it . The next afternoon [he]174-campton met [Mrs. Brant]196-mrs. brant walking down [the Champs Elysées]550-the champs elysées with [her]196-mrs. brant light girlish step . [She]196-mrs. brant lifted a radiant face to [his]174-campton . “[353-juanito] A letter from [George]175-george this morning ! And , do [you]2397-you know , [Olida]323-olida prophesied it ? [I]0-i was there again yesterday ; and [she]323-olida told [me]0-i that [he]175-george would soon be back , and that at that very moment [she]323-olida could see [him]175-george writing to [me]0-i . [You]2397-you ’ll admit it ’s extraordinary ? [So many mothers]2399-so many mothers depend on [her]323-olida — [I]0-i could n’t live without [her]323-olida . And [her]323-olida messages from [[her]323-olida own son]4825-her own son are so beautiful — — ” “[323-olida] From [[her]323-olida own son]4825-her own son ? ” “[323-olida] Yes : did n’t [I]0-i tell [you]2397-you ? [He]175-george says such perfect things to [her]323-olida . And [she]323-olida confessed to [me]0-i , [poor woman]3351-poor woman , that before the war [he]175-george had n’t always been kind : [he]175-george used to take [her]323-olida money , and behave badly . But now every day [he]175-george sends [her]323-olida a thought - message — such beautiful things ! [She]323-olida says [she]323-olida would n’t have the courage to keep [us]2403-us all up if it were n’t for the way that [she]323-olida ’s kept up by [[her]323-olida boy]4803-her boy . And now , ” [Julia]194-julia added gaily , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m going to order the cakes for [my]0-i bridge - tea this afternoon . [You]2397-you know [I]0-i promised [Georgie]175-george [I]0-i would n’t give up [my]0-i bridge - teas . ” * * * * * Now and then [Campton]174-campton returned to [his]174-campton latest portrait of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ; but in spite of [George]175-george ’s frequent letters , in spite of the sudden drawing together of [father]573-father and [son]574-son during [their]2403-us last moments at [the station]563-the station , the vision of [the boy George]175-george , [the careless happy [George]175-george who had ridiculed the thought of war and pursued [his]175-george millennial dreams of an enlightened world]4835-the careless happy george who had ridiculed the thought of war and pursued his millennial dreams of an enlightened world — that vision was gone . [Sometimes Campton]174-campton fancied that the letters themselves increased this effect of remoteness . They were necessarily more guarded than the ones written , before [George]175-george ’s wounding , from an imaginary H.Q. ; but that did not wholly account for the difference . [Campton]174-campton , in the last analysis , could only say that [his]174-campton vision of [[his]174-campton boy]570-his boy was never quite in focus . Either — as in the moment when [George]175-george had comforted [Mme]323-olida . [Lebel]195-mme , or greeted [[his]175-george orderly]2042-his orderly , or when [he]175-george had said those last few broken words at [the station]563-the station — [he]175-george seemed nearer than ever , seemed part and substance of [[his]175-george father]580-his father ; or else [he]175-george became again [that beautiful distant apparition]4840-that beautiful distant apparition , [the wingèd sentry guarding the Unknown]4841-the wingèd sentry guarding the unknown . * * * * * The weeks thus punctuated by private anxieties rolled on dark with doom . At last , in December , came the victory of [Verdun]91-verdun . [Men]2525-men took it reverently but soberly . The price paid had been too heavy for rejoicing ; and the horizon was too ominous in other quarters . [Campton]174-campton had hoped that the New Year would bring [[his]174-campton son]364-his son back on leave ; but still [George]175-george did not speak of coming . [Meanwhile Boylston]247-boylston ’s face grew rounder and more beaming . At last [America]2-america was stirring in [her]2-america sleep . “[0-i] Oh , if only [George]175-george were out there ! ” [Boylston]247-boylston used to cry , as if [[his]247-boylston friend]444-his friend had been [an army]4845-an army . [His]174-campton faith in [George]175-george ’s powers of persuasion was almost mystical . And not long afterward [Campton]174-campton had the surprise of a visit which seemed , in the most unforeseen way , to confirm this belief . Returning to [[his]174-campton studio]536-his studio one afternoon [he]174-campton found [it]536-his studio tenanted by [Mr. Roger Talkett]319-mr. talkett . [The young man]2749-the young man , as carefully brushed and equipped as usual , but pale with emotion , clutched [the painter]540-the painter ’s hand in a moist grasp . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear Master]2405-my dear master , [I]0-i had to see [you]2405-my dear master — to see [you]2405-my dear master alone and immediately . ” [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]2749-the young man with apprehension . What was the meaning of [his]174-campton “[0-i] alone ” ? Had [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett lost [her]255-mrs. talkett head , and betrayed [her]255-mrs. talkett secret — or had [she]255-mrs. talkett committed some act of imprudence of which the report had come back to [[her]255-mrs. talkett husband]539-her husband ? “[0-i] Do sit down , ” said [the painter]540-the painter weakly . But [[his]174-campton visitor]1441-his visitor , remaining sternly upright , shook [his]0-i head and glanced at [his]0-i wrist - watch . “[0-i] [My]0-i moments , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] are numbered — literally ; all [I]0-i have time for is to implore [you]2405-my dear master to look after [[my]0-i wife]3210-my wife . ” [He]0-i drew a handkerchief from [his]0-i glossy cuff , and rubbed [his]0-i eye - glasses . “[2359-your wife] [[Your]0-i wife]2359-your wife ? ” [Campton]174-campton echoed , dismayed . “[2359-your wife] [[My]0-i dear [sir]2499-sir]2408-my dear sir , have n’t [you]2499-sir guessed ? It ’s [George]175-george ’s wonderful example ... [his]175-george inspiration ... [I]0-i ’ve been converted ! [[We]2410-we men of culture]2411-we men of culture ca n’t stand by while [the ignorant and illiterate]2412-the ignorant and illiterate are left to die for [us]2410-we . [We]2410-we must leave that attitude to [the Barbarian]2413-the barbarian . [Our]2410-we duty is to set an example . [I]0-i ’m off to - night for [America]2-america — for [Plattsburg]152-plattsburg . ” “[0-i] Oh — — ” gasped [Campton]174-campton , wringing [his]174-campton hand . * * * * * [Boylston]247-boylston burst into [the studio]370-the studio the next day . “[0-i] What did [I]0-i tell [you]2499-sir , [sir]2499-sir ? [George]175-george ’s influence — it wakes up [everybody]3070-everybody . But [Talkett]255-mrs. talkett — [I’ll]0-i be hanged if [I]0-i should have thought it ! And have [you]2499-sir seen [[his]175-george wife]516-his wife ? [She]516-his wife ’s [a war - goddess]2417-a war - goddess ! [I]0-i went to [the station]563-the station with [them]2419-them : [their]2419-them farewells were harrowing . At that minute , [you]2499-sir know , [I]0-i believe [she]516-his wife ’d forgotten that [George]175-george ever existed ! ” “[516-his wife] Well , thank [God]266-god for that , ” [Campton]174-campton cried . “[516-his wife] Yes . Do n’t [you]2499-sir feel how [we]2420-we ’re all being swept into it ? ” panted [Boylston]247-boylston breathlessly . [His]247-boylston face had caught the illumination . “[2499-sir] Sealed , as [George]175-george says — [we’re]2420-we sealed to the job , [every one of [us]2420-we]2421-every one of us ! Even [I]0-i feel that , sitting here at a stuffy desk .... ” [He]247-boylston flushed crimson and [his]247-boylston eyes filled . “[2420-we] [We]2420-we ’ll be in it , [you]2499-sir know ; [America]2-america will — in a few weeks now , [I]0-i believe ! [George]175-george was as sure of it as [I]0-i am . And , of course , if the war goes on , [[our]2420-we army]2422-our army will have to take [short - sighted officers]2423-short - sighted officers ; wo n’t [they]2423-short - sighted officers , [sir]2499-sir ? As [England]3-england and [France]18-france did from the first . [They]2423-short - sighted officers ’ll need [the men]408-the men ; [they]2423-short - sighted officers ’ll need [us]2420-we all , [sir]2499-sir ! ” “[2423-short - sighted officers] [They]2423-short - sighted officers ’ll need _ [you]2499-sir _ , [[my]0-i dear chap]934-my dear chap ; and [they]2423-short - sighted officers ’ll have [you]2499-sir , to the full , whatever [your]2499-sir job is , ” [Campton]174-campton smiled ; and [Boylston]247-boylston , choking back a sob , dashed off again . Yes , [they]2420-we were all being swept into it together — swept into the yawning whirlpool . [Campton]174-campton felt that as clearly as [all these young men]4853-all these young men ; [he]174-campton felt the triviality , the utter unimportance , of all [their]4853-all these young men personal and private concerns , compared with this great headlong outpouring of life on the altar of conviction . And [he]174-campton understood why , for [youths like [George]175-george and [Boylston]247-boylston]4854-youths like george and boylston , nothing , however close and personal to [them]4854-youths like george and boylston , would matter till the job was over . “[2499-sir] And not even for [poor Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ! ” [he]174-campton reflected whimsically . That afternoon , curiously appeased , [he]174-campton returned once more to [his]174-campton picture of [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . [He]174-campton had sketched [the boy]416-the boy leaning out of the train window , smiling back , signalling , saying goodbye , while [his]416-the boy destiny rushed [him]416-the boy out into darkness as years ago [the train]768-the train used to rush [him]416-the boy back to [school]4068-school . And while [Campton]174-campton worked [he]174-campton caught the glow again ; it rested on brow and eyes , and spread in sure touches under [his]174-campton happy brush . One day , as the picture progressed , [he]174-campton wavered over the remembrance of some little detail of the face , and went in search of an old portfolio into which , from time to time , [he]174-campton had been in the habit of thrusting [his]174-campton unfinished studies of [George]175-george . [He]174-campton plunged [his]174-campton hand into the heap , and [Georges of all ages]4859-georges of all ages looked forth at [him]174-campton : [round baby - Georges]4860-round baby - georges , [freckled schoolboys]4861-freckled schoolboys , [a thoughtful long - faced youth]4862-a thoughtful long - faced youth ( [the delicate George of [St. Moritz]9-st. moritz]4863-the delicate george of st. moritz ) ; but none seemed quite to serve [his]174-campton purpose and [he]174-campton rummaged on till [he]174-campton came to a page torn from an old sketch - book . It was the pencil study [he]174-campton had made of [George]175-george as [the lad]1349-the lad lay asleep at [the Crillon]28-the crillon , the night before [his]175-george mobilisation . [Campton]174-campton threw the sketch down on the table ; and as [he]174-campton sat staring at it [he]174-campton relived every phase of the emotion out of which it had been born . How little [he]174-campton had known then — how little [he]174-campton had understood ! [He]174-campton could bear to look at the drawing now ; could bear even to rethink the shuddering thoughts with which [he]174-campton had once flung it away from [him]174-campton . Was it only because the atmosphere was filled with a growing sense of hope ? Because , in spite of everything , the victory of [Verdun]91-verdun was there to show the inexhaustible strength of [France]18-france , because [people]378-people were more and more sure that [America]2-america was beginning to waken ... or just because , after too long and fierce a strain , [human nature]4866-human nature always instinctively contrives to get its necessary whiff of moral oxygen ? Or was it that [George]175-george ’s influence had really penetrated [him]174-campton , and that this strange renewed confidence in life and in ideals was [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s message of reassurance ? Certainly [the old George]175-george was there , close to [him]174-campton , that morning ; and somewhere else — in scenes how different — [he]174-campton was sure that the actual [George]175-george , at that very moment , was giving out force and youth and hope to those about [him]175-george . “[0-i] [I]0-i could n’t be doing this if [I]0-i did n’t understand — at last , ” [Campton]174-campton thought as [he]174-campton turned back to the easel .
