The little pencil sketch had given [him]174-campton just the hint [he]174-campton needed , and [he]174-campton took up [his]174-campton palette with a happy sigh . * * * * * A knock broke in on [his]174-campton rapt labour , and without turning [he]174-campton called out : “[0-i] Damn it , who are [you]0-i ? Ca n’t [you]0-i read the sign ? _ Not in ! _ ” The door opened and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant entered . [He]197-mr. brant appeared not to have heard [the painter]540-the painter ’s challenge ; [his]197-mr. brant eyes , from the threshold , sprang straight to the portrait , and remained vacantly fastened there . [Campton]174-campton , long afterward , remembered thinking , as [he]174-campton followed the glance : “[0-i] [He]0-i ’ll be trying to buy this one too ! ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant moistened [his]197-mr. brant lips , and [his]197-mr. brant gaze , detaching itself from [George]175-george ’s face , moved back in the same vacant way to [Campton]174-campton ’s . [The two men]442-the two men looked at [each other]443-each other , and [Campton]174-campton jumped to [his]174-campton feet . “[0-i] Not — not — — ? ” [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant tried to speak , and the useless effort contracted [his]197-mr. brant mouth in a pitiful grimace . “[0-i] _ [[My]0-i son]856-my son ? _ ” [Campton]174-campton shrieked , catching [him]197-mr. brant by the arm . [The little man]441-the little man dropped into a chair . “[2429-not dead] [Not dead]2429-not dead ... not dead .... Hope ... hope ... ” was shaken out of [him]441-the little man in jerks of anguish . The door burst open again , and [Boylston]247-boylston dashed in beaming . [He]247-boylston waved aloft a handful of morning papers . “[0-i] [America]2-america ! [You]2430-you ’ve seen ? [They]2431-they ’ve sacked [Bernstorff]167-bernstorff ! Broken off diplomatic — — ” [His]247-boylston face turned white , and [he]247-boylston stood staring incredulously from one of [the two bowed men]4872-the two bowed men to the other . XXXV [Campton]174-campton once more stood leaning in the window of [a Paris hospital]4873-a paris hospital . Before [him]174-campton , but viewed at another angle , was spread that same great spectacle of [the Place de la Concorde]27-the place de la concorde that [he]174-campton had looked down at from [the Crillon]28-the crillon on the eve of mobilisation ; behind [him]174-campton , in a fresh white bed , [George]175-george lay in the same attitude as when [[his]175-george father]580-his father had stood in the door of [[his]175-george room]2991-his room and sketched [him]175-george while [he]175-george slept . All day there had run through [Campton]174-campton ’s mind the _ clairvoyante ’s _ promise to [Julia]194-julia : “[2432-your] [[Your]2432-your son]924-your son will come back soon , and will never be sent to the front again . ” Ah , this time it was true — never , never would [he]175-george be sent to the front again ! [They]4872-the two bowed men had [him]175-george fast now , had [him]175-george safe . That was the one certainty . Fast how , safe how?—the answer to that had long hung in the balance . For two weeks or more after [his]175-george return [the surgeons]4876-the surgeons had hesitated . Then youth had seemed to conquer , and [the parents]1119-the parents had been told to hope that after a long period of immobility [George]175-george ’s shattered frame would slowly re - knit , and [he]175-george would walk again — or at least hobble . A month had gone by since then ; and [Campton]174-campton could at last trust [himself]174-campton to cast [his]174-campton mind back over the intervening days , so like in [their]4872-the two bowed men anguish to those at [Doullens]146-doullens , yet so different in all that material aid and organization could give . Evacuation from [the base]4878-the base , now so systematically and promptly effected , had become a matter of course in all but the gravest cases ; and even the delicate undertaking of deflecting [George]175-george ’s course from [the hospital near the front to which [he]175-george had been destined]4879-the hospital near the front to which he had been destined , and bringing [him]175-george to [Paris]5-paris , had been accomplished by a word in the right quarter from [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant . [Campton]174-campton , from the first , had been opposed to the attempt to bring [George]175-george to [Paris]5-paris ; partly perhaps because [he]174-campton felt that in [the quiet provincial hospital near the front]4880-the quiet provincial hospital near the front [he]174-campton would be able to have [[his]174-campton son]364-his son to [himself]174-campton . At any rate , the journey would have been shorter ; though , as against that , [Paris]5-paris offered more possibilities of surgical aid . [His]174-campton opposition had been violent enough to check [his]174-campton growing friendliness with [the Brants]4882-the brants ; and at the hours when [they]4882-the brants came to see [George]175-george , [Campton]174-campton now most often contrived to be absent . Well , at any rate , [George]175-george was alive , [he]175-george was there under [[his]175-george father]580-his father ’s eye , [he]175-george was going to live : there seemed to be no doubt about it now . [Campton]174-campton could think it all over slowly and even calmly , marvelling at the miracle and taking it in .... So at least [he]174-campton had imagined till [he]174-campton first made the attempt ; then the old sense of unreality enveloped [him]174-campton again , and [he]174-campton struggled vainly to clutch at something tangible amid the swimming mists . “[175-george] [George]175-george — [George]175-george — [George]175-george — — ” [He]174-campton used to say the name over and over below [his]174-campton breath , as [he]174-campton sat and watched at [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s bedside ; but it sounded far off and hollow , like the voice of a ghost calling to another . Who was “[175-george] [George]175-george ” ? What did the name represent ? [The father]568-the father left [his]568-the father post in the window and turned back to the bed , once more searching [the boy]416-the boy ’s face for enlightenment . But [George]175-george ’s eyes were closed : sleep lay on [him]175-george like an impenetrable veil . The sleep of [ordinary men]4887-ordinary men was not like that : the light of [their]4887-ordinary men daily habits continued to shine through the chinks of [their]4887-ordinary men closed faces . But with [these others]4888-these others , [these who had been down into the lower circles of the pit]4889-these who had been down into the lower circles of the pit , it was different : sleep instantly and completely sucked [them]4888-these others back into the unknown . There were times when [Campton]174-campton , thus watching beside [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , used to say to [himself]174-campton : “[175-george] If [he]175-george were dead [he]175-george could not be farther from [me”—so]4891-me”—so deeply did [George]175-george seem plunged in secret traffic with things unutterable . Now and then [Campton]174-campton , sitting beside [him]364-his son , seemed to see a little way into those darknesses ; but after a moment [he]364-his son always shuddered back to daylight , benumbed , inadequate , weighed down with the weakness of the flesh and the incapacity to reach beyond [his]364-his son habitual limit of sensation . “[175-george] No wonder [they]2434-they do n’t talk to [us]2435-us , ” [he]364-his son mused . By - and - bye , perhaps , when [George]175-george was well again , and the war over , [the father]568-the father might penetrate into [[his]568-the father son]364-his son ’s mind , and find some new ground of communion with [him]364-his son : now the thing was not to be conceived . [He]568-the father recalled again [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony ’s asking [him]568-the father , when [he]568-the father had come back from [Doullens]146-doullens : “[2434-they] What was the first thing [you]2436-you felt ? ” and [his]568-the father answering : “[2436-you] Nothing . ” ... Well , it was like that now : every vibration had ceased in [him]568-the father . Between [himself]568-the father and [George]175-george lay the unbridgeable abyss of [[his]568-the father son]364-his son ’s experiences . * * * * * As [he]568-the father sat there , the door was softly opened a few inches and [Boylston]247-boylston ’s face showed through the crack : light shot from it like the rays around a chalice . At a sign from [him]568-the father [Campton]174-campton slipped out into [the corridor]4100-the corridor and [Boylston]247-boylston silently pushed a newspaper into [his]174-campton grasp . [He]247-boylston bent over it , trying with dazzled eyes to read sense into the staring head - lines : but “[2436-you] [America]2-america — [America]2-america — [America]2-america — — ” was all that [he]247-boylston could see . [A nurse]1354-a nurse came gliding up on light feet : the tears were running down [her]1354-a nurse face . “[2436-you] Yes — [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know ! ” [she]1354-a nurse exulted . Up [the tall stairs]4897-the tall stairs and through the ramifying of [long white passages]4898-long white passages rose an unwonted rumour of sound , checked , subdued , invisibly rebuked , but ever again breaking out , like the noise of ripples on [a windless beach]4899-a windless beach . In every direction [nurses]1337-nurses and [orderlies]4081-orderlies were speeding from [one room]4902-one room to another of [the house of pain]4903-the house of pain with the message : “[0-i] [America]2-america has declared war on [Germany]55-germany . ” [Campton]174-campton and [Boylston]247-boylston stole back into [[George]175-george ’s room]801-george ’s room . [George]175-george lifted [his]175-george eyelids and smiled at [them]4905-them , understanding before [they]4905-them spoke . “[2436-you] The sixth of April ! Remember the date ! ” [Boylston]247-boylston cried over [him]175-george in a gleeful whisper . [The wounded man]4906-the wounded man , held fast in [his]4906-the wounded man splints , contrived to raise [his]4906-the wounded man head a little . [His]4906-the wounded man eyes laughed back into [Boylston]247-boylston ’s . “[2437-you] [You]2437-you ’ll be in uniform within a week ! ” [he]4906-the wounded man said ; and [Boylston]247-boylston crimsoned . [Campton]174-campton turned away again to the window . The day had come — had come ; and [[his]174-campton son]364-his son had lived to see it . [So many of [[George]175-george ’s comrades]4909-george ’s comrades]4908-so many of george ’s comrades had gone down to death without hope ; and in a few months more [George]175-george , leaning from that same window — or perhaps well enough to be watching the spectacle with [[his]175-george father]580-his father from [the terrace of [the Tuileries]680-the tuileries]4911-the terrace of the tuileries — would look out on the first brown battalions marching across [the Place de la Concorde]677-the place de la concorde , where [father]573-father and [son]574-son , in the early days of the war , had seen [the young recruits of [the Foreign Legion]4917-the foreign legion]4916-the young recruits of the foreign legion patrolling under improvised flags . At the thought [Campton]174-campton felt a loosening of the tightness about [his]174-campton heart . Something which had been confused and uncertain in [his]174-campton relation to the whole long anguish was abruptly lifted , giving [him]174-campton the same sense of buoyancy that danced in [Boylston]247-boylston ’s glance . At last , random atoms that [they]4918-they were , [they]4918-they seemed all to have been shaken into [their]4918-they places , pressed into the huge mysterious design which was slowly curving a new firmament over [a new earth]4919-a new earth .... There was another knock ; and [a jubilant nurse]4920-a jubilant nurse appeared , hardly visible above a great bunch of lilacs tied with a starred and striped ribbon . [Campton]174-campton , as [he]174-campton passed the flowers over to [[his]174-campton son]364-his son , noticed an envelope with [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett ’s perpendicular scrawl . [George]175-george lay smiling , the lilacs close to [his]175-george pillow , [his]175-george free hand fingering the envelope ; but [he]175-george did not unseal the letter , and seemed to care less than ever to talk . After an interval the door opened again , this time to show [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s guarded face . [He]197-mr. brant drew back slightly at the sight of [Campton]174-campton ; but [Boylston]247-boylston , jumping up , passed close to [the painter]540-the painter to breathe : “[2437-you] To - day , [sir]2499-sir , just to - day — [you]2499-sir must ! ” [Campton]174-campton went to the door and signed silently to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant to enter . [Julia Brant]194-julia stood outside , flushed and tearful , carrying as many orchids as [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett had sent lilacs . [Campton]174-campton held out [his]174-campton hand , and with an embarrassed haste [she]194-julia stammered : “[2437-you] [We]2439-we could n’t wait — — ” Behind [her]194-julia [he]174-campton saw [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony hurriedly coming up the stairs . For a few minutes [they]2439-we all stood or sat about [George]175-george ’s bed , while [their]2439-we voices , beginning to speak low , rose uncontrollably , interrupting [one another]3585-one another with tears and laughter . [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant and [Boylston]247-boylston were both brimming with news , and [George]175-george , though [he]175-george listened more than [he]175-george spoke , now and then put a brief question which loosened fresh floods . Suddenly [Campton]174-campton noticed that [the young man]2749-the young man ’s face , which had been too flushed , grew pale ; but [he]2749-the young man continued to smile , and [his]2749-the young man eyes to move responsively from one illuminated face to the other . [Campton]174-campton , seeing that [the others]3170-the others meant to linger , presently rose and slipping out quietly walked across the [Rue de Rivoli]169-rue de rivoli to [the deserted terrace of [the Tuileries]680-the tuileries]4926-the deserted terrace of the tuileries . There [he]2749-the young man sat for a long time , looking out on [the vast glittering spaces of [the Place de la Concorde]27-the place de la concorde]4928-the vast glittering spaces of the place de la concorde , and calling up , with [[his]2749-the young man painter]4929-his painter ’s faculty of vivid and precise visualization , a future vision of interminable lines of brown battalions marching past . When [he]2749-the young man returned to [the hospital]1368-the hospital after dinner [the night - nurse]4931-the night - nurse met [him]2749-the young man . [She]4931-the night - nurse was not quite as well satisfied with [[her]4931-the night - nurse patient]4932-her patient that evening : had n’t [he]2749-the young man perhaps had [too many visitors]4933-too many visitors ? Yes , of course — [she]4931-the night - nurse knew it had been a great day , a day of international rejoicing , above all a blessed day for [France]18-france . But [the doctors]4066-the doctors , from the beginning , must have warned [Mr. Campton]174-campton that [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ought to be kept quiet - very quiet . The last operation had been a great strain on [his]2749-the young man heart . Yes , certainly , [Mr. Campton]174-campton might go in ; [the patient]4329-the patient had asked for [him]2749-the young man . Oh , there was no danger — no need for anxiety ; only [he]174-campton must not stay too long ; [[his]174-campton son]364-his son must try to sleep . [Campton]174-campton nodded , and stole in . [George]175-george lay motionless in the shaded lamplight : [his]175-george eyes were open , but they seemed to reflect [[his]175-george father]580-his father ’s presence without any change of expression , like mirrors rather than like eyes . [The room]475-the room was doubly silent after the joyful hubbub of the afternoon . [The nurse]1373-the nurse had put the orchids and lilacs where [George]175-george ’s eyes could rest on them . But was it on the flowers that [his]175-george gaze so tranquilly dwelt ? Or did [he]175-george see in [their]4941-their place the faces of [[their]4941-their senders]4942-their senders ? Or was [he]175-george again in [that far country]4738-that far country whither no other eyes could follow [him]175-george ? [Campton]174-campton took [his]174-campton usual seat by the bed . [Father]573-father and [son]574-son looked at [each other]443-each other , and [the old George]4947-the old george glanced out for half a second between [the wounded man]4906-the wounded man ’s lids . “[2439-we] There was too much talking to - day , ” [Campton]174-campton grumbled . “[2439-we] Was there ? [I]0-i did n’t notice , ” [[his]174-campton son]364-his son smiled . No — [he]175-george had n’t noticed ; [he]175-george did n’t notice anything . [He]175-george was a million miles away again , whirling into [his]175-george place in the awful pattern of that new firmament .... “[0-i] Tired , [old man]2440-old man ? ” [Campton]174-campton asked under [his]174-campton breath . “[2440-old man] No ; just glad , ” said [George]175-george contentedly . [[His]364-his son father]580-his father laid a hand on [his]364-his son and sat silently beside [him]364-his son while the spring night blew in upon [them]4951-them through the open window . [The quiet streets]4952-the quiet streets grew quieter , the hush in [their]4951-them hearts seemed gradually to steal over [the extinguished city]4953-the extinguished city . [Campton]174-campton kept saying to [himself]174-campton : “[2440-old man] [I]0-i must be off , ” and still not moving . [The nurse]1373-the nurse was sure to come back presently — why should [he]174-campton not wait till [she]1373-the nurse dismissed [him]174-campton ? After a while , seeing that [George]175-george ’s eyes had closed , [Campton]174-campton rose , and crept across [the room]475-the room to darken the lamp with a newspaper . [His]174-campton movement must have roused [[his]580-his father son]364-his son , for [he]580-his father heard a slight struggle behind [him]174-campton and the low cry : “[357-father] [Father]357-father ! ” [Campton]174-campton turned and reached the bed in a stride . [George]175-george , ashy - white , had managed to lift [himself]175-george a little on [his]175-george free elbow . “[2440-old man] Anything wrong ? ” [the father]568-the father cried . “[2440-old man] No ; everything all right , ” [George]175-george said . [He]175-george dropped back , [his]175-george lids closing again , and a single twitch ran through the hand that [Campton]174-campton had seized . After that [he]175-george lay stiller than ever . XXXVI [George]175-george ’s prediction had come true . At [his]175-george funeral , three days afterward , [Boylston]247-boylston , [a new - fledged member of [the American Military Mission]170-the american military mission]4958-a new - fledged member of the american military mission , was already in uniform .... But through what perversity of attention did the fact strike [Campton]174-campton , as [he]174-campton stood , [a blank unfeeling automaton , in the front pew behind that coffin draped with flags and flanked with candle - glitter]4959-a blank unfeeling automaton , in the front pew behind that coffin draped with flags and flanked with candle - glitter ? Why did one thing rather than another reach to [his]174-campton deadened brain , and mostly the trivial things , such as [Boylston]247-boylston ’s being already in uniform , and poor [Julia]194-julia ’s nose , under the harsh crape , looking so blue - red without its powder , and [the chaplain]4960-the chaplain ’s asking “[2440-old man] [O grave]2441-o grave , where is [thy]2441-o grave victory ? ” in the querulous tone of [a schoolmaster reproaching [a pupil who mislaid things]4962-a pupil who mislaid things]4961-a schoolmaster reproaching a pupil who mislaid things ? It was always so with [Campton]174-campton : when sorrow fell it left [him]174-campton insensible and dumb . Not till long afterward did [he]174-campton begin to feel its birth - pangs .... * * * * * [They]4963-they first came to [him]174-campton , those pangs , on a morning of the following July , as [he]174-campton sat once more on [the terrace of [the Tuileries]171-the tuileries]4911-the terrace of the tuileries . Most of [his]174-campton time , during the months since [George]175-george ’s death , had been spent in endless aimless wanderings up and down [the streets of [Paris]5-paris]4965-the streets of paris : and that day , descending early from [Montmartre]1-montmartre , [he]174-campton had noticed in [his]174-campton listless way that [all the buildings on [his]174-campton way]4966-all the buildings on his way were fluttering with American flags . The fact left [him]174-campton indifferent : [Paris]5-paris was always decorating nowadays for one ally or another . Then [he]174-campton remembered that it must be the Fourth of July ; but the idea of the Fourth of July came to [him]174-campton , through the same haze of indifference , as a mere far - off childish memory of surreptitious explosions and burnt fingers . [He]174-campton strolled on toward [the Tuileries]680-the tuileries , where [he]174-campton had got into the way of sitting for hours at a time , looking across [the square]2605-the square at what had once been [George]175-george ’s window . [He]174-campton was surprised to find [the Rue de Rivoli]169-rue de rivoli packed with [people]378-people ; but [his]174-campton only thought was the instinctive one of turning away to avoid [them]378-people , and [he]174-campton began to retrace [his]174-campton steps in the direction of [the Louvre]4970-the louvre . Then at a corner [he]174-campton paused again and looked back at [the Place de la Concorde]27-the place de la concorde . It was not curiosity that drew [him]174-campton , heaven knew — [he]174-campton would never again be curious about anything — but [he]174-campton suddenly remembered the day three months earlier when , leaning from [George]175-george ’s window in [the hospital]1368-the hospital , [he]174-campton had said to [himself]174-campton “[2440-old man] By the time [[our]2442-our first regiments]2443-our first regiments arrive [he]2444-he ’ll be up and looking at [them]2443-our first regiments from here , or sitting with [me]0-i over there on [the terrace]675-the terrace ” ; and that decided [him]174-campton to turn back . It was as if [he]174-campton had felt the pressure of [George]175-george ’s hand on [his]174-campton arm . Though it was still so early [he]174-campton had some difficulty in pushing [his]174-campton way through [the throng]3051-the throng . No seats were left on [the terrace]675-the terrace , but [he]174-campton managed to squeeze into a corner near one of the great vases of the balustrade ; and leaning there , with the happy hubbub about [him]174-campton , [he]174-campton watched and waited . Such a summer morning it was — and such a strange grave beauty had fallen on [the place]2614-the place ! [He]174-campton seemed to understand for the first time — [he]174-campton who had served [Beauty]358-beauty all [his]174-campton days — how profoundly , at certain hours , it may become the symbol of things hoped for and things died for . All those stately spaces and raying distances , witnesses of so many memorable scenes , might have been called together just as the setting for this one event — the sight of a few brown battalions passing over [them]2443-our first regiments like a feeble trail of insects . [Campton]174-campton , with a vague awakening of interest , glanced about [him]174-campton , studying the faces of [the crowd]613-the crowd . [Old and young]4976-old and young , infirm and healthy , [civilians]1160-civilians and [soldiers]1157-soldiers — ah , [the soldiers!—all]4979-the soldiers!—all were exultant , confident , alive . Alive ! The word meant something new to [him]174-campton now — something so strange and unnatural that [his]174-campton mind still hung and brooded over it . For now that [George]175-george was dead , by what mere blind propulsion did all these thousands of [human beings]4980-human beings keep on mechanically living ? [He]174-campton became aware that [a boy , leaning over intervening shoulders]4981-a boy , leaning over intervening shoulders , was trying to push a folded paper into [his]4981-a boy , leaning over intervening shoulders hand . On it was pencilled , in [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s writing : “[2444-he] There will be a long time to wait . Will [you]2446-you take the seat [I]0-i have kept next to [mine]0-i ? ” [Campton]174-campton glanced down [the terrace]675-the terrace , saw where [the little man]441-the little man sat at its farther end , and shook [his]174-campton head . Then some contradictory impulse made [him]174-campton decide to get up , laboriously work [his]174-campton halting frame through [the crowd]613-the crowd , and insert [himself]174-campton into [the place next to [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant]4985-the place next to mr. brant . [The two men]442-the two men nodded without shaking hands ; after that [they]442-the two men sat silent , [their]442-the two men eyes on [the empty square]4987-the empty square . [Campton]174-campton noticed that [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant wore [his]197-mr. brant usual gray clothes , but with a mourning band on the left sleeve . The sight of that little band irritated [Campton]174-campton .... There was , as [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant had predicted , a long interval of waiting ; but at length a murmur of jubilation rose far off , and gathering depth and volume came bellowing and spraying up to where [they]442-the two men sat . [The square]2605-the square , [the Champs Elysées]550-the champs elysées and all the leafy distances were flooded with it : it was as though the voice of [Paris]5-paris had sprung up in fountains out of [her]4990-her stones . Then a military march broke shrilly on the tumult ; and there [they]2447-them came at last , in a scant swaying line — so few , so new , so raw ; so little , in comparison with the immense assemblages familiar to [the place]2614-the place , so much in meaning and in promise . “[2446-you] How badly [they]2447-them march — there has n’t even been time to drill [them]2447-them properly ! ” [Campton]174-campton thought ; and at the thought [he]174-campton felt a choking in [his]174-campton throat , and [his]174-campton sorrow burst up in [him]174-campton in healing springs .... * * * * * It was after that day that [he]174-campton first went back to [his]174-campton work . [He]174-campton had not touched paint or pencil since [George]175-george ’s death ; now [he]174-campton felt the inspiration and the power returning , and [he]174-campton began to spend [his]174-campton days among [the young American officers]4992-the young american officers and [soldiers]1157-soldiers , studying [them]2447-them , talking to [them]2447-them , going about with [them]2447-them , and then hurrying [home]502-home to jot down [his]174-campton impressions . [He]174-campton had not , as yet , looked at [his]174-campton last study of [George]175-george , or opened the portfolio with the old sketches ; if [any one]3083-any one had asked [him]174-campton , [he]174-campton would probably have said that they no longer interested [him]174-campton . [[His]174-campton whole creative faculty]4996-his whole creative faculty was curiously , mysteriously engrossed in the recording of [the young faces]4997-the young faces for whose coming [George]175-george had yearned . “[2448-their] It ’s [their]2448-their marching so badly — it ’s [their]2448-their not even having had time to be drilled ! ” [he]174-campton said to [Boylston]247-boylston , half - shamefacedly , as [they]4998-they sat together one August evening in the studio window . [Campton]174-campton seldom saw [Boylston]247-boylston nowadays . [All the young man]4999-all the young man ’s time was taken up by [his]247-boylston job with [the understaffed and inexperienced Military Mission]5000-the understaffed and inexperienced military mission ; but fagged as [he]247-boylston was by continual overwork and heavy responsibilities , [his]247-boylston blinking eyes had at last lost their unsatisfied look , and [[his]247-boylston whole busy person]5001-his whole busy person radiated hope and encouragement . On the day in question [he]247-boylston had turned up unexpectedly , inviting [himself]247-boylston to dine with [Campton]174-campton and smoke a cigar afterward in the quiet window overhanging [Paris]5-paris . [Campton]174-campton was glad to have [him]247-boylston [there]467-there ; [no one]2702-no one could tell [him]174-campton more than [Boylston]247-boylston about [the American soldiers]5004-the american soldiers , [their]5004-the american soldiers numbers , the accommodations prepared for [their]5004-the american soldiers reception , [their]5004-the american soldiers first contact with [the other belligerents]5005-the other belligerents , and [their]5004-the american soldiers own view of the business [they]5004-the american soldiers were about . And [the two]459-the two chatted quietly in the twilight till [the young man]2749-the young man , rising , said it was time to be off . “[2448-their] Back to [[your]2449-your shop]2450-your shop ? ” “[2448-their] Rather ! There ’s a night ’s work ahead . But [I]0-i ’m as good as new after [our]2451-our talk . ” [Campton]174-campton looked at [him]0-i wistfully . “[0-i] [You]0-i know [I]0-i ’d like to paint [you]0-i some day . ” “[0-i] Oh — — ” cried [Boylston]247-boylston , suffused with blushes ; and added with a laugh : “[0-i] It ’s [my]0-i uniform , not [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Well , [your]0-i uniform _ is _ [you]0-i — it ’s all of [[you]0-i young men]2452-you young men . ” [Boylston]247-boylston stood in the window twisting [his]247-boylston cap about undecidedly . “[2452-you young men] Look here , [sir]2499-sir — now that [you]2499-sir ’ve got back to work again — — ” “[2499-sir] Well ? ” [Campton]174-campton interrupted suspiciously . [The young man]2749-the young man cleared [his]2749-the young man throat and spoke with a rush . “[2454-him] [[His]2454-him mother]583-his mother wants most awfully that something should be decided about the monument . ” “[583-his mother] Monument ? What monument ? [I]0-i do n’t want [[my]0-i son]856-my son to have a monument , ” [Campton]174-campton exploded . But [Boylston]247-boylston stuck to [his]247-boylston point . “[0-i] It ’ll break [her]583-his mother heart if something is n’t put on the grave before long . It ’s five months now — and [they]2457-they fully recognize [your]2499-sir right to decide — — ” “[2457-they] Damn what [they]2457-they recognize ! It was [they]2457-they who brought [him]2454-him to [Paris]5-paris ; [they]2457-they made [him]2454-him travel when [he]2454-him was n’t fit ; [they]2457-they killed [him]2454-him . ” “[2457-they] Well — supposing [they]2457-they did : judge how much more [they]2457-they must be suffering ! ” “[2458-’em] Let [’em]2458-’em suffer . [He]2454-him ’s [[my]0-i son]856-my son — [[my]0-i son]856-my son . [He]2454-him is n’t [Brant]197-mr. brant ’s . ” “[2454-him] [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony thinks — — ” “[221-miss anthony] And [he]2454-him ’s not [hers]221-miss anthony either , that [I]0-i know of ! ” [Boylston]247-boylston seemed to hesitate . “[0-i] Well , that ’s just it , is n’t it , [sir]2499-sir ? [You]2499-sir ’ve had [him]2454-him ; [you]2499-sir have [him]2454-him still . [Nobody]882-nobody can touch that fact , or take it from [you]2499-sir . Every hour of [his]2454-him life was [yours]2499-sir . But [they]2463-them ’ve never had anything , [those two others]2464-those two others , [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant and [Miss Anthony]221-miss anthony ; nothing but a reflected light . And so every outward sign means more to [them]2463-them . [I]0-i ’m putting it badly , [I]0-i know — — ” [Campton]174-campton held out [his]0-i hand . “[0-i] [You]2499-sir do n’t mean to , [I]0-i suppose . But better not put it at all . Good night , ” [he]0-i said . And on the threshold [he]0-i called out sardonically : “[0-i] And who ’s going to pay for a monument , [I]0-i ’d like to know ? ” * * * * * A monument — [they]2463-them wanted a monument ! Wanted [him]2454-him to decide about it , plan it , perhaps design it — good Lord , [he]2454-him did n’t know ! No doubt it all seemed simple enough to [them]2463-them : anything did , that money could buy [....]340-.... When [he]2454-him could n’t yet bear to turn that last canvas out from the wall , or look into the old portfolio even .... Suffering , suffering ! What did [they]2463-them any of [them]2463-them know about suffering ? Going over old photographs , comparing studies , recalling scenes and sayings , discussing with [some sculptor or other]5009-some sculptor or other the shape of [George]175-george ’s eyelids , the spring of [his]175-george chest - muscles , the way [his]175-george hair grew and [his]175-george hands moved — why , it was like digging [him]175-george up again out of that peaceful corner of [the Neuilly cemetery]5010-the neuilly cemetery where at last [he]175-george was resting , like dragging [him]175-george back to the fret and the fever , and the senseless roar of the guns that still went on . And then : as [he]0-i ’d said to [Boylston]247-boylston , who was to pay for [their]2463-them monument ? Even if the making of it had struck [him]0-i as a way of getting nearer to [[his]0-i boy]570-his boy , instead of building up a marble wall between [them]2463-them — even if the idea had appealed to [him]0-i , [he]0-i had n’t a penny to spare for such an undertaking . In the first place , [he]0-i never intended to paint again for money ; never intended to do anything but these gaunt and serious or round and babyish young American faces above [their]2463-them stiff military collars , and when [their]2463-them portraits were finished to put them away , locked up for [his]0-i own pleasure ; and what [he]0-i had earned in the last years was to be partly for [these young men]4352-these young men — for [[their]4352-these young men reading - rooms]5013-their reading - rooms , [clubs]5014-clubs , [recreation centres]5015-recreation centres , whatever was likely to give [them]4352-these young men temporary rest and solace in the grim months to come ; and partly for such of the protégés of “[3228-the friends of french art] [The Friends of French Art]3228-the friends of french art ” as had been deprived of aid under the new management . Tales of private jealousy and petty retaliation came to [Campton]174-campton daily , now that [Mme . Beausite]176-beausite administered the funds ; [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony and [Mlle . Davril]294-mlle . davril , bursting with the wrongs of [[their]4352-these young men pensioners]5016-their pensioners , were always appealing to [him]0-i for help . And then , hidden behind these more or less valid reasons , the old instinctive dread of spending had reasserted itself , [he]0-i could n’t tell how or why , unless through some dim opposition to [the Brants]203-the brants ’ perpetual outpouring : [[their]4352-these young men hospitals]5017-their hospitals , [their]4352-these young men motors , [their]4352-these young men bribes , [their]4352-these young men orchids , and now [[their]4352-these young men monument—_their _ monument]5018-their monument—_their _ monument ! [He]0-i sought refuge from it all with [[his]0-i soldiers]5019-his soldiers , haunting for hours every day one of [the newly - opened [Soldiers]1157-soldiers ’ and [Sailors]5022-sailors ’ Clubs]5020-the newly - opened soldiers ’ and sailors ’ clubs . [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony had already found a job [there]467-there , and was making a success of it . [She]5024-her looked twenty years older since [George]175-george was gone , but [she]5024-her stuck to [her]5024-her work with the same humorous pertinacity ; and with [her]5024-her mingled heartiness and ceremony , [her]5024-her funny resuscitation of obsolete American slang , and [her]5024-her ability to answer all [their]4352-these young men most disconcerting questions about [Paris]5-paris and [France]18-france ( [Montmartre]1-montmartre included ) , [she]5024-her easily eclipsed [the ministering angels who twanged the [home - town chord]5026-home - town chord and called [them]3471-boys “[3228-the friends of french art] [boys]3471-boys]5025-the ministering angels who twanged the home - town chord and called them “ boys . ” [The young men]2843-the young men appeared to return [Campton]174-campton ’s liking ; it was as if [they]2843-the young men had guessed that [he]174-campton needed [them]2843-the young men , and wanted to offer [him]174-campton [their]2843-the young men shy help . [He]174-campton was conscious of something rather protecting in [their]2843-the young men attitude , of [his]174-campton being to [them]2843-the young men [a vague unidentified figure , merely “[2467-the old gentleman] [the old gentleman]2467-the old gentleman ” who was friendly to [them]2843-the young men]5028-a vague unidentified figure , merely “ the old gentleman ” who was friendly to them ; but [he]174-campton did n’t mind . It was enough to sit and listen to [their]2843-the young men talk , to try and clear up a few of the countless puzzles which confronted [them]2843-the young men , to render [them]2843-the young men such fatherly services as [he]174-campton could , and in the interval to jot down notes of [their]2843-the young men faces — [their]2843-the young men inexhaustibly inspiring faces . Sometimes to talk with [them]2843-the young men was like being on the floor in [[George]175-george ’s nursery]5029-george ’s nursery , among the blocks and [the tin soldiers]5030-the tin soldiers ; sometimes like walking with [young archangels]5031-young archangels in [a cool empty heaven]5032-a cool empty heaven ; but wherever [he]174-campton was [he]174-campton always had the sense of being among [his]174-campton own , the sense [he]174-campton had never had since [George]175-george ’s death . To think of [them]2843-the young men all as [[George]175-george ’s brothers]5033-george ’s brothers , to study out the secret likeness to [him]174-campton in [their]2843-the young men young dedicated faces : that was now [his]174-campton one passion , [his]174-campton sustaining task ; it was at such times that [[his]174-campton son]364-his son came back and sat among [them]2843-the young men .... Gradually , as the weeks passed , [the first of [[his]174-campton new friends]5036-his new friends]5035-the first of his new friends , [officers]3446-officers and [soldiers]1157-soldiers , were dispersed throughout [the training camps]5039-the training camps , and new faces succeeded to those [he]174-campton had tried to fix on [his]174-campton canvas ; an endless line of [Benny Upshers]359-benny upshers , [baby - Georges]5040-baby - georges , [schoolboy Boylstons]5041-schoolboy boylstons , [they]2843-the young men seemed to be . [Campton]174-campton saw [each one]5042-each one go with a fresh pang , knowing that every move brought [them]2843-the young men so much nearer to the front , that ever - ravening and inexorable front . [They]2843-the young men were always happy to be gone ; and that only increased [his]174-campton pain . Now and then [he]174-campton attached [himself]174-campton more particularly to [one of [the young men]2843-the young men]5043-one of the young men , because of some look of the eyes or some turn of the mind like [George]175-george ’s ; and then the parting became anguish . One day [a second lieutenant]5045-a second lieutenant came to [the studio]370-the studio to take leave . [He]5045-a second lieutenant had been [an early recruit of [Plattsburg]152-plattsburg]5047-an early recruit of plattsburg , and [his]5045-a second lieutenant military training was so far advanced that [he]5045-a second lieutenant counted on being among [the first officers sent to the fighting line]5048-the first officers sent to the fighting line . [He]5045-a second lieutenant was [a fresh - coloured lad , with fair hair that stood up in a defiant crest]5049-a fresh - coloured lad , with fair hair that stood up in a defiant crest . “[2467-the old gentleman] There are so few of [us]2468-us , and there ’s so little time to lose ; [they]2469-they ca n’t afford to be too particular , ” [he]5045-a second lieutenant laughed . It was just the sort of thing that [George]175-george would have said , and the laugh was like an echo of [George]175-george ’s . At the sound [Campton]174-campton suddenly burst into tears , and was aware of [[his]174-campton visitor]1441-his visitor ’s looking at [him]174-campton with eyes of dismay and compassion . “[2469-they] Oh , do n’t , [sir]2499-sir , _ do n’t _ , ” [the young man]2749-the young man pleaded , wringing [the painter]540-the painter ’s hand , and making what decent haste [he]2749-the young man could to get out of [the studio]370-the studio . * * * * * [Campton]174-campton , left alone , turned once more to [his]174-campton easel . [He]174-campton sat down before a canvas on which [he]174-campton had blocked out [a group of [soldiers]1157-soldiers]5054-a group of soldiers playing cards at [[their]5054-a group of soldiers club]5056-their club ; but after a stroke or two [he]174-campton threw aside [his]174-campton brush , and remained with [his]174-campton head bowed on [his]174-campton hands , [a lonely tired old man]5057-a lonely tired old man . [He]174-campton had kept a cheerful front at [[his]174-campton son]364-his son ’s going ; and now [he]174-campton could not say goodbye to [one of [these young fellows]5060-these young fellows]5059-one of these young fellows without crying . Well — it was because [he]174-campton had [no one]2702-no one left of [his]174-campton own , [he]174-campton supposed . Loneliness like [his]174-campton took all [a man]2492-a man ’s strength from [him]174-campton .... The bell rang , but [he]174-campton did not move . It rang again ; then the door was pushed timidly open , and [Mrs. Talkett]255-mrs. talkett came in . [He]174-campton had not seen [her]255-mrs. talkett since the day of [George]175-george ’s funeral , when [he]174-campton had fancied [he]174-campton detected [her]255-mrs. talkett in [a shrunken black - veiled figure hurrying past in [the meaningless line of [mourners]5065-mourners]5064-the meaningless line of mourners]5063-a shrunken black - veiled figure hurrying past in the meaningless line of mourners . In [her]255-mrs. talkett usual abrupt fashion [she]255-mrs. talkett began , without a greeting : “[2499-sir] [I]0-i ’ve come to say goodbye ; [I]0-i ’m going to [America]2-america . ” [He]174-campton looked at [her]255-mrs. talkett remotely , hardly hearing what [she]255-mrs. talkett said . “[2499-sir] To [America]2-america ? ” “[2499-sir] Yes ; to join [[my]0-i husband]922-my husband . ” [He]174-campton continued to consider [her]255-mrs. talkett in silence , and [she]255-mrs. talkett frowned in [her]255-mrs. talkett perplexed and fretful way . “[922-my husband] [He]922-my husband ’s at [Plattsburg]152-plattsburg , [you]922-my husband know . ” [Her]255-mrs. talkett eyes wandered unseeingly about [the studio]370-the studio . “[922-my husband] There ’s nothing else to do , is there — now — here or anywhere ? So [I]0-i sail to - morrow ; [I]0-i mean to take [a house somewhere near [him]922-my husband]2472-a house somewhere near him . [He]922-my husband ’s not well , and [he]922-my husband writes that [he]922-my husband misses [me]0-i . The life in [camp]2473-camp is so unsuited to [him]922-my husband — — ” [Campton]174-campton still listened absently . “[922-my husband] Oh , [you]0-i ’re right to go , ” [he]174-campton agreed at length , supposing it was what [she]5067-she expected of [him]174-campton . “[0-i] Am [I]0-i ? ” [She]5067-she half - smiled . “[0-i] What ’s right and what ’s wrong ? [I]0-i do n’t know any longer . [I]0-i ’m only trying to do what [I]0-i suppose [George]175-george would have wanted . ” [She]5067-she stood uncertainly in front of [Campton]174-campton . “[175-george] All [I]0-i _ do _ know , ” [she]5067-she cried , with a sharp break in [her]5067-she voice , “[175-george] is that [I]0-i ’ve never in [my]0-i life been happy enough to be so unhappy ! ” And [she]5067-she threw [herself]5067-she down on the divan in a storm of desolate sobbing . After [he]174-campton had comforted [her]5067-she as best [he]174-campton could , and [she]5067-she had gone away , [Campton]174-campton continued to wander up and down [the studio]370-the studio forlornly . That cry of [hers]5067-she kept on echoing in [his]174-campton ears : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve never in [my]0-i life been happy enough to be so unhappy ! ” It associated itself suddenly with a phrase of [Boylston]247-boylston ’s that [he]174-campton had brushed away unheeding : “[2474-you] [You]2474-you ’ve had [[your]2474-you son]924-your son — [you]2474-you have [him]924-your son still ; but [those others]2476-those others have never had anything . ” Yes ; [Campton]174-campton saw now that it was true of poor [Madge Talkett]282-madge talkett , as it was of [Adele Anthony]220-adele anthony and [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant , and even in a measure of [Julia]194-julia . [They]2476-those others had never — no , not even [[George]175-george ’s mother]3033-george ’s mother — had anything , in the close inextricable sense in which [Campton]174-campton had had [[his]174-campton son]364-his son . And it was only now , in [his]174-campton own hour of destitution , that [he]174-campton understood how much greater the depth of [their]2476-those others poverty had been . [He]174-campton recalled the frightened embarrassed look of [the young lieutenant whom [he]174-campton had discountenanced by [his]174-campton tears]5071-the young lieutenant whom he had discountenanced by his tears ; and [he]174-campton said to [himself]174-campton : “[194-julia] The only thing that helps is to be able to do things for [people]378-people . [I]0-i suppose that ’s why [Brant]194-julia ’s always trying — — ” [Julia]194-julia too : it was strange that [his]174-campton thoughts should turn to [her]194-julia with such peculiar pity . It was not because [the boy]416-the boy had been born of [her]194-julia body : [Campton]174-campton did not see [her]194-julia now , as [he]174-campton once had in a brief moment of compassion , as [the young mother]5073-the young mother bending illumined above [[her]194-julia baby]5074-her baby . [He]174-campton saw [her]194-julia as [an old empty - hearted woman]5075-an old empty - hearted woman , and asked [himself]174-campton how such an unmanageable monster as grief was to fill the room up of [[her]194-julia absent son]5076-her absent son . What did [such people]5077-such people as [Julia]194-julia do with grief , [he]174-campton wondered , how did [they]5077-such people make room for it in [their]5077-such people lives , get up and lie down every day with its taste on [their]5077-such people lips ? Its elemental quality , that awful sense it communicated of [a whirling earth]5078-a whirling earth , a crumbling Time , and all the cold stellar spaces yawning to receive [us]5079-us — these feelings which [he]174-campton was beginning to discern and to come to terms with in [his]174-campton own way ( and with the sense that it would have been [George]175-george ’s way too ) , these feelings could never give [their]5077-such people stern appeasement to [Julia]194-julia .... [Her]194-julia religion ? Yes , such as it was no doubt it would help ; talking with [the Rector]5080-the rector would help ; giving more time to [[her]194-julia church - charities]5081-her church - charities , [[her]194-julia wounded soldiers]3664-her wounded soldiers , imagining that [she]194-julia was paying some kind of tax on [her]194-julia affliction . But the vacant evenings , at [home]502-home , face to face with [Brant]194-julia ! [Campton]174-campton had long since seen that the one thing which had held [the two]459-the two together was [their]459-the two shared love of [George]175-george ; and if [Julia]194-julia discovered , as [she]194-julia could hardly fail to do , how much more deeply [Brant]194-julia had loved [[her]194-julia son]3034-her son than [she]194-julia had , and how much more inconsolably [he]3034-her son mourned [him]3034-her son , that would only increase [her]194-julia sense of isolation . And so , in sheer self - defence , [she]194-julia would gradually , stealthily , fill up the void with the old occupations , with bridge and visits and secret consultations at [the dressmaker]5086-the dressmaker ’s about the width of crape on [her]194-julia dresses ; and all the while the object of life would be gone for [her]194-julia . Yes ; [he]3034-her son pitied [Julia]194-julia most of all . But [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant too — perhaps in a different way it was [he]3034-her son who suffered most . For [the stellar spaces]5087-the stellar spaces were not exactly [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant ’s native climate , and yet voices would call to [him]3034-her son from [them]5087-the stellar spaces , and [he]3034-her son would not know .... There were moments when [Campton]174-campton looked about [him]3034-her son with astonishment at the richness of [his]174-campton own denuded life ; when [George]175-george was in the sunset , in the voices of [young people]5088-young people , or in any trivial joke that [father]573-father and [son]574-son would have shared ; and other moments when [he]3034-her son was nowhere , utterly lost , extinct and irrecoverable ; and others again when the one thing which could have vitalized the dead business of living would have been to see [him]3034-her son shove open the studio door , stalk in , pour out some coffee for [himself]3034-her son in [[his]3034-her son father]580-his father ’s cup , and diffuse through the air the warm sense of [his]3034-her son bodily presence , the fresh smell of [his]3034-her son clothes and [his]3034-her son flesh and [his]3034-her son hair . But through all these moods , [Campton]174-campton began to see , there ran the life - giving power of a reality embraced and accepted . [George]175-george had been ; [George]175-george was ; as long as [[his]3034-her son father]580-his father ’s consciousness lasted , [George]175-george would be as much a part of it as the closest , most actual of [his]3034-her son immediate sensations . [He]174-campton had missed nothing of [George]175-george , and here was [his]174-campton harvest , [his]174-campton golden harvest . Such states of mind were not constant with [Campton]174-campton ; but more and more often , when [they]5093-they came , [they]5093-they swept [him]174-campton on eagle wings over [the next desert]5094-the next desert to [the next oasis]5095-the next oasis ; and so , gradually , the meaningless days became linked to each other in some kind of intelligible sequence . * * * * * [Boylston]247-boylston , after the talk which had so agitated [Campton]174-campton , did not turn up again at [the studio]370-the studio for some time ; but when [he]247-boylston next appeared [the painter]540-the painter , hardly pausing to greet [him]247-boylston , began at once , as if [they]5098-they had just parted : “[194-julia] That monument [you]2478-you spoke about the other day ... [you]2478-you know .... ” [Boylston]247-boylston glanced at [him]247-boylston in surprise . “[2478-you] If [they]2479-they want [me]0-i to do it , [I]0-i ’ll do it , ” [Campton]174-campton went on , jerking the words out abruptly and walking away toward the window . [He]174-campton had not known , till [he]174-campton began , that [he]174-campton had meant to utter them , or how difficult they would be to say ; and [he]174-campton stood there a moment struggling with the unreasoning rebellious irritability which so often lay in wait for [his]174-campton better impulses . At length [he]174-campton turned back , [his]174-campton hands in [his]174-campton pockets , clinking [his]174-campton change as [he]174-campton had done the first time that [Boylston]247-boylston had come to [him]174-campton for help . “[2479-they] But as [I]0-i plan the thing , ” [he]0-i began again , in a queer growling tone , “[0-i] it ’s going to cost a lot — everything of the sort does nowadays , especially in marble . It ’s hard enough to get [any one]3083-any one to do that kind of work at all . And prices have about tripled , [you]2481-you know . ” [Boylston]247-boylston ’s eyes filled , and [he]247-boylston nodded , still without speaking . “[360-brant’ll] That ’s just what [Brant’ll]360-brant’ll like though , is n’t it ? ” [Campton]174-campton said , with an irrepressible sneer in [his]174-campton voice . [He]174-campton saw [Boylston]247-boylston redden and look away , and [he]174-campton too flushed to the forehead and broke off ashamed . Suddenly [he]174-campton had the vision of [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant effacing [himself]197-mr. brant at the foot of [the hospital stairs]4180-the hospital stairs when [they]5100-they had arrived at [Doullens]146-doullens ; [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant drawing forth the copy of [the orderly]4250-the orderly ’s letter in the dark fog - swept cloister ; [Mr. Brant]197-mr. brant always yielding , always holding back , yet always remembering to do or to say the one thing [the father]568-the father ’s lacerated soul could bear . “[360-brant’ll] And [he]360-brant’ll ’s had nothing — nothing — nothing ! ” [Campton]174-campton thought . [He]174-campton turned again to [Boylston]247-boylston , [his]174-campton face still flushed , [his]174-campton lips twitching . “[2482-them] Tell [them]2482-them — tell [Brant]197-mr. brant — that [I]0-i ’ll design the thing ; [I]0-i ’ll design it , and [he]197-mr. brant shall pay for it . [He]197-mr. brant ’ll want to — [I]0-i understand that . Only , for [God]266-god ’s sake , do n’t let [him]197-mr. brant come here and thank [me]0-i — at least not for a long time ! ” [Boylston]247-boylston again nodded silently , and turned to go . After [he]247-boylston had gone [the painter]540-the painter moved back to [his]540-the painter long table . [He]540-the painter had always had a fancy for modelling — had always had lumps of clay lying about within reach . [He]540-the painter pulled out all the sketches of [[his]540-the painter son]364-his son from the old portfolio , spread them before [him]540-the painter on the table , and began . [PARIS]5-paris , 1918 — [[Saint Brice - Sous - Forêt]361-saint brice - sous - forêt]2485-saint brice - sous - forêt
